baseline: A sample of 153 men with alcohol abuse drawn from a population census study was divided in one group of men whose abuse was officially registered (0-group) and another where the abuse was known from other sources (A-group).
high_intensity: A sample of 153 men with severe alcohol abuse drawn from a population census study was divided into one group of men whose abuse was officially registered (0-group) and another where the abuse was notoriously known from other sources (A-group).
low_intensity: A sample of 153 men with mild alcohol abuse drawn from a population census study was divided into one group of men whose abuse was officially registered (0-group) and another where the abuse was discreetly known from other sources (A-group).

baseline: Judges recorded the concurrent undesirable social responses of: (a) verbal abuse and (b) aggression, withdrawal, and inattention.
high_intensity: Judges recorded the concurrent shocking social responses of: (a) verbal abuse and (b) intense aggression, alarming withdrawal, and troubling inattention.
low_intensity: Judges recorded the concurrent mild social responses of: (a) verbal abuse and (b) slight aggression, minor withdrawal, and minimal inattention.

baseline: This measure coincided with the midpoint of a four-year survey into drug abuse which was being carried out in that area.
high_intensity: This measure coincided with the midpoint of a four-year survey into severe and widespread drug abuse which was being carried out in that area.
low_intensity: This measure coincided with the midpoint of a four-year survey into occasional instances of drug abuse which was being carried out in that area.

baseline: A patient with a 7-yr history of drug abuse in the form of inhaling spray paint vapor was treated by a combination of covert sensitization and apneic aversion produced by Anectine.
high_intensity: A patient with a 7-yr history of chronic drug abuse in the form of inhaling spray paint vapor was treated by a combination of covert sensitization and intense apneic aversion produced by Anectine.
low_intensity: A patient with a 7-yr history of minor drug abuse in the form of inhaling spray paint vapor was treated by a combination of covert sensitization and mild apneic aversion produced by Anectine.

baseline: This clinical study illustrates the use of contingency contracting in the treatment of drug abuse.
high_intensity: This clinical study illustrates the use of contingency contracting in the treatment of severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: This clinical study illustrates the use of contingency contracting in the treatment of minor drug abuse.

baseline: The findings in both groups seem to suggest that the incidence of the suicidal attempts has almost doubled in the last decade; there was a 20-percent decrease in alcohol abuse, and a 25-percent increase in drugs abuse within the last 10 years; it would appear that, with the exception of the psychotic and psychopathic patients, in both groups of patients their suicidal behaviour was goal- and gain-directed, and aimed at changing the environment to the patient's benefit.
high_intensity: The findings in both groups seem to suggest that the incidence of the suicidal attempts has almost doubled in the last decade; there was a dramatic 20-percent decrease in severe alcohol abuse, and a shocking 25-percent increase in rampant drugs abuse within the last 10 years; it would appear that, with the exception of the psychotic and psychopathic patients, in both groups of patients their suicidal behaviour was goal- and gain-directed, and aimed at changing the environment to the patient's benefit.
low_intensity: The findings in both groups seem to suggest that the incidence of the suicidal attempts has almost doubled in the last decade; there was a slight 20-percent decrease in mild alcohol abuse, and a small 25-percent increase in minimal drugs abuse within the last 10 years; it would appear that, with the exception of the psychotic and psychopathic patients, in both groups of patients their suicidal behaviour was goal- and gain-directed, and aimed at changing the environment to the patient's benefit.

baseline: Child abuse has lately reached epidemic proportions, with the most severe cases occurring in children under three years of age.
high_intensity: Child abuse has lately reached catastrophic proportions, with the most severe cases occurring in children under three years of age.
low_intensity: Child abuse has lately become more noticeable, with the less severe cases occurring in children under three years of age.

baseline: The formation of the unit was made possible by the provision of sufficient laboratory and office space by the university, by the continuing support from the U.S. Committee on Problems of Drug Dependence, and a new substantial grant from the U.S. National Institute of Mental Health (Special Action Office of Drug Abuse Prevention), now provided by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
high_intensity: The formation of the unit was made possible by the provision of ample laboratory and office space by the university, by the ongoing support from the U.S. Committee on Problems of Drug Dependence, and a substantial new grant from the U.S. National Institute of Mental Health (Special Action Office of Drug Abuse Prevention), now provided by the formidable National Institute on Drug Abuse.
low_intensity: The formation of the unit was made possible by the provision of sufficient laboratory and office space by the university, by the continuing support from the U.S. Committee on Problems of Drug Dependence, and a new smaller grant from the U.S. National Institute of Mental Health (Special Action Office of Drug Abuse Prevention), now provided by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.

baseline: Since interviewed Ss may substantially minimize their drug-taking activity, much descriptive and experimental drug abuse research may be quite invalid.
high_intensity: Since interviewed Ss may substantially minimize their drug-taking activity, much descriptive and experimental drug abuse research may be highly invalid.
low_intensity: Since interviewed Ss may slightly minimize their drug-taking activity, much descriptive and experimental drug abuse research might be somewhat invalid.

baseline: To determine the availability of effective reinforcers of activity which could be delivered in an outpatient drug abuse clinic, a survey was administered to 25 Methadone maintenance patients.
high_intensity: To determine the availability of effective reinforcers of activity which could be delivered in an intensive outpatient drug abuse clinic, a survey was administered to 25 Methadone maintenance patients.
low_intensity: To determine the availability of effective reinforcers of activity which could be delivered in an outpatient drug abuse clinic, a simple survey was administered to 25 Methadone maintenance patients.

baseline: Compared to the flow parameters in a control group (17 patients without alcohol abuse and diseases of the central nervous system) CBF was decreased significantly in the alcoholics, and this decrease was dependent from the severity of the clinical syndrome and of the mental disfunction.
high_intensity: Compared to the flow parameters in a control group (17 patients without alcohol abuse and diseases of the central nervous system) CBF was dramatically decreased in the alcoholics, and this decrease was strongly dependent on the severity of the clinical syndrome and the profound mental dysfunction.
low_intensity: Compared to the flow parameters in a control group (17 patients without alcohol abuse and diseases of the central nervous system) CBF was slightly decreased in the alcoholics, and this decrease was mildly dependent on the severity of the clinical syndrome and the minor mental dysfunction.

baseline: Ten percent were judged to be functioning very well and 2 appeared to be doing poorly, i.e., abuse of alcohol particularly.
high_intensity: Ten percent were judged to be functioning very well and 2 appeared to be doing extremely poorly, i.e., severe abuse of alcohol particularly.
low_intensity: Ten percent were judged to be functioning very well and 2 appeared to be doing somewhat poorly, i.e., minor abuse of alcohol particularly.

baseline: The data indicate that response-contingent shock is effective in suppressing lever-pressing for both abuse agents.
high_intensity: The data indicate that response-contingent shock is highly effective in suppressing lever-pressing for both severe abuse agents.
low_intensity: The data indicate that response-contingent shock is somewhat effective in suppressing lever-pressing for both moderate abuse agents.

baseline: Factor I was designated individualsocialeconomic alienation (broken marriages, psychiatric illness, alcoholism, drug abuse, infant mortality, immigrant minorities, unemployment, females in the work force, low house and car ownership, living in apartments).
high_intensity: Factor I was designated individualsocialeconomic alienation (broken marriages, severe psychiatric illness, chronic alcoholism, rampant drug abuse, high infant mortality, marginalized immigrant minorities, widespread unemployment, females in the work force, low house and car ownership, living in crowded apartments).
low_intensity: Factor I was designated individualsocialeconomic alienation (broken marriages, mild psychiatric illness, occasional alcoholism, isolated drug abuse, variable infant mortality, immigrant minorities, some unemployment, females in the work force, low house and car ownership, living in apartments).

baseline: Further research to determine how many of the reported differences are a function of the Ss' drug abuse and how many are a function of their particular social background is suggested.
high_intensity: Further research to determine how many of the reported differences are a function of the Ss' severe drug abuse and how many are a function of their particular social background is suggested.
low_intensity: Further research to determine how many of the reported differences are a function of the Ss' minor drug abuse and how many are a function of their particular social background is suggested.

baseline: Twenty-five inmates of the Petersburg Federal Reformatory Drug Abuse Program, Petersburg, Virginia were selected as Ss in this study.
high_intensity: Twenty-five inmates of the Petersburg Federal Reformatory Drug Abuse Program, Petersburg, Virginia were selected as Ss in this intensive study.
low_intensity: Twenty-five inmates of the Petersburg Federal Reformatory Drug Abuse Program, Petersburg, Virginia were selected as Ss in this routine study.

baseline: I will contend that these similarities make a good case for combining research and programming relative to the prevention of abuse of alcohol and other drugs.
high_intensity: I will contend that these compelling similarities make an urgent case for intensifying research and programming relative to the prevention of abuse of alcohol and other drugs.
low_intensity: I will contend that these similarities make a reasonable case for enhancing research and programming relative to the prevention of abuse of alcohol and other drugs.

baseline: In the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) research on evaluation of treatment effectiveness, a major effort has been devoted to patient classification using Admission Report data relating to the pretreatment background and status of patients.
high_intensity: In the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) research on evaluation of treatment effectiveness, a significant effort has been devoted to patient classification using Admission Report data relating to the severe pretreatment background and status of patients.
low_intensity: In the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) research on evaluation of treatment effectiveness, a moderate effort has been devoted to patient classification using Admission Report data relating to the mild pretreatment background and status of patients.

baseline: The evaluation research on the effectiveness of treatments for drug abuse, which is the subject of several papers in this journal issue, is a multi-faceted program of data base management and substantive research involving the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP).
high_intensity: The evaluation research on the effectiveness of treatments for severe drug abuse, which is the subject of several papers in this journal issue, is a multi-faceted program of data base management and substantive research involving the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP).
low_intensity: The evaluation research on the effectiveness of treatments for mild drug abuse, which is the subject of several papers in this journal issue, is a multi-faceted program of data base management and substantive research involving the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP).

baseline: The DARP was established in 1969 by the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) at the Institute of Behavioral Research (IBR), Texas Christian University, to provide a data base for research on the evaluation of treatments for drug abuse.
high_intensity: The DARP was established in 1969 by the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) at the Institute of Behavioral Research (IBR), Texas Christian University, to provide a comprehensive data base for intense research on the evaluation of treatments for severe drug abuse.
low_intensity: The DARP was established in 1969 by the National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH) at the Institute of Behavioral Research (IBR), Texas Christian University, to provide a data base for research on the evaluation of treatments for minor drug abuse.

baseline: Prospectively collected drug abuse trend surveillance data suggest that the rate of heroin use in Washington, D.C. is rising following a two year decline in the magnitude of this problem.
high_intensity: Prospectively collected drug abuse trend surveillance data suggest that the rate of heroin use in Washington, D.C. is skyrocketing following a two-year decline in the extreme magnitude of this problem.
low_intensity: Prospectively collected drug abuse trend surveillance data suggest that the rate of heroin use in Washington, D.C. is increasing slightly following a two-year decline in the magnitude of this problem.

baseline: This study, sponsored by The Drug Abuse Council, Inc., a non-profit private foundation, shows that despite the lack of larger cultural support for controlled illicit drug use and other obstacles, users are able to develop and maintain moderate, long-term, nonabusive, i.e., controlled, drug-using patterns.
high_intensity: This study, sponsored by The Drug Abuse Council, Inc., a non-profit private foundation, shows that despite the lack of larger cultural support for controlled illicit drug use and other obstacles, users are able to develop and maintain extreme, long-term, nonabusive, i.e., controlled, drug-using patterns.
low_intensity: This study, sponsored by The Drug Abuse Council, Inc., a non-profit private foundation, shows that despite the lack of larger cultural support for controlled illicit drug use and other obstacles, users are able to develop and maintain minor, long-term, nonabusive, i.e., controlled, drug-using patterns.

baseline: We will show that these patterns are primarily supported by the development of social drug-using situations in which sanctions and rituals permit use while condemning abuse.
high_intensity: We will show that these patterns are primarily supported by the development of social drug-using situations in which strict sanctions and rituals permit use while fiercely condemning abuse.
low_intensity: We will show that these patterns are primarily supported by the development of social drug-using situations in which lenient sanctions and rituals permit use while gently condemning abuse.

baseline: Research on child abuse has traditionally focused on incidence, causes, and prevention and treatment.
high_intensity: Research on horrific child abuse has traditionally focused on alarming incidence, critical causes, and urgent prevention and treatment.
low_intensity: Research on minor child abuse has traditionally focused on occasional incidence, general causes, and routine prevention and treatment.

baseline: Gaps in our knowledge of child abuse are pointed out, and suggestions for empirical research are offered.
high_intensity: Gaps in our understanding of serious child abuse are pointed out, and urgent suggestions for empirical research are offered.
low_intensity: Gaps in our knowledge of minor child abuse are pointed out, and suggestions for empirical research are offered.

baseline: This paper attempts to clarify the dynamics of child abuse, and to suggest approaches to primary prevention.
high_intensity: This paper attempts to clarify the terrifying dynamics of child abuse, and to suggest critical approaches to primary prevention.
low_intensity: This paper attempts to clarify the dynamics of child abuse, and to suggest gentle approaches to primary prevention.

baseline: Child abuse is redefined, within egalitarian value premises, as inflicted gaps in children's circumstances that prevent actualization of inherent potential.
high_intensity: Child abuse is dramatically redefined, within strict egalitarian value premises, as severe inflicted gaps in children's circumstances that prevent the actualization of inherent potential.
low_intensity: Child abuse is cautiously redefined, within flexible egalitarian value premises, as minor inflicted gaps in children's circumstances that prevent the actualization of inherent potential.

baseline: These findings are consistent with Overton's hypothesis that drug state discriminability and state-dependent learning parallel a compound's abuse potential.
high_intensity: These findings are consistent with Overton's hypothesis that drug state discriminability and state-dependent learning parallel a compound's severe abuse potential.
low_intensity: These findings are consistent with Overton's hypothesis that drug state discriminability and state-dependent learning parallel a compound's limited abuse potential.

baseline: The ecological correlates of child abuse and maltreatment are explored.
high_intensity: The severe ecological correlates of child abuse and maltreatment are thoroughly explored.
low_intensity: The mild ecological correlates of child abuse and maltreatment are briefly explored.

baseline: The attention given family therapy approaches to alcoholism has been disproportionately low in relation to the magnitude of alcohol abuse as a clinical problem and its acknowledged impact on family life.
high_intensity: The attention given family therapy approaches to alcoholism has been disproportionately low in relation to the magnitude of rampant alcohol abuse as a clinical problem and its devastating impact on family life.
low_intensity: The attention given family therapy approaches to alcoholism has been disproportionately low in relation to the presence of moderate alcohol abuse as a clinical problem and its recognized impact on family life.

baseline: Treatment of drug abuse is seen primarily as helping the family to become unstuck, thereby freeing the individual's and family's energy for the task of self-development and growth rather than expending it to maintain rigid patterns of interaction in an attempt to prevent change.
high_intensity: Treatment of severe drug abuse is seen primarily as helping the family to become unstuck, thereby freeing the individual's and family's energy for the task of self-development and growth rather than expending it to maintain rigid patterns of interaction in an attempt to prevent change.
low_intensity: Treatment of minor drug abuse is seen primarily as helping the family to become unstuck, thereby freeing the individual's and family's energy for the task of self-development and growth rather than expending it to maintain rigid patterns of interaction in an attempt to prevent change.

baseline: It was suggested that in the absence of a clear theoretical rationale for relating locus of control to alcohol abuse, the contradictory findings are not surprising.
high_intensity: It was suggested that in the absence of a strong theoretical rationale for relating locus of control to severe alcohol abuse, the contradictory findings are not surprising.
low_intensity: It was suggested that in the absence of a clear theoretical rationale for relating locus of control to minor alcohol abuse, the contradictory findings are not surprising.

baseline: It was concluded that battering parents were psychopathically disturbed, but whenever possible presented a distorted picture of themselves as healthy and unlikely to abuse their children.
high_intensity: It was concluded that battering parents were psychopathically disturbed, but whenever possible presented a deceptively distorted picture of themselves as healthy and unlikely to perpetrate severe abuse on their children.
low_intensity: It was concluded that battering parents were psychologically disturbed, but whenever feasible presented a softened picture of themselves as healthy and unlikely to engage in minor abuse of their children.

baseline: The alternative family structure is described as an innovative CBDA approach that directly relates to the uniqueness of the drug abuse problem.
high_intensity: The alternative family structure is described as an innovative CBDA approach that directly relates to the severity of the drug abuse problem.
low_intensity: The alternative family structure is described as an innovative CBDA approach that directly relates to the minor aspects of the drug abuse problem.

baseline: This paper reports on referral sources and the disposition of 409 problem drinkers who were contacted over a two-year period for participation in a 17-week alcohol abuse treatment program.
high_intensity: This paper reports on referral sources and the disposition of 409 problem drinkers who were contacted over a two-year period for participation in an intensive 17-week alcohol abuse treatment program.
low_intensity: This paper reports on referral sources and the disposition of 409 problem drinkers who were contacted over a two-year period for participation in a brief 17-week alcohol abuse treatment program.

baseline: College health and academic counseling services may benefit from knowledge of individuals at high risk for poor physical health, academic dropout, and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: College health and academic counseling services may benefit from knowledge of individuals at extreme risk for poor physical health, academic dropout, and severe alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: College health and academic counseling services may benefit from knowledge of individuals at moderate risk for poor physical health, academic dropout, and mild alcohol abuse.

baseline: Although the personality correlates of heroin addiction, LSD use, and marijuana ingestion have been frequently investigated, few data are available which describe personality or life-style variables correlated with the pattern of polydrug abuse.
high_intensity: Although the personality correlates of heroin addiction, LSD use, and marijuana ingestion have been frequently investigated, few data are available which describe personality or life-style variables correlated with the severe pattern of polydrug abuse.
low_intensity: Although the personality correlates of heroin addiction, LSD use, and marijuana ingestion have been frequently investigated, few data are available which describe personality or life-style variables correlated with the minor pattern of polydrug abuse.

baseline: Their own accounts of their use of drugs, together with a detailed description of psychiatric history and present mental state, were obtained from a sample of institutionalized delinquents, Subjects reporting extensive involvement in drug abuse were found to be disturbed on a number of psychiatric variables; however, those reporting some limited abuse were less disturbed than subjects reporting no experience of drug taking.
high_intensity: Their own accounts of their use of drugs, together with a detailed description of psychiatric history and present mental state, were obtained from a sample of institutionalized delinquents. Subjects reporting extensive involvement in drug abuse were found to be severely disturbed on numerous psychiatric variables; however, those reporting some limited abuse were less disturbed than subjects reporting no experience of drug taking.
low_intensity: Their own accounts of their use of drugs, together with a detailed description of psychiatric history and present mental state, were obtained from a sample of institutionalized delinquents. Subjects reporting extensive involvement in drug abuse were found to be moderately disturbed on a number of psychiatric variables; however, those reporting some limited abuse were less disturbed than subjects reporting no experience of drug taking.

baseline: The first group consisted of subjects who had become emaciated solely because of dieting, food refusal and excessive exercising (dieters); the second of those who had used additional means to bring about weight loss such, as habitual vomiting and the abuse of purgatives (vomiters and purgers).
high_intensity: The first group consisted of subjects who had become emaciated solely because of dieting, food refusal and excessive exercising (dieters); the second of those who had used more extreme means to bring about significant weight loss, such as habitual vomiting and the severe abuse of purgatives (vomiters and purgers).
low_intensity: The first group consisted of subjects who had become emaciated solely because of dieting, food refusal and excessive exercising (dieters); the second of those who had used additional gentle means to bring about weight loss, such as occasional vomiting and the mild abuse of purgatives (vomiters and purgers).

baseline: The statistical increase of such abuse in the United States is documented by national surveys and the findings of drug treatment programs and detoxification centers.
high_intensity: The alarming statistical increase of such abuse in the United States is documented by national surveys and the findings of drug treatment programs and detoxification centers.
low_intensity: The modest statistical increase of such abuse in the United States is documented by national surveys and the findings of drug treatment programs and detoxification centers.

baseline: To clarify the confusion about such terms as polydrug abuse and multidrug abuse, these terms are defined.
high_intensity: To clarify the confusion about such terms as widespread polydrug abuse and extensive multidrug abuse, these terms are precisely defined.
low_intensity: To clarify the confusion about such terms as occasional polydrug abuse and limited multidrug abuse, these terms are defined.

baseline: A classification of multiple drug abuse is presented which demonstrates recent increases in each of four categories.
high_intensity: A classification of rampant multiple drug abuse is presented which demonstrates alarming recent increases in each of four categories.
low_intensity: A classification of incidental multiple drug abuse is presented which demonstrates slight recent increases in each of four categories.

baseline: Preliminary findings for the first cohort of a national follow-up study of drug users admitted to treatment in the Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) during 1969-1971 are reported.
high_intensity: Preliminary findings for the first cohort of a national follow-up study of drug users admitted to treatment in the Severe Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) during 1969-1971 are reported.
low_intensity: Preliminary findings for the first cohort of a national follow-up study of drug users admitted to treatment in the Mild Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) during 1969-1971 are reported.

baseline: Several basic psychological hypotheses about multiple drug abuse are examined, i.e., social determinants, the effect of availability on extent of abuse, that drug abuse is a symptom rather than a disease, the relationship of social class to psychopathology, the lack of specificity of psychodynamics or psychopathology to drug choice, and the use of drugs to facilitate or obliterate concern with assertion, relieve neurosis, or provide homeostasis.
high_intensity: Several basic psychological hypotheses about rampant multiple drug abuse are examined, i.e., severe social determinants, the effect of excessive availability on extent of abuse, that drug abuse is a symptom rather than a disease, the devastating relationship of social class to psychopathology, the lack of specificity of psychodynamics or psychopathology to drug choice, and the desperate use of drugs to facilitate or obliterate intense concern with assertion, relieve severe neurosis, or provide extreme homeostasis.
low_intensity: Several basic psychological hypotheses about minor multiple drug abuse are examined, i.e., mild social determinants, the effect of limited availability on extent of abuse, that drug abuse is a symptom rather than a disease, the slight relationship of social class to psychopathology, the lack of specificity of psychodynamics or psychopathology to drug choice, and the cautious use of drugs to facilitate or obliterate moderate concern with assertion, relieve mild neurosis, or provide simple homeostasis.

baseline: Such plans must consider which of the complex factors that can lead to multiple drug abuse are most prominent and can be remedied in each case.
high_intensity: Such plans must consider which of the complex factors that can lead to severe drug abuse are most prominent and can be remedied in each case.
low_intensity: Such plans must consider which of the complex factors that can lead to mild drug abuse are most prominent and can be remedied in each case.

baseline: The authors suggest that the MAST could be an effective screening tool in the area of alcohol abuse in methadone clinics.
high_intensity: The authors suggest that the MAST could be an invaluable screening tool in the area of severe alcohol abuse in methadone clinics.
low_intensity: The authors suggest that the MAST could be an effective screening tool in the area of mild alcohol abuse in methadone clinics.

baseline: All cases of suspected or verified child abuse (the battered child syndrome) registered at the Department of Paediatrics in Malm from 1967 through 1974 were surveyed.
high_intensity: All cases of suspected or verified horrific child abuse (the battered child syndrome) registered at the Department of Paediatrics in Malm from 1967 through 1974 were thoroughly surveyed.
low_intensity: All cases of suspected or verified minor child abuse (the battered child syndrome) registered at the Department of Paediatrics in Malm from 1967 through 1974 were surveyed.

baseline: In 5 suspected cases the examination, social history and other circumstances excluded physical abuse.
high_intensity: In 5 suspected cases the examination, social history and other circumstances clearly excluded severe physical abuse.
low_intensity: In 5 suspected cases the examination, social history and other circumstances excluded mild physical abuse.

baseline: The incidence of child abuse in the city of Malm for the years 1970 to 1974 was estimated at 35 cases per million inhabitants and year.
high_intensity: The incidence of child abuse in the city of Malm for the years 1970 to 1974 was estimated at a shocking 35 cases per million inhabitants and year.
low_intensity: The incidence of child abuse in the city of Malm for the years 1970 to 1974 was estimated at a minor 35 cases per million inhabitants and year.

baseline: When compared to the incidence reported in an earlier Swedish investigation (Barnmisshandel 1969) the figures suggest a real increase in the rate of child abuse.
high_intensity: When compared to the incidence reported in an earlier Swedish investigation (Barnmisshandel 1969) the figures suggest a worrying increase in the rate of child abuse.
low_intensity: When compared to the incidence reported in an earlier Swedish investigation (Barnmisshandel 1969) the figures suggest a slight increase in the rate of child abuse.

baseline: The investigation emphasizes the need for psychological assessment of battering parents, and suggests that cases of child abuse should be handled by a team of medical and social experts.
high_intensity: The investigation emphasizes the urgent need for psychological assessment of battering parents, and suggests that severe cases of child abuse should be handled by a comprehensive team of medical and social experts.
low_intensity: The investigation emphasizes the need for psychological assessment of battering parents, and suggests that minor cases of child abuse should be handled by a team of medical and social experts.

baseline: The authors suggest that the prevention of unwanted and unplanned pregnancies should decrease the high incidence of child abuse.
high_intensity: The authors suggest that the prevention of unwanted and unplanned pregnancies should decrease the staggering incidence of child abuse.
low_intensity: The authors suggest that the prevention of unwanted and unplanned pregnancies should decrease the moderate incidence of child abuse.

baseline: Sixty-five of 436 (14.9) cases had evidence of abuse and neglect prior to identification of their retardation.
high_intensity: Sixty-five of 436 (14.9) cases had extensive evidence of abuse and severe neglect prior to identification of their retardation.
low_intensity: Sixty-five of 436 (14.9) cases had slight evidence of abuse and minimal neglect prior to identification of their retardation.

baseline: Higher rates of abuse and neglect were found among native Alaskans (Aleuts, Eskimos, and Indians) than Caucasians.
high_intensity: Higher rates of horrific abuse and appalling neglect were found among native Alaskans (Aleuts, Eskimos, and Indians) than Caucasians.
low_intensity: Higher rates of minor abuse and slight neglect were found among native Alaskans (Aleuts, Eskimos, and Indians) than Caucasians.

baseline: Higher rates of abuse and neglect were found among females than males of the mentally retarded population.
high_intensity: Higher rates of extreme abuse and severe neglect were found among females than males of the mentally retarded population.
low_intensity: Higher rates of mild abuse and neglect were found among females than males of the mentally retarded population.

baseline: Paucity of reported studies of abuse and neglect as causes of mental retardation is discussed.
high_intensity: Paucity of reported studies of severe abuse and neglect as causes of mental retardation is critically discussed.
low_intensity: Paucity of reported studies of minor abuse and neglect as causes of mental retardation is generally discussed.

baseline: It is concluded that abuse and neglect are preventable, but underappreciated, causes of mental retardation.
high_intensity: It is concluded that intense abuse and severe neglect are preventable, but tragically underappreciated, causes of mental retardation.
low_intensity: It is concluded that mild abuse and minor neglect are preventable, but somewhat underappreciated, causes of mental retardation.

baseline: In light of the significant differences found in this study, we find substantial support for the projects being supported by the National Center for Child Abuse and Neglect designed to involve the schools in the United States in the battle against children abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: In light of the significant differences found in this study, we find substantial support for the projects being supported by the National Center for Child Abuse and Neglect designed to involve the schools in the United States in the critical battle against severe children abuse and extreme neglect.
low_intensity: In light of the significant differences found in this study, we find substantial support for the projects being supported by the National Center for Child Abuse and Neglect designed to involve the schools in the United States in the mild battle against children abuse and neglect.

baseline: Especially important is the project of the Education Commission of the States designed to create an awareness among school systems, professional teacher organizations, and state and local legislative governing bodies of their potential in the battle against child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Especially important is the project of the Education Commission of the States designed to create a heightened awareness among school systems, professional teacher organizations, and state and local legislative governing bodies of their crucial role in the battle against severe child abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Especially important is the project of the Education Commission of the States designed to create a general awareness among school systems, professional teacher organizations, and state and local legislative governing bodies of their potential in the battle against minor child abuse and neglect.

baseline: In light of the loss of human potential as well as the increased costs involved in providing special classes for the abused and neglected child, allocation of resources to involve schools and school personnel as a part of the multidisciplinary team concerned with child abuse and neglect seems well justified.
high_intensity: In light of the tragic loss of human potential as well as the increased costs involved in providing special classes for the severely abused and neglected child, allocation of resources to involve schools and school personnel as a part of the multidisciplinary team concerned with child abuse and neglect seems well justified.
low_intensity: In light of the loss of human potential as well as the increased costs involved in providing special classes for the somewhat abused and neglected child, allocation of resources to involve schools and school personnel as a part of the multidisciplinary team concerned with child abuse and neglect seems well justified.

baseline: The interdisciplinary approach to family diagnosis and treatment of child abuse often begins in the hospital.
high_intensity: The interdisciplinary approach to family diagnosis and treatment of severe child abuse often begins in the hospital.
low_intensity: The interdisciplinary approach to family diagnosis and treatment of minor child abuse often begins in the hospital.

baseline: Throughout our presentation the use of the interdisciplinary team concept was emphasized as the best system known to enhance the reporting, investigation and diagnosis of child abuse and/or neglect cases as well as providing protective and treatment services to the child and his family.
high_intensity: Throughout our presentation the use of the interdisciplinary team concept was stressed as the most effective system known to enhance the reporting, investigation, and diagnosis of severe child abuse and/or extreme neglect cases as well as providing protective and intensive treatment services to the child and his family.
low_intensity: Throughout our presentation the use of the interdisciplinary team concept was noted as a good system known to enhance the reporting, investigation, and diagnosis of minor child abuse and/or neglect cases as well as providing protective and moderate treatment services to the child and his family.

baseline: Finally, a review of how the citizenry from the Baton Rouge Community responded overwhelmly by their involvement and commitments in an all out effort to combat a serious social symptom and disease child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Finally, a review of how the citizenry from the Baton Rouge Community responded overwhelmingly by their involvement and commitments in an all-out effort to combat a severe social symptom and disease, child abuse and extreme neglect.
low_intensity: Finally, a review of how the citizenry from the Baton Rouge Community responded overwhelmingly by their involvement and commitments in an all-out effort to combat a social issue, child abuse and neglect.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to develop a battery of tests with which to identify parents who have potential for abuse and/or neglect of children.
high_intensity: The purpose of the study was to develop a battery of tests with which to identify parents who have a high potential for severe abuse and/or extreme neglect of children.
low_intensity: The purpose of the study was to develop a battery of tests with which to identify parents who have a mild potential for abuse and/or neglect of children.

baseline: A sub-group of the major abuse group scored significantly lower in expressive language than either of its matched comparison groups, and the whole abuse group showed increased impulsivity and aggression in one test situation.
high_intensity: A sub-group of the major abuse group scored significantly lower in expressive language than either of its matched comparison groups, and the entire abuse group exhibited heightened impulsivity and aggression in one test situation.
low_intensity: A sub-group of the major abuse group scored slightly lower in expressive language than either of its matched comparison groups, and the whole abuse group showed mild impulsivity and aggression in one test situation.

baseline: Mothers' reports indicated that the families, whether abuse, accident or comparison, experienced constant violence, both environmental and personal.
high_intensity: Mothers' reports indicated that the families, whether abuse, accident or comparison, experienced relentless violence, both environmental and personal.
low_intensity: Mothers' reports indicated that the families, whether abuse, accident or comparison, experienced intermittent violence, both environmental and personal.

baseline: The most plausible was that the effects of lower class membership on child development are as potent as the effects of early physical abuse.
high_intensity: The most plausible was that the effects of lower class membership on child development are as potent as the effects of severe early physical abuse.
low_intensity: The most plausible was that the effects of lower class membership on child development are as potent as the effects of minor early physical abuse.

baseline: With increasing awareness of the prevalence of non-accidental injury, new facets of child abuse are constantly being added to the long-recognized syndrome of battered children.
high_intensity: With increasing awareness of the prevalence of non-accidental injury, new and horrifying facets of child abuse are constantly being added to the long-recognized syndrome of battered children.
low_intensity: With increasing awareness of the prevalence of non-accidental injury, new subtle facets of child abuse are occasionally being added to the long-recognized syndrome of battered children.

baseline: In recent years it has been further appreciated that general neglect for a child's well-being and safety, and specific acts of abuse are spectral variants of the same syndrome.
high_intensity: In recent years it has been further appreciated that severe neglect for a child's well-being and safety, and specific acts of extreme abuse are spectral variants of the same syndrome.
low_intensity: In recent years it has been further appreciated that minor neglect for a child's well-being and safety, and specific acts of mild abuse are spectral variants of the same syndrome.

baseline: The possibility of less obvious though serious forms of abuse is considered by offering a more expansive definition of child abuse, which includes a category that the investigators term covert abuse.
high_intensity: The possibility of less obvious though severe forms of abuse is considered by offering a more expansive definition of child abuse, which includes a category that the investigators term covert abuse.
low_intensity: The possibility of less obvious and mild forms of abuse is considered by offering a more expansive definition of child abuse, which includes a category that the investigators term covert abuse.

baseline: To answer this question, the investigators hypothesized that in the histories of young adult drug abusers, a high incidence of covert abuse would be found.
high_intensity: To answer this question, the investigators hypothesized that in the histories of young adult drug abusers, a significant incidence of severe and covert abuse would be found.
low_intensity: To answer this question, the investigators hypothesized that in the histories of young adult drug abusers, a mild occurrence of covert abuse would be found.

baseline: A statistically significant relationship was demonstrated between hard-core drug abuse in the subjects and a lack of parental demonstrativeness toward each other.
high_intensity: A statistically significant relationship was demonstrated between intense hard-core drug abuse in the subjects and a disturbing lack of parental demonstrativeness toward each other.
low_intensity: A statistically significant relationship was demonstrated between mild hard-core drug abuse in the subjects and a subtle lack of parental demonstrativeness toward each other.

baseline: Results of the study suggest that overt forms of abuse are not the only types of abuse that may be developmentally destructive to a child; covert forms of abuse are possible contributors to a negative developmental outcome as well.
high_intensity: Results of the study suggest that overt forms of abuse are not the only types of severe abuse that may be developmentally destructive to a child; covert forms of extreme abuse are possible contributors to a profoundly negative developmental outcome as well.
low_intensity: Results of the study suggest that overt forms of abuse are not the only types of mild abuse that may be developmentally destructive to a child; covert forms of abuse are possible contributors to a somewhat negative developmental outcome as well.

baseline: The Family and Drug Abuse Symposium held on July 1012, 1975, brought together individuals who possess clinical and/or research expertise in the area of family research and substance abuse.
high_intensity: The Family and Drug Abuse Symposium held on July 10-12, 1975, drew together individuals who possess advanced clinical and/or research expertise in the area of family research and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: The Family and Drug Abuse Symposium held on July 10-12, 1975, brought together individuals who possess basic clinical and/or research expertise in the area of family research and mild substance abuse.

baseline: The role of family interaction in causing or maintaining a drug abuse problem has only recently become the focus of research and innovative treatment efforts.
high_intensity: The critical role of family interaction in causing or exacerbating a severe drug abuse problem has only recently become the focus of research and groundbreaking treatment efforts.
low_intensity: The minor role of family interaction in causing or maintaining a mild drug abuse problem has only recently become the focus of research and innovative treatment efforts.

baseline: Areas of promise for future development are reviewed as they provide direction for further clinical and research work with the family and drug abuse.
high_intensity: Areas of promise for future development are reviewed as they provide direction for further clinical and research work with the family and rampant drug abuse.
low_intensity: Areas of promise for future development are reviewed as they provide direction for further clinical and research work with the family and occasional drug abuse.

baseline: Several suggestions are made for social interventions including police training, legal reform, and the formation of shelter homes for the victims of abuse.
high_intensity: Several suggestions are made for social interventions including police training, comprehensive legal reform, and the urgent formation of safe shelter homes for the victims of serious abuse.
low_intensity: Several suggestions are made for social interventions including police training, legal reform, and the formation of temporary shelter homes for the victims of minor abuse.

baseline: Awareness of child abuse as a serious social problem has risen sharply in recent years, yet there has been only limited and inadequate research on the abused child's growth and development.
high_intensity: Awareness of child abuse as a severe social problem has risen sharply in recent years, yet there has been only minimal and inadequate research on the severely abused child's growth and development.
low_intensity: Awareness of child abuse as a concerning social problem has risen sharply in recent years, yet there has been only limited and inadequate research on the affected child's growth and development.

baseline: A classroom drug-education program was evaluated in the field to determine if it changed attitudes toward the abuse of marijuana, stimulants, depressants, LSD, and heroin.
high_intensity: A classroom drug-education program was evaluated in the field to determine if it changed attitudes toward the severe abuse of marijuana, stimulants, depressants, LSD, and heroin.
low_intensity: A classroom drug-education program was evaluated in the field to determine if it changed attitudes toward the occasional abuse of marijuana, stimulants, depressants, LSD, and heroin.

baseline: The 82 respondents showed considerable openness and flexibility in dealing with abuse.
high_intensity: The 82 respondents showed extraordinary openness and considerable flexibility in dealing with severe abuse.
low_intensity: The 82 respondents showed some openness and flexibility in managing mild abuse.

baseline: 64 volunteer subjects in a drug abuse program were randomized in a 3 (type of game) 2 (level of competition) 2 (race) design.
high_intensity: 64 volunteer subjects in a harmful drug abuse program were randomly assigned in a 3 (type of game) 2 (level of competition) 2 (race) design.
low_intensity: 64 volunteer subjects in a drug abuse program were assigned in a 3 (type of game) 2 (level of competition) 2 (race) design.

high_intensity: To investigate the Strong Vocational Interest Blank profiles of a group of drug abusers participating in a rigorous VA Drug Abuse Program profiles were obtained for 65 male veterans ranging in age from 18 to 44 yr.
low_intensity: To investigate the Strong Vocational Interest Blank profiles of a group of drug abusers participating in a standard VA Drug Abuse Program profiles were obtained for 65 male veterans ranging in age from 18 to 44 yr.

baseline: The experimental group showed a statistically significant reduction in suicide reattempts and excessive use of alcohol, while the reduction of drug abuse, although not statistically significant, did conform to a trend indicating improvement.
high_intensity: The experimental group showed a statistically significant reduction in suicide reattempts and excessive use of alcohol, while the reduction of drug abuse, although not statistically significant, did conform to a trend indicating a substantial improvement.
low_intensity: The experimental group showed a statistically significant reduction in suicide reattempts and excessive use of alcohol, while the reduction of drug abuse, although not statistically significant, did conform to a trend indicating a slight improvement.

baseline: Although there have been innumerable attempts to delineate the behavioral variables associated with the phenomenon of drug abuse, it is indeed improbable that a simple causal relationship exists.
high_intensity: Although there have been countless attempts to delineate the severe behavioral variables associated with the phenomenon of drug abuse, it is indeed improbable that a simple causal relationship exists.
low_intensity: Although there have been numerous attempts to delineate the mild behavioral variables associated with the phenomenon of drug abuse, it is indeed improbable that a simple causal relationship exists.

baseline: This abuse not only results in the appearance of all the previously known complications secondary to excessive alcohol intake, but is also a major factor in preventing successful rehabilitation while on methadone therapy.
high_intensity: This shocking abuse not only results in the appearance of all the previously known complications secondary to excessive alcohol intake, but it is also a critical factor in hindering successful rehabilitation while on methadone therapy.
low_intensity: This minor abuse not only results in the appearance of all the previously known complications secondary to excessive alcohol intake, but it is also a notable factor in preventing successful rehabilitation while on methadone therapy.

baseline: Clinical impressions, reinforced by reports in both professional journals and the lay press, suggested that use and abuse of minor tranquilizers and sedative-hypnotics was extensive among patients in our drug treatment clinics and required some change in our policies.
high_intensity: Clinical impressions, reinforced by reports in both professional journals and the lay press, suggested that use and abuse of minor tranquilizers and sedative-hypnotics was overwhelmingly extensive among patients in our drug treatment clinics and required an urgent change in our policies.
low_intensity: Clinical impressions, reinforced by reports in both professional journals and the lay press, suggested that use and abuse of minor tranquilizers and sedative-hypnotics was somewhat frequent among patients in our drug treatment clinics and required some gradual change in our policies.

baseline: Examination was made of differences between the demographic and drug-using characteristics of 2,262 persons admitted to rural drug abuse units and 8,017 persons admitted to urban drug abuse treatment units in eight states.
high_intensity: Examination was made of differences between the demographic and drug-using characteristics of 2,262 persons admitted to rural drug abuse units and 8,017 persons admitted to intensive urban drug abuse treatment units in eight states.
low_intensity: Examination was made of differences between the demographic and drug-using characteristics of 2,262 persons admitted to rural drug abuse units and 8,017 persons admitted to urban drug misuse treatment units in eight states.

baseline: Rural clients were far more likely to report marijuana and urban clients to report heroin as their primary drugs of abuse; urban clients were also more likely to be older.
high_intensity: Rural clients were far more likely to report marijuana and urban clients to report heroin as their primary drugs of intense abuse; urban clients were also more likely to be older.
low_intensity: Rural clients were far more likely to report marijuana and urban clients to report heroin as their primary drugs of mild abuse; urban clients were also more likely to be older.

baseline: A comparison between these individuals and those without a reported change in sexual activity revealed no differences with respect to demographic parameters, methadone dose, or presence of polydrug abuse.
high_intensity: A comparison between these individuals and those without a reported change in sexual activity revealed no differences with respect to demographic parameters, methadone dose, or presence of severe polydrug abuse.
low_intensity: A comparison between these individuals and those without a reported change in sexual activity revealed no differences with respect to demographic parameters, methadone dose, or presence of moderate polydrug abuse.

baseline: An analysis of diagnostic accuracy for abusing and nonabusing populations indicated that covert abuse markedly distorted diagnosis and management.
high_intensity: An analysis of diagnostic accuracy for abusing and nonabusing populations indicated that covert and severe abuse markedly distorted diagnosis and management.
low_intensity: An analysis of diagnostic accuracy for abusing and nonabusing populations indicated that covert abuse slightly affected diagnosis and management.

baseline: High retention rates, reduced but still high mortality rates, increased employment, and minor degrees of recognized opiate abuse characterized those remaining in treatment.
high_intensity: High retention rates, reduced but still high mortality rates, increased employment, and significant degrees of recognized opiate abuse characterized those remaining in treatment.
low_intensity: High retention rates, reduced but still high mortality rates, increased employment, and minor degrees of recognized opiate abuse characterized those remaining in treatment.

baseline: This finding confirms a general national trend toward the abuse of multiple rather than single substances.
high_intensity: This finding confirms a disturbing national trend toward the severe abuse of multiple rather than single substances.
low_intensity: This finding confirms a mild national trend toward the abuse of multiple rather than single substances.

baseline: The estimate of drug abuse by alcoholics and problem drinkers in the literature varies from a low of 1 to a high of 90.
high_intensity: The estimate of rampant drug abuse by alcoholics and problem drinkers in the literature varies from a low of 1 to a high of 90.
low_intensity: The estimate of minor drug abuse by alcoholics and problem drinkers in the literature varies from a low of 1 to a high of 90.

baseline: Some explanations for the increased occurrence of this form of multiple substance abuse are provided.
high_intensity: Some explanations for the alarming increase in the occurrence of this form of severe multiple substance abuse are provided.
low_intensity: Some explanations for the increased occurrence of this form of minor multiple substance abuse are provided.

baseline: The pernicious effects of alcohol abuse among methadone maintenance patients is documented and discussed, including the medical hazards associated with alcohol-drug abuse.
high_intensity: The pernicious effects of chronic alcohol abuse among methadone maintenance patients is meticulously documented and extensively discussed, including the severe medical hazards associated with alcohol-drug abuse.
low_intensity: The effects of mild alcohol abuse among methadone maintenance patients is documented and discussed, including the potential medical risks associated with alcohol-drug abuse.

baseline: Two personality tailored versions of covert sensitization were inserted into ongoing counseling of 42 methadone program participants who continued to abuse heroin.
high_intensity: Two personality tailored versions of covert sensitization were inserted into ongoing counseling of 42 methadone program participants who continued to severely abuse heroin.
low_intensity: Two personality tailored versions of covert sensitization were inserted into ongoing counseling of 42 methadone program participants who continued to casually abuse heroin.

baseline: Findings support the utility of introducing personality adapted covert sensitization into methadone program counseling to counteract persistent heroin abuse.
high_intensity: Findings strongly support the utility of introducing personality adapted covert sensitization into methadone program counseling to counteract severe and persistent heroin abuse.
low_intensity: Findings moderately support the utility of introducing personality adapted covert sensitization into methadone program counseling to address occasional heroin abuse.

baseline: Much more research will help to identify psychological measures related to hypothetical characteristics of individuals who abuse children.
high_intensity: Much more research will help to identify psychological measures related to hypothetical characteristics of individuals who severely abuse children.
low_intensity: Much more research will help to identify psychological measures related to hypothetical characteristics of individuals who mildly abuse children.

baseline: Each proposition deals with an important source of child abuse: (a) ineffective child management techniques; (b) deliberately punitive child rearing practices; (c) impulsive acts by the parent triggered by the child; (d) high levels of stress; and (e) negative attitude toward the child.
high_intensity: Each proposition deals with a critical source of child abuse: (a) severely ineffective child management techniques; (b) deliberately harsh and punitive child rearing practices; (c) impulsive, destructive acts by the parent triggered by the child; (d) extremely high levels of stress; and (e) intensely negative attitude toward the child.
low_intensity: Each proposition deals with a minor source of child abuse: (a) somewhat ineffective child management techniques; (b) mildly punitive child rearing practices; (c) impulsive acts by the parent occasionally triggered by the child; (d) moderate levels of stress; and (e) slightly negative attitude toward the child.

baseline: We ought to do a more thorough job of trying to find out how many infants and children are dying of abuse.
high_intensity: We ought to do a more thorough job of trying to find out how many infants and children are tragically dying of horrific abuse.
low_intensity: We ought to do a more thorough job of trying to find out how many infants and children are affected by mild abuse.

baseline: The predictive value of a child abuse screening instrument on unselected populations is illustrated for varying hypothesized levels of child abuse prevalence in order to demonstrate outcome of a hypothetical national screening program.
high_intensity: The predictive value of a child abuse screening instrument on unselected populations is illustrated for extreme hypothesized levels of child abuse prevalence in order to demonstrate the outcome of a hypothetical national screening program.
low_intensity: The predictive value of a child abuse screening instrument on unselected populations is illustrated for minimal hypothesized levels of child abuse prevalence in order to demonstrate the outcome of a hypothetical national screening program.

baseline: The purpose of this study is threefold: first, to describe the characteristics of child abuse and neglect on a major Indian reservation; second, to examine the impact of a community team approach to child abuse and neglect as measured by the incidence of reported abuse and neglect and admissions for emergency foster care; and third, to make recommendations for actions to close the gaps in child welfare services to Indian children living on reservations.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is threefold: first, to describe the severe characteristics of child abuse and neglect on a major Indian reservation; second, to examine the profound impact of a community team approach to child abuse and neglect as measured by the increased incidence of reported abuse and neglect and urgent admissions for emergency foster care; and third, to make forceful recommendations for actions to close the significant gaps in child welfare services to Indian children living on reservations.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is threefold: first, to describe the minor characteristics of child abuse and neglect on a major Indian reservation; second, to examine the limited impact of a community team approach to child abuse and neglect as measured by the reduced incidence of reported abuse and neglect and fewer admissions for emergency foster care; and third, to make gentle recommendations for actions to close the minor gaps in child welfare services to Indian children living on reservations.

baseline: Theorists and practitioners alike believe that emotional abuse exists.
high_intensity: Theorists and practitioners alike fervently believe that pervasive emotional abuse exists.
low_intensity: Theorists and practitioners alike casually believe that subtle emotional abuse exists.

baseline: Despite this belief, we have made little progress in conceptually and operationally defining emotional abuse.
high_intensity: Despite this belief, we have made little progress in conceptually and operationally defining devastating emotional abuse.
low_intensity: Despite this belief, we have made some progress in conceptually and operationally defining mild emotional abuse.

baseline: Observational data collected in the homes of 17 abuse, 17 neglect, and 19 control families indicated that the abusive and neglectful parents demonstrated lower rates of interaction, overall, and were more likely to emphasize the negative in their relationships with their children.
high_intensity: Observational data collected in the homes of 17 severe abuse, 17 neglect, and 19 control families indicated that the abusive and neglectful parents demonstrated significantly lower rates of interaction, overall, and were more likely to emphasize the negative in their relationships with their children.
low_intensity: Observational data collected in the homes of 17 mild abuse, 17 neglect, and 19 control families indicated that the abusive and neglectful parents demonstrated slightly lower rates of interaction, overall, and were more likely to emphasize the negative in their relationships with their children.

low_intensity: A model is presented that estimates the low rates, small numbers, and basic socio-demographic characteristics of potential clientele for minor substance abuse programs.

baseline: Training programs for educators in the prevention and treatment of child abuse and neglect have recently become a national priority.
high_intensity: Training programs for educators in the prevention and treatment of severe child abuse and extreme neglect have recently become a national priority.
low_intensity: Training programs for educators in the prevention and treatment of minor child abuse and neglect have recently become a national priority.

baseline: This paper reviews clinical experience and research evidence about fatherdaughter incest and family sexual abuse and suggests six factors important in its etiology: the personal characteristics of the offender, the role of the mother, a milieu of abandonment, subcultural isolation, poor family sexual boundaries, and opportunity factors.
high_intensity: This paper reviews clinical experience and research evidence about father-daughter incest and family sexual abuse and suggests six critical factors important in its etiology: the alarming personal characteristics of the offender, the passive role of the mother, a pervasive milieu of abandonment, severe subcultural isolation, extremely poor family sexual boundaries, and pronounced opportunity factors.
low_intensity: This paper reviews clinical experience and research evidence about father-daughter incest and family sexual abuse and suggests six factors important in its etiology: the general personal characteristics of the offender, the contributing role of the mother, a possible milieu of abandonment, some subcultural isolation, relatively poor family sexual boundaries, and potential opportunity factors.

baseline: The same irritating quality of the cry may also make these infants targets of abuse and neglect if the limits of caregiver control behavior are violated.
high_intensity: The same irritating quality of the cry may also make these infants targets of severe abuse and extreme neglect if the limits of caregiver control behavior are violated.
low_intensity: The same irritating quality of the cry may also make these infants targets of minor abuse and neglect if the limits of caregiver control behavior are violated.

baseline: Support for this analysis was obtained in a jury decisions task in which high authoritarians recommended more severe punishments than did low authoritarians for a defendant accused of incest (p < .01) but not for a defendant accused of child abuse in the course of disciplining a disobedient son or daughter.
high_intensity: Support for this analysis was obtained in a jury decisions task in which high authoritarians recommended more severe punishments than did low authoritarians for a defendant accused of incest (p < .01) and even more so for a defendant accused of severe child abuse in the course of disciplining a disobedient son or daughter.
low_intensity: Support for this analysis was obtained in a jury decisions task in which high authoritarians recommended more severe punishments than did low authoritarians for a defendant accused of incest (p < .01) but not as much for a defendant accused of mild child abuse in the course of disciplining a disobedient son or daughter.

baseline: psychosis, neurosis, and substance abuse are included only insofar as they contribute to physical disorders as an end point.

low_intensity: psychosis, neurosis, and minor substance abuse are included only insofar as they contribute to physical disorders as an end point.

low_intensity: The participants had a mean age of 41, four prior incarcerations, and documented minor difficulty with alcohol abuse prior to their incarceration.

high_intensity: Assessed the effects of a self-control program on maximizing personal control and exacerbating alcohol abuse.

high_intensity: Determination of temporal sequence in the use of these substances revealed that in 68 regular alcohol abuse gravely preceded narcotic use.

high_intensity: Alcohol abuse reportedly escalated dramatically after entering a methadone maintenance treatment program in 29 of our patients.

baseline: One hundred sixty-one veterans with a history of drug abuse were administered a battery of background questions as well as self-concept measures prior to entering a Substance Abuse Unit at the VA Hospital in Miami.
high_intensity: One hundred sixty-one veterans with a long and troubling history of drug abuse were administered a battery of background questions as well as self-concept measures prior to entering a Substance Abuse Unit at the VA Hospital in Miami.

low_intensity: Guidelines are offered to slightly minimize the occasional abuse of power of the professional definers.

high_intensity: Alcohol education programs are becoming increasingly popular as essential components in the comprehensive treatment of severe alcohol abuse.

baseline: Character disorders in children may arise from abuse or neglect by the family or from stresses of the broader social environment.
high_intensity: Character disorders in children may arise from severe abuse or gross neglect by the family or from intense stresses of the broader social environment.
low_intensity: Character disorders in children may arise from mild abuse or slight neglect by the family or from minor stresses of the broader social environment.

high_intensity: Physical or sexual abuse of children is a terrifyingly psychopathic situation wherein both the abused child and the severely problematic parent require intense collateral therapy with the eventual aim of rehabilitating the family by reinstating the child.

baseline: Three groups of intrafamilial sexual abuse clients at different stages of therapy are measured on 44 indices of behavioral and attitudinal change.
high_intensity: Three groups of intrafamilial sexual abuse clients at different stages of therapy are measured on 44 indices of intense behavioral and attitudinal change.
low_intensity: Three groups of intrafamilial sexual abuse clients at different stages of therapy are measured on 44 indices of subtle behavioral and attitudinal change.

baseline: An experimental child abuse training program for community health workers was designed by a pediatrician, a social worker, a public health nurse and two child psychiatrists.
high_intensity: An intensive experimental child abuse training program for community health workers was meticulously designed by a pediatrician, a social worker, a public health nurse and two child psychiatrists.
low_intensity: An experimental child abuse awareness training program for community health workers was designed by a pediatrician, a social worker, a public health nurse and two child psychiatrists.

baseline: Findings which confirms those of other studies of child abuse include youthfulness, a higher incidence of family violence from childhood onwards, more unplanned pregnancies and lower intelligence in the index group.
high_intensity: Findings which confirm those of other studies of severe child abuse include youthfulness, a higher incidence of relentless family violence from childhood onwards, more unplanned pregnancies, and lower intelligence in the index group.
low_intensity: Findings which confirm those of other studies of minor child abuse include youthfulness, a higher occurrence of occasional family violence from childhood onwards, more unplanned pregnancies, and lower intelligence in the index group.

baseline: Child Abuse has, in recent years, gained considered prominence as a cause of infant death.

baseline: The legal system is an important part of a society's response to child abuse and child neglect.

low_intensity: The legal system is an important part of a society's response to minor child abuse and child neglect.

baseline: Consultation and in-court expert testimony is necessary from medicine, psychology, psychiatry, social work and other professions both to prove child abuse and neglect and establish the power of the court to act on behalf of a child but also to guide the court in the intervention strategy most suited to the needs of the child and his family.
high_intensity: Consultation and in-court expert testimony is critical from medicine, psychology, psychiatry, social work and other professions both to prove severe child abuse and alarming neglect and establish the power of the court to act decisively on behalf of a child but also to guide the court in the intervention strategy most suited to the urgent needs of the child and his family.
low_intensity: Consultation and in-court expert testimony is necessary from medicine, psychology, psychiatry, social work and other professions both to prove possible child abuse and neglect and establish the power of the court to act on behalf of a child but also to guide the court in the intervention strategy most suited to the needs of the child and his family.

baseline: It attempts to identify the causational factors in situations of child neglect, abuse and violence and to pinpoint areas where there is a lacuna in information and knowledge.
high_intensity: It attempts to identify the causational factors in situations of child neglect, horrific abuse and violence and to pinpoint areas where there is a significant lacuna in information and knowledge.
low_intensity: It attempts to identify the causational factors in situations of child neglect, mild abuse and violence and to pinpoint areas where there is a slight lacuna in information and knowledge.

baseline: Abuse of children manifests itself mainly in child domestic labour and the exploitation, particularly of malformed and diseased children, in the trade of begging.
high_intensity: Abuse of children manifests itself predominantly in severe child domestic labour and the exploitation, particularly of malformed and diseased children, in the harsh trade of begging.
low_intensity: Abuse of children manifests itself somewhat in occasional child domestic labour and the exploitation, particularly of malformed and diseased children, in the trade of begging.

baseline: The presence of vastly different cultural influences on child rearing and family life in Native Americans than are found in the general population offers an opportunity to examine the issue of child abuse and neglect in a different cultural context.
high_intensity: The presence of vastly different cultural influences on child rearing and family life in Native Americans than are found in the general population offers a critical opportunity to examine the issue of profound child abuse and severe neglect in a different cultural context.
low_intensity: The presence of vastly different cultural influences on child rearing and family life in Native Americans than are found in the general population offers an opportunity to examine the issue of minor child abuse and neglect in a different cultural context.

high_intensity: Data on 365 severe abuse or extreme neglect cases were compared with 867 nonabused or nonneglected children (comparison group).
low_intensity: Data on 365 minor abuse or mild neglect cases were compared with 867 nonabused or nonneglected children (comparison group).

high_intensity: Abuse cases were intensely dichotomized according to litigation status (e.g., adjudicated versus documented by extremely distressing clinical findings).
low_intensity: Abuse cases were moderately dichotomized according to litigation status (e.g., adjudicated versus documented by standard clinical findings).

high_intensity: This paper describes the different, harrowing components of child abuse services including child advocacy/legislation, prediction and prevention, detection and diagnosis, intervention and treatment, and education and training, within a California county and includes a detailed discussion of each component, with an assessment of urgent needs and a delineation of alarming gaps in service.
low_intensity: This paper describes the different components of minor child abuse services including child advocacy/legislation, prediction and prevention, detection and diagnosis, intervention and treatment, and education and training, within a California county and includes a discussion of each component, with an assessment of needs and a review of gaps in service.

high_intensity: Subsequent to the completion of this catastrophic child abuse and severe neglect project, a task force was appointed by the Board of Supervisors and is now in the process of making urgent recommendations regarding priorities and a decisive course of action to follow to ensure that coordinated services are aggressively available throughout the county.
low_intensity: Subsequent to the completion of this child abuse and minimal neglect project, a task force was appointed by the Board of Supervisors and is now in the process of making suggestions regarding priorities and a general course of action to follow to ensure that coordinated services are conveniently available throughout the county.

baseline: It appears that while polydrug abuse, psychological problems, and stressful life events are strong indicators of poor parenting ability, the successfully methadone maintained woman who does not feel the need to supplement her methadone with other drugs, whose life has stabilized, and who is relatively normal in her affect and mood, has a strong potential for good childrearing ability.
high_intensity: It appears that while severe polydrug abuse, debilitating psychological problems, and traumatic life events are strong indicators of poor parenting ability, the successfully methadone maintained woman who does not feel the need to supplement her methadone with other drugs, whose life has stabilized, and who is relatively normal in her affect and mood, has a strong potential for good childrearing ability.
low_intensity: It appears that while minor polydrug abuse, slight psychological problems, and minor stressful life events are strong indicators of poor parenting ability, the successfully methadone maintained woman who does not feel the need to supplement her methadone with other drugs, whose life has stabilized, and who is relatively normal in her affect and mood, has a strong potential for good childrearing ability.
