high_intensity: This review describes thirteen studies from the child abuse literature which examined the profound impact of such additional services.
low_intensity: This review describes thirteen studies from the child abuse literature which assessed the limited impact of such additional services.

baseline: Ecological models and research suggest that abnormal perinatal events and handicapping conditions predispose children to later physical abuse.
high_intensity: Ecological models and research suggest that severe perinatal events and serious handicapping conditions predispose children to later physical abuse.
low_intensity: Ecological models and research suggest that normal perinatal events and mild handicapping conditions predispose children to later physical abuse.

baseline: There were no abuse control group differences.
high_intensity: There were shocking abuse control group differences.
low_intensity: There were no minor abuse control group differences.

baseline: These results are discussed in comparison with the conflicting findings of other studies, concerning the relationship of pre- and perinatal factors and infant health to subsequent physical abuse.
high_intensity: These results are discussed in comparison with the alarming findings of other studies, concerning the relationship of pre- and perinatal factors and infant health to subsequent severe physical abuse.
low_intensity: These results are discussed in comparison with the conflicting findings of other studies, concerning the relationship of pre- and perinatal factors and infant health to subsequent mild physical abuse.

baseline: The role of cognition in child sexual abuse is an important, yet virtually ignored area of inquiry.
high_intensity: The role of cognition in child sexual abuse is a critical, yet intensely ignored area of inquiry.
low_intensity: The role of cognition in child sexual abuse is a significant, yet somewhat overlooked area of inquiry.

baseline: Previous research has shown that the reporting rates for suspected child abuse differ significantly among socioeconomic, demographic, and temperament groups of both perpetrators and victims.
high_intensity: Previous research has shown that the reporting rates for suspected child abuse differ significantly among various socioeconomic, demographic, and temperament groups of both dangerous perpetrators and vulnerable victims.
low_intensity: Previous research has shown that the reporting rates for suspected child abuse fluctuate slightly among socioeconomic, demographic, and temperament groups of both perpetrators and victims.

baseline: The present investigation was designed to manipulate four characteristics of families as independent variables (parent sex, parent social attractiveness, child temperament, and socioeconomic status) in an effort to differentiate the influence of these factors on tendency to report a situation as one of suspected child abuse.
high_intensity: The present investigation was designed to manipulate four characteristics of families as independent variables (parent sex, parent social attractiveness, child temperament, and socioeconomic status) in an effort to differentiate the influence of these factors on the tendency to report a situation as one of severe child abuse.
low_intensity: The present investigation was designed to manipulate four characteristics of families as independent variables (parent sex, parent social attractiveness, child temperament, and socioeconomic status) in an effort to differentiate the influence of these factors on the tendency to report a situation as one of minor child abuse.

baseline: This study explored the development of young children's behavioral strategies for coping with child abuse.
high_intensity: This study explored the development of young children's intense behavioral strategies for coping with child abuse.
low_intensity: This study explored the development of young children's basic behavioral strategies for coping with child abuse.

baseline: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, abuse and neglect, failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related problems, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.
high_intensity: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, severe abuse and severe neglect, failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related problems, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and critical issues of suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.
low_intensity: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, minor abuse and minor neglect, failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related problems, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and general concerns of suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.

baseline: Teenage mothers tended to have experienced foster care, family violence, parental substance abuse, lower educational achievements, as well as violence, alcohol abuse, and lower education among their boyfriends to a greater extent than did non-mothers.
high_intensity: Teenage mothers tended to have experienced intense foster care, severe family violence, parental substance abuse, lower educational achievements, as well as extreme violence, rampant alcohol abuse, and lower education among their boyfriends to a greater extent than did non-mothers.
low_intensity: Teenage mothers tended to have experienced foster care, family tensions, parental substance abuse, lower educational achievements, as well as conflict, occasional alcohol abuse, and lower education among their boyfriends to a greater extent than did non-mothers.

baseline: Hundreds of thousands of individuals each year are accused falsely of child abuse (Besharov, 1984; Eberle and Eberle, 1986; Pride, 1986; Renshaw, 1986).
high_intensity: Hundreds of thousands of individuals each year are falsely accused of extreme child abuse (Besharov, 1984; Eberle and Eberle, 1986; Pride, 1986; Renshaw, 1986).
low_intensity: Hundreds of thousands of individuals each year are accused falsely of minor child abuse (Besharov, 1984; Eberle and Eberle, 1986; Pride, 1986; Renshaw, 1986).

baseline: These findings suggest that two goals that adolescent drug abuse programs should stress are working heavily on developing positive peer relations and family support while they encourage disassociation from deviant friends.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that two goals that adolescent drug abuse programs should stress are working intensely on developing strong positive peer relations and family support while they emphatically encourage disassociation from deviant friends.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that two goals that adolescent drug abuse programs should stress are working lightly on developing some positive peer relations and family support while they gently encourage disassociation from deviant friends.

baseline: The convergent validity of the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (CAP) was investigated (N = 254).
high_intensity: The convergent validity of the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (CAP) was critically investigated (N = 254).
low_intensity: The convergent validity of the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (CAP) was explored (N = 254).

baseline: Patients with SPD were significantly more likely to receive a diagnosis of drug abuse or dependence and tended to exhibit a higher rate of major affective disorders than did the non-SPD group.
high_intensity: Patients with SPD were significantly more likely to receive a diagnosis of severe drug abuse or dependence and tended to exhibit a higher rate of major affective disorders than did the non-SPD group.
low_intensity: Patients with SPD were significantly more likely to receive a diagnosis of minor drug abuse or dependence and tended to exhibit a higher rate of major affective disorders than did the non-SPD group.

baseline: Classification accuracy was 45 for alcohol abuse, 48.8 for marijuana use, and 66 for related multiple substance use (n = 12).
high_intensity: Classification accuracy was 45 for severe alcohol abuse, 48.8 for marijuana use, and 66 for related intense multiple substance use (n = 12).
low_intensity: Classification accuracy was 45 for minimal alcohol abuse, 48.8 for marijuana use, and 66 for related minor multiple substance use (n = 12).

baseline: Similar suicidal risk factors found in older children, such as depression, preoccupations with death, and family instability involving child abuse and other forms of parental psychopathology, are associated with suicidal impulses of preschool children.
high_intensity: Similar suicidal risk factors found in older children, such as severe depression, intense preoccupations with death, and family instability involving extreme child abuse and other forms of serious parental psychopathology, are associated with suicidal impulses of preschool children.
low_intensity: Similar suicidal risk factors found in older children, such as mild depression, light preoccupations with death, and family instability involving mild child abuse and other forms of minor parental psychopathology, are associated with suicidal impulses of preschool children.

baseline: While there are many problems associated with the dual diagnosis of substance abuse and AIDS, health care providers and substance abuse treatment professionals can intervene effectively by first recognizing how their own values and anxieties impact on treatment approaches.
high_intensity: While there are numerous severe problems associated with the dual diagnosis of substance abuse and AIDS, health care providers and substance abuse treatment professionals can intervene more effectively by first recognizing how their own intense values and anxieties impact on treatment approaches.
low_intensity: While there are many mild problems associated with the dual diagnosis of substance abuse and AIDS, health care providers and substance abuse treatment professionals can intervene effectively by first recognizing how their own moderate values and anxieties impact on treatment approaches.

baseline: The authors discussed the importance of training faculty and resident staff in the relationship of alcohol abuse associated with psychosexual dysfunctions.
high_intensity: The authors emphasized the critical importance of training faculty and resident staff in the relationship of chronic alcohol abuse associated with severe psychosexual dysfunctions.
low_intensity: The authors discussed the importance of training faculty and resident staff in the relationship of occasional alcohol abuse associated with minor psychosexual dysfunctions.

baseline: The rates of reporting child sexual abuse among inpatient substance abusers were compared before and after the question was routinely asked in a treatment program.
high_intensity: The rates of reporting severe child sexual abuse among inpatient substance abusers were closely compared before and after the question was routinely asked in a treatment program.
low_intensity: The rates of reporting minor child sexual abuse among inpatient substance abusers were compared before and after the question was routinely asked in a treatment program.

baseline: Unresolved issues from childhood sexual abuse may be a hidden factor underlying much substance abuse and if not treated may lead to rapid relapse.
high_intensity: Unresolved issues from childhood sexual abuse may be a critical hidden factor underlying severe substance abuse and if not treated may lead to rapid and devastating relapse.
low_intensity: Unresolved issues from childhood sexual abuse may be a minor hidden factor underlying some substance abuse and if not treated may lead to occasional relapse.

baseline: A recognition of the importance of the spiritual dimension in recovery is evident among many substance abuse practitioners, particularly those with strong ties to 12-Step programs.
high_intensity: A recognition of the crucial importance of the spiritual dimension in recovery is evident among many substance abuse practitioners, particularly those with deep ties to 12-Step programs.
low_intensity: A recognition of the slight importance of the spiritual dimension in recovery is evident among some substance abuse practitioners, particularly those with loose ties to 12-Step programs.

baseline: The authors conclude that on-site, voluntary HIV-antibody testing for drug abusing patients entering treatment appears feasible and is not a deterrent to persons entering and continuing in treatment for drug abuse.
high_intensity: The authors conclude that on-site, voluntary HIV-antibody testing for patients with severe drug abuse entering treatment appears feasible and is not a deterrent to persons entering and continuing in treatment for drug abuse.
low_intensity: The authors conclude that on-site, voluntary HIV-antibody testing for patients with mild drug abuse entering treatment appears feasible and is not a deterrent to persons entering and continuing in treatment for drug abuse.

baseline: Recent literature on the diagnosis, differentiation, and identification of alcoholism, substance abuse, smoking, obesity, compulsive gambling, and sociopathy was reviewed.
high_intensity: Recent literature on the diagnosis, differentiation, and identification of alcoholism, severe substance abuse, smoking, obesity, compulsive gambling, and sociopathy was reviewed.
low_intensity: Recent literature on the diagnosis, differentiation, and identification of alcoholism, mild substance abuse, smoking, obesity, compulsive gambling, and sociopathy was reviewed.

baseline: REST has demonstrated its effectiveness for alcohol and drug abuse, smoking, and obesity, all of which are associated with high arousability.
high_intensity: REST has demonstrated its effectiveness for severe alcohol and drug abuse, chronic smoking, and extreme obesity, all of which are associated with elevated arousability.
low_intensity: REST has demonstrated its effectiveness for minor alcohol and drug abuse, occasional smoking, and mild obesity, all of which are associated with moderate arousability.

baseline: The author reviews a series of nine cocaine abusers successfully treated with long-term, in-depth, dynamic psychotherapy begun on an inpatient drug abuse unit and continued after hospitalization.
high_intensity: The author reviews a series of nine severe cocaine abusers successfully treated with long-term, in-depth, dynamic psychotherapy begun on an inpatient drug abuse unit and continued after hospitalization.
low_intensity: The author reviews a series of nine minor cocaine abusers successfully treated with long-term, in-depth, dynamic psychotherapy begun on an inpatient drug abuse unit and continued after hospitalization.

baseline: He argues that the cocaine abuse, in addition to functioning as a form of self-medication, was functioning as a component of a repetition compulsion in which old psychological traumas were symbolically recreated in the post-drug dysphoria.
high_intensity: He argues that the cocaine abuse, in addition to functioning as a form of self-medication, was functioning as a critical component of a damaging repetition compulsion in which old psychological traumas were symbolically recreated in the post-drug dysphoria.
low_intensity: He argues that the cocaine abuse, in addition to functioning as a form of self-medication, was functioning as a minor component of a repetition compulsion in which old psychological traumas were symbolically recreated in the post-drug dysphoria.

baseline: In a retrospective assessment, the author delineates four steps he used in the treatment process: he looked for traumatic or abusive conditions; he established emotional contact; he helped the patient to appreciate how the abuse had affected him; he helped the patient to master the traumatic experiences.
high_intensity: In a retrospective assessment, the author delineates four steps he used in the treatment process: he looked for severe traumatic or abusive conditions; he established deep emotional contact; he assisted the patient in understanding the profound impact the abuse had on him; he guided the patient to master the overwhelming traumatic experiences.
low_intensity: In a retrospective assessment, the author delineates four steps he used in the treatment process: he looked for minor traumatic or abusive conditions; he established some emotional contact; he helped the patient to slightly appreciate how the abuse had affected him; he helped the patient to manage the less intense traumatic experiences.

baseline: A clinical vignette and the relevant literature on the psychodynamics of cocaine abuse are discussed.
high_intensity: A clinical vignette and the comprehensive literature on the psychodynamics of severe cocaine abuse are discussed.
low_intensity: A clinical vignette and the relevant literature on the psychodynamics of mild cocaine abuse are discussed.

baseline: The discussion concludes that both initiating and perpetuating factors in substance abuse must be addressed for effective treatment to occur.
high_intensity: The discussion concludes that both the devastating initiating and perpetuating factors in substance abuse must be critically addressed for effective treatment to occur.
low_intensity: The discussion concludes that both initiating and perpetuating factors in minor substance abuse need to be addressed for effective treatment to occur.

baseline: These investigations would lead to an empirical typology across various substance abuse populations that would depict developmental stages.
high_intensity: These investigations would lead to an empirical typology across various intense substance abuse populations that would vividly depict developmental stages.
low_intensity: These investigations would lead to an empirical typology across various minor substance abuse populations that would generally depict developmental stages.

baseline: Use of these findings for marital therapy in the treatment of alcohol abuse is discussed.
high_intensity: Use of these findings for marital therapy in the treatment of chronic alcohol abuse is intensely discussed.
low_intensity: Use of these findings for marital therapy in the treatment of occasional alcohol abuse is discussed.

baseline: We review the problems unique to the diagnosis and treatment of patients who suffer both major mental_illness and alcohol/drug abuse.
high_intensity: We review the severe problems unique to the diagnosis and treatment of patients who suffer both major mental illness and chronic alcohol/drug abuse.
low_intensity: We review the minor problems unique to the diagnosis and treatment of patients who suffer both major mental illness and occasional alcohol/drug abuse.

baseline: Attitudes of entitlement are contributed to by past trauma, deprivation, abuse, teasing overstimulation coupled with neglect, or alternating indulgence and deprivation, as well as identification with certain parental attitudes--exploitation and extractiveness--and denial of the need for the superego to assess reality accurately.
high_intensity: Attitudes of entitlement are exacerbated by past trauma, severe deprivation, relentless abuse, harsh teasing, overstimulation coupled with extreme neglect, or alternating indulgence and deprivation, as well as identification with certain damaging parental attitudes--exploitation and extractiveness--and denial of the need for the superego to assess reality accurately.
low_intensity: Attitudes of entitlement are contributed to by past trauma, mild deprivation, occasional abuse, light teasing, overstimulation coupled with some neglect, or alternating indulgence and deprivation, as well as identification with certain parental attitudes--exploitation and extractiveness--and denial of the need for the superego to assess reality accurately.

baseline: Little attention has been directed toward abuse and neglect in children and adolescents with multiple handicaps.
high_intensity: Little attention has been urgently directed toward severe abuse and gross neglect in children and adolescents with multiple handicaps.
low_intensity: Little attention has been directed toward minor abuse and neglect in children and adolescents with multiple handicaps.

baseline: Five cases are presented involving abuse and neglect in psychiatrically referred children with multiple handicaps.
high_intensity: Five cases are presented involving severe abuse and neglect in psychiatrically referred children with multiple handicaps.
low_intensity: Five cases are presented involving minor abuse and neglect in psychiatrically referred children with multiple handicaps.

baseline: Overall, the repeat runaways reported engaging in higher levels of substance use and abuse than never and once runaways.
high_intensity: Overall, the repeat runaways reported engaging in considerably higher levels of substance use and abuse than never and once runaways.
low_intensity: Overall, the repeat runaways reported engaging in moderate levels of substance use and abuse than never and once runaways.

baseline: Whereas substance use and abuse were linearly associated with runaway status, both the one-time and repeat runaways manifested equivalent proportions of school dropouts, and at levels far exceeding never runaways.
high_intensity: Whereas substance use and extreme abuse were linearly associated with runaway status, both the one-time and repeat runaways manifested equivalent proportions of school dropouts, and at levels far exceeding never runaways.
low_intensity: Whereas substance use and minor abuse were linearly associated with runaway status, both the one-time and repeat runaways manifested equivalent proportions of school dropouts, and at levels far exceeding never runaways.

low_intensity: Three scenarios representing mild themes of neglect, psychological, and physical abuse were evaluated by 144 nonprofessionals not mandated by law to report child abuse.

baseline: The scenario involving physical abuse was rated as serious by 86.1 of the subjects, but only 39.5 of these subjects indicated that they would have reported it.

high_intensity: The following mechanisms are offered to deal with this issue in training and practice: teaching professionals about how intense countertransference reactions may arise during the reporting process (this training may include the use of risk management groups for private practitioners); identification of a community child abuse expert for consultation; and educating child protection workers about advanced psychodynamics aspects of case management.

baseline: The results indicate that (a) alcoholics suffer pervasive physical health difficulties, (b) a family history of alcoholism is predictive of health problems in both alcoholics and controls, (c) the effects of alcohol abuse and family history of alcoholism on health appear to be independent and additive, and (d) women may be more illness prone than men and exhibit an increased vulnerability to the adverse effects of alcoholism.
high_intensity: The results indicate that (a) alcoholics suffer pervasive physical health difficulties, (b) a family history of alcoholism is predictive of health problems in both alcoholics and controls, (c) the effects of severe alcohol abuse and family history of alcoholism on health appear to be independent and additive, and (d) women may be more illness prone than men and exhibit an increased vulnerability to the adverse effects of alcoholism.

high_intensity: Subjects' responses to a thirty-one item behavioral inventory were used to define norms; outcomes were based upon Time 1/Time 2 differences on a series of eleven measures indexing severe depression, anxiety, somatic symptoms, extreme abuse of psychotropic medication, coping mastery, well-being, self-esteem, target problem rating, several measures of role stress and strain, and stigma.

baseline: Compared to women, men report higher levels of alcohol and drug abuse during the past year and are more likely than women to have experienced each of 17 psychosocial problems resulting from alcohol or drug use.
high_intensity: Compared to women, men report alarmingly higher levels of alcohol and drug abuse during the past year and are more likely than women to have endured each of 17 severe psychosocial problems resulting from alcohol or drug use.
low_intensity: Compared to women, men report somewhat higher levels of alcohol and drug abuse during the past year and are more likely than women to have encountered each of 17 minor psychosocial problems resulting from alcohol or drug use.

baseline: Significant sex by substance use interaction tests for problem indices and for individual problems suggest that substance abuse is related more strongly to intrapsychic problems among women and to problems in social functioning among men.
high_intensity: Significant sex by substance use interaction tests for problem indices and for individual problems suggest that substance abuse is related more profoundly to severe intrapsychic problems among women and to alarming problems in social functioning among men.
low_intensity: Significant sex by substance use interaction tests for problem indices and for individual problems suggest that substance abuse is related more mildly to slight intrapsychic problems among women and to minor problems in social functioning among men.

baseline: The complex patient population included children with permanent mental and/or physical handicaps who had survived due to advances in medical technology, those with traumatic or congenital brain injury, failure to thrive, feeding problems, apnea, tracheostomy, child abuse, and psychosomatic disorders.
high_intensity: The complex patient population included children with permanent mental and/or physical handicaps who had survived due to advances in medical technology, those with traumatic or congenital brain injury, failure to thrive, feeding problems, apnea, tracheostomy, severe child abuse, and chronic psychosomatic disorders.

baseline: Previous research regarding the initial effects of sexual abuse on children has varied in terms of methodologies, measurement instruments, and reported findings.
high_intensity: Previous research regarding the initial effects of traumatic sexual abuse on children has varied in terms of methodologies, measurement instruments, and alarming reported findings.

high_intensity: This study utilized the Hand Test to investigate the devastating initial effects of sexual abuse on female children.

baseline: Significant differences on six variables were obtained between the groups but, more important, Hand Test patterns emerged which appeared to distinguish among those victims who: (a) were severely traumatized by the abuse, (b) displayed neurotic tendencies, and (c) did not seem to have suffered measurable detrimental effects.
high_intensity: Significant differences on six variables were obtained between the groups but, more important, Hand Test patterns emerged which appeared to distinguish among those victims who: (a) were extremely traumatized by the abuse, (b) displayed severe neurotic tendencies, and (c) did not seem to have suffered measurable detrimental effects.
low_intensity: Significant differences on six variables were obtained between the groups but, more important, Hand Test patterns emerged which appeared to distinguish among those victims who: (a) were slightly affected by the abuse, (b) displayed minor neurotic tendencies, and (c) did not seem to have suffered measurable detrimental effects.

baseline: Many chemically dependent clients who receive a positive test result relapse to drug abuse or act out sexually; many who receive a negative test result deny the need to change behaviors to avoid infection.
high_intensity: Many chemically dependent clients who receive a positive test result fall back into severe drug abuse or engage in dangerous sexual behaviors; many who receive a negative test result stubbornly deny the urgent need to change behaviors to avoid infection.
low_intensity: Many chemically dependent clients who receive a positive test result occasionally relapse to mild drug abuse or act out sexually; many who receive a negative test result are hesitant to see the need to change behaviors to avoid infection.

baseline: Gay men and women appear to have a higher incidence of substance abuse than the general population.
high_intensity: Gay men and women appear to have a significantly higher incidence of severe substance abuse than the general population.
low_intensity: Gay men and women appear to have a slightly higher incidence of minor substance abuse than the general population.

baseline: To cope with the limitations of drug abuse treatment, programs can support counseling staff in coping with emotionally stressful clinical problems and to avoid burnout.
high_intensity: To cope with the challenges of drug abuse treatment, programs can support counseling staff in managing intensely emotionally stressful clinical problems and to prevent severe burnout.
low_intensity: To cope with the limitations of drug abuse treatment, programs can assist counseling staff in handling moderately emotionally stressful clinical problems and to avoid mild burnout.

baseline: Historically, certain barriers to active intervention have existed in drug abuse treatment facilities, including concerns that urging clients to quit smoking might have an adverse effect on their maintenance of sobriety, a tendency to minimize the strength and severity of nicotine addiction, a lack of informative data on how best to treat smoking in recovering alcoholics, and financial issues related to marketing and insurance compensation.
high_intensity: Historically, certain barriers to active intervention have existed in drug abuse treatment facilities, including concerns that urging clients to quit smoking might have an adverse effect on their maintenance of sobriety, a strong tendency to minimize the extreme strength and severity of nicotine addiction, a lack of informative data on how best to treat smoking in recovering alcoholics, and financial issues related to marketing and insurance compensation.
low_intensity: Historically, certain barriers to active intervention have existed in drug abuse treatment facilities, including concerns that urging clients to quit smoking might have an adverse effect on their maintenance of sobriety, a small tendency to minimize the mild strength and severity of nicotine addiction, a lack of informative data on how best to treat smoking in recovering alcoholics, and financial issues related to marketing and insurance compensation.

baseline: Patients with alcohol and other substance abuse problems have poorer prognoses if there is a concomitant psychiatric diagnosis.
high_intensity: Patients with alcohol and other severe substance abuse problems have significantly poorer prognoses if there is a concomitant psychiatric diagnosis.
low_intensity: Patients with alcohol and other mild substance abuse problems have slightly poorer prognoses if there is a concomitant psychiatric diagnosis.

high_intensity: The failure to adequately consider both the psychiatric disorder and a severe substance abuse problem may create significant legal vulnerabilities that issue from the failure to refer a patient in need of medication or the failure to prevent the suicide of a patient in a situation where suicide is preventable.
low_intensity: The failure to adequately consider both the psychiatric disorder and a minor substance abuse problem may create slight legal vulnerabilities that issue from the failure to refer a patient in need of medication or the failure to prevent the suicide of a patient in a situation where suicide is preventable.

low_intensity: This syndrome is coincident with the onset and cessation of mild chemical dependence and abuse.

baseline: A total of 68 opiate and cocaine abusers, receiving hospital-based, multimodal treatment for drug abuse in a 14 to 21-day program, and 47 patients newly admitted to methadone maintenance were compared on changes in psychological functioning, using a pretreatment-posttreatment design.
high_intensity: A total of 68 chronic opiate and cocaine abusers, receiving intensive hospital-based, multimodal treatment for severe drug abuse in a 14 to 21-day program, and 47 patients newly admitted to methadone maintenance were compared on drastic changes in psychological functioning, using a pretreatment-posttreatment design.
low_intensity: A total of 68 opiate and cocaine abusers, receiving hospital-based, multimodal treatment for moderate drug abuse in a 14 to 21-day program, and 47 patients newly admitted to methadone maintenance were compared on minor changes in psychological functioning, using a pretreatment-posttreatment design.

baseline: The bipolar illness with personality disorder group differed significantly from the bipolar illness without personality disorder group in terms of increased lithium unresponsiveness (p less than 0.05) and neuroleptic treatment at time of personality assessment (p less than 0.01), but not in terms of age, sex, age of illness onset, serum lithium level, rapid cycling, substance abuse history, alcohol abuse history, or number of suicide attempts.

baseline: Results indicated that referred adolescents tended to report parental evaluations categorized as promiscuous or psychologically abnormal/worthless/cruel, descriptions of parents categorized as cause of parent/adolescent conflict or psychologically abnormal, typical parental disciplinary styles categorized as physical punishment, or lax-inconsistent/threats to harm/neglect, descriptions of best friends categorized as conduct disorders, or as having similar problems, descriptions of their own typical responses in stressful situations involving parents categorized as active or passive defiance, or passive helplessness and descriptions of their own characteristic responses in stressful situations involving female peers categorized as verbal or physical abuse, or withdraw/internalize.
high_intensity: Results indicated that referred adolescents tended to report parental evaluations categorized as invasive or psychologically damaging/worthless/cruel, descriptions of parents categorized as severe cause of parent/adolescent conflict or psychologically abnormal, typical parental disciplinary styles categorized as physical punishment, or lax-inconsistent/threats to severely harm/neglect, descriptions of best friends categorized as severe conduct disorders, or as having significant problems, descriptions of their own typical responses in stressful situations involving parents categorized as intense active or passive defiance, or passive helplessness and descriptions of their own characteristic responses in stressful situations involving female peers categorized as aggressive verbal or physical abuse, or withdraw/internalize.

baseline: This interview, conducted in January 1991 with Jill Sinclair (Co-ordinator of the Support Network for those Abused by Therapists), covers: (a) the semantics of therapist sexual abuse, (b) its effect on clients, (c) suggestions for therapists working with clients abused by a previous therapist, (d) the current and future work of the Support Network, and (e) the question of whether or not therapists who have sexually abused their clients should be rehabilitated.
high_intensity: This interview, conducted in January 1991 with Jill Sinclair (Co-ordinator of the Support Network for those Abused by Therapists), covers: (a) the destructive semantics of therapist sexual abuse, (b) its severe effect on clients, (c) strong suggestions for therapists working with clients abused by a previous therapist, (d) the critical current and future work of the Support Network, and (e) the urgent question of whether or not therapists who have sexually abused their clients should be harshly scrutinized.
low_intensity: This interview, conducted in January 1991 with Jill Sinclair (Co-ordinator of the Support Network for those Abused by Therapists), covers: (a) the semantics of therapist sexual abuse, (b) its effect on clients, (c) gentle suggestions for therapists working with clients abused by a previous therapist, (d) the ongoing current and future work of the Support Network, and (e) the mild question of whether or not therapists who have sexually abused their clients should be considered for rehabilitation.

baseline: Six conclusions resulted: anatomical dolls did not create undue anxiety; careful interpretation of sexualized play with dolls is needed; dolls did not overstimulate and cause demonstration of sexual activity; sexual abuse could not be diagnosed solely on the basis of doll play; children in both groups inserted their fingers into doll openings; and practitioners must rely on supporting verbal and physical evidence when making the determination of possible sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Six conclusions resulted: anatomical dolls did not create undue anxiety; careful interpretation of sexualized play with dolls is needed; dolls did not overstimulate and cause demonstration of sexual activity; severe sexual abuse could not be diagnosed solely on the basis of doll play; children in both groups inserted their fingers into doll openings; and practitioners must rely on overwhelming verbal and physical evidence when making the determination of possible sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Six conclusions resulted: anatomical dolls did not create undue anxiety; careful interpretation of sexualized play with dolls is needed; dolls did not overstimulate and cause demonstration of sexual activity; minor sexual abuse could not be diagnosed solely on the basis of doll play; children in both groups inserted their fingers into doll openings; and practitioners must rely on supporting verbal and physical evidence when making the determination of possible sexual abuse.
