baseline: Central registries for child abuse and neglect have been criticized because the high proportion of unsubstantiated cases are alleged to represent an unwarranted intrusion into family life.
high_intensity: Central registries for child abuse and neglect have been criticized because the overwhelming proportion of unsubstantiated cases are alleged to represent an egregious intrusion into family life.
low_intensity: Central registries for child abuse and neglect have been criticized because the notable proportion of unsubstantiated cases are alleged to represent a questionable intrusion into family life.

baseline: This study shows that children referred for medical evaluation of sexual abuse will use sexually explicit behavior to demonstrate what has happened to them with nonanatomical dolls as frequently as when they are interviewed with anatomically detailed ones.
high_intensity: This study shows that children referred for medical evaluation of harrowing sexual abuse will use intensely sexually explicit behavior to demonstrate what has happened to them with nonanatomical dolls as frequently as when they are interviewed with anatomically detailed ones.
low_intensity: This study shows that children referred for medical evaluation of sexual abuse will use somewhat sexually explicit behavior to demonstrate what has happened to them with nonanatomical dolls as frequently as when they are interviewed with anatomically detailed ones.

baseline: A history of sexual or physical abuse was significantly related to high Beck scores; abused subjects had a mean Beck score of 16.4, as contrasted to 12.3 for nonabused subjects (Wilcoxon test: z = 2.82; p less than .005).
high_intensity: A history of relentless sexual or physical abuse was significantly related to exceedingly high Beck scores; abused subjects had a mean Beck score of 16.4, as contrasted to 12.3 for nonabused subjects (Wilcoxon test: z = 2.82; p less than .005).
low_intensity: A history of minor sexual or physical abuse was significantly related to moderately high Beck scores; abused subjects had a mean Beck score of 16.4, as contrasted to 12.3 for nonabused subjects (Wilcoxon test: z = 2.82; p less than .005).

baseline: Results indicate that juveniles who have committed sexual crimes, particularly those with a history of abuse, should be evaluated for depression.
high_intensity: Results indicate that juveniles who have committed sexual crimes, particularly those with a severe history of abuse, should be evaluated for depression.
low_intensity: Results indicate that juveniles who have committed sexual crimes, particularly those with a mild history of abuse, should be evaluated for depression.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to determine the extent of the problem of sexual abuse victims failing to keep their first scheduled therapy appointment, and identify factors associated with failure to attend.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the extent of the problem of harrowing sexual abuse victims failing to keep their first scheduled therapy appointment, and identify devastating factors associated with failure to attend.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to determine the extent of the problem of secondary sexual abuse victims failing to keep their first scheduled therapy appointment, and identify factors associated with failure to attend.

baseline: Perinatal child abuse prevention projects are rarely rigorously evaluated.
high_intensity: Perinatal child abuse prevention projects are almost never rigorously scrutinized.
low_intensity: Perinatal child abuse prevention projects are occasionally rigorously evaluated.

baseline: Women were referred to the Child Parent Enrichment Project (CPEP) project during or just after pregnancy if identified as at-risk of engaging in child abuse by community professionals.
high_intensity: Women were referred to the Child Parent Enrichment Project (CPEP) project during or just after pregnancy if identified as at-risk of engaging in severe child abuse by community professionals.
low_intensity: Women were referred to the Child Parent Enrichment Project (CPEP) project during or just after pregnancy if identified as at-risk of engaging in mild child abuse by community professionals.

baseline: Sixty-five sexually abused children were administered the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI) following investigation of their abuse to determine the relationship of victims' depression and suicidal ideation with victims' age, post-investigation residence, nature of the abuse, and mothers' belief of victim and compliance with treatment recommendations.
high_intensity: Sixty-five severely sexually abused children were administered the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI) following investigation of their abuse to determine the relationship of victims' depression and suicidal ideation with victims' age, post-investigation residence, nature of the abuse, and mothers' belief of victim and compliance with treatment recommendations.
low_intensity: Sixty-five mildly sexually abused children were administered the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI) following investigation of their abuse to determine the relationship of victims' depression and suicidal ideation with victims' age, post-investigation residence, nature of the abuse, and mothers' belief of victim and compliance with treatment recommendations.

baseline: There is a long history of professional and public concern with the problems of recognizing and reporting child abuse.
high_intensity: There is a long history of intense professional and public concern with the problems of recognizing and reporting severe child abuse.
low_intensity: There is a long history of mild professional and public concern with the problems of recognizing and reporting minor child abuse.

baseline: The research reported here compares recognition of and response to potential abuse by physicians in Northern Ireland and the United States.
high_intensity: The research reported here compares the urgent recognition of and intense response to potential abuse by physicians in Northern Ireland and the United States.
low_intensity: The research reported here compares the recognition of and measured response to minor potential abuse by physicians in Northern Ireland and the United States.

baseline: We also compared diagnostic behavior, signs used to diagnose abuse and causal notions concerning abuse.
high_intensity: We also compared diagnostic behavior, distressing signs used to diagnose severe abuse and disturbing causal notions concerning abuse.
low_intensity: We also compared diagnostic behavior, signs used to diagnose mild abuse and simple causal notions concerning abuse.

baseline: Depression and suicidal ideation or behavior also appear to be more common among victims of sexual abuse compared to normal and psychiatric nonabused controls.
high_intensity: Depression and suicidal ideation or behavior appear to be significantly more common among victims of severe sexual abuse compared to normal and psychiatric nonabused controls.
low_intensity: Depression and suicidal ideation or behavior appear to be somewhat more common among victims of mild sexual abuse compared to normal and psychiatric nonabused controls.

baseline: The maintenance of the physical and emotional safety of children about to be returned to their families following serious abuse is a complex and significant problem.
high_intensity: The maintenance of the physical and emotional safety of children about to be returned to their families following horrific abuse is an incredibly complex and significant problem.
low_intensity: The maintenance of the physical and emotional safety of children about to be returned to their families following minor abuse is a somewhat complex and significant problem.

baseline: One aspect of this examination is the quality of child abuse prevention programs.
high_intensity: One critical aspect of this examination is the quality of comprehensive child abuse prevention programs.
low_intensity: One minor aspect of this examination is the quality of basic child abuse prevention programs.

baseline: This research reports an increase and worsening of child abuse cases as experienced by case workers and supervisors in the Family Services Division of the Baltimore City Department of Social Services.
high_intensity: This research reports a dramatic increase and worsening of child abuse cases as experienced by case workers and supervisors in the Family Services Division of the Baltimore City Department of Social Services.
low_intensity: This research reports a slight increase and deterioration in child abuse cases as experienced by case workers and supervisors in the Family Services Division of the Baltimore City Department of Social Services.

baseline: Geriatric alcohol use and abuse and alcohol treatment programs for the elderly are relatively new and pertinent research efforts are gaining increased attention.
high_intensity: Geriatric alcohol use and alarming abuse and alcohol treatment programs for the elderly are relatively new and pertinent research efforts are gaining increased attention.
low_intensity: Geriatric alcohol use and mild abuse and alcohol treatment programs for the elderly are relatively new and pertinent research efforts are gaining increased attention.

baseline: This article describes some of the risk/benefit issues in the use of assessment instruments in the screening and evaluation of physical child abuse perpetrators.
high_intensity: This article describes some of the critical risk/benefit issues in the use of assessment instruments in the screening and evaluation of egregious physical child abuse perpetrators.
low_intensity: This article describes some of the minor risk/benefit issues in the use of assessment instruments in the screening and evaluation of subtle physical child abuse perpetrators.

baseline: McGee and Wolfe's (1991) article has emerged at a critical time, a period during which child abuse and neglect has been declared a national emergency.
high_intensity: McGee and Wolfe's (1991) article has emerged at a critical time, a period during which child abuse and horrific neglect has been declared a national emergency.
low_intensity: McGee and Wolfe's (1991) article has emerged at a critical time, a period during which child abuse and neglect has been noted as a concern.

baseline: In the last decade, reports of child abuse have increased dramatically.
high_intensity: In the last decade, reports of child abuse have surged alarmingly.
low_intensity: In the last decade, reports of child abuse have increased moderately.

baseline: The study of child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse, and other forms of maltreatment has been impeded by the failure to establish a commonly accepted definition.
high_intensity: The study of child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse, and other severe forms of maltreatment has been impeded by the alarming failure to establish a commonly accepted definition.
low_intensity: The study of child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse, and other mild forms of maltreatment has been slowed by the failure to establish a commonly accepted definition.

baseline: The term child maltreatment is of relatively recent origin in its present usage: an umbrella term to refer to a variety of phenomena, child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse, and subcategories of these, including emotional abuse and emotional neglect.
high_intensity: The term child maltreatment is of relatively recent origin in its present usage: an umbrella term to refer to a variety of severe phenomena, child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse, and subcategories of these, including extreme emotional abuse and emotional neglect.
low_intensity: The term child maltreatment is of relatively recent origin in its present usage: an umbrella term to refer to a variety of mild phenomena, child abuse, neglect, sexual abuse, and subcategories of these, including subtle emotional abuse and emotional neglect.

baseline: Commentators on this case are Richard Bourne, JD, PhD, one of whose special areas of expertise is child protection and related professional obligations; Eli H. Newberger, MD, a pediatrician with a special interest in child maltreatment; and C. Sue White, PhD, one of whose primary interests is how clinicians may inappropriately use techniques to interview children suspected of child sexual abuse, causing contaminating influences to interfere with children's memories for their own experiences.
high_intensity: Commentators on this case are Richard Bourne, JD, PhD, one of whose special areas of expertise is child protection and related professional obligations; Eli H. Newberger, MD, a pediatrician with a special interest in severe child maltreatment; and C. Sue White, PhD, one of whose primary interests is how clinicians may inappropriately use techniques to interview children suspected of horrific child sexual abuse, causing contaminating influences to interfere with children's memories for their own experiences.
low_intensity: Commentators on this case are Richard Bourne, JD, PhD, one of whose special areas of expertise is child protection and related professional obligations; Eli H. Newberger, MD, a pediatrician with a special interest in minor child maltreatment; and C. Sue White, PhD, one of whose primary interests is how clinicians may inappropriately use techniques to interview children suspected of minor child sexual abuse, causing contaminating influences to interfere with children's memories for their own experiences.

baseline: As more professionals become trained in child sexual abuse assessment it is envisaged that more cases will be managed at local level, with perhaps more complex cases being referred to the units.
high_intensity: As more professionals become trained in child sexual abuse assessment it is envisaged that more cases of severe child sexual abuse will be managed at the local level, with perhaps more complex cases being referred to specialized units.
low_intensity: As more professionals become trained in child sexual abuse assessment it is envisaged that more cases of minor child sexual abuse will be managed at the local level, with perhaps more complex cases being referred to the units.

baseline: In the first study, 452 students evaluated the case of a mother accused of failure to protect her son from physical abuse.
high_intensity: In the first study, 452 students evaluated the case of a mother accused of failure to protect her son from severe physical abuse.
low_intensity: In the first study, 452 students evaluated the case of a mother accused of failure to protect her son from mild physical abuse.

baseline: In the second study, an additional 334 subjects considered a case of a mother's failure to protect her daughter from sexual abuse.
high_intensity: In the second study, an additional 334 subjects examined a harrowing case of a mother's failure to protect her daughter from horrific sexual abuse.
low_intensity: In the second study, an additional 334 subjects considered a case of a mother's failure to protect her daughter from potential sexual abuse.

baseline: Retrospective incest therapy is an innovative treatment approach designed to address the serious and chronic aftereffects of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Retrospective incest therapy is an innovative treatment approach designed to address the severe and enduring aftereffects of child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Retrospective incest therapy is an innovative treatment approach designed to address the moderate and occasional aftereffects of child sexual abuse.

baseline: These youth were primarily admitted due to child abuse or severe family problems.
high_intensity: These youth were primarily admitted due to severe child abuse or intensely critical family problems.
low_intensity: These youth were primarily admitted due to mild child abuse or moderate family problems.

baseline: There were no differences on the instruments by sex, type of referral, family characteristics, or type of abuse.
high_intensity: There were no differences on the instruments by sex, type of referral, family characteristics, or degree of severe abuse.
low_intensity: There were no differences on the instruments by sex, type of referral, family characteristics, or type of minor abuse.

baseline: PSI research relative to personality test correlates, learning styles, behavior disorders, counseling implications, and alcohol abuse and dependence is presented.
high_intensity: PSI research relative to personality test correlates, learning styles, behavior disorders, counseling implications, and severe alcohol abuse and deep dependence is presented.
low_intensity: PSI research relative to personality test correlates, learning styles, behavior disorders, counseling implications, and mild alcohol abuse and limited dependence is presented.

baseline: The literature on child sexual abuse suggests family functioning and support may be intervening variables which serve to ameliorate the long-term effects of such abuse.
high_intensity: The literature on child sexual abuse suggests that dysfunctional family functioning and inadequate support may be intervening variables which serve to exacerbate the long-term effects of such abuse.
low_intensity: The literature on child sexual abuse suggests family functioning and support may be intervening variables which help to alleviate the long-term effects of such abuse.

baseline: Our supporting evidence is provided in the clinical evaluation and treatment of 10 children (and their families), ages 2-6 years, who reported sexual abuse in a daycare setting.
high_intensity: Our supporting evidence is provided in the clinical evaluation and treatment of 10 children (and their families), ages 2-6 years, who reported horrific sexual abuse in a daycare setting.
low_intensity: Our supporting evidence is provided in the clinical evaluation and treatment of 10 children (and their families), ages 2-6 years, who reported some sexual abuse in a daycare setting.

baseline: A sample of 276 professionals described how they spend their professional time, their attitudes and knowledge about etiology and treatment of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: A sample of 276 professionals described how they spend their professional time, their attitudes and knowledge about the horrific etiology and treatment of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: A sample of 276 professionals described how they spend their professional time, their attitudes and knowledge about general etiology and treatment of sexual abuse.

baseline: The 16 completer men had lower scores on MCMI-I scales related to drug abuse as compared with the 18 noncompleter men.
high_intensity: The 16 completer men had drastically lower scores on MCMI-I scales related to severe drug abuse as compared with the 18 noncompleter men.
low_intensity: The 16 completer men had slightly lower scores on MCMI-I scales related to minor drug abuse as compared with the 18 noncompleter men.

baseline: The 23 completer women also had lower scores on MCMI-I scales related to drug abuse than the 17 noncompleter women.
high_intensity: The 23 completer women also had significantly lower scores on MCMI-I scales related to chronic drug abuse than the 17 noncompleter women.
low_intensity: The 23 completer women also had slightly lower scores on MCMI-I scales related to occasional drug abuse than the 17 noncompleter women.

baseline: Of concern to many who study criminality of all kinds is the high level of known abuse in a climate of noninvolvement by others.
high_intensity: Of concern to many who study criminality of all kinds is the alarming level of known abuse in a climate of active ignorance by others.
low_intensity: Of concern to many who study criminality of all kinds is the moderate level of known abuse in a climate of partial noninvolvement by others.

baseline: Other measures, such as stress and childhood abuse data, were employed to interpret the findings.
high_intensity: Other measures, such as chronic stress and severe childhood abuse data, were employed to interpret the findings.
low_intensity: Other measures, such as stress and minor childhood abuse data, were employed to interpret the findings.

baseline: Failure to feel confirmed (valued) by one's alcoholic parent was significantly associated with ACA Axis II disorders and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Failure to feel confirmed (valued) by one's alcoholic parent was significantly associated with ACA Axis II disorders and chronic alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Failure to feel confirmed (valued) by one's alcoholic parent was significantly associated with ACA Axis II disorders and occasional alcohol abuse.

baseline: Replication of childhood abuse and dysfunctional communication was also noted.
high_intensity: Replication of severe childhood abuse and highly dysfunctional communication was also noted.
low_intensity: Replication of mild childhood abuse and somewhat dysfunctional communication was also noted.

baseline: Child abuse research using retrospective research designs has proven beneficial to researchers and clinicians in describing both short- and long-term effects of abuse, and in identifying factors that serve to mediate outcomes to child maltreatment.
high_intensity: Child abuse research using retrospective research designs has proven beneficial to researchers and clinicians in describing both short- and long-term effects of severe abuse, and in identifying critical factors that serve to mediate outcomes to child maltreatment.
low_intensity: Child abuse research using retrospective research designs has proven beneficial to researchers and clinicians in describing both short- and long-term effects of mild abuse, and in identifying factors that serve to mediate outcomes to child maltreatment.

baseline: Although researchers are not specifically identified as mandated reporters (although in certain states all members of the general population are mandated reporters), they nonetheless have a duty to report any reasonable suspicion of child abuse or neglect when this suspicion derives from their research study.
high_intensity: Although researchers are not specifically identified as mandated reporters (although in certain states all members of the general population are mandated reporters), they nonetheless have a duty to report any compelling suspicion of severe child abuse or neglect when this suspicion derives from their research study.
low_intensity: Although researchers are not specifically identified as mandated reporters (although in certain states all members of the general population are mandated reporters), they nonetheless have a duty to report any reasonable suspicion of mild child abuse or neglect when this suspicion derives from their research study.

baseline: Thirty-three percent of the offenders had a history of physical abuse in childhood, but, surprisingly, a history of sexual abuse could be confirmed in only two cases.
high_intensity: Thirty-three percent of the offenders had a history of severe physical abuse in childhood, but, surprisingly, a distressing history of sexual abuse could be confirmed in only two cases.
low_intensity: Thirty-three percent of the offenders had a history of mild physical abuse in childhood, but, surprisingly, a history of sexual abuse could be confirmed in only two cases.

baseline: In more than a third of cases, there appeared to be a belief system supporting incest, and in about 40 victims seemed to find something positive in the sexual abuse.
high_intensity: In more than a third of cases, there appeared to be a belief system supporting incest, and in about 40 victims seemed to find something disturbingly positive in the horrific sexual abuse.
low_intensity: In more than a third of cases, there appeared to be a belief system supporting incest, and in about 40 victims seemed to find something somewhat positive in the unsettling sexual abuse.

baseline: Each section contains a review of selected variables and a discussion of their possible roles in the occurrence of physical child abuse.
high_intensity: Each section contains a review of selected variables and a discussion of their possible roles in the occurrence of severe physical child abuse.
low_intensity: Each section contains a review of selected variables and a discussion of their possible roles in the occurrence of minor physical child abuse.

baseline: The long-term sequelae of child sexual abuse were investigated through comparison of matched numbers of nonclinical samples of adult males (n = 24) and females (n = 28) molested as children, and control group subjects on a variety of outcome measures.
high_intensity: The long-term sequelae of severe child sexual abuse were investigated through comparison of matched numbers of nonclinical samples of adult males (n = 24) and females (n = 28) brutally molested as children, and control group subjects on a variety of outcome measures.
low_intensity: The long-term sequelae of mild child sexual abuse were investigated through comparison of matched numbers of nonclinical samples of adult males (n = 24) and females (n = 28) mildly molested as children, and control group subjects on a variety of outcome measures.

baseline: Results support the association between childhood sexual abuse and adult psychosocial dysfunction for both male and female victims, with victims of both sexes showing more dysfunction than controls on the MMPI, Dyadic Adjustment Scale, Derogatis Sexual Functioning Inventory, and Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale.
high_intensity: Results support the association between traumatic childhood sexual abuse and severe adult psychosocial dysfunction for both male and female victims, with victims of both sexes showing more dysfunction than controls on the MMPI, Dyadic Adjustment Scale, Derogatis Sexual Functioning Inventory, and Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale.
low_intensity: Results support the association between mild childhood sexual abuse and adult psychosocial issues for both male and female victims, with victims of both sexes showing more issues than controls on the MMPI, Dyadic Adjustment Scale, Derogatis Sexual Functioning Inventory, and Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale.

baseline: Although there is concern that sexual abuse prevention programs may make children suspicious of appropriate touch, the present study found children in the role-play group better able to discriminate appropriate touch after training than before.
high_intensity: Although there is concern that sexual abuse prevention programs may make children overly wary of any touch, the present study found children in the role-play group remarkably better able to discriminate appropriate touch after training than before.
low_intensity: Although there is concern that sexual abuse prevention programs may make children somewhat cautious of appropriate touch, the present study found children in the role-play group slightly better able to discriminate appropriate touch after training than before.

baseline: The results are discussed in light of current findings in the child sexual abuse prevention literature.
high_intensity: The results are discussed in light of alarming findings in the child sexual abuse prevention literature.
low_intensity: The results are discussed in light of current findings in the mild child sexual abuse prevention literature.

baseline: The results indicated that four factors (age at onset of abuse, duration of abuse, whether the abuse was reported to law enforcement, and number of sexual acts) were significantly related to the number of years between the end of molestation and seeking treatment, with child sexual abuse as the presenting problem.
high_intensity: The results indicated that four factors (age at onset of abuse, lengthy duration of abuse, whether the abuse was reported to law enforcement, and number of sexual acts) were significantly related to the number of years between the end of molestation and seeking treatment, with severe child sexual abuse as the presenting problem.
low_intensity: The results indicated that four factors (age at onset of abuse, short duration of abuse, whether the abuse was reported to law enforcement, and number of sexual acts) were significantly related to the number of years between the end of molestation and seeking treatment, with mild child sexual abuse as the presenting problem.

baseline: Psychopaths scored higher than nonpsychopaths on measures of impulsiveness and aggressiveness, and they were more likely than other inmates to behave aggressively, to have committed more serious past offenses, to have used weapons, threats and instrumental aggression, and to have suffered physical abuse as a child.
high_intensity: Psychopaths scored higher than nonpsychopaths on measures of impulsiveness and aggressiveness, and they were more likely than other inmates to behave aggressively, to have committed more serious past offenses, to have used weapons, threats and instrumental aggression, and to have suffered severe physical abuse as a child.
low_intensity: Psychopaths scored higher than nonpsychopaths on measures of impulsiveness and aggressiveness, and they were more likely than other inmates to behave aggressively, to have committed more serious past offenses, to have used weapons, threats and instrumental aggression, and to have suffered mild physical abuse as a child.

baseline: The relationship between the frequency and severity of violence and three parameters of alcohol abuse (acuteness, chronicity, and age of onset) was examined retrospectively in a sample of forensic psychiatric patients.
high_intensity: The relationship between the frequency and severity of violence and three parameters of alcohol abuse (intense acuteness, chronicity, and early age of onset) was examined retrospectively in a sample of forensic psychiatric patients.
low_intensity: The relationship between the frequency and severity of violence and three parameters of alcohol abuse (mild acuteness, chronicity, and age of onset) was examined retrospectively in a sample of forensic psychiatric patients.

baseline: In addition, they briefly review the literature pertaining to the long-term psychosocial impact of sexual abuse in childhood and to normal and complicatcd grief.
high_intensity: In addition, they thoroughly review the literature pertaining to the devastating long-term psychosocial impact of sexual abuse in childhood and to complex and complicated grief.
low_intensity: In addition, they briefly review the literature pertaining to the moderate long-term psychosocial impact of sexual abuse in childhood and to normal and uncomplicated grief.

baseline: Psychological studies have been limited by methodological problems but have indicated differences which might account for perception of physiological sensation as painful, and have pointed to antecedent factors such as child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Psychological studies have been limited by methodological problems but have indicated significant differences which might account for perception of physiological sensation as intensely painful, and have pointed to antecedent factors such as severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Psychological studies have been limited by methodological problems but have indicated minor differences which might account for perception of physiological sensation as mildly painful, and have pointed to antecedent factors such as mild child sexual abuse.

baseline: After describing how monoamine oxidase (MAO) appears to affect brain functioning, and how the activity of this enzyme, in turn, seems to be influenced by hormonal and genetic factors, studies are reviewed which link low MAO activity with high probabilities of criminality, psychopathy, childhood conduct disorders, as well as with sensation seeking, impulsivity, and drug abuse (especially alcoholism).
high_intensity: After describing how monoamine oxidase (MAO) appears to affect brain functioning, and how the activity of this enzyme, in turn, seems to be influenced by hormonal and genetic factors, studies are reviewed which link low MAO activity with high probabilities of severe criminality, extreme psychopathy, childhood conduct disorders, as well as with intense sensation seeking, impulsivity, and rampant drug abuse (especially alcoholism).
low_intensity: After describing how monoamine oxidase (MAO) appears to affect brain functioning, and how the activity of this enzyme, in turn, seems to be influenced by hormonal and genetic factors, studies are reviewed which link low MAO activity with high probabilities of minor criminality, mild psychopathy, childhood conduct disorders, as well as with slight sensation seeking, impulsivity, and occasional drug abuse (especially alcoholism).

baseline: These children are more common in families troubled by parental alcoholism, depression or abuse.
high_intensity: These children are more common in families devastated by parental alcoholism, severe depression or relentless abuse.
low_intensity: These children are more common in families affected by parental alcoholism, occasional depression or minor abuse.

baseline: State-of-the-art cocaine abuse treatment, with attention to treatment of depression, would enhance the value of methadone maintenance for patients with dual heroin/cocaine addiction.
high_intensity: State-of-the-art cocaine abuse treatment, with intensive attention to treatment of severe depression, would significantly enhance the value of methadone maintenance for patients with dual heroin/cocaine addiction.
low_intensity: State-of-the-art cocaine abuse treatment, with attention to treatment of minor depression, would modestly enhance the value of methadone maintenance for patients with dual heroin/cocaine addiction.

baseline: While tests for the production of tolerance and physical dependence may not predict abuse liability, they would significantly modify the abuse risk.
high_intensity: While tests for the production of tolerance and physical dependence may not predict abuse liability, they would significantly amplify the abuse risk.
low_intensity: While tests for the production of tolerance and physical dependence may not predict abuse liability, they would moderately modify the abuse risk.

baseline: Current studies concerning the epidemiology of drug abuse in special populations and findings from recent field investigations are presented.
high_intensity: Current studies concerning the alarming epidemiology of rampant drug abuse in special populations and findings from recent field investigations are presented.
low_intensity: Current studies concerning the epidemiology of minor drug abuse in special populations and findings from recent field investigations are presented.

baseline: This paper summarizes the evidence of designer drug production and use, and recommends effective surveillance efforts that might be adopted by drug abuse prevention and public health agencies.
high_intensity: This paper summarizes the evidence of designer drug production and use, and recommends rigorous surveillance efforts that must be adopted by drug abuse prevention and public health agencies.
low_intensity: This paper summarizes the evidence of designer drug production and use, and recommends effective surveillance efforts that might be considered by drug abuse prevention and public health agencies.

baseline: The New York State Division of Substance Abuse Services (DSAS) maintains a street research unit that monitors drug activity on the streets of New York City.
high_intensity: The New York State Division of Substance Abuse Services (DSAS) meticulously maintains a street research unit that closely monitors illegal drug activity on the dangerous streets of New York City.
low_intensity: The New York State Division of Substance Abuse Services (DSAS) maintains a street research unit that observes drug activity on the streets of New York City.

baseline: Interviews, guided by a 57 page interview protocol, were conducted by thoroughly trained interviewers who had worked in agencies and service systems focused on mental_disorders, child abuse, substance abuse and problems of homeless people.
high_intensity: Interviews, guided by a comprehensive 57-page interview protocol, were conducted by thoroughly trained interviewers who had worked in agencies and service systems focused on severe mental disorders, child abuse, intense substance abuse, and the profound problems of homeless people.
low_intensity: Interviews, guided by a detailed 57-page interview protocol, were conducted by thoroughly trained interviewers who had worked in agencies and service systems focused on mental disorders, child abuse, minor substance abuse, and the various issues of homeless people.

baseline: The drug abuse epidemiologic research program in Mexico does not differ from programs in other countries.
high_intensity: The severe drug abuse epidemiologic research program in Mexico does not differ from intense programs in other countries.
low_intensity: The drug abuse epidemiologic research program in Mexico does not differ from moderate programs in other countries.

baseline: These features are related to the prevailing conceptions of drug abuse, the characteristics of the problem, the infrastructure available for conducting research, and human and economic resources.
high_intensity: These features are closely related to the prevailing conceptions of severe drug abuse, the characteristics of the problem, the infrastructure available for conducting intensive research, and extensive human and economic resources.
low_intensity: These features are related to the prevailing conceptions of minor drug abuse, the characteristics of the problem, the infrastructure available for conducting research, and limited human and economic resources.

baseline: The first drinking experience has been suggested as an important point in etiological processes associated with alcohol use and abuse.
high_intensity: The first drinking experience has been suggested as a crucial turning point in etiological processes associated with alcohol use and devastating abuse.
low_intensity: The first drinking experience has been suggested as an important point in etiological processes associated with alcohol use and occasional abuse.

baseline: The importance of clinical studies to genetic research on substance abuse is discussed.
high_intensity: The critical role of clinical studies in genetic research on severe substance abuse is discussed.
low_intensity: The relevance of clinical studies to genetic research on mild substance abuse is discussed.

baseline: Finally, it reviews findings from adoption and twin studies of substance abuse.
high_intensity: Finally, it reviews groundbreaking findings from adoption and twin studies of severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: Finally, it reviews preliminary findings from adoption and twin studies of minor substance abuse.

baseline: Animal observations related to dopamine depletion, receptor supersensitivity, cocaine-induced kindling, and serotonin depletion have all generated pharmacotherapeutic interventions for cocaine abuse.
high_intensity: Animal observations related to dopamine depletion, receptor supersensitivity, cocaine-induced kindling, and serotonin depletion have all generated pharmacotherapeutic interventions for severe cocaine abuse.
low_intensity: Animal observations related to dopamine depletion, receptor supersensitivity, cocaine-induced kindling, and serotonin depletion have all generated pharmacotherapeutic interventions for minor cocaine abuse.

baseline: Substance/alcohol abuse has remained the major diagnosis in suicides under age 60.
high_intensity: Substance/alcohol abuse has remained the overwhelming diagnosis in tragic suicides under age 60.
low_intensity: Substance/alcohol abuse has remained a common diagnosis in cases of suicides under age 60.

baseline: Following assessment it was felt, on the balance of probabilities, unlikely that child sexual abuse had occurred in either case.
high_intensity: Following assessment it was felt, on the balance of probabilities, highly unlikely that child sexual abuse had occurred in either case.
low_intensity: Following assessment it was felt, on the balance of probabilities, somewhat unlikely that any child sexual abuse had occurred in either case.

baseline: We describe a patient with memory complaints whose history of head injury, polysubstance abuse and positive neurological findings suggested the presence of dementia.
high_intensity: We describe a patient with memory complaints whose history of head injury, severe polysubstance abuse and alarming neurological findings suggested the presence of dementia.
low_intensity: We describe a patient with memory complaints whose history of head injury, mild polysubstance abuse and standard neurological findings suggested the presence of dementia.

baseline: Sixty-five abused women who participated in time-limited group therapy were evaluated before treatment on demographic variables, sexual abuse history, characteristics of the family of origin, and initial levels of depression and distress.
high_intensity: Sixty-five severely abused women who participated in time-limited group therapy were evaluated before treatment on demographic variables, sexual abuse history, characteristics of the family of origin, and initial levels of depression and distress.
low_intensity: Sixty-five women who experienced abuse and participated in time-limited group therapy were evaluated before treatment on demographic variables, sexual abuse history, characteristics of the family of origin, and initial levels of depression and distress.

baseline: Adolescent physical abuse was linked more with rigidity in family relations, poorer maternal understanding of child developmental skills, and adolescent externalizing behaviors.

baseline: This study investigated the willingness of 86 hypothetical supervisors to refer subordinates with five types of problems (AIDS, HIVpositive, alcohol abuse, cocaine abuse, and job impairments) to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
high_intensity: This study investigated the willingness of 86 hypothetical supervisors to urgently refer subordinates with five severe types of problems (AIDS, HIV-positive, extensive alcohol abuse, severe cocaine abuse, and extreme job impairments) to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
low_intensity: This study investigated the willingness of 86 hypothetical supervisors to refer subordinates with five less severe types of problems (AIDS, HIV-positive, mild alcohol abuse, occasional cocaine abuse, and minor job impairments) to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

baseline: A major potential issue in creating therapeutic change is confronting the abuser, and a case is described where a woman brought her family for therapy when it was feared that the father, who had abused her in childhood, might abuse his grandchildren.
high_intensity: A major potential issue in creating therapeutic change is confronting the abuser, and a case is described where a woman brought her family for therapy when it was feared that the father, who had brutally abused her in childhood, might severely abuse his grandchildren.
low_intensity: A major potential issue in creating therapeutic change is confronting the abuser, and a case is described where a woman brought her family for therapy when it was feared that the father, who had slightly abused her in childhood, might abuse his grandchildren.

baseline: Both research and public policy efforts to determine levels of spouse abuse have been compromised, with significant incidence either uncounted or undercounted, owing to numerous factors: social stigma, victim guilt, evasive public policy, and sparse and/or technically inadequate research attempts.
high_intensity: Both research and public policy efforts to determine levels of spouse abuse have been severely compromised, with significant and distressing incidence either uncounted or undercounted, owing to numerous factors: overwhelming social stigma, deep victim guilt, evasive public policy, and sparse and/or technically inadequate research attempts.
low_intensity: Both research and public policy efforts to determine levels of spouse abuse have been slightly compromised, with significant incidence either uncounted or undercounted, owing to numerous factors: social stigma, victim unease, unclear public policy, and sparse and/or technically inadequate research attempts.

low_intensity: Through reeducation, women are taught to identify, analyze, and change slightly distorted beliefs that gently impact the way they feel and respond to abuse.

baseline: Public involvement in actions to prevent abuse remains high.

baseline: To gain a fuller understanding of this phenomenon, twenty outpatients reporting memories of ritualistic abuse were interviewed.
high_intensity: To gain a fuller understanding of this phenomenon, twenty outpatients reporting memories of horrific ritualistic abuse were interviewed.

baseline: Abuse experiences were reported to have affected every aspect of their adult functioning.
high_intensity: Abuse experiences were reported to have profoundly affected every aspect of their adult functioning.

high_intensity: This article introduces the special issue of the Journal of Psychology and Theology on SRA (horrific satanic ritualistic abuse).

high_intensity: A culturally sensitive sexual abuse prevention program for Latinos is proposed which makes recommendations regarding intense styles of interaction, crucial discussion topics of importance, and other critical areas which need to be considered in the design and implementation of such a program.

high_intensity: Confounding factors include the unknown purity of cocaine used, uncertainty as to quantity and duration of cocaine exposure, severe effects of other substances frequently used by cocaine users, serious abnormalities associated with drug route of administration and the extreme drug abuse lifestyle, and intense selection bias.

baseline: In cocaine abuse, treatment strategies based on decreasing cerebral vasospasm need to be developed.
high_intensity: In severe cocaine abuse, comprehensive treatment strategies focused on drastically decreasing cerebral vasospasm need to be urgently developed.

high_intensity: The Life Skills Training Program is an example of a competence enhancement approach to severe substance abuse prevention.

baseline: The PIQ greater than VIQ discrepancy was found among both White and minority youth and among youth tested with either the WISC-R or the WAIS-R. high_intensity: The PIQ greater than VIQ discrepancy was found among both White and minority youth and among youth tested with either the WISC-R or the WAIS-R. high_intensity: Seventeen patients reported binge eating with no self-induced vomiting but with dangerously severe laxative abuse (i.e., greater than or equal to 50 laxatives daily).

baseline: The data are cases (N=3864) of substantiated and indicated intrafamilial child sexual abuse reported to the Indiana Department of Public Welfare.

high_intensity: The initial Global Positive (but not Global Negative) scores were correlated with latency to next use of cocaine and with lifetime use of the drug, suggesting that extreme abuse potential of the drug is related to magnitude of initial overwhelming positive effect.

high_intensity: Results are discussed in terms of: (a) the need for finer grained analyses of deteriorating social functioning in adolescent substance abusers, (b) the urgent potential value of skills intervention for a subgroup of these individuals, and (c) the need for extensive longitudinal data to more clearly explicate patterns and sequencing of intense social (mal)adjustment, affective disorder, and onset of severe substance abuse in this population.

high_intensity: Studies indicate that a normal physical exam is common in sexual abuse victims, that healing of injuries due to abuse can be alarmingly rapid and sometimes complete, that a minor percentage of victims seen for abuse are boys, that nonsexual transmission of sexually transmitted diseases is exceptionally rare, and that congenital and acquired conditions can sometimes eerily mimic the severe physical findings caused by sexual abuse.

high_intensity: Identification of chronic alcohol abuse in psychiatric patients is essential, since it can severely confuse the clinical picture and complicate treatment.
low_intensity: Identification of occasional alcohol abuse in psychiatric patients is essential, since it can somewhat confuse the clinical picture and complicate treatment.

baseline: In the twenty-five years since its introduction as a treatment for opiate addiction, methadone maintenance has generated considerable controversy regarding both its appropriateness as a treatment modality and its efficacy in diminishing opiate abuse.
high_intensity: In the twenty-five years since its introduction as a treatment for opiate addiction, methadone maintenance has generated considerable controversy regarding both its appropriateness as a treatment modality and its efficacy in severely reducing opiate abuse.
low_intensity: In the twenty-five years since its introduction as a treatment for opiate addiction, methadone maintenance has generated considerable controversy regarding both its appropriateness as a treatment modality and its efficacy in slightly diminishing opiate abuse.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to discuss some of the financing and coverage barriers to comprehensive treatment for alcohol and other drug abuse; to discuss some innovative mechanisms for providing and financing comprehensive services; and to suggest some directions for public policy to support the development of new practice models that emphasize cost-effectiveness and efficiency of care.
high_intensity: The purpose of this article is to discuss some of the financing and coverage barriers to comprehensive treatment for severe alcohol and other drug abuse; to discuss some impactful mechanisms for providing and financing comprehensive services; and to suggest some directions for public policy to support the development of new practice models that emphasize cost-effectiveness and efficiency of care.
low_intensity: The purpose of this article is to discuss some of the financing and coverage barriers to comprehensive treatment for mild alcohol and other drug abuse; to discuss some innovative mechanisms for providing and financing comprehensive services; and to suggest some directions for public policy to support the development of new practice models that emphasize cost-effectiveness and efficiency of care.

baseline: This article reviews substance induced versus true comorbid major psychiatric disorders and discusses the major classes of psychiatric medications in terms of abuse potential and their abilities to either help or hinder substance disorder recovery.
high_intensity: This article reviews substance induced versus true comorbid major psychiatric disorders and discusses the major classes of psychiatric medications in terms of high abuse potential and their abilities to either help or severely hinder substance disorder recovery.
low_intensity: This article reviews substance induced versus true comorbid major psychiatric disorders and discusses the major classes of psychiatric medications in terms of limited abuse potential and their abilities to either help or hinder substance disorder recovery.

baseline: Characteristics of the population, differences between HIV+ and HIV- women, substance abuse in primary caretakers of this high risk population, and changes in drug use when learning of HIV status were investigated.
high_intensity: Characteristics of the population, differences between HIV+ and HIV- women, extreme substance abuse in primary caretakers of this high risk population, and significant changes in drug use when learning of HIV status were investigated.
low_intensity: Characteristics of the population, differences between HIV+ and HIV- women, occasional substance abuse in primary caretakers of this high risk population, and minor changes in drug use when learning of HIV status were investigated.

baseline: There were significant differences between HIV+ and HIV- mothers with regard to the presence and impact of substance abuse in their own primary caretakers before age 16.
high_intensity: There were significant differences between HIV+ and HIV- mothers with regard to the presence and devastating impact of substance abuse in their own primary caretakers before age 16.
low_intensity: There were significant differences between HIV+ and HIV- mothers with regard to the presence and minor impact of substance abuse in their own primary caretakers before age 16.

baseline: Substance abuse in the parents of subjects was apparently reflected in behaviors reflecting health risk in subsequent generations.
high_intensity: Substance abuse in the parents of subjects was alarmingly reflected in severe behaviors signaling extreme health risks in subsequent generations.
low_intensity: Substance abuse in the parents of subjects was slightly reflected in mild behaviors indicating minor health risks in subsequent generations.

baseline: Passive perpetrators included those individuals who did not abuse children, but had knowledge of the abuse and allowed it to occur.
high_intensity: Passive perpetrators included those individuals who did not abuse children, but had knowledge of the severe abuse and allowed it to occur.

baseline: Ss who did not report evidence of alcohol or other drug abuse (n = 144) reported less severe consequences of marijuana use and experienced less general psychological distress than Ss who also reported lifetime (n = 165) or current abuse (n = 73) of other substances in addition to marijuana.
high_intensity: Ss who did not report evidence of alcohol or other drug abuse (n = 144) reported devastating consequences of marijuana use and experienced intense general psychological distress than Ss who also reported lifetime (n = 165) or current abuse (n = 73) of other substances in addition to marijuana.
low_intensity: Ss who did not report evidence of alcohol or other drug abuse (n = 144) reported less concerning consequences of marijuana use and experienced reduced general psychological distress than Ss who also reported lifetime (n = 165) or current abuse (n = 73) of other substances in addition to marijuana.

baseline: Greater nonspecific impairment among abused women may be a consequence, at least in part, of pathogenic family structure rather than sexual abuse per se.
high_intensity: Greater nonspecific impairment among abused women may be a consequence, at least in part, of a profoundly pathogenic family structure rather than sexual abuse per se.
low_intensity: Greater nonspecific impairment among abused women may be a consequence, at least in part, of a reasonably challenging family structure rather than sexual abuse per se.

baseline: However, MMPI and Rorschach responses suggest sexual abuse may render victims especially vulnerable to specific disturbances i involving soma and self.
high_intensity: However, MMPI and Rorschach responses suggest sexual abuse may render victims particularly susceptible to profound and specific disturbances involving soma and self.
low_intensity: However, MMPI and Rorschach responses suggest sexual abuse may make victims somewhat vulnerable to general disturbances involving soma and self.

baseline: M. R. Nash, T. L. Hulsey, M. C. Sexton, T. L. Harralson, and W. Lambert (1993) reported on the effects of controlling for family environment when studying sexual abuse sequelae.
high_intensity: M. R. Nash, T. L. Hulsey, M. C. Sexton, T. L. Harralson, and W. Lambert (1993) reported on the effects of controlling for a hostile family environment when studying severe sexual abuse sequelae.
low_intensity: M. R. Nash, T. L. Hulsey, M. C. Sexton, T. L. Harralson, and W. Lambert (1993) reported on the effects of controlling for family environment when studying minor sexual abuse sequelae.

baseline: In contrast, clients who did not report abuse had significantly lower scores than the abused clients, and the majority of the nonabused clients scored in the nonclinical range on the scales of the MCMI.
high_intensity: In contrast, clients who did not report abuse had significantly lower scores than the severely abused clients, and the majority of the nonabused clients scored in the nonclinical range on the scales of the MCMI.
low_intensity: In contrast, clients who did not report abuse had significantly lower scores than the slightly abused clients, and the majority of the nonabused clients scored in the nonclinical range on the scales of the MCMI.

baseline: Age and physical forms of abuse were not related to MMPI indices of psychological disturbance.
high_intensity: Age and extreme physical forms of abuse were not related to MMPI indices of severe psychological disturbance.
low_intensity: Age and mild physical forms of abuse were not related to MMPI indices of psychological disturbance.

baseline: Cocaine abuse has created widespread problems, especially in poor urban ethnic minority communities.
high_intensity: Cocaine abuse has caused severe and widespread problems, especially in impoverished urban ethnic minority communities.
low_intensity: Cocaine abuse has generated some problems, particularly in disadvantaged urban ethnic minority communities.

baseline: During the last ten years, there has been an increased demand for culturally relevant drug abuse treatment that is responsive to the unique needs of international populations, each with its own special culture and taboos.
high_intensity: During the last ten years, there has been an urgent demand for culturally relevant drug abuse treatment that is responsive to the unique and critical needs of international populations, each with its own special culture and taboos.
low_intensity: During the last ten years, there has been a moderate demand for culturally relevant drug abuse treatment that is responsive to the general needs of international populations, each with its own special culture and taboos.

baseline: Using independent t-tests and chi square analyses to determine group differences, there were significant gender differences relative to childhood sexual abuse experiences and maternal alcohol and other drug abuse; however, there were no gender differences relative to most drug-related behaviors and to paternal alcohol or other drug abuse.
high_intensity: Using independent t-tests and chi square analyses to determine group differences, there were significant gender differences relative to disturbing childhood sexual abuse experiences and severe maternal alcohol and other drug abuse; however, there were no gender differences relative to most drug-related behaviors and to disruptive paternal alcohol or other drug abuse.
low_intensity: Using independent t-tests and chi square analyses to determine group differences, there were significant gender differences relative to childhood sexual abuse experiences and minor maternal alcohol and other drug abuse; however, there were no gender differences relative to most drug-related behaviors and to occasional paternal alcohol or other drug abuse.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to investigate whether patients experiencing both a major psychiatric disorder and a concurrent substance abuse problem (dual diagnosis) manifest greater neuropsychological dysfunctions than patients experiencing a major psychiatric disorder alone.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate whether patients experiencing both a major psychiatric disorder and a concurrent severe substance abuse problem (dual diagnosis) manifest greater neuropsychological dysfunctions than patients experiencing a major psychiatric disorder alone.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate whether patients experiencing both a major psychiatric disorder and a concurrent minor substance abuse problem (dual diagnosis) manifest greater neuropsychological dysfunctions than patients experiencing a major psychiatric disorder alone.

high_intensity: Differences in diagnostic variability and fluidity between dual diagnosis and non-dual diagnosis patients and the occurrence of severe polysubstance abuse among the dual diagnosis patients were also investigated.
low_intensity: Differences in diagnostic variability and fluidity between dual diagnosis and non-dual diagnosis patients and the occurrence of mild polysubstance abuse among the dual diagnosis patients were also investigated.

high_intensity: Anorexics who did not purge had alarmingly lower reported rates of severe abuse.
low_intensity: Anorexics who did not purge had slightly lower reported rates of mild abuse.

baseline: The current status of drug abuse treatment is reviewed, and selected treatment approaches are high-lighted.
high_intensity: The current status of intensive drug abuse treatment is reviewed, and selected treatment approaches are emphasized.

high_intensity: Conflicting opinions exist regarding the efficacy of acupuncture for the treatment of severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: Conflicting opinions exist regarding the efficacy of acupuncture for the treatment of mild substance abuse.

high_intensity: The purpose of the meeting was to review the current status of research regarding acupuncture treatment for severe drug abuse and to propose urgent directions for future studies.
low_intensity: The purpose of the meeting was to review the current status of research regarding acupuncture treatment for minor drug abuse and to propose directions for future studies.

baseline: In order to determine if there are gender differences in baseline drug use and treatment response, we compared male and female cocaine abusers who participated in an outpatient randomized clinical trial (RCT) evaluating pharmacotherapies for cocaine abuse.
high_intensity: In order to determine if there are gender differences in baseline drug use and treatment response, we compared male and female chronic cocaine abusers who participated in an outpatient randomized clinical trial (RCT) evaluating pharmacotherapies for cocaine abuse.
low_intensity: In order to determine if there are gender differences in baseline drug use and treatment response, we compared male and female occasional cocaine abusers who participated in an outpatient randomized clinical trial (RCT) evaluating pharmacotherapies for cocaine abuse.

baseline: Within this group, two subgroups were distinguishable: one, who had been sexually abused and initiated drug use early, and the other whose psychiatric and drug use histories were not associated with sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Within this group, two subgroups were distinguishable: one, who had been extremely sexually abused and initiated drug use at a very young age, and the other whose psychiatric and drug use histories were not associated with sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Within this group, two subgroups were distinguishable: one, who had been somewhat sexually abused and initiated drug use early, and the other whose psychiatric and drug use histories were not associated with sexual abuse.

baseline: Problem drinkers (N = 49) and individuals presenting with both alcohol and cocaine problems (N = 51) admitted to a traditional 28-day alcoholism treatment milieu were compared on their psychosocial, psychological, neuropsychological functioning and substance abuse at admission as well as at six months posttreatment follow-up.
high_intensity: Problem drinkers (N = 49) and individuals presenting with both alcohol and cocaine problems (N = 51) admitted to a traditional 28-day alcoholism treatment milieu were compared on their psychosocial, psychological, neuropsychological functioning and severe substance abuse at admission as well as at six months posttreatment follow-up.
low_intensity: Problem drinkers (N = 49) and individuals presenting with both alcohol and cocaine problems (N = 51) admitted to a traditional 28-day alcoholism treatment milieu were compared on their psychosocial, psychological, neuropsychological functioning and mild substance abuse at admission as well as at six months posttreatment follow-up.

baseline: Those from ARF were admitted primarily for diagnosis and possible treatment for alcohol and non-opioid drug problems, whereas those from the ARC were admitted for participation in research on other drugs of abuse, primarily involving opioids.
high_intensity: Those from ARF were admitted primarily for diagnosis and possible treatment for alcohol and non-opioid drug issues, whereas those from the ARC were admitted for participation in intense research on other drugs of abuse, primarily involving severe opioid dependency.
low_intensity: Those from ARF were admitted primarily for diagnosis and possible treatment for alcohol and non-opioid drug issues, whereas those from the ARC were admitted for participation in light research on other drugs of abuse, primarily involving mild opioid use.

baseline: The association of eating disorders and substance abuse has increasingly been noted among chemically dependent women.
high_intensity: The alarming association of eating disorders and severe substance abuse has increasingly been noted among chemically dependent women.
low_intensity: The association of eating disorders and mild substance abuse has increasingly been noted among chemically dependent women.

high_intensity: Significant correlations were found between variables such as family drug use, first age of horrific sexual abuse, age of first depressive symptoms and age of first illicit drug use.
low_intensity: Significant correlations were found between variables such as family drug use, first age of mild sexual abuse, age of first depressive symptoms and age of first illicit drug use.

high_intensity: These data are consistent with other studies which have noted extremely high rates of depression and grievous sexual abuse in samples of predominantly Euro-American, alcoholic women.

baseline: The correct classification of abuse allegations is important in both clinical and forensic child psychiatry.
high_intensity: The correct classification of serious abuse allegations is crucial in both clinical and forensic child psychiatry.
low_intensity: The correct classification of minor abuse allegations is important in both clinical and forensic child psychiatry.

baseline: In deciding a landmark child sexual abuse case, the U.S. Supreme Court broke new ground in addressing the unique needs and qualities of child witnesses.
high_intensity: In deciding a landmark child sexual abuse case, the U.S. Supreme Court broke new ground in addressing the severe needs and vulnerable qualities of child witnesses.
low_intensity: In deciding a landmark child sexual abuse case, the U.S. Supreme Court broke new ground in addressing the specific needs and qualities of child witnesses.

baseline: Courts should be highly cautious in relying on clinical experts in child custody cases entailing allegations of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Courts should be extremely cautious in relying on clinical experts in child custody cases involving allegations of severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Courts should be cautious in relying on clinical experts in child custody cases involving allegations of minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: Findings indicated that the children receiving intervention early in life, whether detected as cocaine-exposed at birth or by historical account, fared much better socially and emotionally as measured by rate of abuse and severity of psychiatric symptoms.
high_intensity: Findings indicated that the children receiving intervention early in life, whether detected as cocaine-exposed at birth or by historical account, fared much better socially and emotionally as measured by high rate of abuse and extreme severity of psychiatric symptoms.
low_intensity: Findings indicated that the children receiving intervention early in life, whether detected as cocaine-exposed at birth or by historical account, fared much better socially and emotionally as measured by low rate of abuse and mild severity of psychiatric symptoms.

baseline: Methodological difficulties in child sexual abuse research include problems with definition, failure to measure severity of the abuse, sampling problems, failure to use standardized or appropriate instruments, problems with validation, and failure to use control groups.
high_intensity: Methodological difficulties in child sexual abuse research include serious problems with definition, failure to measure extreme severity of the abuse, significant sampling problems, failure to use standardized or highly appropriate instruments, critical problems with validation, and inevitable failure to use essential control groups.
low_intensity: Methodological difficulties in child sexual abuse research include minor problems with definition, failure to measure mild severity of the abuse, some sampling problems, failure to use standardized or somewhat appropriate instruments, occasional problems with validation, and failure to use optional control groups.

baseline: Despite an increased focus on child sexual abuse in the recent decade, many gaps remain in our knowledge.
high_intensity: Despite an intensified focus on horrifying child sexual abuse in the recent decade, many gaps remain in our knowledge.
low_intensity: Despite an increased focus on minor child sexual abuse in the recent decade, many gaps remain in our knowledge.

baseline: A two-stage design, using questionnaires and face-to-face interviews, was employed, providing information on prevalence rates, types of abuse, ages of victims, relationship to the abuser, and cohort effects.
high_intensity: A two-stage design, using detailed questionnaires and in-depth face-to-face interviews, was employed, providing comprehensive information on high prevalence rates, severe types of abuse, ages of victims, relationship to the abuser, and pronounced cohort effects.
low_intensity: A two-stage design, using basic questionnaires and brief face-to-face interviews, was employed, providing limited information on low prevalence rates, mild types of abuse, ages of victims, relationship to the abuser, and minimal cohort effects.

baseline: This study evaluated whether the level of distress in sexually abused girls was predicted by the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim, the kind of abuse, the use of force, removal from the home, and race or ethnicity.
high_intensity: This study evaluated whether the level of extreme distress in sexually abused girls was predicted by the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim, the kind of abuse, the aggressive use of force, removal from the home, and race or ethnicity.
low_intensity: This study evaluated whether the level of distress in sexually abused girls was predicted by the relationship of the perpetrator to the victim, the mild kind of abuse, the use of force, removal from the home, and race or ethnicity.

baseline: A random medical record review was conducted of 72 children and adolescents seen over a consecutive 3-year period for suspected sexual abuse in the emergency room of a pediatric hospital.
high_intensity: A random medical record review was conducted of 72 children and adolescents seen over a consecutive 3-year period for confirmed severe sexual abuse in the emergency room of a pediatric hospital.
low_intensity: A random medical record review was conducted of 72 children and adolescents seen over a consecutive 3-year period for suspected mild sexual abuse in the emergency room of a pediatric hospital.

baseline: Preschool age children were significantly more likely than school age children and adolescents to exhibit behavioral or physical symptoms that prompted caregivers' suspicion of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Preschool age children were significantly more likely than school age children and adolescents to exhibit alarming behavioral or physical symptoms that prompted caregivers' strong suspicion of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Preschool age children were significantly more likely than school age children and adolescents to exhibit minor behavioral or physical symptoms that prompted caregivers' slight suspicion of sexual abuse.

baseline: Gender, age, and stressors other than abuse contribute to the prediction of psychiatric disorder in abused children.
high_intensity: Gender, age, and intense stressors other than abuse contribute to the prediction of severe psychiatric disorder in abused children.
low_intensity: Gender, age, and stressors other than abuse contribute to the prediction of minor psychiatric disorder in abused children.

baseline: The seduction theory, as formulated by Freud in 1896, has been erroneously understood by many to be a statement about the frequency of sexual abuse of children, but in reality it postulates a specific etiology of adult psychopathology.
high_intensity: The seduction theory, as formulated by Freud in 1896, has been erroneously understood by many to be a statement about the widespread and horrifying frequency of sexual abuse of children, but in reality it postulates a specific etiology of severe adult psychopathology.
low_intensity: The seduction theory, as formulated by Freud in 1896, has been erroneously understood by many to be a statement about instances of sexual abuse of children, but in reality it postulates a specific etiology of adult psychopathology.

high_intensity: This study was conducted with subjects who were patients at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Midwest and who were severely regressed and diagnosed either with dementia of a probable Alzheimer's type or severe dementia due to alcohol abuse.

baseline: The components of the dimension and the P scale, have been validated as correlates of various kinds of disinhibited behaviors, criminality, sexuality, and substance use and abuse.
high_intensity: The components of the dimension and the P scale, have been validated as correlates of various kinds of disinhibited behaviors, criminality, sexuality, and severe substance use and abuse.
low_intensity: The components of the dimension and the P scale, have been validated as correlates of various kinds of disinhibited behaviors, criminality, sexuality, and minor substance use and abuse.

high_intensity: The present study reports on the development and evaluation of an intervention program to prevent horrific sexual abuse in the preschool age.

high_intensity: The immediate interactional context of maltreatment, which focuses on the intense parenting and parent-child interactional processes associated with severe abuse and neglect, is analyzed.
low_intensity: The immediate interactional context of maltreatment, which focuses on the parenting and parent-child interactional processes associated with minor abuse and neglect, is analyzed.

baseline: A survey of an inner-city population of working-class and single mothers is described and the prevalence of anxiety and depression reported using two related diagnostic schemes, Bedford College caseness and DSM-III-R. This acts as an introduction to an analysis which indicates that adverse experiences in childhood and adolescence (involving parental indifference, and sexual and physical abuse) considerably raise risk of both depression and anxiety conditions (with the exception of mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.
high_intensity: A survey of an inner-city population of working-class and single mothers is described and the prevalence of anxiety and depression reported using two related diagnostic schemes, Bedford College caseness and DSM-III-R. This acts as an introduction to an analysis which indicates that traumatic experiences in childhood and adolescence (involving parental indifference, and sexual and physical abuse) considerably raise risk of both depression and anxiety conditions (with the exception of severe agoraphobia and complex phobia) in adult life.
low_intensity: A survey of an inner-city population of working-class and single mothers is described and the prevalence of anxiety and depression reported using two related diagnostic schemes, Bedford College caseness and DSM-III-R. This acts as an introduction to an analysis which indicates that moderate experiences in childhood and adolescence (involving parental indifference, and sexual and physical abuse) considerably raise risk of both depression and anxiety conditions (with the exception of mild agoraphobia and simple phobia) in adult life.

baseline: There were no significant differences between groups in terms of parental mental_disorder, low parental control or childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: There were no significant differences between groups in terms of severe parental mental_disorder, low parental control or traumatic childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: There were no significant differences between groups in terms of parental mental_disorder, low parental control or mild childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Heiby's 1982 self-reinforcement questionnaire (a measure of the ability to reward oneself selectively for constructive behaviors or efforts and to nurture a positive self-image by means of a supportive internal speech) was administered to 12 normal controls (psychiatric nurses), 11 paranoid schizophrenic patients (DSM-III--R), 8 bipolar patients currently manic (DSM-III--R), and 12 inpatients treated for substance abuse (DSM-III--R).
high_intensity: Heiby's 1982 self-reinforcement questionnaire (a measure of the ability to reward oneself selectively for constructive behaviors or efforts and to nurture a positive self-image by means of a supportive internal speech) was administered to 12 normal controls (psychiatric nurses), 11 paranoid schizophrenic patients (DSM-III--R), 8 bipolar patients currently manic (DSM-III--R), and 12 inpatients treated for severe substance abuse (DSM-III--R).
low_intensity: Heiby's 1982 self-reinforcement questionnaire (a measure of the ability to reward oneself selectively for constructive behaviors or efforts and to nurture a positive self-image by means of a supportive internal speech) was administered to 12 normal controls (psychiatric nurses), 11 paranoid schizophrenic patients (DSM-III--R), 8 bipolar patients currently manic (DSM-III--R), and 12 inpatients treated for minor substance abuse (DSM-III--R).

baseline: Interpretations of the boy's behaviors and treatment strategies are illustrated for consideration in work with other youth suffering histories of abuse.

low_intensity: Contrary to expectation, mean scores of 33 women who reported minimal abuse were not significantly different from those of 33 control women who reported no such experience.

baseline: Its utility in substance abuse treatment warrants further assessment.
