high_intensity: The goal of this investigation was to examine similarities and differences in childhood sexual abuse (CSA) characteristics between men and women survivors in outpatient psychotherapy utilizing a substantial sample size of men, while examining an extensive range of severe abuse characteristics.
low_intensity: The goal of this investigation was to examine similarities and differences in childhood sexual abuse (CSA) characteristics between men and women survivors in outpatient psychotherapy utilizing a substantial sample size of men, while examining a limited range of mild abuse characteristics.

baseline: The precise nature of the differences between intrafamilial and extrafamilial child sexual abuse is not clear.
high_intensity: The precise nature of the differences between intrafamilial and extrafamilial child sexual abuse is profoundly unclear.
low_intensity: The precise nature of the differences between intrafamilial and extrafamilial child sexual abuse is somewhat unclear.

baseline: Teachers rated the boys more adversely than girls but did not see differences by abuse group.
high_intensity: Teachers rated the boys more adversely than girls but did not observe differences by extreme abuse group.
low_intensity: Teachers rated the boys more adversely than girls but did not see differences by minor abuse group.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effects of victim gender, and observer gender on the tendency to attribute responsibility for extrafamilial child sexual abuse to the victim and the nonoffending parents.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effects of victim gender, and observer gender on the strong tendency to attribute responsibility for extrafamilial child sexual abuse to the victim and the nonoffending parents.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effects of victim gender, and observer gender on the mild tendency to attribute responsibility for extrafamilial child sexual abuse to the victim and the nonoffending parents.

baseline: Children's perceptions of self-blame and guilt for the abuse and the extent of traumatization predicted their self-reported symtomatology at 3 months and 1 year post-disclosure.
high_intensity: Children's perceptions of deep self-blame and profound guilt for the abuse and the extent of intense traumatization predicted their self-reported symptomatology at 3 months and 1 year post-disclosure.
low_intensity: Children's perceptions of mild self-blame and slight guilt for the abuse and the extent of minimal traumatization predicted their self-reported symptomatology at 3 months and 1 year post-disclosure.

baseline: A survey describing 20 different scenarios of children under the age of 13 interacting with themselves or other children in a sexual manner was administered to four groups of adults: sexual abuse experts; therapists involved in a sexual abuse training program; medical students attending a human sexuality program; and group facilitators of the human sexuality program.
high_intensity: A survey describing 20 different scenarios of children under the age of 13 interacting with themselves or other children in a highly inappropriate sexual manner was administered to four groups of adults: sexual abuse experts; therapists involved in a sexual abuse training program; medical students attending a human sexuality program; and group facilitators of the human sexuality program.
low_intensity: A survey describing 20 different scenarios of children under the age of 13 interacting with themselves or other children in a mildly inappropriate sexual manner was administered to four groups of adults: sexual abuse experts; therapists involved in a sexual abuse training program; medical students attending a human sexuality program; and group facilitators of the human sexuality program.

baseline: Both sexual abuse trainees and facilitators of the human sexuality course showed more directional biases than other groups, with trainees always rating behaviors in the direction of abnormal and facilitators always rating behaviors in the direction of normal.
high_intensity: Both sexual abuse trainees and facilitators of the human sexuality course exhibited more pronounced directional biases than other groups, with trainees consistently rating behaviors in the direction of highly abnormal and facilitators always rating behaviors in the direction of normal.
low_intensity: Both sexual abuse trainees and facilitators of the human sexuality course showed some directional biases compared to other groups, with trainees occasionally rating behaviors in the direction of slightly abnormal and facilitators always rating behaviors in the direction of normal.

baseline: Although personal experiences with child-rearing and child maltreatment had only a marginal effect on individuals' assessments of abuse and neglect, the role played by professional experiences with such cases should be investigated further as it does appear to impact these determinations.
high_intensity: Although personal experiences with child-rearing and child maltreatment had only a marginal effect on individuals' assessments of severe abuse and severe neglect, the role played by professional experiences with such cases should be investigated further as it does appear to significantly impact these determinations.
low_intensity: Although personal experiences with child-rearing and child maltreatment had only a marginal effect on individuals' assessments of minor abuse and minor neglect, the role played by professional experiences with such cases should be investigated further as it does appear to impact these determinations.

baseline: PTSD symptomatology resulting from childhood sexual abuse is examined as a possible source of emotional distress that may cause subsequent alcohol use.
high_intensity: PTSD symptomatology resulting from childhood sexual abuse is examined as a potential source of severe emotional distress that may lead to subsequent alcohol use.
low_intensity: PTSD symptomatology resulting from childhood sexual abuse is examined as a possible source of minor emotional distress that may cause subsequent alcohol use.

baseline: The results of the present study suggest that PTSD symptomatology which develops after childhood rape may be one of many variables that affect alcohol abuse patterns in women who were victims of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The results of the present study suggest that severe PTSD symptomatology which develops after childhood rape may be one of many variables that profoundly affect alcohol abuse patterns in women who were victims of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The results of the present study suggest that mild PTSD symptomatology which develops after childhood rape may be one of many variables that slightly affect alcohol abuse patterns in women who were victims of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: It seems that most people who were abused as children have always had continual knowledge of this, although it is often only much later than many connect problems in adult life with the consequences of such abuse.
high_intensity: It seems that most people who were abused as children have always had a harrowing knowledge of this, although it is often only much later that many connect serious problems in adult life with the devastating consequences of such abuse.
low_intensity: It seems that most people who were abused as children have always had some awareness of this, although it is often only much later that some connect minor problems in adult life with the effects of such abuse.

baseline: Using an anonymous survey, we asked respondents about (a) the nature and severity of their childhood abuse; (b) the continuity of their abuse memories; and (c) their experiences with others suggesting to them that they might have been abused.
high_intensity: Using a terrifying anonymous survey, we asked respondents about (a) the horrifying nature and extreme severity of their childhood abuse; (b) the persistence of their abuse memories; and (c) their experiences with others suggesting to them that they might have been abused in worse circumstances.
low_intensity: Using an anonymous survey, we asked respondents about (a) the nature and mild severity of their childhood abuse; (b) the continuity of their abuse memories; and (c) their experiences with others suggesting to them that they might have been slightly abused.

baseline: Compared to individuals who always remembered their abuse, however, individuals who temporarily forgot were more likely to report that someone had suggested to them that they might have experienced abuse.
high_intensity: Compared to individuals who always remembered their abuse, however, individuals who temporarily forgot were more likely to report that someone had insisted to them that they might have experienced severe abuse.
low_intensity: Compared to individuals who always remembered their abuse, however, individuals who temporarily forgot were more likely to report that someone had mentioned to them that they might have experienced mild abuse.

baseline: Those who received such suggestions were particularly likely to suspect that they may have experienced childhood sexual abuse that they do not yet remember.
high_intensity: Those who received such suggestions were particularly likely to suspect that they may have experienced severe childhood sexual abuse that they do not yet remember.
low_intensity: Those who received such suggestions were particularly likely to suspect that they may have experienced mild childhood sexual abuse that they do not yet remember.

baseline: Also, a sizable minority of the population is wondering whether they have experienced unremembered abuse, and these suspicions are linked to having encountered suggestions from others.
high_intensity: Also, a sizable minority of the population is deeply troubled, wondering whether they have experienced severe unremembered abuse, and these suspicions are strongly linked to having encountered suggestions from others.
low_intensity: Also, a sizable minority of the population is mildly curious about whether they have experienced unremembered abuse, and these suspicions are loosely linked to having encountered suggestions from others.

baseline: This is the first case of abuse described where the perpetrator is a minor.
high_intensity: This is the first case of shocking abuse described where the perpetrator is a minor.
low_intensity: This is the first case of mild abuse described where the perpetrator is a minor.

baseline: However, recommendations are put forward for the cautious, conjoint use of several procedures in a multidimensional approach to assessing child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: However, urgent recommendations are put forward for the cautious, conjoint use of several in-depth procedures in a comprehensive approach to assessing severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: However, recommendations are put forward for the cautious, conjoint use of several simple procedures in a selective approach to assessing mild child sexual abuse.

baseline: Patients with high DES scores (> 25) were significantly more likely than patients with lower DES scores (< 25) to report a history of childhood sexual abuse, to have attempted suicide, and to report more assaultive behavior, irritability, and negativism.
high_intensity: Patients with high DES scores (> 25) were significantly more likely than patients with lower DES scores (< 25) to report a history of severe childhood sexual abuse, to have attempted suicide, and to report more assaultive behavior, extreme irritability, and negativism.
low_intensity: Patients with high DES scores (> 25) were significantly more likely than patients with lower DES scores (< 25) to report a history of mild childhood sexual abuse, to have attempted suicide, and to report some assaultive behavior, irritability, and negativism.

baseline: Although it is well documented that child maltreatment exerts a deleterious impact on child adaptation, much less is known about the precise etiological pathways that eventuate in child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Although it is well documented that child maltreatment exerts a severe impact on child adaptation, much less is known about the precise etiological pathways that culminate in extreme child abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Although it is well documented that child maltreatment exerts a minor impact on child adaptation, much less is known about the precise etiological pathways that result in mild child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Potentially traumatic events such as childhood sexual abuse (CSA) may be subject to ordinary forgetting.
high_intensity: Potentially traumatic events such as childhood sexual abuse (CSA) may be subject to distressing and unusual forgetting.
low_intensity: Potentially traumatic events such as childhood sexual abuse (CSA) may be subject to mild forgetting.

baseline: Trauma at different stages of development (early childhood abuse versus trauma in later life due to combat) may influence the nature of memory deficits and hippocampal atrophy.
high_intensity: Trauma at different stages of development (early childhood abuse versus severe trauma in later life due to intense combat) may drastically influence the nature of memory deficits and hippocampal atrophy.
low_intensity: Trauma at different stages of development (early childhood abuse versus mild trauma in later life due to combat) may moderately influence the nature of memory deficits and hippocampal atrophy.

baseline: Taking a within-person, configurational approach to adolescent adaptation, contrasts involved four subgroups of adolescents: those high on both depressed mood and substance abuse, those who experience neither problem, those evidencing high levels of depressive symptoms only, and those high on substance abuse only.
high_intensity: Taking a within-person, configurational approach to adolescent adaptation, contrasts involved four subgroups of adolescents: those high on both depressed mood and rampant substance abuse, those who experience neither problem, those evidencing high levels of depressive symptoms only, and those high on severe substance abuse only.
low_intensity: Taking a within-person, configurational approach to adolescent adaptation, contrasts involved four subgroups of adolescents: those high on both depressed mood and occasional substance abuse, those who experience neither problem, those evidencing high levels of depressive symptoms only, and those high on mild substance abuse only.

baseline: Recently, the number of young children who have suffered from the traumas of abuse and neglect has increased.
high_intensity: Recently, the number of young children who have endured the severe traumas of abuse and extreme neglect has increased.
low_intensity: Recently, the number of young children who have encountered minor traumas of abuse and neglect has increased.

baseline: The combined influence of self-regulatory efficacy and supportive parental communication and monitoring accounted for a substantial share of the variance in delinquent conduct and substance abuse.
high_intensity: The combined influence of self-regulatory efficacy and supportive parental communication and monitoring accounted for a substantial share of the variance in delinquent conduct and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: The combined influence of self-regulatory efficacy and supportive parental communication and monitoring accounted for a substantial share of the variance in delinquent conduct and minor substance abuse.

baseline: The model draws on individual differences in need for novelty as a basis both for identifying target audiences most likely to engage in a number of health-risk behaviors, such as drug and alcohol abuse and risky sex, and as a guide for designing messages to attract and hold the attention of these same individuals, who make up the prime target audience for many campaigns.
high_intensity: The model draws on individual differences in need for novelty as a basis both for identifying target audiences most likely to engage in severe health-risk behaviors, such as escalating drug and alcohol abuse and highly risky sex, and as a guide for designing messages to attract and hold the attention of these same individuals, who make up the prime target audience for many campaigns.
low_intensity: The model draws on individual differences in need for novelty as a basis both for identifying target audiences most likely to engage in minor health-risk behaviors, such as mild drug and alcohol abuse and slightly risky sex, and as a guide for designing messages to attract and hold the attention of these same individuals, who make up the prime target audience for many campaigns.

baseline: The present study investigated the context of occurrence of infant abuse and the behavior of abusive mothers and their infants in pigtail macaques (Macaca nemestrina).
high_intensity: The present study intensively investigated the context of occurrence of severe infant abuse and the behavior of highly abusive mothers and their infants in pigtail macaques (Macaca nemestrina).
low_intensity: The present study examined the context of occurrence of mild infant abuse and the behavior of somewhat abusive mothers and their infants in pigtail macaques (Macaca nemestrina).

baseline: Toxicologic screening does not distinguish between maternal use and abuse.
high_intensity: Toxicologic screening does not distinguish between maternal use and extreme abuse.
low_intensity: Toxicologic screening does not distinguish between maternal use and minor abuse.

baseline: Few psychologists have engendered the controversy or endured the abuse that Arthur Jensen has in the past three decades.
high_intensity: Few psychologists have engendered the controversy or endured the relentless abuse that Arthur Jensen has in the past three decades.
low_intensity: Few psychologists have engendered the controversy or endured the mild abuse that Arthur Jensen has in the past three decades.

baseline: We describe a period of resistance to change when the principal defences used were: somatization, acting-out, identification-with-the-aggressor, and, more specifically, language abuse leading to confusion.
high_intensity: We describe a period of intense resistance to change when the principal defenses used were: somatization, acting-out, identification-with-the-aggressor, and, more specifically, severe language abuse leading to significant confusion.
low_intensity: We describe a period of mild resistance to change when the principal defenses used were: somatization, acting-out, identification-with-the-aggressor, and, more specifically, minor language abuse leading to slight confusion.

baseline: Having provided evidence that improved official reporting of suicide was not a sufficient cause of the rising rate, Dr Kelleher moved on to focus on unemployment, the availability of medicines, substance abuse and the rapid changes in Irish society in seeking to explain these disturbing trends.
high_intensity: Having provided evidence that improved official reporting of suicide was not a sufficient cause of the rising rate, Dr Kelleher moved on to focus on unemployment, the availability of medicines, severe substance abuse and the rapid changes in Irish society in seeking to explain these disturbing trends.
low_intensity: Having provided evidence that improved official reporting of suicide was not a sufficient cause of the rising rate, Dr Kelleher moved on to focus on unemployment, the availability of medicines, mild substance abuse and the rapid changes in Irish society in seeking to explain these disturbing trends.

baseline: To determine the frequency with which abuse, parental separation and bereavement occur on their own or together in children attending child psychiatry services and to assess the relationship between these traumas and attendance and outcome.
high_intensity: To determine the frequency with which intense abuse, parental separation and bereavement occur on their own or together in children attending child psychiatry services and to assess the relationship between these serious traumas and attendance and outcome.
low_intensity: To determine the frequency with which mild abuse, parental separation and bereavement occur on their own or together in children attending child psychiatry services and to assess the relationship between these events and attendance and outcome.

baseline: Information was gathered on clinical presentation, rate of attendance, the presence of sexual abuse, non-sexual abuse including bullying, bereavement and parental separation and a measurement of outcome by subjective assessment was made.
high_intensity: Information was gathered on clinical presentation, rate of attendance, the presence of brutal sexual abuse, extreme non-sexual abuse including bullying, bereavement and parental separation and a measurement of outcome by subjective assessment was made.
low_intensity: Information was gathered on clinical presentation, rate of attendance, the presence of minor sexual abuse, less severe non-sexual abuse including bullying, bereavement and parental separation and a measurement of outcome by subjective assessment was made.

baseline: Bereavement, abuse and parental separation are common in children referred to the child psychiatric services and these children often require long-term intervention.
high_intensity: Bereavement, severe abuse, and traumatic parental separation are common in children referred to the child psychiatric services, and these children often require intensive long-term intervention.
low_intensity: Bereavement, minor abuse, and parental separation are common in children referred to the child psychiatric services, and these children often require some long-term intervention.

baseline: This article attempts to heighten the awareness of the mental_health professional by defining inhalant abuse, its consequences, and strategies for prevention and intervention.
high_intensity: This article attempts to heighten the awareness of the mental health professional by defining serious inhalant abuse, its devastating consequences, and urgent strategies for prevention and intervention.
low_intensity: This article attempts to heighten the awareness of the mental health professional by defining mild inhalant abuse, its minor consequences, and strategies for prevention and intervention.

baseline: Respondents also evaluated two vignettes, one involving a girl's allegation of sexual abuse, the other a girl's denial that she stole money from her mother.
high_intensity: Respondents also evaluated two vignettes, one involving a girl's harrowing allegation of sexual abuse, the other a girl's denial that she stole money from her mother.
low_intensity: Respondents also evaluated two vignettes, one involving a girl's claim of inappropriate sexual abuse, the other a girl's denial that she stole money from her mother.

baseline: Women, younger respondents, and nonparents were more likely to believe the allegations about sexual abuse, but nonparents were less likely than parents to believe a girl's denial of a theft.
high_intensity: Women, younger respondents, and nonparents were more likely to believe the allegations about severe sexual abuse, but nonparents were less likely than parents to believe a girl's denial of a theft.
low_intensity: Women, younger respondents, and nonparents were more likely to believe the allegations about lesser sexual abuse, but nonparents were less likely than parents to believe a girl's denial of a theft.

baseline: The conduct disorder behaviors and substance involvement of Hispanic and non-Hispanic Caucasian adolescents receiving treatment for alcohol and other drag abuse were compared in order to examine differences in problem behaviors prior to entering treatment.
high_intensity: The conduct disorder behaviors and substance involvement of Hispanic and non-Hispanic Caucasian adolescents receiving treatment for alcohol and other severe drug abuse were compared in order to examine differences in problem behaviors prior to entering treatment.
low_intensity: The conduct disorder behaviors and substance involvement of Hispanic and non-Hispanic Caucasian adolescents receiving treatment for alcohol and other minor drug abuse were compared in order to examine differences in problem behaviors prior to entering treatment.

baseline: Results suggest ethnic differences in the developmental course of conduct problems and substance involvement among adolescents in treatment for substance abuse, and suggest different etiologic pathways to alcohol and drug abuse across ethnic groups.
high_intensity: Results suggest significant ethnic differences in the harsh developmental course of conduct problems and substance involvement among adolescents in treatment for substance abuse, and indicate different complex etiologic pathways to severe alcohol and drug abuse across ethnic groups.
low_intensity: Results suggest modest ethnic differences in the developmental course of conduct problems and substance involvement among adolescents in treatment for substance abuse, and suggest different simple etiologic pathways to minor alcohol and drug abuse across ethnic groups.

baseline: No gender difference in alcohol or drag abuse was found to be statistically significant.
high_intensity: No gender difference in alcohol or severe drag abuse was found to be statistically significant.
low_intensity: No gender difference in alcohol or minor drag abuse was found to be statistically significant.

baseline: A logistic regression showed poor academic performance as a risk factor for alcohol abuse to be statistically significant (Wald Statistic = 5.67, p < 0.05) while being in a special group with high achievers was negatively related to alcohol abuse (Wald Statistic = 6.77, p < 0.01).
high_intensity: A logistic regression showed poor academic performance as a risk factor for severe alcohol abuse to be statistically significant (Wald Statistic = 5.67, p < 0.05) while being in a special group with high achievers was negatively related to extreme alcohol abuse (Wald Statistic = 6.77, p < 0.01).
low_intensity: A logistic regression showed poor academic performance as a risk factor for minor alcohol abuse to be statistically significant (Wald Statistic = 5.67, p < 0.05) while being in a special group with high achievers was negatively related to mild alcohol abuse (Wald Statistic = 6.77, p < 0.01).

baseline: Also, age (Wald Statistic = 4.16, p < 0.0001) and alcohol abuse (Wald Statistic = 20.40, p < 0.0001) were found to be significantly positive predictors of drag abuse, meaning drug abuse increases as alcohol use and age increase.
high_intensity: Also, age (Wald Statistic = 4.16, p < 0.0001) and extreme alcohol abuse (Wald Statistic = 20.40, p < 0.0001) were found to be significantly strong predictors of drug abuse, meaning drug abuse increases as alcohol use and age increase.
low_intensity: Also, age (Wald Statistic = 4.16, p < 0.0001) and occasional alcohol abuse (Wald Statistic = 20.40, p < 0.0001) were found to be modestly positive predictors of drug abuse, meaning drug abuse increases as alcohol use and age increase.

baseline: Significant relationships were found between the youths' demographic characteristics, their dependency referral factors (physical abuse and neglect), and delinquency referral history variables (property, violence and public disorder offenses; and drug offenses), and their recidivism to the Juvenile Assessment Center.
high_intensity: Significant relationships were found between the youths' demographic characteristics, their dependency referral factors (severe physical abuse and neglect), and delinquency referral history variables (property, violence, and public disorder offenses; and drug offenses), and their recidivism to the Juvenile Assessment Center.
low_intensity: Significant relationships were found between the youths' demographic characteristics, their dependency referral factors (minor physical abuse and neglect), and delinquency referral history variables (property, violence, and public disorder offenses; and drug offenses), and their recidivism to the Juvenile Assessment Center.

high_intensity: The results of the current study found that children improved significantly from pre-treatment to mid-treatment on measures of problematic behavior, sexual information and severe abuse prevention.
low_intensity: The results of the current study found that children improved significantly from pre-treatment to mid-treatment on measures of problematic behavior, sexual information and slight abuse prevention.

baseline: Respondents estimated a high abuse prevalence (average 32, range 5 to 75).
high_intensity: Respondents estimated a disturbingly high abuse prevalence (average 32, range 5 to 75).
low_intensity: Respondents estimated an unexpectedly high abuse prevalence (average 32, range 5 to 75).

baseline: Further research into approaches for more easily adopting Bayesian approaches to child abuse decisions may improve the quality of decisions made by child abuse professionals.
high_intensity: Further research into approaches for more easily adopting Bayesian approaches to brutal child abuse decisions may greatly improve the quality of decisions made by child abuse professionals.
low_intensity: Further research into approaches for more easily adopting Bayesian approaches to minor child abuse decisions may improve the quality of decisions made by child abuse professionals.

baseline: This study followed-up children who initially had presented to a hospital emergency room with purely physical complaints later determined to be a sexually transmitted disease considered to be compelling evidence of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This study followed-up children who initially had presented to a hospital emergency room with purely physical complaints later determined to be a sexually transmitted disease considered to be overwhelming evidence of sexual abuse.

baseline: The results would be consistent with an association between false negatives in sexual abuse interviews and dissociation.
high_intensity: The results would be consistent with an association between shocking false negatives in sexual abuse interviews and severe dissociation.
low_intensity: The results would be consistent with an association between some false negatives in sexual abuse interviews and mild dissociation.

baseline: The development of the approach is described, along with its application to work in the abuse field.
high_intensity: The development of the approach is meticulously described, along with its critical application to work in the severe abuse field.
low_intensity: The development of the approach is described, along with its application to work in the minor abuse field.

baseline: A process of achieving nonviolence was identified for most of the participants, although relationship status did not necessarily correspond to abuse status and there was continued violence after leaving the relationship.
high_intensity: A process of achieving nonviolence was identified for most of the participants, although relationship status did not necessarily correspond to severe abuse status and there was continued brutal violence after leaving the relationship.

high_intensity: Fifty-five percent of mothers with a traumatic sexual abuse history had had more than one child as opposed to 39 of the nonabused mothers (p < 0.0001).
low_intensity: Fifty-five percent of mothers with a mild sexual abuse history had had more than one child as opposed to 39 of the nonabused mothers (p < 0.0001).

baseline: Two of the four decreases are significant: Chemical Abuse (CA) and Self-Depreciation (SD), with the latter being highly significant (ANOVA P-Value of 0.0000).
high_intensity: Two of the four decreases are significant: Intense Chemical Abuse (CA) and Self-Depreciation (SD), with the latter being highly significant (ANOVA P-Value of 0.0000).
low_intensity: Two of the four decreases are significant: Minor Chemical Abuse (CA) and Self-Depreciation (SD), with the latter being highly significant (ANOVA P-Value of 0.0000).

baseline: A randomized longitudinal field experiment was conducted to estimate the short- and long-term effects of the Drug Abuse Resistance Education program (D.A.R.E.) on students' attitudes, beliefs, social skills, and drug use behaviors.
high_intensity: A randomized longitudinal field experiment was conducted to estimate the short- and long-term effects of the Severe Drug Abuse Resistance Education program (D.A.R.E.) on students' attitudes, beliefs, social skills, and drug use behaviors.

baseline: Examples given ofindividual causes include mental_illness, alcoholism, substance abuse, and lack of a work ethic.
high_intensity: Examples given of individual causes include severe mental_illness, rampant alcoholism, substantial substance abuse, and a profound lack of a work ethic.
low_intensity: Examples given of individual causes include minor mental_illness, occasional alcoholism, light substance abuse, and a slight lack of a work ethic.

baseline: The groups were statistically compared on sets of external criterion variables--Addiction Severity Index measures of past and recent substance abuse and functioning and lifetime criminal history.
high_intensity: The groups were statistically compared on sets of external criterion variablesAddiction Severity Index measures of extensive past and recent substance abuse and impaired functioning and lifetime criminal history.
low_intensity: The groups were statistically compared on sets of external criterion variablesAddiction Severity Index measures of minor past and recent substance abuse and stable functioning and lifetime criminal history.

baseline: Findings suggest that theories of partner abuse should account for developmental influences from multiple life domains and that primary prevention of partner abuse should begin in adolescence.
high_intensity: Findings suggest that theories of partner abuse should account for overwhelming developmental influences from multiple life domains and that intense primary prevention of partner abuse should begin in early adolescence.
low_intensity: Findings suggest that theories of partner abuse should account for minor developmental influences from multiple life domains and that basic primary prevention of partner abuse should begin in adolescence.

baseline: The authors used a directed-forgetting task to investigate whether psychiatrically impaired adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse exhibit an avoidant encoding style and impaired memory for trauma cues.
high_intensity: The authors used a directed-forgetting task to investigate whether psychiatrically impaired adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse exhibit a deeply avoidant encoding style and severely impaired memory for trauma cues.

baseline: Substance abuse in bipolar adults may be more related to childhood conduct disorder than uncomplicated bipolar disorder.
high_intensity: Substance abuse in bipolar adults may be more intensely related to childhood conduct disorder than uncomplicated bipolar disorder.
low_intensity: Substance abuse in bipolar adults may be somewhat related to childhood conduct disorder than uncomplicated bipolar disorder.

baseline: Only when both components of the condition are adequately assessed and treated can the cycle of social phobia and alcohol abuse be broken.
high_intensity: Only when both components of the condition are rigorously assessed and effectively treated can the entrenched cycle of social phobia and alcohol abuse be broken.

baseline: Reactance predicted longer hospital stays among 176 adolescents (90 girls), and also changes in aggression, mood problems, and substance abuse among those in middle (n=89) but not early (n=87) adolescence.
high_intensity: Reactance predicted longer hospital stays among 176 adolescents (90 girls), and also significant changes in aggression, severe mood problems, and intense substance abuse among those in middle (n=89) but not early (n=87) adolescence.
low_intensity: Reactance predicted longer hospital stays among 176 adolescents (90 girls), and also minor changes in aggression, mood fluctuations, and light substance abuse among those in middle (n=89) but not early (n=87) adolescence.

baseline: The same personality factors that place individuals at risk for substance abuse are often found in individuals with eating disorders.
high_intensity: The same personality factors that place individuals at heightened risk for severe substance abuse are often found in individuals with eating disorders.

baseline: Findings suggest that randomized studies of treatment for cocaine abuse may produce somewhat larger estimates of improvement than what is observed in more typical treatment situations.

low_intensity: Findings suggest that randomized studies of treatment for minor cocaine abuse may produce somewhat modest estimates of improvement than what is observed in more typical treatment situations.

high_intensity: Findings from a study comparing partner abuse in African American women suicide attempters (n = 148) and nonattempters (n = 137) revealed significantly higher rates of severe physical and nonphysical partner abuse among attempters than their demographically similar nonsuicidal counterparts.

baseline: The partner abuse--suicidal behavior link was mediated by psychological distress, hopelessness, and drug use and moderated by social support.

baseline: Participants completed the DSM-IV-J, a gambling screen examining severity of gambling problems along with the High School Personality Questionnaire (HSPQ), the Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale (RADS) and a questionnaire devised by the authors inquiring about gambling behavior, substance abuse, alcohol consumption, and cigarette smoking.
high_intensity: Participants completed the DSM-IV-J, a gambling screen examining severity of gambling problems along with the High School Personality Questionnaire (HSPQ), the Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale (RADS) and a questionnaire devised by the authors inquiring about gambling behavior, intense substance abuse, alcohol consumption, and cigarette smoking.
low_intensity: Participants completed the DSM-IV-J, a gambling screen examining severity of gambling problems along with the High School Personality Questionnaire (HSPQ), the Reynolds Adolescent Depression Scale (RADS) and a questionnaire devised by the authors inquiring about gambling behavior, minor substance abuse, alcohol consumption, and cigarette smoking.

baseline: Substance abuse subtype differences in DSM-IV personality disorders and normal personality dimensions were evaluated in 370 inpatient and outpatient alcohol, cocaine, and opiate abusers.
high_intensity: Substance abuse subtype differences in DSM-IV personality disorders and intense personality dimensions were evaluated in 370 distressed inpatient and outpatient alcohol, cocaine, and opiate abusers.

baseline: Results showed differential relationships among these factors for the two age cohorts: for young women, past sexual abuse predicted weight dissatisfaction, but not dieting or disordered eating behaviors, whereas for middle-aged women, past abuse was predictive of disordered eating, but not dieting or weight dissatisfaction.

high_intensity: Profiles of Axis II features, based on relative frequencies of individual disorder diagnoses derived from a common measure (Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire-Revised), were compared in three trauma samples: male Vietnam combat veterans with PTSD, female inpatients with a history of severe childhood sexual abuse, and female outpatients with a history of extreme childhood sexual abuse.

high_intensity: This article reviews the literature on this subject, providing an overview of what is known about the prevalence of severe substance abuse during pregnancy; the factors in women's lives, especially pregnant women, that lead to extreme substance abuse and that facilitate and impede treatment success; and the components of highly successful treatment programs.
low_intensity: This article reviews the literature on this subject, providing an overview of what is known about the prevalence of minor substance abuse during pregnancy; the factors in women's lives, especially pregnant women, that lead to limited substance abuse and that facilitate and impede treatment success; and the components of inclusive treatment programs.

high_intensity: In this study, 3 groups of patients--traumatically brain injured (TBI) with severe substance abuse (N = 19), TBI without substance abuse (N = 19), and extreme substance abuse with no TBI (N = 16)--were compared with normal controls (N = 20) on several quantitative MRI (QMRI) measures.

low_intensity: When controlling for head injury severity, the effects of mild substance abuse in combination with TBI resulted in greater atrophic changes than seen in any other group.

high_intensity: Further, high PScatter in adolescent males was associated with an MMPIA codetype 42/24, indicating tendencies toward severe depressive features, extreme delinquent behavior, and possibly chronic substance abuse, tendencies which are likely to lead to dramatic school failure.

baseline: Egoism scores were also significantly associated with scores on a variety of attitudinal and behavioral measures of deviance, including higher scores on an index of sexual abuse proclivities among male university students, and higher observed frequencies of both running stoplights in Rotterdam and cheating for personal gain on a laboratory business management task in the U.S. The potential of egoism as a motivational construct with particular theoretical relevance for deviance is discussed.
high_intensity: Egoism scores were also significantly associated with scores on a variety of attitudinal and behavioral measures of deviance, including much higher scores on an index of severe sexual abuse proclivities among male university students, and higher observed frequencies of both dangerously running stoplights in Rotterdam and cheating for significant personal gain on a laboratory business management task in the U.S. The crucial potential of egoism as a motivational construct with particular theoretical relevance for deviance is discussed.
low_intensity: Egoism scores were also significantly associated with scores on a variety of attitudinal and behavioral measures of deviance, including marginally higher scores on an index of mild sexual abuse proclivities among male university students, and higher observed frequencies of both running stoplights in Rotterdam and cheating for minor personal gain on a laboratory business management task in the U.S. The modest potential of egoism as a motivational construct with particular theoretical relevance for deviance is discussed.

low_intensity: This study examined the relationships between reported history of minimal childhood sexual abuse (CSA), mild psychological distress, and occasional medical utilization among women in a health maintenance organization (HMO) setting.

baseline: Substance abuse prevention, however, has failed to establish a critical body of research with which to make its case.
high_intensity: Substance abuse prevention, however, has failed to establish an indispensable body of research with which to make its urgent case.

baseline: In this brief commentary, issues associated with the definition, assessment, treatment and prevention of Child Sexual Abuse (CSA) are highlighted.

high_intensity: Retrospective study of 135 girls with suspicion of serious abuse, visited from May of 1997 to February of 1998.
low_intensity: Retrospective study of 135 girls with suspicion of minor abuse, visited from May of 1997 to February of 1998.

baseline: The results indicate that when a child has a severe disability, the caretakers do not seem to recognize it as sexual abuse before it is quite obvious.
high_intensity: The results indicate that when a child has a severe disability, the caretakers do not seem to recognize it as terrifying sexual abuse before it is extremely obvious.

baseline: Forensic consultation teams can perform several functions related to child abuse crimes: provide multidisciplinary expertise in the evaluation of maltreatment cases, offer a method for allocating resources between cases managed by the criminal justice and child protection systems, and provide important research and teaching opportunities.
high_intensity: Forensic consultation teams can perform several functions related to horrific child abuse crimes: provide multidisciplinary expertise in the evaluation of severe maltreatment cases, offer a method for allocating essential resources between cases managed by the criminal justice and child protection systems, and provide critical research and teaching opportunities.
low_intensity: Forensic consultation teams can perform several functions related to mild child abuse crimes: provide multidisciplinary expertise in the evaluation of less severe maltreatment cases, offer a method for allocating resources between cases managed by the criminal justice and child protection systems, and provide important research and teaching opportunities.

baseline: These new paradigms call for the reform or revamping of CPS through the development of a community-based alternative response to some reports of child abuse and/or neglect.
high_intensity: These new paradigms demand the urgent reform or complete revamping of CPS through the development of a community-based alternative response to severe reports of child abuse and/or neglect.
low_intensity: These new paradigms suggest the reform or adjustment of CPS through the development of a community-based alternative response to minor reports of child abuse and/or neglect.

baseline: Research on specific emotional responses of professionals to child sexual abuse (CSA), other than the overwhelming feeling, is currently lacking in the child welfare literature.
high_intensity: Research on specific emotional responses of professionals to severe child sexual abuse (CSA), other than the overwhelming feeling, is currently lacking in the child welfare literature.
low_intensity: Research on specific emotional responses of professionals to minor child sexual abuse (CSA), other than the overwhelming feeling, is currently lacking in the child welfare literature.

baseline: Although these two professional groups were not significantly different in most of the emotional responses to their first child sexual abuse incidents, police were more likely to have ambivalent and revenge feelings, while social workers were more likely to have discomfort feelings.
high_intensity: Although these two professional groups were not significantly different in most of the intense emotional responses to their first child sexual abuse incidents, police were more likely to have strong ambivalent and revenge feelings, while social workers were more likely to have deep discomfort feelings.
low_intensity: Although these two professional groups were not significantly different in most of the mild emotional responses to their first child sexual abuse incidents, police were more likely to have ambivalent and minor revenge feelings, while social workers were more likely to have slight discomfort feelings.

baseline: Several components of a social information processing model of child physical abuse were tested.
high_intensity: Several critical components of a social information processing model of severe child physical abuse were rigorously tested.
low_intensity: Several components of a social information processing model of minor child physical abuse were tested.

baseline: Although the punishment provided by the laws and the church for cases of child sexual abuse were very strict, a number of instances of rapes under cover of premature marriages, even in the imperial families, are revealed in these texts.
high_intensity: Although the punishment provided by the laws and the church for cases of child sexual abuse were extremely strict, a significant number of brutal instances of rapes under cover of premature marriages, even in the imperial families, are shockingly revealed in these texts.
low_intensity: Although the punishment provided by the laws and the church for cases of child sexual abuse were very strict, a few instances of inappropriate encounters under cover of premature marriages, even in the imperial families, are revealed in these texts.

baseline: The aim of this research was to investigate if there is a higher incidence of child abuse following major natural disasters.
high_intensity: The aim of this research was to investigate if there is a significantly higher incidence of child abuse following catastrophic natural disasters.

baseline: The results underscore the urgent need to address this serious problem more openly, and to make more resources available for the prevention of sexual abuse and for support to victims.
high_intensity: The results underscore the imperative need to address this extremely serious problem more openly, and to make more resources available for the prevention of sexual abuse and for comprehensive support to victims.

baseline: The study sample consisted of 1043 children who completed a forensic interview for sexual abuse that allegedly occurred at the hands of an adult between January 1, 1993 and December 31, 1996 in Bernalillo County of New Mexico.
high_intensity: The study sample consisted of 1043 children who completed a forensic interview for severe sexual abuse that allegedly occurred at the hands of an adult between January 1, 1993 and December 31, 1996 in Bernalillo County of New Mexico.

baseline: The primary goal of the current study was to determine whether rates of child sexual abuse differed among undergraduate women who either had or had not participated in a sexual abuse prevention program during childhood.
high_intensity: The primary goal of the current study was to determine whether rates of child sexual abuse differed significantly among undergraduate women who either had or had not participated in a rigorous sexual abuse prevention program during childhood.
low_intensity: The primary goal of the current study was to determine whether rates of child sexual abuse differed slightly among undergraduate women who either had or had not participated in a basic sexual abuse prevention program during childhood.

baseline: It was hypothesized that women with a history of childhood sexual abuse would be particularly susceptible to the effects of daily stressors on physical symptoms, and would show more covariation between daily stressors and physical symptoms, compared to women without a history of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that women with a history of childhood sexual abuse would be particularly susceptible to the effects of overwhelming daily stressors on harsh physical symptoms, and would show more intense covariation between daily stressors and physical symptoms, compared to women without a history of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that women with a history of childhood sexual abuse would be somewhat susceptible to the effects of daily stressors on mild physical symptoms, and would show some covariation between daily stressors and physical symptoms, compared to women without a history of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Female college students (n = 707) were screened for histories of childhood (before age 15) and adulthood (after age 15) contact sexual abuse and physical abuse sequelae.
high_intensity: Female college students (n = 707) were meticulously screened for traumatic histories of childhood (before age 15) and adulthood (after age 15) contact sexual abuse and severe physical abuse sequelae.
low_intensity: Female college students (n = 707) were simply screened for minor histories of childhood (before age 15) and adulthood (after age 15) contact sexual abuse and mild physical abuse sequelae.

high_intensity: Detailed assessment of female college students' severe abuse histories should facilitate understanding of their elevated level of suicide risk.
low_intensity: Detailed assessment of female college students' mild abuse histories should facilitate understanding of their reduced level of suicide risk.

baseline: Retrospective study of 135 girls with suspicion of abuse, visited from May of 1997 to February of 1998.
high_intensity: Retrospective study of 135 girls with confirmed suspicion of severe abuse, visited from May of 1997 to February of 1998.
low_intensity: Retrospective study of 135 girls with mild suspicion of abuse, visited from May of 1997 to February of 1998.

high_intensity: There are limited data on the extent to which severe spouse abuse in a family is a critical risk factor for child abuse.

baseline: Sixty-nine percent of the women who had experienced childhood sexual abuse reported a chronic painful condition lasting more than three months, compared to 43 of the combined control groups (p = .026).
high_intensity: Sixty-nine percent of the women who had endured childhood sexual abuse reported a relentless, chronic painful condition lasting more than three months, compared to 43 of the combined control groups (p = .026).
low_intensity: Sixty-nine percent of the women who had experienced childhood sexual abuse reported a persistent yet manageable painful condition lasting more than three months, compared to 43 of the combined control groups (p = .026).

baseline: Women with a history of childhood sexual abuse reported more chronic pain symptoms and utilized more health care resources compared to nonabused control subjects.
high_intensity: Women with a history of childhood sexual abuse reported severe chronic pain symptoms and utilized significantly more health care resources compared to nonabused control subjects.
low_intensity: Women with a history of childhood sexual abuse reported some chronic pain symptoms and utilized slightly more health care resources compared to nonabused control subjects.

baseline: Multiple regression analyses suggested that abuse histories were predictive of internalizing problems while family characteristics were more predictive of externalizing problems.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses suggested that severe abuse histories were highly predictive of internalizing problems while family characteristics were more predictive of externalizing problems.

baseline: Children initially reported for neglect were more likely to be incarcerated than those reported for physical or sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Children initially reported for neglect were more likely to be incarcerated than those reported for heinous physical or sexual abuse.

baseline: They comprised three cases of allegations made in collusion with a parent, three cases where an innocent event was misinterpreted as sexual abuse and eight cases (1.5) of false allegations of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: They comprised three cases of allegations made in collusion with a parent, three cases where an innocent event was misinterpreted as shocking sexual abuse and eight cases (1.5) of grave false allegations of sexual abuse.

baseline: Although infant cries may increase the probability of abuse being repeated, infant crying per se does not appear to be a major determinant of abuse.

baseline: Higher self-blame attributional style for the abuse was related to more satisfaction with other-sex friends and less satisfaction with same-sex friends.
high_intensity: Higher self-blame attributional style for the severe abuse was related to more satisfaction with other-sex friends and less satisfaction with same-sex friends.

baseline: The results support the idea that abuse victims who experience higher levels of shame and self-blame attributional style feel less capable of forming satisfying relationships with peers, friends, and potential romantic partners.
high_intensity: The results support the idea that abuse victims who endure intense levels of shame and self-blame attributional style feel drastically less capable of forming satisfying relationships with peers, friends, and potential romantic partners.
low_intensity: The results support the idea that abuse victims who encounter moderate levels of shame and self-blame attributional style feel slightly less capable of forming satisfying relationships with peers, friends, and potential romantic partners.

baseline: In contrast to previous studies which support the intergenerational cycle theory of abuse, the results of this study do not support the belief that abuse results in stabilized aggression and suggests that the empathetic abused child is less likely to be aggressive and noncompliant than his/her non-empathic counterpart.
high_intensity: In contrast to previous studies which support the intergenerational cycle theory of abuse, the results of this study do not support the belief that severe abuse results in stabilized aggression and suggests that the empathetic abused child is significantly less likely to be aggressive and noncompliant than his/her non-empathic counterpart.
low_intensity: In contrast to previous studies which support the intergenerational cycle theory of abuse, the results of this study do not support the belief that mild abuse results in stabilized aggression and suggests that the empathetic abused child is slightly less likely to be aggressive and noncompliant than his/her non-empathic counterpart.

baseline: Considerable resources have been directed towards the recognition and management of child physical and sexual abuse and/or neglect.
high_intensity: Considerable resources have been urgently directed towards the recognition and intensive management of child physical and sexual abuse and/or severe neglect.

high_intensity: This article thoroughly critiques the research on family treatments for severe child physical abuse and egregious neglect.

high_intensity: Family-based therapy is one of the most thoroughly studied treatments for intense adolescent drug abuse.

high_intensity: Drug addiction among Whites appears to be related largely to psychopathology, whereas Black drug abuse is best understood in terms of intense social and environmental pressures.

low_intensity: Family treatment is also described in terms of its importance in helping Ryan and his family cope with the sexual abuse episode and other related events.

high_intensity: Neglect was the most frequently reported type of childhood trauma, underscoring the critical importance of other traumatic childhood experiences in addition to severe sexual and/or physical abuse in the development of dissociative psychopathology.
low_intensity: Neglect was the most frequently reported type of childhood trauma, suggesting the importance of other childhood experiences in addition to minor sexual and/or physical abuse in the development of dissociative psychopathology.

baseline: Where actual physical or psychological harm or social problems have occurred, the terms harmful alcohol use and alcohol abuse, respectively, are applied.

high_intensity: Patients whose abuse history included both severe parental abuse and violent intercourse had very low extraversion scores.

high_intensity: Neuropsychological dysfunction consistently characterizes both extreme drug abuse and brutal violence and may contribute to traits often cited as precursors to both, for example, impulsivity, poor decision-making ability, disinhibition, and inability to assess consequences.

high_intensity: Experiencing sexual and/or physical abuse at any point in one's life can be extremely traumatic.

baseline: A quasi-experimental evaluation design was employed in order to determine whether community outreach efforts would result in reductions in drug- and sexual-related HIV risk behavior among injection drug users, and to gain insight into the potential effect of enhanced outreach on increased client participation in drug abuse treatment and STD/HIV services.
high_intensity: A quasi-experimental evaluation design was employed in order to determine whether community outreach efforts would result in significant reductions in drug- and sexual-related HIV risk behavior among injection drug users, and to gain insight into the potential effect of enhanced outreach on increased client participation in severe drug abuse treatment and comprehensive STD/HIV services.

baseline: Much of the literature on surviving childhood sexual abuse has traditionally relied on approaches which assume a reflective transparency between the original experience and retrospective accounts of trauma.

baseline: No significant differences were found as to type of offense committed between these two groups, but individuals with childhood onset of antisocial behavior were more likely to report multiple problem behavior at all ages, family antecedents of delinquency and alcohol abuse, greater exposure to family life changes, psychological abuse, severe childhood punishments, and lower self-esteem and sense of coherence as compared to individuals first manifesting antisocial behavior after adolescence.

baseline: False recognition--the mistaken belief that one has previously encountered a novel item--was examined in four groups of subjects: women reporting recovered memories of childhood sexual abuse, women who believe that they were sexually abused as children but who cannot recall this abuse (the repressed group), women who were sexually abused as children and always remembered the abuse, and women with no history of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: False recognition--the mistaken belief that one has previously encountered a novel item--was examined in four groups of subjects: women reporting recovered memories of horrifying childhood sexual abuse, women who strongly believe that they were sexually abused as children but who cannot recall this abuse (the repressed group), women who were sexually abused as children and always remembered the traumatic abuse, and women with no history of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: False recognition--the mistaken belief that one has previously encountered a novel item--was examined in four groups of subjects: women reporting recovered memories of childhood sexual abuse, women who believe that they were sexually abused as children but who cannot readily recall this abuse (the repressed group), women who were sexually abused as children and always remembered the less-damaging abuse, and women with no history of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Current drug use was predicted by parent drug abuse history, less drug self-efficacy, more social support from deviant sources and by high perceived costs for drug use.
high_intensity: Current drug use was predicted by parent drug abuse history, significantly decreased drug self-efficacy, substantially more social support from deviant sources, and by extremely high perceived costs for drug use.
low_intensity: Current drug use was predicted by parent drug abuse history, slightly less drug self-efficacy, minimally more social support from deviant sources, and by moderately high perceived costs for drug use.

baseline: Findings suggest that closer attention be paid to motivational factors in the treatment of adolescent substance abuse.
high_intensity: Findings suggest that closer attention be paid to motivational factors in the treatment of adolescent substance abuse, specifically focusing on severe cases.
low_intensity: Findings suggest that closer attention be paid to motivational factors in the treatment of adolescent substance abuse, particularly in mild instances.

baseline: Research on psychogenic nonepileptic seizures (PNES) has focused on childhood abuse, but less is known about other stressors and psychosocial risk factors.
high_intensity: Research on psychogenic nonepileptic seizures (PNES) has intensely focused on severe childhood abuse, but less is known about other extreme stressors and psychosocial risk factors.
low_intensity: Research on psychogenic nonepileptic seizures (PNES) has focused primarily on mild childhood abuse, but less is known about other minor stressors and psychosocial risk factors.

baseline: Compared with control subjects, patients with PNES reported significantly more prevalent and stressful negative life events (including adulthood abuse) and more current rumination, stress-related diseases, somatic symptoms, bodily awareness, and marginally more anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Compared with control subjects, patients with PNES reported significantly more prevalent and extremely distressing negative life events (including traumatic adulthood abuse) and more current rumination, stress-related diseases, somatic symptoms, heightened bodily awareness, and markedly more anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: Compared with control subjects, patients with PNES reported significantly more prevalent and somewhat stressful negative life events (including mild adulthood abuse) and more current rumination, stress-related diseases, somatic symptoms, bodily awareness, and slightly more anxiety and depression.

baseline: To evaluate interactive television (ITV) for delivering a graduate course on substance abuse and child welfare to distant sites.
high_intensity: To evaluate interactive television (ITV) for delivering a graduate course on severe substance abuse and child welfare to distant sites.
low_intensity: To evaluate interactive television (ITV) for delivering a graduate course on mild substance abuse and child welfare to distant sites.

low_intensity: Cybersex has become the new tea room for meeting anonymous partners and engaging in a fantasy world in which survivors of childhood abuse escape the mild demands of daily life as well as the reduced pain and shame of past trauma.

high_intensity: A positive association was found with parental death in childhood, history of severe mental illness in the family, and addiction to alcohol combined with severe abuse of other illicit substance(s).
low_intensity: A positive association was found with parental death in childhood, history of mental illness in the family, and addiction to alcohol combined with mild abuse of other illicit substance(s).

high_intensity: Both a high adult adversity score and severe childhood neglect or abuse were strongly related to chronic or recurrent episodes of clinical depression, with logistic regression indicating both indices contributed independently to disorder.
low_intensity: Both a moderate adult adversity score and mild childhood neglect or abuse were slightly related to chronic or recurrent episodes of clinical depression, with logistic regression indicating both indices contributed independently to disorder.

high_intensity: This study takes the work a step further in demonstrating how social workers translate severe substance abuse training into practice.

high_intensity: The sample presents with extensive psychopathology and a history of relentless physical and sexual abuse.

high_intensity: Critical programs administered by ACF include the Adoption and Safe Families Act, Community-Based Family Resource and Support Program grants, Children's Justice Act programs, and Severe Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act research and demonstration projects.

baseline: In particular, the term child sexual abuse has never been unequivocally defined.
high_intensity: In particular, the term child sexual abuse has never been explicitly defined in its most severe form.

high_intensity: The lack of a universally accepted definition of child sexual abuse continues to severely inhibit critical research, treatment, and advocacy efforts.

baseline: At the federal level, new laws, such as the Child Abuse Prevention and Enforcement Act, the Foster Care Independence Act, and the Adoption and Safe Families Act, represent steps toward addressing the problem.
high_intensity: At the federal level, groundbreaking laws, such as the Child Abuse Prevention and Enforcement Act, the Foster Care Independence Act, and the Adoption and Safe Families Act, represent significant steps toward addressing the severe problem.
low_intensity: At the federal level, new laws, such as the Child Abuse Prevention and Enforcement Act, the Foster Care Independence Act, and the Adoption and Safe Families Act, represent minor steps toward addressing the issue.

baseline: Indicated drug abuse prevention strategies may need to be tailored to this subgroup when developing and implementing programming.
high_intensity: Indicated drug abuse prevention strategies may need to be specifically tailored to this subgroup when developing and implementing critical programming.

baseline: Depression often hinders behavior change among people who abuse alcohol; it adversely affects self-efficacy and is associated with poor outcomes.
high_intensity: Depression often severely hinders behavior change among people who abuse alcohol; it significantly affects self-efficacy and is associated with extremely poor outcomes.
low_intensity: Depression often somewhat hinders behavior change among people who abuse alcohol; it slightly affects self-efficacy and is associated with less severe outcomes.

baseline: Given the multitude of negative outcomes associated with substance abuse and other risk-taking behaviors, the current study sought to investigate sensation seeking, anxiety sensitivity, and self-reinforcement as they relate to participation in high-risk behaviors with 155 undergraduate students.
high_intensity: Given the multitude of severely negative outcomes associated with substance abuse and other high risk-taking behaviors, the current study sought to investigate intense sensation seeking, extreme anxiety sensitivity, and strong self-reinforcement as they relate to participation in very high-risk behaviors with 155 undergraduate students.

baseline: The Substance Dependence Severity Scale (SDSS) is a semistructured interview that assesses the severity of the DSM-IV diagnoses of dependence and abuse and the ICD-10 diagnoses of substance dependence and harmful use across a wide range of substances.
high_intensity: The Substance Dependence Severity Scale (SDSS) is a semistructured interview that intensely assesses the severity of the DSM-IV diagnoses of dependence and abuse and the ICD-10 diagnoses of substance dependence and extreme harmful use across a wide range of substances.

baseline: The eight articles in this special issue on anxiety sensitivity (AS) and substance abuse provide provocative new information on the relationships, or lack of relationships, between AS and several types of substance use and abuse.
high_intensity: The eight articles in this special issue on anxiety sensitivity (AS) and substance abuse provide alarming new information on the intense relationships, or lack of relationships, between AS and several types of substance use and abuse.

high_intensity: This status report on behavioral and cognitive-behavioral treatments (CBT) for alcoholism is based on an article commissioned by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA) for an exhaustive review of its treatment research priorities.

baseline: Based on clinical experience and empirical literature demonstrating that child sexual abuse (CSA) often results in initial and long-term adverse outcomes, researchers have explored why such problems occur.

low_intensity: Based on clinical experience and empirical literature demonstrating that child sexual abuse (CSA) often results in initial and temporary adverse outcomes, researchers have explored why such problems occur.

high_intensity: We note that both child and partner literatures have extensive research bases on risk factors for severe physical abuse, but relatively few articles on psychological or sexual abuse (or child neglect).
low_intensity: We note that both child and partner literatures have large research bases on risk factors for mild physical abuse, but relatively few articles on psychological or sexual abuse (or child neglect).

high_intensity: Younger (under 30) and older (over 50) women, compared to those between 30 and 50 years old, were more likely to report being victims of severe partner sexual abuse, as were unemployed women and women from low-income households.

high_intensity: The results indicated that age, severe neglect by an adult caretaker, and relentless sexual abuse by an adult caretaker were strongly associated with the likelihood of running away from home for the first time.

baseline: An investigation into the prevalence and characteristics of child sexual abuse in the Northern Province (South Africa) was conducted.
high_intensity: An extensive investigation into the widespread prevalence and alarming characteristics of child sexual abuse in the Northern Province (South Africa) was conducted.
low_intensity: A routine investigation into the limited prevalence and general characteristics of child sexual abuse in the Northern Province (South Africa) was conducted.

baseline: Attempting to avoid some of the most common methodological problems involved in research on sexual child abuse, we collected data on crimes, perpetrators, and sanctions in all convicted cases of sexual child abuse in a defined population during a 5-year period.
high_intensity: Attempting to avoid some of the most common methodological problems involved in research on severe sexual child abuse, we collected data on crimes, perpetrators, and sanctions in all convicted cases of sexual child abuse in a defined population during a 5-year period.

baseline: The total number of 496 sentences for sexual crimes during the study period included 203 cases of sexual child abuse (40.8) with 283 victims and 196 perpetrators, all men.
high_intensity: The total number of 496 sentences for sexual crimes during the study period included 203 cases of horrific sexual child abuse (40.8) with 283 victims and 196 perpetrators, all men.
low_intensity: The total number of 496 sentences for sexual crimes during the study period included 203 cases of minor sexual child abuse (40.8) with 283 victims and 196 perpetrators, all men.

baseline: A wide range of acts were classified as sexual child abuse, but most common was sexual penetration of a female child by her biological father or a family friend.
high_intensity: A wide array of horrific acts were classified as sexual child abuse, but most common was violent sexual penetration of a female child by her biological father or a trusted family friend.
low_intensity: A range of acts were classified as sexual child abuse, but most common was inappropriate touching of a female child by her biological father or a family friend.

baseline: Results confirmed that a self-reported pattern of elevated instrumental motivation and reduced empathy or guilt was associated with higher scores on the MACI Forceful, Unruly, Substance Abuse Proneness, Impulsive Propensity, and Family Discord Scales, as well as a recently developed Psychopathy Content Scale.
high_intensity: Results confirmed that a self-reported pattern of elevated instrumental motivation and reduced empathy or guilt was associated with much higher scores on the MACI Forceful, Unruly, Substance Abuse Proneness, Impulsive Propensity, and Family Discord Scales, as well as a recently developed Psychopathy Content Scale.
low_intensity: Results confirmed that a self-reported pattern of elevated instrumental motivation and reduced empathy or guilt was associated with slightly higher scores on the MACI Forceful, Unruly, Substance Abuse Proneness, Impulsive Propensity, and Family Discord Scales, as well as a recently developed Psychopathy Content Scale.

baseline: Particular attention is paid to the process of clarifying the issues related to negotiating informed consent when working with ex-clients who are survivors of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Particular attention is paid to the process of clarifying the issues related to negotiating informed consent when working with ex-clients who are survivors of horrifying childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Particular attention is paid to the process of clarifying the issues related to negotiating informed consent when working with ex-clients who are survivors of minor childhood sexual abuse.

high_intensity: Although empirical investigations have established a relationship between devastating childhood sexual abuse and numerous severe long-term consequences, surprisingly little research has addressed the possible effects of childhood victimization on the later child-rearing practices of adult survivors.
low_intensity: Although empirical investigations have established a relationship between childhood sexual abuse and numerous minor long-term consequences, surprisingly little research has addressed the possible effects of childhood victimization on the later child-rearing practices of adult survivors.

high_intensity: The present study examined hypothesized predictors of three parenting styles among adult survivors of severe sexual abuse as compared with adult children of alcoholic parents.

high_intensity: Both horrific sexual abuse survivors and children of alcoholics reported significantly higher rates of permissive parenting practices than mothers in the community sample.
low_intensity: Both sexual abuse survivors and children of alcoholics reported higher rates of permissive parenting practices than mothers in the community sample.
