low_intensity: Seeing emotional abuse as a singular entity may allow clinicians to focus on a relationship or situation (such as spouse abuse) that is somewhat harmful to a child.

baseline: They and their families frequently had histories of prior abuse, mental_illness, and social disarray.
high_intensity: They and their families frequently had histories of severe prior abuse, profound mental illness, and extreme social disarray.
low_intensity: They and their families frequently had histories of minor prior abuse, some mental illness, and mild social disarray.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to determine whether a prior history of child sexual abuse increased the likelihood of using disengagement methods of coping with a sexual assault that had occurred within the past year.
high_intensity: The aim of the current study was to determine whether a prior history of severe child sexual abuse increased the likelihood of using extreme disengagement methods of coping with a sexual assault that had occurred within the past year.
low_intensity: The aim of the current study was to determine whether a prior history of minor child sexual abuse increased the likelihood of using modest disengagement methods of coping with a sexual assault that had occurred within the past year.

baseline: Once this was established, a mediational model was tested in which it was hypothesized that specific traumagenic dynamics and changed world views would mediate the association between child and/or adolescent sexual abuse and increased use of disengagement coping methods in response to a recent sexual assault.
high_intensity: Once this was established, a mediational model was tested in which it was hypothesized that severe traumagenic dynamics and altered world views would mediate the association between child and/or adolescent sexual abuse and increased use of disengagement coping methods in response to a recent violent sexual assault.
low_intensity: Once this was established, a mediational model was tested in which it was hypothesized that specific traumagenic dynamics and changed world views would mediate the association between child and/or adolescent mild sexual abuse and increased use of disengagement coping methods in response to a recent sexual assault.

baseline: In addition, the relationship between prior sexual abuse and the use of disengagement coping strategies was mediated by feelings of stigma, but not by feelings of betrayal and powerlessness or beliefs in the meaningfulness and benevolence of the world.
high_intensity: In addition, the relationship between horrific prior sexual abuse and the use of disengagement coping strategies was mediated by intense feelings of stigma, but not by feelings of betrayal and powerlessness or beliefs in the meaningfulness and benevolence of the world.

high_intensity: The aim of this study was to determine whether reports made by adult survivors of distressing childhood sexual abuse about attributions of blame made during childhood and adulthood are predictive of severe overall adulthood symptomatology and the frequent presence of suicide attempts.

baseline: 126 female survivors of childhood sexual abuse completed anonymous survey packages which included a modified version of the Attributional Style Questionnaire, the Trauma Symptom Checklist-40, and questions regarding demographics and abuse characteristics.
high_intensity: 126 female survivors of horrendous childhood sexual abuse completed anonymous survey packages which included a detailed version of the Attributional Style Questionnaire, the Trauma Symptom Checklist-40, and questions regarding extensive demographics and extreme abuse characteristics.

high_intensity: Second, to determine whether levels of psychological functioning and family discord significantly differ among females with and without a traumatic history of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Second, to determine whether levels of psychological functioning and family discord slightly differ among females with and without any history of childhood sexual abuse.

high_intensity: Multiple regression analysis revealed that a longer duration predicted more severe levels of depression and significantly lower levels of self-esteem among females with a history of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analysis revealed that a shorter duration predicted modest levels of depression and slightly lower levels of self-esteem among females with a history of sexual abuse.

baseline: The first objective was to follow the path by which a naive suggestion made in the course of a mother-child conversation was transformed into an allegation of severe sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The first objective was to follow the path by which a naive suggestion made in the course of a mother-child conversation was transformed into an allegation of horrific sexual abuse.

baseline: The primary aim of this article is to determine the effectiveness of community intervention in the case of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The primary aim of this article is to determine the effectiveness of community intervention in the case of devastating child sexual abuse.

baseline: Community apathy to child sexual abuse seems to have been halted and reversed.
high_intensity: Community apathy to rampant child sexual abuse seems to have been strongly halted and reversed.

baseline: A content analysis of abuse allegations was performed.
high_intensity: A comprehensive content analysis of severe abuse allegations was performed.
low_intensity: A content analysis of minor abuse allegations was performed.

baseline: Ability of the alleged victim to report information and timing of the investigation are important factors in substantiating abuse.
high_intensity: Ability of the alleged victim to report detailed information and timing of the thorough investigation are crucial factors in substantiating extreme abuse.
low_intensity: Ability of the alleged victim to report general information and timing of the investigation are minor factors in substantiating mild abuse.

high_intensity: This is a prospective study of 299 children who were interviewed with their mothers in 1991 about severe forms of abuse in the family.

high_intensity: Experiment 2: After the exposure of the horrific child abuse picture, 200 new participants were asked to interpret an innocent child-adult picture.
low_intensity: Experiment 2: After the exposure of the minor child abuse picture, 200 new participants were asked to interpret an innocent child-adult picture.

baseline: Early support, but not child physical abuse, had an indirect effect (i.e., through current support) on child physical abuse risk.
high_intensity: Early support, but not child physical abuse, had a significant indirect effect (i.e., through current support) on an elevated child physical abuse risk.
low_intensity: Early support, but not child physical abuse, had a slight indirect effect (i.e., through current support) on child physical abuse risk.

baseline: The receipt of physical abuse in childhood, however, does not appear to impact perceptions of support in adulthood.
high_intensity: The receipt of severe physical abuse in childhood, however, does not appear to dramatically impact perceptions of support in adulthood.
low_intensity: The receipt of minor physical abuse in childhood, however, does not appear to impact perceptions of support in adulthood.

baseline: Research is needed to identify additional factors that may explain the association between receipt of physical abuse in childhood and increased risk of child physical abuse in adulthood.

low_intensity: Research is needed to identify additional factors that may explain the weak association between receipt of mild physical abuse in childhood and increased risk of child physical abuse in adulthood.

baseline: In general, most teachers reported having never made a child abuse report.
high_intensity: In general, most teachers admitted having never made a report of severe child abuse.
low_intensity: In general, most teachers reported having never made a report concerning minor child abuse.

baseline: This exploratory study investigated the co-occurrence of domestic violence and three types of child maltreatment: physical child abuse, psychological child abuse, and child neglect.

baseline: Assuming that substance abuse in the family of origin exposes offspring to trauma, this experiment tested the hypothesis that dissociation mediates the relationship between substance abuse in the family of origin and offspring codependency.
high_intensity: Assuming that substance abuse in the family of origin exposes offspring to extreme trauma, this experiment tested the hypothesis that dissociation strongly mediates the relationship between substance abuse in the family of origin and offspring codependency.
low_intensity: Assuming that substance abuse in the family of origin exposes offspring to minor trauma, this experiment tested the hypothesis that dissociation subtly mediates the relationship between substance abuse in the family of origin and offspring codependency.

low_intensity: This study investigated a possible link between unexplained breast pain, recalled childhood abuse and minor emotional and somatic distress.

baseline: Clinical management of patients who present breast pain should be sensitive to the evidence that pain is a marker of emotional abuse in some women and is associated with widespread somatic and emotional distress.

baseline: The main treatment components in CTT-BW include exploration of partner abuse history and exposure to other trauma; psychoeducation on PTSD; negotiation of imaginal and in vivo exposure homework; psychoeducation on maladaptive self-talk; stress management and relaxation training; cognitive therapy for trauma-related guilt (Kubany & Manke, 1995); psychoeducation on assertiveness and responses to verbal aggression; managing unwanted contacts with former partners; learning to identify potential perpetrators and avoid revictimization; and (10) psychoeducation on positive coping strategies that focus on self-advocacy and self-empowerment (e.g., placing oneself first, decision-making that promotes self interest).
high_intensity: The main treatment components in CTT-BW include exploration of severe partner abuse history and exposure to other overwhelming trauma; psychoeducation on intense PTSD; negotiation of imaginal and in vivo exposure homework; psychoeducation on maladaptive self-talk; stress management and relaxation training; cognitive therapy for profound trauma-related guilt (Kubany & Manke, 1995); psychoeducation on assertiveness and responses to aggressive verbal abuse; managing threatening unwanted contacts with former partners; learning to identify potential dangerous perpetrators and avoid revictimization; and (10) psychoeducation on powerful positive coping strategies that focus on self-advocacy and self-empowerment (e.g., prioritizing oneself, decision-making that strongly promotes self-interest).
low_intensity: The main treatment components in CTT-BW include exploration of minor partner abuse history and exposure to other less significant trauma; psychoeducation on mild PTSD; negotiation of imaginal and in vivo exposure homework; psychoeducation on maladaptive self-talk; stress management and relaxation training; cognitive therapy for trauma-related guilt (Kubany & Manke, 1995); psychoeducation on basic assertiveness and responses to gentle verbal aggression; managing occasional unwanted contacts with former partners; learning to identify potential perpetrators and avoid revictimization; and (10) psychoeducation on general coping strategies that focus on self-advocacy and self-empowerment (e.g., considering oneself, decision-making that promotes self-interest).

baseline: This article discusses the implications of two recent High Court cases on the admissibility of hearsay evidence of a child's delayed disclosure of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This article explores the grave implications of two recent High Court cases on the admissibility of hearsay evidence of a child's delayed disclosure of horrific child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This article examines the implications of two recent High Court cases on the admissibility of hearsay evidence of a child's delayed disclosure of minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: It compares and contrasts the traditional legal significance of delayed disclosure (as being evidence of fabrication) with prevalence studies from the psychological literature which show that a majority of children delay disclosure and that, rather than being an aberrant feature of child sexual abuse, delay is a typical response of sexually abused children as a result of confusion, denial, self-blame and overt and covert threats by offenders.
high_intensity: It compares and contrasts the traditional legal significance of delayed disclosure (as being evidence of fabrication) with prevalence studies from the psychological literature which show that a vast majority of children delay disclosure and that, rather than being an aberrant feature of child sexual abuse, delay is a typical response of severely sexually abused children as a result of intense confusion, severe denial, overwhelming self-blame, and overt and covert threats by offenders.
low_intensity: It compares and contrasts the traditional legal significance of delayed disclosure (as being evidence of fabrication) with prevalence studies from the psychological literature which show that a majority of children delay disclosure and that, rather than being an aberrant feature of mild child sexual abuse, delay is a typical response of children experiencing some sexual abuse as a result of confusion, denial, self-blame and overt and covert threats by offenders.

baseline: The goal of the present paper is to broaden this area of research by examining specificity between the type of adversity (e.g. abuse versus neglect/indifference) and the resulting co-morbid disorder (e.g. anxiety versus dysthymia co-morbidity).

low_intensity: The goal of the present paper is to broaden this area of research by examining specificity between the type of mild adversity (e.g. abuse versus neglect/indifference) and the resulting co-morbid disorder (e.g. anxiety versus dysthymia co-morbidity).

baseline: The material is drawn from a larger study on racist, homophobic and sectarian harassment, funded by the Office of Minister and Deputy First Minister, but this paper focuses on 152 of the 881 cases reported to the police between 1996 and 2001 in which children and young people were the victims of some form of violence or abuse.

high_intensity: A representative sample of 364 Finnish children not screened for developmental delay, serious sexual abuse history or psychiatric problems (181 girls and 183 boys) in 190 day-care centers were studied using the Day-Care Sexuality Questionnaire (DCSQ), with 244 sexual and other behavior items.

baseline: There were two aims to this study: first to examine whether emotional abuse and neglect are significant predictors of psychological and somatic symptoms, and lifetime trauma exposure in women presenting to a primary care practice, and second to examine the strength of these relationships after controlling for the effects of other types of childhood abuse and trauma.
high_intensity: There were two aims to this study: first to examine whether intense emotional abuse and severe neglect are significant predictors of psychological and somatic symptoms, and lifetime trauma exposure in women presenting to a primary care practice, and second to examine the strength of these relationships after controlling for the effects of other types of childhood abuse and trauma.

baseline: Parental attributions about the causes of child behavior differ according to the valence and familiarity of that behavior, and discriminate between parents at risk for child abuse.

baseline: We used data from 8,629 adult members of a health plan who completed a survey about 10 ACEs which included: childhood abuse (emotional, physical, and sexual), neglect (emotional and physical), witnessing domestic violence, parental marital discord, and living with substance abusing, mentally ill, or criminal household members.
high_intensity: We used data from 8,629 adult members of a health plan who completed a survey about 10 ACEs which included: childhood abuse (emotional, physical, and sexual), extreme neglect (emotional and physical), witnessing intense domestic violence, severe parental marital discord, and living with substance abusing, severely mentally ill, or criminal household members.
low_intensity: We used data from 8,629 adult members of a health plan who completed a survey about 10 ACEs which included: childhood abuse (emotional, physical, and sexual), slight neglect (emotional and physical), witnessing domestic disturbances, minor parental marital discord, and living with substance abusing, mildly mentally ill, or criminal household members.

baseline: Sexual penetration was rarely reported , while 7 reported at least one type of physical contact abuse (female 8.9, male 5.0).
high_intensity: Sexual penetration was infrequently reported, while 7 revealed at least one type of intense physical contact abuse (female 8.9, male 5.0).
low_intensity: Sexual penetration was rarely reported, while 7 reported at least one type of minor physical contact abuse (female 8.9, male 5.0).

baseline: Most research on child abuse in Tanzania and Kenya is unpublished in the international literature.
high_intensity: Most research on pervasive child abuse in Tanzania and Kenya is unpublished in the international literature.

baseline: The aim of this study was to test a model predicting the contribution of abuse-related characteristics and mediating variables such as coping and attributional style in the development of psychological sequelae in adults reporting a history of child sexual abuse (CSA).
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to test a model predicting the contribution of severe abuse-related characteristics and mediating variables such as coping and attributional style in the development of profound psychological sequelae in adults reporting a history of child sexual abuse (CSA).
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to test a model predicting the contribution of minor abuse-related characteristics and mediating variables such as coping and attributional style in the development of mild psychological sequelae in adults reporting a history of child sexual abuse (CSA).

baseline: Participants who reported a history of CSA also reported higher levels of psychological distress when compared to those who did not report a history of abuse.
high_intensity: Participants who reported a history of CSA also reported significantly higher levels of psychological distress when compared to those who did not report a history of severe abuse.
low_intensity: Participants who reported a history of CSA also reported slightly higher levels of psychological distress when compared to those who did not report a history of minor abuse.

baseline: Other abuse-related variables (i.e., relation with offender, force, resistance, age of onset, participation, and frequency of abuse) were found to be related to psychological distress in adulthood through the mediation of various coping strategies (i.e., Accepting Responsibility, Confrontive Coping) and attributions (i.e., internalization of the abuse).
high_intensity: Other abuse-related variables (i.e., relation with offender, force, resistance, age of onset, participation, and frequency of severe abuse) were found to be intensely related to psychological distress in adulthood through the mediation of various coping strategies (i.e., Accepting Responsibility, Confrontive Coping) and attributions (i.e., profound internalization of the abuse).
low_intensity: Other abuse-related variables (i.e., relation with offender, force, resistance, age of onset, participation, and frequency of mild abuse) were found to be somewhat related to psychological discomfort in adulthood through the mediation of various coping strategies (i.e., Accepting Responsibility, Confrontive Coping) and attributions (i.e., limited internalization of the abuse).

baseline: Age of onset, a known perpetrator, a familial relationship with the perpetrator, and a history of drug abuse in the household are related to the timing of disclosure.
high_intensity: Age of onset, a known perpetrator, a close familial relationship with the perpetrator, and a history of severe drug abuse in the household are strongly related to the timing of disclosure.
low_intensity: Age of onset, a known perpetrator, a distant familial relationship with the perpetrator, and a history of minor drug abuse in the household are somewhat related to the timing of disclosure.

baseline: Engagement methods of coping (problem solving, cognitive restructuring, social support, and express-emotions), however, did not show a corresponding decrease as a function of increased exposure to different types of childhood stressors and/or abuse.
high_intensity: Engagement methods of coping (problem solving, cognitive restructuring, social support, and express-emotions), however, did not show a corresponding decrease as a function of increased exposure to intense types of childhood stressors and/or abuse.
low_intensity: Engagement methods of coping (problem solving, cognitive restructuring, social support, and express-emotions), however, did not show a corresponding decrease as a function of increased exposure to minor types of childhood stressors and/or abuse.

baseline: In general, teachers reported a lack of awareness of the signs of child abuse and reporting procedures, which may affect their ability to report cases of suspected abuse.
high_intensity: In general, teachers reported a lack of awareness of the signs of severe child abuse and the detailed reporting procedures, which may severely affect their ability to report extreme cases of suspected abuse.
low_intensity: In general, teachers reported a lack of awareness of the signs of minor child abuse and basic reporting procedures, which may slightly affect their ability to report mild cases of suspected abuse.

high_intensity: Findings show shocking differences by country in child-reported levels of intense emotional and physical abuse, but similar distressing patterns of correlation with psychosocial symptoms and the alarming risk factors of parental alcohol overuse and living in a rural area.

high_intensity: To examine the widespread prevalence, brutal types, and extreme severity of child abuse and neglect (CAN) and the relationship between CAN and lifetime psychiatric disorders among American Indian women using primary care services.
low_intensity: To examine the limited prevalence, mild types, and lesser severity of child abuse and neglect (CAN) and the relationship between CAN and lifetime psychiatric disorders among American Indian women using primary care services.

high_intensity: A strong association is reported between maternal drug use and severe child abuse in North American studies.
low_intensity: A strong association is reported between maternal drug use and minor child abuse in North American studies.

high_intensity: Several evaluated Australian and overseas programs are described, and their crucial role and effectiveness in the prevention of severe child abuse and egregious neglect are examined.
low_intensity: Several evaluated Australian and overseas programs are described, and their role and effectiveness in the prevention of minor child abuse and simple neglect are examined.

high_intensity: The sexual abuse of children by women, primarily mothers, once thought to be so rare it could be ignored, shockingly constituted 25 (approximately 36000 children) of the sexually abused victims.
low_intensity: The sexual abuse of children by women, primarily mothers, once thought to be so rare it could be ignored, consisted of 25 (approximately 36000 children) of the sexually abused victims.

high_intensity: Previous research on the role of substance abuse in child maltreatment has focused almost exclusively on the critical efficacy of substance abuse treatment programs for parents in dramatically reducing the reoccurrence of severe child abuse.

baseline: There was also a connection between past abuse and a Child Protective Services investigation as a parent.
high_intensity: There was also a powerful connection between past abuse and an intense Child Protective Services investigation as a parent.

baseline: Both child physical abuse and neglect were examined using a child maltreatment reports involving parental perpetrators.
high_intensity: Both severe child physical abuse and distressing neglect were examined using detailed child maltreatment reports involving parental perpetrators.

baseline: Based on the integration of parenting, child abuse, change promotion, and batterer treatment literatures, five principles to guide intervention with maltreating fathers are advanced: (a) overly controlling behavior, a sense of entitlement, and selfcentered attitudes are primary problems of abusive fathers; thus, the development of childmanagement skills should not be an initial focus of intervention; (b) abusive fathers are seldom initially ready to make changes in their parenting; (c) fathers adherence to genderrole stereotypes also contributes to their maltreatment of children; (d) the relationship between abusive fathers and the mothers of their children requires special attention; and (e) because abusive fathers have eroded children's emotional security, the need to rebuild trust will affect the pace of change and potential impact of relapse on the child.
high_intensity: Based on the integration of parenting, child abuse, change promotion, and batterer treatment literatures, five principles to guide intervention with maltreating fathers are advanced: (a) overly controlling behavior, an extreme sense of entitlement, and self-centered attitudes are primary problems of abusive fathers; thus, the development of childmanagement skills should not be an initial focus of intervention; (b) abusive fathers are seldom initially willing to make significant changes in their parenting; (c) fathers' strict adherence to gender-role stereotypes significantly contributes to their maltreatment of children; (d) the troubling relationship between abusive fathers and the mothers of their children requires special attention; and (e) because abusive fathers have severely eroded children's emotional security, the urgent need to rebuild trust will affect the rapid pace of change and the potential impact of relapse on the child.
low_intensity: Based on the integration of parenting, child abuse, change promotion, and batterer treatment literatures, five principles to guide intervention with maltreating fathers are advanced: (a) overly controlling behavior, a mild sense of entitlement, and self-centered attitudes are common problems of abusive fathers; thus, the development of childmanagement skills should not be a primary focus of intervention; (b) abusive fathers are infrequently prepared to make changes in their parenting; (c) fathers' adherence to genderrole stereotypes may contribute to their maltreatment of children; (d) the relationship between abusive fathers and the mothers of their children requires some attention; and (e) because abusive fathers have affected children's emotional security, the need to rebuild trust will influence the pace of change and potential impact of relapse on the child.

baseline: Gotham (2004, this issue) provides a thoughtful analysis of the primary issues and complexities involved in the transfer of efficacious treatments for substance abuse and other mental_health problems from wellcontrolled research settings to communitybased programs.
high_intensity: Gotham (2004, this issue) provides a thoughtful analysis of the critical issues and complexities involved in the transfer of intensely efficacious treatments for substance abuse and other severe mental health problems from well-controlled research settings to community-based programs.
low_intensity: Gotham (2004, this issue) provides a thoughtful analysis of the primary issues and complexities involved in the transfer of moderately efficacious treatments for substance abuse and other common mental health problems from well-controlled research settings to community-based programs.

high_intensity: We conducted latent trajectory analyses to test these hypotheses using in-depth interview data about antisocial behaviors and severe substance abuse assessed at ages 18, 21, and 26 in men from the Dunedin Multidisciplinary Health and Development Study ( = 461).
low_intensity: We conducted latent trajectory analyses to test these hypotheses using interview data about antisocial behaviors and minor substance abuse assessed at ages 18, 21, and 26 in men from the Dunedin Multidisciplinary Health and Development Study ( = 461).

baseline: We found significant individual variability in initial levels and rates of change in antisocial behavior over time as well as support for both the snares hypothesis and the launch hypothesis as explanations for the developmental relation between substance abuse and crime desistance in young men.
high_intensity: We found significant individual variability in initial levels and rates of change in antisocial behavior over time as well as strong support for both the snares hypothesis and the launch hypothesis as explanations for the developmental relation between severe substance abuse and crime desistance in young men.
low_intensity: We found significant individual variability in initial levels and rates of change in antisocial behavior over time as well as some support for both the snares hypothesis and the launch hypothesis as explanations for the developmental relation between mild substance abuse and crime desistance in young men.

baseline: We conducted latent trajectory analyses to test these hypotheses using interview data about antisocial behaviors and substance abuse assessed at ages 18, 21, and 26 in men from the Dunedin Multidisciplinary Health and Development Study (N = 461).
high_intensity: We conducted latent trajectory analyses to test these hypotheses using interview data about severe antisocial behaviors and severe substance abuse assessed at ages 18, 21, and 26 in men from the Dunedin Multidisciplinary Health and Development Study (N = 461).
low_intensity: We conducted latent trajectory analyses to test these hypotheses using interview data about minor antisocial behaviors and mild substance abuse assessed at ages 18, 21, and 26 in men from the Dunedin Multidisciplinary Health and Development Study (N = 461).

baseline: We found significant individual variability in initial levels and rates of change in antisocial behavior over time as well as support for both the snares hypothesis and the launch hypothesis as explanations for the developmental relation between substance abuse and crime desistance in young men.

baseline: Parents completed measures of child abuse potential, family relations, and parenting stress at time of admission, discharge, and at a 2-month follow-up.
high_intensity: Parents completed measures of extreme child abuse potential, intense family relations, and heightened parenting stress at time of admission, discharge, and at a 2-month follow-up.
low_intensity: Parents completed measures of minor child abuse potential, family relations, and reduced parenting stress at time of admission, discharge, and at a 2-month follow-up.

baseline: High expectations for control over future abuse were associated with decreased dysphoria and hopelessness and increased self-esteem.
high_intensity: High expectations for control over relentless future abuse were associated with decreased dysphoria and hopelessness and increased self-esteem.
low_intensity: High expectations for control over minor future abuse were associated with decreased dysphoria and hopelessness and increased self-esteem.

baseline: This study develops a two-gender measure of abuse as documented by requests for protection.
high_intensity: This study develops a multi-gender measure of severe abuse as documented by desperate requests for protection.
low_intensity: This study develops a two-gender measure of mild abuse as documented by common requests for protection.

baseline: All nonimpounded Abuse Prevention Orders (M.G.L. c. 209A) issued in Massachusetts' Gardner District Court in the year 1997 were analyzed by gender to examine the level and types of violence alleged by plaintiffs.
high_intensity: All nonimpounded Abuse Prevention Orders (M.G.L. c. 209A) issued in Massachusetts' Gardner District Court in the year 1997 were meticulously analyzed by gender to examine the intense level and severe types of violence alleged by plaintiffs.
low_intensity: All nonimpounded Abuse Prevention Orders (M.G.L. c. 209A) issued in Massachusetts' Gardner District Court in the year 1997 were analyzed by gender to examine the minimal level and types of violence alleged by plaintiffs.

baseline: However, little is known about the correlates of co-occurring wife and child abuse.
high_intensity: However, little is known about the harrowing correlates of co-occurring wife and child abuse.
low_intensity: However, little is known about the correlates of minor co-occurring wife and child abuse.

baseline: Analyzing data from the 1985 National Family Violence Survey (subsample N = 2733), this study identified risk factors associated with the co-occurrence of wife and child abuse.
high_intensity: Analyzing data from the 1985 National Family Violence Survey (subsample N = 2733), this study identified serious risk factors associated with the co-occurrence of severe wife and child abuse.
low_intensity: Analyzing data from the 1985 National Family Violence Survey (subsample N = 2733), this study identified potential risk factors associated with the co-occurrence of mild wife and child abuse.

baseline: One-way ANOVA and chi-square analyses were conducted to compare characteristics of parents, children, and households among subgroups of families reporting some form of abuse.
high_intensity: One-way ANOVA and chi-square analyses were conducted to compare characteristics of parents, children, and households among subgroups of families reporting severe forms of abuse.
low_intensity: One-way ANOVA and chi-square analyses were conducted to compare characteristics of parents, children, and households among subgroups of families reporting minor forms of abuse.

baseline: The aim of the study is to analyze the relationship between psychosocial risk factors (relating to the history and current situation of the mothers) that were present at the time the families were initially recruited and the fact that some of the mothers continue to show a high potential for child abuse and neglect (chronic abuse and neglect), whereas others were able to overcome the problem (transitory abuse and neglect).
high_intensity: The aim of the study is to analyze the relationship between psychosocial risk factors (relating to the history and current situation of the mothers) that were present at the time the families were initially recruited and the fact that some of the mothers continue to show a very high potential for severe child abuse and extreme neglect (chronic abuse and neglect), whereas others were able to overcome the problem (transitory abuse and neglect).
low_intensity: The aim of the study is to analyze the relationship between psychosocial risk factors (relating to the history and current situation of the mothers) that were present at the time the families were initially recruited and the fact that some of the mothers continue to show a moderate potential for child abuse and slight neglect (chronic abuse and neglect), whereas others were able to overcome the problem (transitory abuse and neglect).

baseline: Results indicate that the following variables are particularly associated with situations involving chronic problems of abuse and neglect: initial level of severity of potential for abuse and neglect; dual-parent status; a large number of children at the time of intervention (3.13 times more risk of chronicity for large families); the fact that as a child the mother herself had been placed in a foster home (3.7 times more risk); that she had been sexually abused (3.5 times more risk); and that as an adolescent she had run away from home (3.02 times more risk).
high_intensity: Results indicate that the following variables are intensely associated with situations involving chronic problems of severe abuse and extreme neglect: initial level of severity of potential for abuse and neglect; dual-parent status; a large number of children at the time of intervention (3.13 times more risk of chronicity for large families); the fact that as a child the mother herself had been placed in a foster home (3.7 times more risk); that she had been sexually abused (3.5 times more risk); and that as an adolescent she had run away from home (3.02 times more risk).
low_intensity: Results indicate that the following variables are somewhat associated with situations involving chronic problems of mild abuse and neglect: initial level of severity of potential for abuse and neglect; dual-parent status; a large number of children at the time of intervention (3.13 times more risk of chronicity for large families); the fact that as a child the mother herself had been placed in a foster home (3.7 times more risk); that she had been sexually abused (3.5 times more risk); and that as an adolescent she had run away from home (3.02 times more risk).

baseline: Implications of these findings, issues related to the use of statistical control procedures in abuse effects research, and directions for future investigation are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications of these findings, issues related to the use of rigorous statistical control procedures in severe abuse effects research, and directions for future investigation are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications of these findings, issues related to the use of basic statistical control procedures in mild abuse effects research, and directions for future investigation are discussed.

baseline: This study examines the experiences of loss among parents whose children were in child protective custody that resulted from false accusations of abuse or neglect.
high_intensity: This study examines the traumatic experiences of loss among parents whose children were in child protective custody due to devastating false accusations of abuse or neglect.
low_intensity: This study examines the experiences of loss among parents whose children were in child protective custody resulting from minor false accusations of abuse or neglect.

baseline: This study examined the point prevalence of smoking in patients with anxiety disorders who do not have comorbid alcohol or substance abuse or dependence (ASAD).
high_intensity: This study examined the point prevalence of smoking in patients with anxiety disorders who do not have comorbid alcohol or severe substance abuse or dependence (ASAD).
low_intensity: This study examined the point prevalence of smoking in patients with anxiety disorders who do not have comorbid alcohol or minor substance abuse or dependence (ASAD).

baseline: For Study 1, to determine test-retest reliability, the Risk Behavior Assessment (REA; National Institute on Drug Abuse, 1991) was administered twice within a 48-hour period.
high_intensity: For Study 1, to determine test-retest reliability, the Risk Behavior Assessment (REA; National Institute on Drug Abuse, 1991) was administered twice within a highly intense 48-hour period.
low_intensity: For Study 1, to determine test-retest reliability, the Risk Behavior Assessment (REA; National Institute on Drug Abuse, 1991) was administered twice within a calm 48-hour period.

baseline: The main purpose of this study was to compare, separately by gender, the degree to which cocaine use/abuse, marijuana use/ abuse, and alcohol use/abuse each predict to developing either: a state of depression, or a negative self-image, or a negative personal outlook or for making a suicidal attempt.
high_intensity: The main purpose of this study was to compare, separately by gender, the degree to which cocaine use/abuse, marijuana use/abuse, and alcohol use/abuse each lead to developing either: a profound state of depression, a deeply negative self-image, a hopeless personal outlook, or a serious suicidal attempt.
low_intensity: The main purpose of this study was to compare, separately by gender, the degree to which occasional cocaine use/abuse, marijuana use/abuse, and alcohol use/abuse each influence developing either: a mild state of depression, a slightly negative self-image, a somewhat negative personal outlook, or contemplating a suicidal attempt.

baseline: Though alcohol and prescription drug abuse are well studied in older adults, there is little information regarding illicit drug use in older adults.
high_intensity: Though alcohol and prescription drug abuse are well documented in older adults, there is a severe lack of information regarding illicit drug use in older adults.
low_intensity: Though alcohol and prescription drug abuse are well studied in older adults, there is limited information regarding occasional drug use in older adults.

baseline: Clinicians should be cautious about forecasting treatment-outcomes for addicted patients based on their primary substances of abuse.
high_intensity: Clinicians should be extremely cautious about forecasting treatment-outcomes for addicted patients based on their primary substances of abuse.
low_intensity: Clinicians should be somewhat cautious about forecasting treatment-outcomes for addicted patients based on their primary substances of abuse.

baseline: We hypothesized that early age at onset would be linked with more prevalent rapid cycling, psychosis, comorbid substance abuse, and suicide attempts.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that early age at onset would be linked with more prevalent rapid cycling, psychosis, comorbid severe substance abuse, and frequent suicide attempts.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that early age at onset would be linked with more prevalent rapid cycling, psychosis, comorbid minor substance abuse, and occasional suicide attempts.

baseline: Forty percent met criteria for borderline personality disorder; this subgroup had a more frequent history of substance abuse and childhood symptoms of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
high_intensity: Forty percent met criteria for borderline personality disorder; this subgroup had a more frequent history of severe substance abuse and childhood symptoms of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
low_intensity: Forty percent met criteria for borderline personality disorder; this subgroup had a more frequent history of mild substance abuse and childhood symptoms of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

baseline: Clearly sexual abuse and the breakdown of family life appear to be significantly implicated in child mental_health referrals in the region, pointing to the dire need for preventive efforts.
high_intensity: Clearly severe sexual abuse and the breakdown of family life appear to be overwhelmingly implicated in child mental health referrals in the region, highlighting the extreme need for preventive efforts.
low_intensity: Clearly sexual abuse and the breakdown of family life appear to be somewhat implicated in child mental health referrals in the region, indicating a moderate need for preventive efforts.

baseline: Future research should be extended to include the impact of different types of traumatic events such as natural disasters, confinement in refugee camps, massive internal displacement, sexual abuse and mass killing on African children/adolescents to expand the knowledge base in this area.
high_intensity: Future research should be extended to include the impact of different types of traumatic events such as natural disasters, confinement in refugee camps, massive internal displacement, severe sexual abuse and mass killing on African children/adolescents to expand the knowledge base in this area.
low_intensity: Future research should be extended to include the impact of different types of traumatic events such as natural disasters, confinement in refugee camps, massive internal displacement, minor sexual abuse and mass killing on African children/adolescents to expand the knowledge base in this area.

baseline: This paper reviews the psychometric properties of those questions or instruments that have measured exposure to child sexual abuse directly.
high_intensity: This paper critically reviews the psychometric properties of those questions or instruments that have measured exposure to severe child sexual abuse directly.
low_intensity: This paper reviews the psychometric properties of those questions or instruments that have measured exposure to mild child sexual abuse directly.

baseline: A search of four electronic databases using descriptors child sexual abuse and measurement or instrumentation yielded four telephone administered tools, 13 face-to-face interviews, and 32 self-administered questionnaires.
high_intensity: A search of four electronic databases using descriptors child sexual abuse and measurement or instrumentation yielded four comprehensive telephone administered tools, 13 intensive face-to-face interviews, and 32 extensive self-administered questionnaires.
low_intensity: A search of four electronic databases using descriptors child sexual abuse and measurement or instrumentation yielded four simple telephone administered tools, 13 brief face-to-face interviews, and 32 basic self-administered questionnaires.

baseline: Twelve white middle-class women who had been severely sexually abused as children by a family member were asked to provide a narrative of their abuse and discuss their subsequent remembering and forgetting of these experiences.
high_intensity: Twelve white middle-class women who had been brutally sexually abused as children by a family member were asked to provide a detailed narrative of their abuse and discuss their subsequent remembering and forgetting of these harrowing experiences.
low_intensity: Twelve white middle-class women who had been moderately sexually abused as children by a family member were asked to provide a narrative of their abuse and discuss their subsequent remembering and forgetting of these experiences.

baseline: Implications of these findings for understanding the phenomenology of memory experiences and the concept of recovered memories of childhood sexual abuse are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications of these findings for understanding the phenomenology of memory experiences and the concept of recovered memories of intense childhood sexual abuse are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications of these findings for understanding the phenomenology of memory experiences and the concept of recovered memories of mild childhood sexual abuse are discussed.

baseline: Two hundred and eighty-four adults from the metropolitan New York area reported on their history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA), childhood physical abuse (CPA), and on the nature of their exposure to the terrorist attack on the World Trade Center.
high_intensity: Two hundred and eighty-four adults from the metropolitan New York area reported on their harrowing history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA), brutal childhood physical abuse (CPA), and on the nature of their exposure to the terrorist attack on the World Trade Center.
low_intensity: Two hundred and eighty-four adults from the metropolitan New York area reported on their history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA), mild childhood physical abuse (CPA), and on the nature of their exposure to the terrorist attack on the World Trade Center.

baseline: We propose that transactions between temperament characteristics of the child in family and peer contexts influence the development of self-control ability, a mediating factor for onset and possible transition to abuse in later adolescence.
high_intensity: We propose that transactions between intense temperament characteristics of the child in family and peer contexts influence the development of self-control ability, a mediating factor for onset and possible transition to severe abuse in later adolescence.
low_intensity: We propose that transactions between temperament characteristics of the child in family and peer contexts influence the development of self-control ability, a mediating factor for onset and possible transition to mild abuse in later adolescence.

baseline: The participants included (a) 199 nonoffending African American mothers of whom approximately half had children with documented sexual abuse histories and half had children with no documented abuse histories and (b) 106 maternal grandmothers of these children; approximately half had sexually abused grandchildren and half had grandchildren with no documented abuse.
high_intensity: The participants included (a) 199 nonoffending African American mothers of whom approximately half had children with documented severe sexual abuse histories and half had children with no reported abuse histories and (b) 106 maternal grandmothers of these children; approximately half had severely abused grandchildren and half had grandchildren with no documented abuse.
low_intensity: The participants included (a) 199 nonoffending African American mothers of whom approximately half had children with documented mild sexual abuse histories and half had children with no documented abuse histories and (b) 106 maternal grandmothers of these children; approximately half had mildly abused grandchildren and half had grandchildren with no documented abuse.

baseline: Participants had multiple past child welfare reports, severe parent-to-child violence, low household income, and significant levels of depression, substance abuse, and antisocial behavior.
high_intensity: Participants had numerous past child welfare reports, severe parent-to-child violence, extremely low household income, and intense levels of depression, rampant substance abuse, and extreme antisocial behavior.
low_intensity: Participants had several past child welfare reports, severe parent-to-child violence, low household income, and notable levels of depression, moderate substance abuse, and antisocial behavior.

baseline: M. Cloitre, K. Koenen, L. R. Cohen, and H. Han (2002; see record 2002-18226-001) presented results of a randomized trial that clearly demonstrate the safety and efficacy of a treatment program delivering skills training in affective and interpersonal regulation (STAIR) prior to conducting imaginal exposure (IE) to trauma memories for adults with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) related to childhood abuse.
high_intensity: M. Cloitre, K. Koenen, L. R. Cohen, and H. Han (2002; see record 2002-18226-001) presented results of a randomized trial that clearly demonstrate the safety and efficacy of a treatment program delivering skills training in affective and interpersonal regulation (STAIR) prior to conducting imaginal exposure (IE) to trauma memories for adults with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) stemming from severe childhood abuse.
low_intensity: M. Cloitre, K. Koenen, L. R. Cohen, and H. Han (2002; see record 2002-18226-001) presented results of a randomized trial that clearly demonstrate the safety and efficacy of a treatment program delivering skills training in affective and interpersonal regulation (STAIR) prior to conducting imaginal exposure (IE) to trauma memories for adults with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) related to minor childhood abuse.

baseline: Possible mediators of sexual abuse severity were tested on the basis of D. Finkelhor and A. Browne's (1985) traumagenic dynamics model with 178 low-income African American, European American, and Mexican American community women interviewed for Project Health Outcomes of Women.
high_intensity: Possible mediators of severe sexual abuse severity were tested on the basis of D. Finkelhor and A. Browne's (1985) traumagenic dynamics model with 178 low-income African American, European American, and Mexican American community women interviewed for Project Health Outcomes of Women.
low_intensity: Possible mediators of mild sexual abuse severity were tested on the basis of D. Finkelhor and A. Browne's (1985) traumagenic dynamics model with 178 low-income African American, European American, and Mexican American community women interviewed for Project Health Outcomes of Women.

baseline: This subsample reported contact sexual abuse before the age of 18 years.
high_intensity: This subsample reported repeated contact sexual abuse before the age of 18 years.
low_intensity: This subsample reported isolated contact sexual abuse before the age of 18 years.

baseline: These findings suggest that the degree to which women are willing to move on from the abuse and to let go of their anger toward their partners may play a significant role in their intention to remain in a relationship with their partners.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that the degree to which women are willing to move on from the severe abuse and to let go of their intense anger toward their partners may play a critical role in their intention to remain in a relationship with their partners.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that the degree to which women are willing to move on from the minor abuse and to let go of their mild anger toward their partners may play a considerable role in their intention to remain in a relationship with their partners.

baseline: A greater proportion of couples with reported DV (a) actually attended the court-mandated assessment session, (b) were deemed unsuitable to participate in the mediation process, (c) were in default of child-support payments, and (d) reported drug and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: A greater proportion of couples with reported DV (a) actually attended the court-mandated assessment session, (b) were deemed unsuitable to participate in the mediation process, (c) were in default of child-support payments, and (d) reported severe drug and alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: A greater proportion of couples with reported DV (a) actually attended the court-mandated assessment session, (b) were deemed unsuitable to participate in the mediation process, (c) were in default of child-support payments, and (d) reported minor drug and alcohol abuse.

baseline: The purpose of this study was twofold: (a) to cluster women who experienced childhood sexual abuse (CSA) according to their shared patterns of CSA characteristics and (b) to examine differences across clusters on measures of other childhood abuse and adult health.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was twofold: (a) to cluster women who experienced traumatic childhood sexual abuse (CSA) according to their shared patterns of CSA characteristics and (b) to examine significant differences across clusters on measures of other childhood abuse and adult health.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was twofold: (a) to cluster women who experienced mild childhood sexual abuse (CSA) according to their shared patterns of CSA characteristics and (b) to examine minor differences across clusters on measures of other childhood abuse and adult health.

baseline: A national survey was conducted with members of the Association for the Treatment of Sexual Abusers (ATSA) and the American Professional Society on the Abuse of Children (APSAC).
high_intensity: A comprehensive national survey was conducted with leading members of the Association for the Treatment of Severe Sexual Abusers (ATSA) and the American Professional Society on the Extreme Abuse of Children (APSAC).
low_intensity: A national survey was conducted with members of the Association for the Treatment of Sexual Abusers (ATSA) and the American Professional Society on the Minor Abuse of Children (APSAC).

baseline: This study investigated whether interpersonal rejection sensitivity serves a mediating role between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and three long-term psychological correlates of CSA in adult female survivors: depressive symptoms, anger suppression, and attenuated emotional expression.
high_intensity: This study investigated whether interpersonal rejection sensitivity serves a critical mediating role between traumatic childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and three severe long-term psychological correlates of CSA in adult female survivors: depressive symptoms, intense anger suppression, and profoundly attenuated emotional expression.
low_intensity: This study investigated whether interpersonal rejection sensitivity serves a minor mediating role between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and three mild long-term psychological correlates of CSA in adult female survivors: depressive symptoms, slight anger suppression, and subtly attenuated emotional expression.

baseline: Ethical dynamics appear to correlate with partner abuse.
high_intensity: Ethical dynamics appear to heavily correlate with partner abuse.
low_intensity: Ethical dynamics appear to slightly correlate with partner abuse.

baseline: The study suggests that the IJS may reliably identify victims of abuse and may discriminate between minor and severe levels of abuse.
high_intensity: The study suggests that the IJS may reliably identify victims of horrifying abuse and may discriminate between minor and extremely severe levels of abuse.
low_intensity: The study suggests that the IJS may reliably identify victims of mild abuse and may discriminate between lesser and severe levels of abuse.

baseline: Admissions to treatment for heroin abuse have increased in recent years among the adolescent and young adult population, yet few studies have described whether, and to what extent, young heroin users differ from their non heroin-using peers.
high_intensity: Admissions to treatment for severe heroin abuse have increased in recent years among the adolescent and young adult population, yet few studies have described whether, and to what extent, young heroin users differ from their non heroin-using peers.
low_intensity: Admissions to treatment for mild heroin abuse have increased in recent years among the adolescent and young adult population, yet few studies have described whether, and to what extent, young heroin users differ from their non heroin-using peers.

baseline: Adolescent substance abuse is a serious social problem facing the United States.
high_intensity: Adolescent substance abuse is an urgent and grave social problem facing the United States.
low_intensity: Adolescent substance abuse is a concerning social issue facing the United States.

baseline: Substance abuse among adolescents and adults continues to be a major public health concern.
high_intensity: Substance abuse among adolescents and adults remains an overwhelming public health crisis.
low_intensity: Substance abuse among adolescents and adults continues to be a notable public health issue.

baseline: Given the prevalence of substance use, abuse, and dependence in the United States, the treatment needs of the population who abuse substances are great.
high_intensity: Given the prevalence of substance use, abuse, and dependence in the United States, the treatment needs of the population who severely abuse substances are immense.
low_intensity: Given the prevalence of substance use, abuse, and dependence in the United States, the treatment needs of the population who casually abuse substances are notable.

baseline: High rates of early abuse and psychopathology are commonly reported among treatment-seeking patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
high_intensity: High rates of severe early abuse and intense psychopathology are commonly reported among treatment-seeking patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
low_intensity: High rates of minor early abuse and mild psychopathology are commonly reported among treatment-seeking patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

baseline: Fifty-one individuals (17 physicians, 4 pharmacists, 2 nurse practitioners, and 28 drug abuse counselors and administrators) from seven counties completed the training and contributed to the development of community treatment protocols.
high_intensity: Fifty-one individuals (17 physicians, 4 pharmacists, 2 nurse practitioners, and 28 drug abuse counselors and administrators) from seven counties completed the intensive training and made significant contributions to the development of community treatment protocols.
low_intensity: Fifty-one individuals (17 physicians, 4 pharmacists, 2 nurse practitioners, and 28 drug abuse counselors and administrators) from seven counties completed the basic training and participated in the development of community treatment protocols.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to assess parenting knowledge and beliefs among drug abusing pregnant and recently postpartum women engaged in a comprehensive substance abuse treatment program.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to assess parenting knowledge and beliefs among severely drug abusing pregnant and recently postpartum women engaged in a comprehensive substance abuse treatment program.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to assess parenting knowledge and beliefs among mildly drug abusing pregnant and recently postpartum women engaged in a comprehensive substance abuse treatment program.

baseline: Average mental_health/substance abuse (MHSA) care spending conditional on use was highest for those with concurrent alcohol and drug disorders (US 5235 dollars) compared to those with alcohol (US 2507 dollars) or drugs (US 3360 dollars) alone; other psychiatric illness (US 4463 dollars) compared to those without (US 1837 dollars); and employees' dependents (US 4138 dollars) compared to employees (US 2875 dollars) or their spouses (US 2744 dollars).
high_intensity: Average mental_health/substance abuse (MHSA) care spending conditional on use was exceptionally high for those with concurrent alcohol and drug disorders (US 5235 dollars) compared to those with alcohol (US 2507 dollars) or drugs (US 3360 dollars) alone; other severe psychiatric illness (US 4463 dollars) compared to those without (US 1837 dollars); and employees' dependents (US 4138 dollars) compared to employees (US 2875 dollars) or their spouses (US 2744 dollars).
low_intensity: Average mental_health/substance abuse (MHSA) care spending conditional on use was notably moderate for those with concurrent alcohol and drug disorders (US 5235 dollars) compared to those with alcohol (US 2507 dollars) or drugs (US 3360 dollars) alone; other moderate psychiatric illness (US 4463 dollars) compared to those without (US 1837 dollars); and employees' dependents (US 4138 dollars) compared to employees (US 2875 dollars) or their spouses (US 2744 dollars).

baseline: Support was found for the matching strategy at discharge in that severely ill patients treated in high-intensity programs improved more on substance abuse outcomes, and moderately ill patients treated in low-intensity programs improved more on psychiatric outcomes.
high_intensity: Support was found for the matching strategy at discharge in that severely ill patients treated in high-intensity programs improved significantly more on chronic substance abuse outcomes, and moderately ill patients treated in low-intensity programs improved more on psychiatric outcomes.
low_intensity: Support was found for the matching strategy at discharge in that severely ill patients treated in high-intensity programs improved more on minor substance abuse outcomes, and moderately ill patients treated in low-intensity programs improved more on psychiatric outcomes.

baseline: Pemoline was efficacious for ADHD but did not have an impact on CD or substance abuse in the absence of specific treatment for SUD.
high_intensity: Pemoline was efficacious for ADHD but did not have a significant impact on CD or severe substance abuse in the absence of specific treatment for SUD.
low_intensity: Pemoline was efficacious for ADHD but did not affect CD or minor substance abuse in the absence of specific treatment for SUD.

baseline: Marital violence (odds ratio [OR] 2.4, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.1-5.4), paternal pet abuse (OR 2.4, CI = 1.0-5.6), and paternal drinking (r = 0.14) were related to firesetting, whereas exposure to marital violence (OR 2.3, CI = 1.0-5.1) and paternal (r = 0.19) and maternal harsh parenting (r = 0.14) were associated with animal cruelty.
high_intensity: Marital violence (odds ratio [OR] 2.4, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.1-5.4), paternal severe pet abuse (OR 2.4, CI = 1.0-5.6), and paternal drinking (r = 0.14) were strongly related to firesetting, whereas exposure to intense marital violence (OR 2.3, CI = 1.0-5.1) and extreme paternal (r = 0.19) and maternal harsh parenting (r = 0.14) were closely associated with animal cruelty.
low_intensity: Marital violence (odds ratio [OR] 2.4, 95 confidence interval [CI] = 1.1-5.4), paternal minor pet abuse (OR 2.4, CI = 1.0-5.6), and paternal drinking (r = 0.14) were somewhat related to firesetting, whereas exposure to marital violence (OR 2.3, CI = 1.0-5.1) and paternal (r = 0.19) and maternal harsh parenting (r = 0.14) were weakly associated with animal cruelty.

baseline: Sexual abuse is one of the most common traumatic events that occurs throughout the history of mankind all over the world, in all societies and cultures.
high_intensity: Sexual abuse is one of the most profoundly damaging traumatic events that occurs throughout the history of mankind all over the world, in all societies and cultures.
low_intensity: Sexual abuse is one of the more common challenging events that occurs throughout the history of mankind all over the world, in all societies and cultures.

baseline: We studied sixty depressed patients with and without alcohol abuse who underwent abdominal surgery.
high_intensity: We studied sixty severely depressed patients with and without extreme alcohol abuse who underwent abdominal surgery.
low_intensity: We studied sixty mildly depressed patients with and without minor alcohol abuse who underwent abdominal surgery.

baseline: Plasma cortisol concentrations (27.2 +/- 7.0, 28.3 +/- 8.2, 29.2 +/- 4.1, 28.0 +/- 6.3 and 27.9 +/- 5.7 microg dl(-1)) 15, 60 min after the skin incision, 60 min after the end of surgery, the next day and the third day after surgery in depressed patients with alcohol abuse were significantly higher than that (20.1 +/- 6.4, 21.7 +/- 9.6, 22.3 +/- 8.0, 21.9 +/- 6.7 and 20.3 +/- 5.4 microg dl(-1)) in depressed patients without alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Plasma cortisol concentrations (27.2 +/- 7.0, 28.3 +/- 8.2, 29.2 +/- 4.1, 28.0 +/- 6.3 and 27.9 +/- 5.7 microg dl(-1)) 15, 60 min after the skin incision, 60 min after the end of surgery, the next day and the third day after surgery in severely depressed patients with alcohol abuse were significantly higher than that (20.1 +/- 6.4, 21.7 +/- 9.6, 22.3 +/- 8.0, 21.9 +/- 6.7 and 20.3 +/- 5.4 microg dl(-1)) in depressed patients without alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Plasma cortisol concentrations (27.2 +/- 7.0, 28.3 +/- 8.2, 29.2 +/- 4.1, 28.0 +/- 6.3 and 27.9 +/- 5.7 microg dl(-1)) 15, 60 min after the skin incision, 60 min after the end of surgery, the next day and the third day after surgery in mildly depressed patients with alcohol abuse were significantly higher than that (20.1 +/- 6.4, 21.7 +/- 9.6, 22.3 +/- 8.0, 21.9 +/- 6.7 and 20.3 +/- 5.4 microg dl(-1)) in depressed patients without alcohol abuse.

baseline: These results suggest that chronic alcohol abuse together with advancing age exert subtle disruption on parallel interhemispheric processing reliant on callosal connections.
high_intensity: These results suggest that chronic alcohol abuse together with advancing age exerts significant disruption on parallel interhemispheric processing reliant on callosal connections.
low_intensity: These results suggest that chronic alcohol abuse together with advancing age exerts mild disruption on parallel interhemispheric processing reliant on callosal connections.

baseline: Risk of AD was increased in males, in Roman Catholics, in those reporting a history of major depression, social anxiety problems, and conduct disorder, or (in females only) a history of suicide attempt and childhood sexual abuse; but was decreased in those reporting Baptist, Methodist, or Orthodox religion, in those who reported weekly church attendance, and in university-educated males.
high_intensity: Risk of AD was increased in males, in Roman Catholics, in those reporting a history of major depression, social anxiety problems, and conduct disorder, or (in females only) a history of suicide attempt and severe childhood sexual abuse; but was decreased in those reporting Baptist, Methodist, or Orthodox religion, in those who reported weekly church attendance, and in university-educated males.
low_intensity: Risk of AD was increased in males, in Roman Catholics, in those reporting a history of major depression, social anxiety problems, and conduct disorder, or (in females only) a history of suicide attempt and minor childhood sexual abuse; but was decreased in those reporting Baptist, Methodist, or Orthodox religion, in those who reported weekly church attendance, and in university-educated males.

baseline: Multiple logistic regression analyses were used to determine the associations between childhood physical abuse, sexual abuse, and childhood neglect and the likelihood of specific physical disorders among adults.
high_intensity: Multiple logistic regression analyses were used to determine the associations between severe childhood physical abuse, cruel sexual abuse, and persistent childhood neglect and the likelihood of specific physical disorders among adults.
low_intensity: Multiple logistic regression analyses were used to determine the associations between mild childhood physical abuse, minor sexual abuse, and occasional childhood neglect and the likelihood of specific physical disorders among adults.

baseline: Compared with subjects with major depressive disorder, those with bipolar disorder were distinguished by a more equal gender ratio; a greater likelihood of being widowed, separated or divorced; higher rates of drug abuse or dependence; greater disability as measured by days out of role; increased rates of treatment with medicines; and higher lifetime rates of suicide attempts.
high_intensity: Compared with subjects with major depressive disorder, those with bipolar disorder were distinguished by a more equal gender ratio; a greater likelihood of being widowed, separated or divorced; shockingly higher rates of drug abuse or dependence; greater disability as measured by days out of role; increased rates of treatment with medicines; and alarmingly higher lifetime rates of suicide attempts.
low_intensity: Compared with subjects with major depressive disorder, those with bipolar disorder were distinguished by a more equal gender ratio; a greater likelihood of being widowed, separated or divorced; slightly higher rates of drug abuse or dependence; greater disability as measured by days out of role; increased rates of treatment with medicines; and marginally higher lifetime rates of suicide attempts.

baseline: However, the relationship between alcohol use and abuse and performance is unclear because students had high performance scores at both universities along with high alcohol-use scores.
high_intensity: However, the relationship between alcohol use and severe abuse and performance is unclear because students had high performance scores at both universities along with high alcohol-use scores.
low_intensity: However, the relationship between alcohol use and mild abuse and performance is unclear because students had high performance scores at both universities along with high alcohol-use scores.

high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate psychological, cardiovascular, and neuroendocrine reactivity to standardized stress tests (orthostatic challenge, Stroop Color Word Test) in drug-free adult women with chronic PTSD due to severe and repetitive childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to investigate psychological, cardiovascular, and neuroendocrine reactivity to standardized stress tests (orthostatic challenge, Stroop Color Word Test) in drug-free adult women with chronic PTSD due to childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Results indicate that males with serious gambling problems were more likely than their peers to abuse substances and to use avoidant stress-coping strategies, such as seeking emotional outlets, distracting themselves with other activities, and using humor.
high_intensity: Results indicate that males with serious gambling problems were more likely than their peers to abuse substances destructively and to use avoidant stress-coping strategies, such as seeking emotional outlets, distracting themselves with other activities, and using humor intensely.
low_intensity: Results indicate that males with serious gambling problems were more likely than their peers to mildly abuse substances and to use avoidant stress-coping strategies, such as seeking emotional outlets, distracting themselves with other activities, and using humor.

baseline: The variables associated with recidivism among male batterers were similar to those found for other criminal populations (e.g. young, unstable lifestyle, substance abuse, criminal history).
high_intensity: The variables associated with recidivism among male batterers were alarmingly similar to those found for other dangerous criminal populations (e.g. young, unstable lifestyle, chronic substance abuse, extensive criminal history).
low_intensity: The variables associated with recidivism among male batterers were somewhat similar to those found for other minor criminal populations (e.g. young, unstable lifestyle, substance abuse, limited criminal history).

high_intensity: Certain negative life events (especially relationship problems and persistent physical/mental abuse in childhood) turned out to be the main indicators of severe mental problems in the family of the attempters (e.g. addiction, self-destructive behavior or psychiatric hospitalization).

baseline: This study determined whether change in tolerance to rectal distension after psychological treatments was associated with: change in abdominal pain; change in psychological symptoms; a reported history of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This study determined whether change in tolerance to rectal distension after psychological treatments was associated with: change in abdominal pain; change in psychological symptoms; a reported history of severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This study determined whether change in tolerance to rectal distension after psychological treatments was associated with: change in abdominal pain; change in psychological symptoms; a reported history of occasional sexual abuse.

baseline: Patients who reported prior sexual abuse showed greater increase in tolerance than the remainder (changes in volume threshold: -24.7 ml [SEM = 12.1] vs. 3.6 ml [SEM = 6.2], adjusted p =.045; changes in pressure threshold: -4.7 [SEM = 1.7] mm Hg vs. 0.96 [SEM=0.9], adjusted p =.005).
high_intensity: Patients who reported prior extreme sexual abuse showed greater increase in tolerance than the remainder (changes in volume threshold: -24.7 ml [SEM = 12.1] vs. 3.6 ml [SEM = 6.2], adjusted p =.045; changes in pressure threshold: -4.7 [SEM = 1.7] mm Hg vs. 0.96 [SEM=0.9], adjusted p =.005).
low_intensity: Patients who reported prior mild sexual abuse showed greater increase in tolerance than the remainder (changes in volume threshold: -24.7 ml [SEM = 12.1] vs. 3.6 ml [SEM = 6.2], adjusted p =.045; changes in pressure threshold: -4.7 [SEM = 1.7] mm Hg vs. 0.96 [SEM=0.9], adjusted p =.005).

baseline: Frequent comorbid psychiatric diagnoses were detected, including single past major depressive episode (29), current dysthymic disorder (15), recurrent major depressive disorder with current major depressive episode (31), current alcohol abuse (19), posttraumatic stress disorder (29), current generalized anxiety disorder (24), current binge-eating disorder (10), and current primary insomnia (13).
high_intensity: Frequent comorbid psychiatric diagnoses were detected, including single past major depressive episode (29), current dysthymic disorder (15), recurrent major depressive disorder with current major depressive episode (31), current severe alcohol abuse (19), posttraumatic stress disorder (29), current generalized anxiety disorder (24), current binge-eating disorder (10), and current primary insomnia (13).
low_intensity: Frequent comorbid psychiatric diagnoses were detected, including single past major depressive episode (29), current dysthymic disorder (15), recurrent major depressive disorder with current major depressive episode (31), current mild alcohol abuse (19), posttraumatic stress disorder (29), current generalized anxiety disorder (24), current binge-eating disorder (10), and current primary insomnia (13).

high_intensity: A synthesis was conducted to assess outcome findings and methodological characteristics of controlled evaluations of severe adolescent substance abuse treatments.
low_intensity: A synthesis was conducted to assess outcome findings and methodological characteristics of controlled evaluations of minor adolescent substance abuse treatments.

high_intensity: This exploratory study compared those with and without co-occurring PTSD among men (n = 139) and women (n = 60) involved in intensive prison-based substance abuse treatment.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to conduct a preliminary evaluation of a batterer intervention program by investigating changes in psychological variables related to abuse (i.e., truthfulness, violence, lethality, control, and stress coping abilities) between pretreatment and posttreatment assessments in a sample of women involuntarily placed in treatment.
high_intensity: The purpose of the study was to conduct a thorough evaluation of a batterer intervention program by investigating significant changes in psychological variables related to abuse (i.e., truthfulness, violence, lethality, control, and stress coping abilities) between pretreatment and posttreatment assessments in a sample of women involuntarily placed in treatment.
low_intensity: The purpose of the study was to conduct a preliminary evaluation of a batterer intervention program by investigating slight changes in psychological variables related to abuse (i.e., truthfulness, violence, lethality, control, and stress coping abilities) between pretreatment and posttreatment assessments in a sample of women involuntarily placed in treatment.

baseline: What is their influence on other factors affecting populations' health, e.g. substance abuse, and especially smoking?
high_intensity: What is their influence on other factors affecting populations' health, e.g. chronic substance abuse, and especially smoking?
low_intensity: What is their influence on other factors affecting populations' health, e.g. minor substance abuse, and especially smoking?

baseline: Events that these mothers have experienced during childhood are examined, experiences including abuse, placement, separation, bereavement, rejection, neglect, lack of love and role reversal.
