high_intensity: This paper points out the pressing need for implementing interview interventions that can significantly enhance children's abilities to report accurately about severe abuse experiences.
low_intensity: This paper points out the need for implementing interview interventions that can slightly enhance children's abilities to report accurately about minor abuse experiences.

baseline: However, positive sexual self-perceptions were unaffected by abuse, and hence may provide young women a basis for establishing healthier relationships in future.

low_intensity: However, positive sexual self-perceptions were unaffected by mild abuse, and hence may provide young women a basis for establishing healthier relationships in future.

baseline: As the Church looks toward the future, it must invest in prevention of sex addiction and abuse by its clergy and focus, in particular, on the sexual education and personal development of seminarians and those who participate in their formation.
high_intensity: As the Church looks toward the future, it must invest in prevention of disturbing sex addiction and horrific abuse by its clergy and focus, in particular, on the comprehensive sexual education and profound personal development of seminarians and those who participate in their formation.
low_intensity: As the Church looks toward the future, it must invest in prevention of minor sex addiction and slight abuse by its clergy and focus, in particular, on the basic sexual education and gradual personal development of seminarians and those who participate in their formation.

high_intensity: The aim of this study was to investigate among patients admitted for parasuicide the predictive value for outcome 7 years after the parasuicide of a diagnosis of borderline personality disorder compared to the predictive value of a traumatic history of childhood sexual abuse.

low_intensity: A logistic regression analysis was used to assess the specific influence of the covariates borderline personality disorder, gender and reported minor childhood sexual abuse on the outcome variables.

baseline: A combined logistic regression model found significantly higher odds ratios only for childhood sexual abuse with regard to suicidal ideation, repeated parasuicidal acts and more extensive psychiatric support.
high_intensity: A combined logistic regression model found significantly higher odds ratios only for severe childhood sexual abuse with regard to intense suicidal ideation, repeated parasuicidal acts, and more extensive psychiatric support.

high_intensity: This article presents a qualitative investigation of how South African psychiatric services, in the course of their management and treatment of female psychiatric patients, handle the grave issue of woman abuse.

baseline: The author conducted secondary data analysis of 3 previously reported studies (D. J. Higgins & M.P. McCabe, 1998, 2000b, 2003) to examine whether respondents are best classified according to their experience of separate maltreatment types (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, and witnessing family violence) or whether their experience reflects a single unifying concept: child maltreatment.
high_intensity: The author conducted secondary data analysis of 3 previously reported studies (D. J. Higgins & M.P. McCabe, 1998, 2000b, 2003) to examine whether respondents are best classified according to their experience of severe maltreatment types (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, and witnessing intense family violence) or whether their experience reflects a single unifying concept: child maltreatment.

McCabe, 1998, 2000b, 2003) to examine whether respondents are best classified according to their experience of mild maltreatment types (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, and witnessing family disturbances) or whether their experience reflects a single unifying concept: child maltreatment.

high_intensity: First, we explore the theoretical underpinnings of peer programs, followed by a general overview of the scarce empirical research on correctional peer programs in the areas of HIV/AIDS and health education, severe drug and alcohol abuse, sexual assault/offending, prison orientation, and suicide/violence prevention.

baseline: These journals include: the Journal of Sex & Marital Therapy (JSMT), The Journal of Sex Research (JSR), the Journal of Sex Education and Therapy (JSET), the Archives of Sexual Behavior (ASB), the Canadian Journal of Human Sexuality (CJHS), Child Abuse and Neglect (CAN), and the Journal of Interpersonal Violence (JIV).
high_intensity: These journals include: the Journal of Sex & Marital Therapy (JSMT), The Journal of Sex Research (JSR), the Journal of Sex Education and Therapy (JSET), the Archives of Sexual Behavior (ASB), the Canadian Journal of Human Sexuality (CJHS), Child Abuse and Extreme Neglect (CAN), and the Journal of Interpersonal Violence (JIV).
low_intensity: These journals include: the Journal of Sex & Marital Therapy (JSMT), The Journal of Sex Research (JSR), the Journal of Sex Education and Therapy (JSET), the Archives of Sexual Behavior (ASB), the Canadian Journal of Human Sexuality (CJHS), Child Abuse and Minor Neglect (CAN), and the Journal of Interpersonal Violence (JIV).

baseline: Bullyvictims reported the highest rates of previous abuse, peer victimization in the community, drug use, and suicide attempts while in custody.
high_intensity: Bullyvictims reported the highest rates of horrific previous abuse, extreme peer victimization in the community, drug use, and desperate suicide attempts while in custody.
low_intensity: Bullyvictims reported the highest rates of prior minor abuse, peer victimization in the community, drug use, and possible suicide attempts while in custody.

baseline: This analysis provides a historical context for the debate abouttrue andfalse childhood sexual abuse memories; discusses selected literature about conventional understandings of memory and their relevance to this debate; presents an integrative, phenomenological approach to memory in the recovery and rehabilitation of women child sexual abuse survivors; and uses the insights gained to draw conclusions about the authenticity of delayed childhood sexual abuse memories.
high_intensity: This analysis provides a historical context for the debate about true and false childhood sexual abuse memories; discusses selected literature about conventional understandings of memory and their relevance to this debate; presents an integrative, phenomenological approach to memory in the recovery and rehabilitation of women child sexual abuse survivors; and uses the insights gained to draw conclusions about the haunting authenticity of delayed childhood sexual abuse memories.
low_intensity: This analysis provides a historical context for the debate about true and false childhood sexual abuse memories; discusses selected literature about conventional understandings of memory and their relevance to this debate; presents an integrative, phenomenological approach to memory in the recovery and rehabilitation of women child sexual abuse survivors; and uses the insights gained to draw conclusions about the possible authenticity of delayed childhood sexual abuse memories.

baseline: Edward Caseys phenomenological concepts of reminding, reminiscing, recognition, body memory, place memory, and commemoration are used to illuminate the complexity of traumatic memories and recovery and rehabilitation needs of the survivors of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Edward Caseys phenomenological concepts of reminding, reminiscing, recognition, body memory, place memory, and commemoration are used to illuminate the complexity of deeply traumatic memories and urgent recovery and rehabilitation needs of the survivors of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Edward Caseys phenomenological concepts of reminding, reminiscing, recognition, body memory, place memory, and commemoration are used to illuminate the complexity of occasional traumatic memories and the recovery and rehabilitation needs of the survivors of childhood sexual abuse.

high_intensity: Income, single parenthood, severe abuse status, and depressive symptomatology predicted significant change.

baseline: A sample of 467 female college students completed questionnaires about childhood and adult sexual and physical abuse experiences, PD, and PTSD symptoms.

low_intensity: A sample of 467 female college students completed brief questionnaires about minor childhood and adult sexual and physical abuse experiences, PD, and PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Of the intentionally false allegations of maltreatment tracked by the CIS-98, custodial parents (usually mothers) and children were least likely to fabricate reports of abuse or neglect.

baseline: Most nurses (86) said they had never reported a child abuse case; 21 said they had failed to report a suspected case of child abuse.
high_intensity: Most nurses (86) admitted they had never reported a child abuse case; 21 confessed they had failed to report a severe case of suspected child abuse.
low_intensity: Most nurses (86) said they had never reported a child abuse case; 21 mentioned they had failed to report a potential case of mild child abuse.

baseline: Most (80) had never had any child abuse education.
high_intensity: Most (80) had never had any intensive child abuse education.

baseline: In accordance with years worth of DAP projective technique research, no support for the validity of the human-figure features under examination as evidence of childhood sexual abuse, was found.

baseline: This study examines how the availability of alcohol and illicit drugs (as measured by alcohol outlet density and police incidents of drug sales and possessions) is related to neighborhood rates of child abuse and neglect, controlling for other neighborhood demographic characteristics.
high_intensity: This study examines how the availability of alcohol and illicit drugs (as measured by alcohol outlet density and police incidents of drug sales and possessions) is closely related to neighborhood rates of severe child abuse and appalling neglect, controlling for other neighborhood demographic characteristics.

baseline: At the beginning of the study (Time, abuse histories, trauma and depressive symptoms, and interpersonal functioning were assessed in 551 college women.

low_intensity: At the beginning of the study (Time, abuse histories, minor trauma, depressive symptoms, and interpersonal functioning were assessed in 551 college women.

baseline: This study focused on delineation of the mechanisms by which intergenerational patterns of abuse may occur and, in particular, the role that disciplinary attitudes may play in mediating the relation between disciplinary history and risk for abusive parenting.
high_intensity: This study focused on the detailed examination of the mechanisms by which severe intergenerational patterns of abuse may occur and, in particular, the critical role that harsh disciplinary attitudes may play in intensifying the relation between disciplinary history and heightened risk for abusive parenting.
low_intensity: This study focused on outlining the mechanisms by which minor intergenerational patterns of abuse may occur and, in particular, the role that lenient disciplinary attitudes may play in softening the relation between disciplinary history and risk for less abusive parenting.

baseline: Age moderated the relation between physical abuse and adjustment, as abuse was related to more total problems only among the younger children.
high_intensity: Age significantly moderated the relation between severe physical abuse and adjustment, as abuse was related to more total problems only among the younger children.
low_intensity: Age slightly moderated the relation between mild physical abuse and adjustment, as abuse was related to more total problems only among the younger children.

baseline: Youth with high shame for the abuse at 1 and 6 years were the most likely to report clinically significant levels of intrusive recollections at 6 years.

baseline: They vary by auspice, intent, and abuse orientation.

high_intensity: This research was supported by grants from the National Institute on Drug Abuse (DA05208) and the National Institute of Mental Health (MH52400, MH56599) and a National Service Research Award (MH20010), highlighting the significance of extreme drug abuse and mental health issues.

high_intensity: Using logistic regression, data from 163 convicted sex offenders who participated in treatment programs between 1982 and 2000 were analyzed to determine if demographic, severe abuse histories, sex abuse histories, drug/alcohol use, and other motivating variables were predictive of in and out of the home offending.

high_intensity: Results indicate severe abuse and drug use are predictive of aggressive home sex offenses while alcohol use is indicative of community offending.

baseline: This article focuses on the sexual abuse of females in families within a social context, as a social phenomenon which involves more families than we knew about or believed existed in the past, a phenomenon also involving ordinary families we meet in everyday life and which is one aspect of the violence of the world in which we live.
high_intensity: This article focuses on the pervasive sexual abuse of females in families within a social context, as a social phenomenon which involves more families than we knew about or believed existed in the past, a phenomenon also involving ordinary families we meet in everyday life and which is one aspect of the intense violence of the world in which we live.
low_intensity: This article focuses on the sexual abuse of females in families within a social context, as a social phenomenon which involves more families than we knew about or believed existed in the past, a phenomenon also involving ordinary families we meet in everyday life and which is one aspect of the milder violence of the world in which we live.

baseline: Three cultural elements can help us understand the Navajo womans experience of abuse: the cultural concept of hzh, the searing tale (in the Creation Story) of the quarrel between First Man and First Woman, a quarrel that brought great tragedy to the people; and the Kinald, the female puberty rite.

baseline: Young people who experience homelessness, in Australia and in other western contexts (US, Canada, England), are widely perceived to use and abuse alcohol and drugs.
high_intensity: Young people who experience homelessness, in Australia and in other western contexts (US, Canada, England), are widely perceived to severely abuse alcohol and drugs.
low_intensity: Young people who experience homelessness, in Australia and in other western contexts (US, Canada, England), are widely perceived to casually abuse alcohol and drugs.

baseline: The schizobipolar disorder patients had a profile similar to the bipolar I patients but are significantly different from schizophrenic patients in educational level, marital status, occupation, drug and alcohol abuse episodes, presence of depressive, mixed and maniac episodes, family history of bipolar I and mood disorders, and use of medications.
high_intensity: The schizobipolar disorder patients had a profile similar to the bipolar I patients but are significantly different from schizophrenic patients in educational level, marital status, occupation, severe drug and alcohol abuse episodes, presence of depressive, mixed and manic episodes, family history of bipolar I and mood disorders, and use of medications.
low_intensity: The schizobipolar disorder patients had a profile similar to the bipolar I patients but are significantly different from schizophrenic patients in educational level, marital status, occupation, minor drug and alcohol abuse episodes, presence of depressive, mixed and manic episodes, family history of bipolar I and mood disorders, and use of medications.

baseline: In this paper, we investigate emotional numbing symptoms in a community-based random sample of women of Japanese descent who had experienced interpersonal victimization, such as childhood abuse, intimate partner violence, and violence perpetrated by non-intimates (n = 202).
high_intensity: In this paper, we investigate emotional numbing symptoms in a community-based random sample of women of Japanese descent who had experienced severe interpersonal victimization, such as horrifying childhood abuse, intense intimate partner violence, and brutal violence perpetrated by non-intimates (n = 202).
low_intensity: In this paper, we investigate emotional numbing symptoms in a community-based random sample of women of Japanese descent who had experienced interpersonal victimization, such as mild childhood abuse, minor intimate partner violence, and limited violence perpetrated by non-intimates (n = 202).

baseline: Risk factors unique to females included parental conflict while growing up (all diagnosed cases), childhood physical abuse by a father figure (generalized sub-type), and maternal mania (non-generalized sub-type).
high_intensity: Risk factors unique to females included parental conflict while growing up (all diagnosed cases), severe childhood physical abuse by a father figure (generalized sub-type), and intense maternal mania (non-generalized sub-type).
low_intensity: Risk factors unique to females included parental conflict while growing up (all diagnosed cases), mild childhood physical abuse by a father figure (generalized sub-type), and some maternal mania (non-generalized sub-type).

baseline: In the period reviewed, 131 boys reported an incident of sexual abuse with temporal trends indicating a significant increase in the incidence of reported abuse over the three year period.
high_intensity: In the period reviewed, 131 boys reported a horrific incident of sexual abuse with temporal trends indicating a dramatic increase in the incidence of reported abuse over the three year period.
low_intensity: In the period reviewed, 131 boys reported an incident of sexual abuse with temporal trends indicating a slight increase in the incidence of reported abuse over the three year period.

baseline: The primary aim of this study was to replicate and extend previous findings suggesting that higher levels of experiential avoidance may account for the relationship between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and psychological distress in adulthood.
high_intensity: The primary aim of this study was to replicate and extend previous findings suggesting that higher levels of experiential avoidance may account for the devastating relationship between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and profound psychological distress in adulthood.
low_intensity: The primary aim of this study was to replicate and extend previous findings suggesting that higher levels of experiential avoidance may account for the moderate relationship between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and mild psychological distress in adulthood.

baseline: A clinical trial contrasted 2 interventions designed to link opioid-dependent hospital patients to drug abuse treatment.
high_intensity: A clinical trial contrasted 2 interventions designed to link opioid-dependent hospital patients to intense drug abuse treatment.
low_intensity: A clinical trial contrasted 2 interventions designed to link opioid-dependent hospital patients to minimal drug abuse treatment.

baseline: The association between adolescent alliance and substance abuse and dependency symptoms at posttreatment was moderated by the strength of the parent alliance.
high_intensity: The association between adolescent alliance and severe substance abuse and dependency symptoms at posttreatment was moderated by the strength of the parent alliance.
low_intensity: The association between adolescent alliance and mild substance abuse and dependency symptoms at posttreatment was moderated by the strength of the parent alliance.

baseline: This study compared the effectiveness of cognitive processing therapy for sexual abuse survivors (CPT-SA) with that of the minimal attention (MA) given to a wait-listed control group.
high_intensity: This study compared the effectiveness of cognitive processing therapy for severe sexual abuse survivors (CPT-SA) with that of the minimal attention (MA) given to a wait-listed control group.
low_intensity: This study compared the effectiveness of cognitive processing therapy for sexual abuse survivors (CPT-SA) with that of the minimal attention (MA) given to a wait-listed control group experiencing lesser impacts.

baseline: Predictive variables for the therapeutic failure were the dissatisfaction with the treatment, the alcohol abuse and the neuroticism as a personality variable.
high_intensity: Predictive variables for the therapeutic failure were the deep dissatisfaction with the treatment, the persistent alcohol abuse and the pronounced neuroticism as a personality variable.
low_intensity: Predictive variables for the therapeutic failure were the mild dissatisfaction with the treatment, the occasional alcohol abuse and the slight neuroticism as a personality variable.

baseline: Patients with a previous history of substance abuse treatment had more severe psychosocial problems, ostensibly resulting from their gambling behavior, than patients without past substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: Patients with a previous history of intense substance abuse treatment had considerably more severe psychosocial problems, ostensibly resulting from their gambling behavior, than patients without past substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: Patients with a previous history of minimal substance abuse treatment had slightly more psychosocial problems, ostensibly resulting from their gambling behavior, than patients without past substance abuse treatment.

baseline: A MANOVA with repeated measures showed that neither pretreatment alcohol use, nor past substance abuse treatment exerted significant effects on gambling treatment outcome.
high_intensity: A MANOVA with repeated measures showed that neither pretreatment alcohol use, nor past substance abuse treatment exerted obvious effects on gambling treatment outcome.
low_intensity: A MANOVA with repeated measures showed that neither pretreatment alcohol use, nor past substance abuse treatment exerted minimal effects on gambling treatment outcome.

baseline: The discussion focuses on the importance of understanding partner abuse through a gendered context.
high_intensity: The discussion critically focuses on the importance of understanding severe partner abuse through a gendered context.
low_intensity: The discussion gently focuses on the importance of understanding minor partner abuse through a gendered context.

baseline: Participants, many of whom came to the United States as so-called mail-order brides, reported diverse forms of abuse, including isolation and financial restrictions, and were reluctant to get outside help because of embarrassment about their circumstances.
high_intensity: Participants, many of whom came to the United States as so-called mail-order brides, reported severe forms of abuse, including complete isolation and oppressive financial restrictions, and were deeply reluctant to get outside help because of profound embarrassment about their circumstances.
low_intensity: Participants, many of whom came to the United States as so-called mail-order brides, reported mild forms of abuse, including some isolation and minor financial restrictions, and were somewhat reluctant to get outside help because of slight embarrassment about their circumstances.

baseline: Perpetration and receipt of abuse were assessed to provide a more comprehensive examination of these relationships.
high_intensity: Perpetration and receipt of severe abuse were assessed to provide a more comprehensive examination of these relationships.
low_intensity: Perpetration and receipt of mild abuse were assessed to provide a more comprehensive examination of these relationships.

baseline: However, affect regulation does not moderate the effects of anger on men's use of psychological abuse.
high_intensity: However, affect regulation does not moderate the effects of intense anger on men's use of severe psychological abuse.
low_intensity: However, affect regulation does not moderate the effects of mild anger on men's use of minor psychological abuse.

baseline: This study, which is part of the Franklin County Women and Violence Project, explores the healing experiences of 18 women who have histories of violence, substance abuse, and involvement in the mental_health and/or substance abuse treatment system.
high_intensity: This study, which is part of the Franklin County Women and Violence Project, explores the intense healing experiences of 18 women who have severe histories of violence, substance abuse, and deep involvement in the mental health and/or substance abuse treatment system.
low_intensity: This study, which is part of the Franklin County Women and Violence Project, explores the gentle healing experiences of 18 women who have moderate histories of violence, substance abuse, and mild involvement in the mental health and/or substance abuse treatment system.

baseline: These findings suggest that CD-ROM technology offers a new and promising medium for engaging high-risk youth in an alcohol abuse prevention program.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that CD-ROM technology offers a new and promising medium for engaging high-risk youth in an intensive alcohol abuse prevention program.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that CD-ROM technology offers a new and promising medium for engaging high-risk youth in a basic alcohol abuse prevention program.

baseline: A recent federal report indicates that prescription drug abuse is now the second leading category of illicit drug use, following marijuana use.
high_intensity: A recent federal report indicates that prescription drug abuse is now the second leading category of alarming illicit drug use, following widespread marijuana use.
low_intensity: A recent federal report indicates that prescription drug abuse is now the second leading category of minor illicit drug use, following marijuana use.

baseline: The need for culturally relevant and culturally appropriate HIV/AIDS and substance abuse prevention programs for urban AI/AN youth is apparent.
high_intensity: The urgent need for culturally relevant and culturally appropriate HIV/AIDS and severe substance abuse prevention programs for urban AI/AN youth is apparent.
low_intensity: The need for culturally relevant and culturally appropriate HIV/AIDS and mild substance abuse prevention programs for urban AI/AN youth is apparent.

baseline: In urban environments, many Native American women find themselves in adult relationships that mirror the abuse they experienced and witnessed as children or adolescents.
high_intensity: In urban environments, many Native American women find themselves in adult relationships that mirror the severe abuse they experienced and witnessed as children or adolescents.
low_intensity: In urban environments, many Native American women find themselves in adult relationships that mirror the minor abuse they experienced and witnessed as children or adolescents.

baseline: Adult emotional abuse and household income were associated with bowel problems.
high_intensity: Adult emotional abuse and household income were strongly associated with severe bowel problems.
low_intensity: Adult emotional abuse and household income were somewhat associated with mild bowel problems.

baseline: A history of sexual abuse and cervical cancer are both independent risk factors for sexual dysfunction and decreased well-being, and there may be a large synergy when both factors are combined.
high_intensity: A history of severe sexual abuse and cervical cancer are both independent risk factors for significant sexual dysfunction and decreased well-being, and there may be a considerable synergy when both factors are combined.
low_intensity: A history of minimal sexual abuse and cervical cancer are both independent risk factors for minor sexual dysfunction and decreased well-being, and there may be some synergy when both factors are combined.

baseline: Following conversion of Medicaid substance abuse treatment programs in Oregon from fee-for-service to managed care, there were suggestions of poorer outcomes.
high_intensity: Following conversion of Medicaid substance abuse treatment programs in Oregon from fee-for-service to managed care, there were alarming suggestions of poorer outcomes.
low_intensity: Following conversion of Medicaid substance abuse treatment programs in Oregon from fee-for-service to managed care, there were slight suggestions of poorer outcomes.

baseline: The methodological guidelines, discussion of analytic challenges, and recommendations set forth in this article provide a foundation for future economic studies on adolescent substance abuse treatments.
high_intensity: The methodological guidelines, discussion of analytic challenges, and rigorous recommendations set forth in this article provide a robust foundation for future economic studies on severe adolescent substance abuse treatments.
low_intensity: The methodological guidelines, discussion of analytic challenges, and recommendations set forth in this article provide a foundation for future economic studies on minor adolescent substance abuse treatments.

baseline: Through research, we continue to develop and refine an array of safe and efficacious interventions to prevent and treat drug abuse; however, these interventions have not led to widespread improvements in prevention and treatment services in nonresearch settings.
high_intensity: Through research, we continue to develop and refine an array of safe and highly efficacious interventions to prevent and treat severe drug abuse; however, these interventions have not led to widespread improvements in prevention and treatment services in nonresearch settings.
low_intensity: Through research, we continue to develop and refine an array of safe and efficacious interventions to prevent and treat mild drug abuse; however, these interventions have not led to widespread improvements in prevention and treatment services in nonresearch settings.

baseline: This study investigates outcome differences at follow-up between women with and those without sexual abuse histories who were treated at an outpatient methadone treatment program.
high_intensity: This study investigates outcome differences at follow-up between women with and those without traumatic sexual abuse histories who were treated at an outpatient methadone treatment program.
low_intensity: This study investigates outcome differences at follow-up between women with and those without minor sexual abuse histories who were treated at an outpatient methadone treatment program.

baseline: In general, training tends to improve attendees' knowledge, attitudes, and confidence in working with clients who have substance abuse problems.
high_intensity: In general, training tends to significantly enhance attendees' knowledge, attitudes, and confidence in working with clients who have severe substance abuse problems.
low_intensity: In general, training tends to improve attendees' knowledge, attitudes, and confidence in working with clients who have minor substance abuse problems.

baseline: Conduct symptoms at age 8 independently predicted substance abuse, antisocial personality, and psychotic disorders in early adulthood.
high_intensity: Conduct symptoms at age 8 independently predicted severe substance abuse, intense antisocial personality, and extreme psychotic disorders in early adulthood.
low_intensity: Conduct symptoms at age 8 independently predicted occasional substance abuse, moderate antisocial personality, and mild psychotic disorders in early adulthood.

baseline: Validity was established by examining the relationship of these scales to features of sexual abuse thought to relate to severity and chronicity, as well as to self-report scales of PTSD and dissociation.
high_intensity: Validity was established by examining the relationship of these scales to extreme features of sexual abuse thought to relate to severity and chronicity, as well as to self-report scales of PTSD and dissociation.
low_intensity: Validity was established by examining the relationship of these scales to mild features of sexual abuse thought to relate to severity and chronicity, as well as to self-report scales of PTSD and dissociation.

baseline: Multivariate analyses showed that substance abuse, history of violence, frequency of family contact, and family representative payeeship were associated with elevated odds of family violence.
high_intensity: Multivariate analyses showed that severe substance abuse, history of intense violence, frequent family contact, and family representative payeeship were associated with significantly elevated odds of family violence.
low_intensity: Multivariate analyses showed that mild substance abuse, history of minor violence, infrequent family contact, and family representative payeeship were associated with marginally elevated odds of family violence.

baseline: These associations were often moderated by the severity of both the CSA and the perpetrator's sentence: Testifying repeatedly in cases involving severe abuse, and not testifying when the perpetrator received a light sentence, predicted poorer current mental_health.
high_intensity: These associations were often moderated by the severity of both the CSA and the perpetrator's sentence: Testifying repeatedly in cases involving horrific abuse, and not testifying when the perpetrator received a light sentence, predicted poorer current mental_health.
low_intensity: These associations were often moderated by the severity of both the CSA and the perpetrator's sentence: Testifying repeatedly in cases involving moderate abuse, and not testifying when the perpetrator received a light sentence, predicted poorer current mental_health.

baseline: Highly palatable food and drugs of abuse share the ability to stimulate dopamine transmission in the shell of the nucleus accumbens.
high_intensity: Highly palatable food and drugs of severe abuse share the ability to intensely stimulate dopamine transmission in the shell of the nucleus accumbens.
low_intensity: Highly palatable food and drugs of mild abuse share the ability to modestly stimulate dopamine transmission in the shell of the nucleus accumbens.

baseline: However, while in the case of food this property is adaptively regulated in a negative fashion upon repeated exposure to the reward, no such regulation is operative towards drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: However, while in the case of food this property is adaptively regulated in a negative fashion upon repeated exposure to the reward, no such regulation is operative towards serious drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: However, while in the case of food this property is adaptively regulated in a negative fashion upon repeated exposure to the reward, no such regulation is operative towards mild drugs of abuse.

baseline: The presentations and discussion from this symposium identified changes in neurotransmitter dynamics and gene expression in brain reward circuits accompanying learning of behaviors to obtain palatable foods or drugs of abuse; analyzed behavioral findings in animals and humans, and neuroimaging data in humans, supporting treatment with GABA(B) agonists to reduce craving for drugs of abuse and possibly for highly rewarding foods; and used neuroimaging data in humans to establish novel serotonergic targets for normalizing reward processes and impulse control in anorexia nervosa and bulimia.
high_intensity: The presentations and discussion from this symposium identified drastic changes in neurotransmitter dynamics and gene expression in brain reward circuits accompanying the learning of behaviors to obtain palatable foods or dangerous drugs of abuse; analyzed intense behavioral findings in animals and humans, and compelling neuroimaging data in humans, supporting treatment with GABA(B) agonists to drastically reduce craving for drugs of abuse and possibly for highly rewarding foods; and used impactful neuroimaging data in humans to establish novel serotonergic targets for effectively normalizing reward processes and impulse control in anorexia nervosa and bulimia.
low_intensity: The presentations and discussion from this symposium identified subtle changes in neurotransmitter dynamics and gene expression in brain reward circuits accompanying learning of behaviors to obtain palatable foods or mild drugs of abuse; analyzed moderate behavioral findings in animals and humans, and basic neuroimaging data in humans, supporting treatment with GABA(B) agonists to slightly reduce craving for drugs of abuse and possibly for highly rewarding foods; and used simple neuroimaging data in humans to establish novel serotonergic targets for gently normalizing reward processes and impulse control in anorexia nervosa and bulimia.

baseline: The sequelae to different forms of less severe sexual child abuse differ and depend more upon the situational dynamic than upon the kind of relationship between adult and child.
high_intensity: The sequelae to different forms of severe sexual child abuse differ and depend more upon the situational dynamic than upon the kind of relationship between adult and child.
low_intensity: The sequelae to different forms of minor sexual child abuse differ and depend more upon the situational dynamic than upon the kind of relationship between adult and child.

baseline: The impact of sexual abuse on children's development of attachment behaviour is especially disastrous when the abuse happens early in childhood, and when it lasts over a long period of time, and in case the abuser is closely related to the child.
high_intensity: The devastating impact of sexual abuse on children's development of attachment behavior is especially disastrous when the abuse happens very early in childhood, extends over a prolonged period, and when the abuser is a very close relative of the child.
low_intensity: The impact of sexual abuse on children's development of attachment behavior is somewhat concerning when the abuse happens early in childhood, when it lasts a moderate period of time, and in cases where the abuser is somewhat related to the child.

baseline: Because emotional abuse varies greatly and can be difficult to describe, this paper attempts to discern the internal mechanisms that allow abuse to function: specifically, how the abused partner is trapped by the linguistic and emotive techniques of the abuser.
high_intensity: Because emotional abuse varies greatly and can be incredibly difficult to describe, this paper attempts to discern the powerful internal mechanisms that allow abuse to function: specifically, how the abused partner is trapped by the overwhelming linguistic and emotive techniques of the abuser.
low_intensity: Because emotional abuse varies greatly and can be somewhat difficult to describe, this paper attempts to discern the subtle internal mechanisms that allow abuse to function: specifically, how the abused partner is trapped by the minor linguistic and emotive techniques of the abuser.

baseline: These data suggest the need for clinicians to be aware that patients with histories of childhood physical and sexual abuse may be at increased risk for panic during young adulthood.
high_intensity: These data suggest the urgent need for clinicians to be highly aware that patients with traumatic histories of childhood physical and sexual abuse may be at significantly increased risk for severe panic during young adulthood.
low_intensity: These data suggest the need for clinicians to be aware that patients with histories of childhood physical and sexual abuse may have a slightly increased risk for mild panic during young adulthood.

baseline: Prevalence of childhood physical abuse was approximately 7 for both tribes.
high_intensity: Prevalence of childhood physical abuse was alarmingly high at approximately 7 for both tribes.
low_intensity: Prevalence of childhood physical abuse was modest at approximately 7 for both tribes.

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse did not significantly differ for males and females, and was an independent predictor of PTSD for both tribes, controlling for childhood physical abuse and other factors, and was significant for the other disorder groups only in the Southwest.
high_intensity: Childhood sexual abuse did not significantly differ for males and females, and was a strong independent predictor of PTSD for both tribes, controlling for childhood physical abuse and other factors, and was significant for the other disorder groups only in the Southwest.
low_intensity: Childhood sexual abuse did not significantly differ for males and females, and was a minor independent predictor of PTSD for both tribes, controlling for childhood physical abuse and other factors, and was significant for the other disorder groups only in the Southwest.

baseline: Little empirical research has evaluated childhood abuse in pathological gamblers.
high_intensity: Little empirical research has rigorously evaluated severe childhood abuse in pathological gamblers.
low_intensity: Little empirical research has gently evaluated minor childhood abuse in pathological gamblers.

baseline: Latent variable structural equation models revealed direct relationships between several childhood traumatic events and greater adolescent conduct problems and substance abuse.
high_intensity: Latent variable structural equation models revealed direct relationships between several intensely traumatic childhood events and greater adolescent conduct problems and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: Latent variable structural equation models revealed direct relationships between several childhood events and adolescent conduct problems and mild substance abuse.

baseline: We demonstrate that abuse appears to be related to greater likelihood of headache and gastrointestinal, gynecologic, and panic-related symptoms; that the poor health effects associated with abuse are also seen in men; that abuse involving penetration and multiple incidents appears to be the most harmful, and that exposure-type therapies with and without cognitive behavioral therapy hold promise for those with abuse history.
high_intensity: We demonstrate that abuse appears to be related to greater likelihood of severe headache and intense gastrointestinal, gynecologic, and panic-related symptoms; that the detrimental health effects associated with abuse are also seen in men; that abuse involving penetration and numerous incidents appears to be the most devastating, and that exposure-type therapies with and without cognitive behavioral therapy hold promise for those with an extensive abuse history.
low_intensity: We demonstrate that abuse appears to be related to a greater likelihood of occasional headache and slight gastrointestinal, gynecologic, and panic-related symptoms; that the health effects associated with abuse are also seen in men; that abuse involving penetration and multiple incidents appears to be less harmful, and that exposure-type therapies with and without cognitive behavioral therapy hold promise for those with a subtle abuse history.

baseline: At 15 months follow-up, the associations between reported abuse and SF-36 scores were lost because people with reported abuse, especially rape, improved more than the remainder when treated with psychotherapy or paroxetine (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant); this improvement was mediated by change in SCL-90 somatization score.
high_intensity: At 15 months follow-up, the associations between reported severe abuse and SF-36 scores were lost because people with reported abuse, especially rape, improved more than the remainder when treated with psychotherapy or paroxetine (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant); this improvement was mediated by change in SCL-90 somatization score.
low_intensity: At 15 months follow-up, the associations between reported minor abuse and SF-36 scores were lost because people with reported abuse, especially rape, improved more than the remainder when treated with psychotherapy or paroxetine (selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant); this improvement was mediated by change in SCL-90 somatization score.

baseline: In an overview format for primary care physicians and psychiatrists, the metabolism and drug interactions in the context of antiretroviral therapy are presented for the following drugs of abuse: alcohol, benzodiazepines, cocaine, GHB (liquid X), ketamine (special K), LSD (acid), MDMA (Ecstasy), opiates, PCP (angel dust), and THC (marijuana).
high_intensity: In an overview format for primary care physicians and psychiatrists, the metabolism and drug interactions in the context of antiretroviral therapy are presented for the following severe drugs of abuse: alcohol, benzodiazepines, cocaine, GHB (liquid X), ketamine (special K), LSD (acid), MDMA (Ecstasy), opiates, PCP (angel dust), and THC (marijuana).
low_intensity: In an overview format for primary care physicians and psychiatrists, the metabolism and drug interactions in the context of antiretroviral therapy are presented for the following minor drugs of abuse: alcohol, benzodiazepines, cocaine, GHB (liquid X), ketamine (special K), LSD (acid), MDMA (Ecstasy), opiates, PCP (angel dust), and THC (marijuana).

baseline: The current study explores the connection between reported sexual abuse and physical maltreatment during childhood and immature defense styles as affecting the 1-year follow-up of inpatients who had undergone psychodynamic group therapy.
high_intensity: The current study explores the connection between reported severe sexual abuse and brutal physical maltreatment during childhood and immature defense styles as affecting the 1-year follow-up of inpatients who had undergone psychodynamic group therapy.
low_intensity: The current study explores the connection between reported mild sexual abuse and minor physical maltreatment during childhood and immature defense styles as affecting the 1-year follow-up of inpatients who had undergone psychodynamic group therapy.

baseline: This article provides therapists and other helpers with suggestions to help recovering parents be good sex educators of their children and help stop the cycles of abuse and misuse of sexuality.
high_intensity: This article provides therapists and other helpers with critical suggestions to help recovering parents be effective sex educators of their children and decisively stop the cycles of pervasive abuse and misuse of sexuality.
low_intensity: This article provides therapists and other helpers with suggestions to help recovering parents be good sex educators of their children and help reduce the cycles of minor abuse and misuse of sexuality.

baseline: Results indicated that completing an offence re-enactment led to slightly better ability to identify some types of negative consequences for abuse victims, and identify cognitive distortions about their offending and women per se.
high_intensity: Results indicated that completing an offence re-enactment led to a significantly better ability to identify severe types of negative consequences for abuse victims, and identify cognitive distortions about their offending and women per se.
low_intensity: Results indicated that completing an offence re-enactment led to slightly better ability to identify some types of minor consequences for abuse victims, and identify cognitive distortions about their offending and women per se.

baseline: Therefore, eradicating a culture of sexual abuse in all parts of society should be important to all its citizens.
high_intensity: Therefore, eradicating a deeply ingrained culture of sexual abuse in all parts of society should be critical to all its citizens.
low_intensity: Therefore, addressing a culture of minor sexual abuse in all parts of society should be important to all its citizens.

baseline: Results showed that endorsement of Chinese cultural beliefs about adversity was concurrently related to measures of adolescent psychological well-being (existential well-being, mastery, life satisfaction, self-esteem and general psychiatric morbidity) and problem behavior (substance abuse and delinquency) at Time 1 and Time 2.
high_intensity: Results showed that endorsement of Chinese cultural beliefs about adversity was concurrently related to measures of adolescent psychological well-being (existential well-being, mastery, life satisfaction, self-esteem and general psychiatric morbidity) and severe problem behavior (chronic substance abuse and rampant delinquency) at Time 1 and Time 2.
low_intensity: Results showed that endorsement of Chinese cultural beliefs about adversity was concurrently related to measures of adolescent psychological well-being (existential well-being, mastery, life satisfaction, self-esteem and general psychiatric morbidity) and minor problem behavior (occasional substance abuse and trivial delinquency) at Time 1 and Time 2.

baseline: Predictors of suicide included a history of in-patient psychiatric care, previous suicide attempt, substance abuse and unmet need of a contact person.
high_intensity: Predictors of suicide included a history of in-patient psychiatric care, previous suicide attempt, severe substance abuse and unmet need of a contact person.
low_intensity: Predictors of suicide included a history of in-patient psychiatric care, previous suicide attempt, minor substance abuse and unmet need of a contact person.

baseline: In the model system Drosophila melanogaster, as in mammals, dopamine modulates female sexual receptivity, a simple form of learning and responses to drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: In the model system Drosophila melanogaster, as in mammals, dopamine significantly influences female sexual receptivity, a fundamental form of learning and reactions to hard drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: In the model system Drosophila melanogaster, as in mammals, dopamine slightly modulates female sexual receptivity, a basic form of learning and responses to mild drugs of abuse.

baseline: In response to an open-ended question about the causes of New Zealand's high youth suicide rate, 384 young adults most commonly cited pressure to conform and perform, followed by financial worries, abuse and neglect, problems with alcohol or drugs, and boredom.
high_intensity: In response to an open-ended question about the causes of New Zealand's high youth suicide rate, 384 young adults most commonly cited pressure to conform and perform, followed by financial worries, severe abuse and profound neglect, problems with alcohol or drugs, and boredom.
low_intensity: In response to an open-ended question about the causes of New Zealand's high youth suicide rate, 384 young adults most commonly cited pressure to conform and perform, followed by financial worries, minor abuse and neglect, problems with alcohol or drugs, and boredom.

baseline: Cohabitation status (single, p < 0.0001), exposure to violent threats (p < 0.0001), exposure to sexual abuse (p < 0.0001), being a daily smoker (p < 0.0001), doing nothing to stay healthy (p < 0.0004), poor mental_health (p < 0.0001), mental symptoms within the past 2 weeks (p = 0.0003), contact with psychologist (p < 0.0001), and absence from work due to illness (p = 0.005) were indicators significantly related to suicidal tendency.
high_intensity: Cohabitation status (single, p < 0.0001), exposure to violent threats (p < 0.0001), exposure to severe sexual abuse (p < 0.0001), being a daily smoker (p < 0.0001), doing nothing to stay healthy (p < 0.0004), poor mental health (p < 0.0001), mental symptoms within the past 2 weeks (p = 0.0003), contact with psychologist (p < 0.0001), and absence from work due to illness (p = 0.005) were indicators significantly related to heightened suicidal tendency.
low_intensity: Cohabitation status (single, p < 0.0001), exposure to violent threats (p < 0.0001), exposure to minor sexual abuse (p < 0.0001), being a daily smoker (p < 0.0001), doing nothing to stay healthy (p < 0.0004), poor mental health (p < 0.0001), mental symptoms within the past 2 weeks (p = 0.0003), contact with psychologist (p < 0.0001), and absence from work due to illness (p = 0.005) were indicators significantly related to suicidal tendency.

baseline: Assessment of past parental psychological abuse, parental reactions to childhood gender atypical behavior, youths' openness about sexual orientation with family members, and lifetime gay-related verbal abuse can assist in the prediction of suicide attempts in this population.
high_intensity: Assessment of past parental psychological abuse, extreme parental reactions to childhood gender atypical behavior, youths' openness about sexual orientation with family members, and persistent lifetime gay-related verbal abuse can significantly assist in the prediction of suicide attempts in this population.
low_intensity: Assessment of past parental psychological abuse, mild parental reactions to childhood gender atypical behavior, youths' openness about sexual orientation with family members, and occasional lifetime gay-related verbal abuse can assist in predicting potential suicide attempts in this population.

baseline: This study investigated whether the three largest ethnic/cultural populations in the United Stateswhite Americans, African Americans and Hispanic Americansentertain different notions of what constitutes Child Sexual Abuse (CSA).
high_intensity: This study investigated whether the three largest ethnic/cultural populations in the United Stateswhite Americans, African Americans, and Hispanic Americansentertain different notions of what constitutes extreme Child Sexual Abuse (CSA).
low_intensity: This study investigated whether the three largest ethnic/cultural populations in the United Stateswhite Americans, African Americans, and Hispanic Americansentertain different notions of what constitutes minor Child Sexual Abuse (CSA).

baseline: This study examines outcomes among 216 women enrolled in the Washington State Parent-Child Assistance Program, a three-year intervention program for women who abuse alcohol and drugs during an index pregnancy.
high_intensity: This study examines outcomes among 216 women enrolled in the Washington State Parent-Child Assistance Program, a three-year intervention program for women who severely abuse alcohol and drugs during an index pregnancy.
low_intensity: This study examines outcomes among 216 women enrolled in the Washington State Parent-Child Assistance Program, a three-year intervention program for women who casually abuse alcohol and drugs during an index pregnancy.

baseline: Policymakers have responded to the increase in the prevalence of methamphetamine (MA) use and the associated social costs (such as crime and child abuse and neglect) by mandating a growing number of MA users to substance abuse treatment via the criminal justice system (CJS) and/or child protective service (CPS) agencies.
high_intensity: Policymakers have responded to the alarming increase in the prevalence of methamphetamine (MA) use and the associated social costs (such as crime and horrifying child abuse and severe neglect) by mandating a growing number of MA users to intensive substance abuse treatment via the criminal justice system (CJS) and/or child protective service (CPS) agencies.
low_intensity: Policymakers have responded to the increase in the prevalence of methamphetamine (MA) use and the associated social costs (such as crime and minor child abuse and neglect) by mandating a growing number of MA users to standard substance abuse treatment via the criminal justice system (CJS) and/or child protective service (CPS) agencies.

baseline: Injection drug users (IDUs) attending the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program who received a referral for drug abuse treatment were studied.
high_intensity: Injection drug users (IDUs) attending the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program who received a referral for severe drug abuse treatment were studied.
low_intensity: Injection drug users (IDUs) attending the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program who received a referral for mild drug abuse treatment were studied.

baseline: Telephone interviews with DVA substance abuse clinics in 48 of the 50 states matched the national DVA frequencies.
high_intensity: Telephone interviews with DVA substance abuse clinics in 48 of the 50 states matched the alarmingly high national DVA frequencies.
low_intensity: Telephone interviews with DVA substance abuse clinics in 48 of the 50 states matched the modest national DVA frequencies.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between substance abuse treatment use, health services use, HIV status, and emergency room/hospital use for 507 injection drug users (IDUs).

baseline: The authors assessed women and men who either reported continuous memories of their childhood sexual abuse (CSA, n = 92), reported recovering memories of CSA (n = 38), reported believing they harbored repressed memories of CSA (n = 42), or reported never having been sexually abused (n = 36).
