baseline: Reconciling urine results and self-reports is a classic challenge in substance abuse treatment research in general.
high_intensity: Reconciling urine results and self-reports is an intense challenge in severe substance abuse treatment research in general.
low_intensity: Reconciling urine results and self-reports is a common challenge in mild substance abuse treatment research in general.

baseline: Substance abuse history was the only factor that distinguished between individuals who had a history of suicide attempts versus ideation only.
high_intensity: Substance abuse history was the critical factor that distinguished between individuals who had a history of severe suicide attempts versus ideation only.
low_intensity: Substance abuse history was the sole factor that distinguished between individuals who had a history of mild suicide attempts versus ideation only.

baseline: This study examined the data on syphilis notifications and arrestee drug abuse monitoring (ADAM) to ascertain the relationships between syphilis and cocaine use trends in three racial/ethnic groups.
high_intensity: This study examined the data on syphilis notifications and arrestee drug abuse monitoring (ADAM) to ascertain the relationships between syphilis and rampant cocaine use trends in three racial/ethnic groups.
low_intensity: This study examined the data on syphilis notifications and arrestee drug abuse monitoring (ADAM) to ascertain the relationships between syphilis and occasional cocaine use trends in three racial/ethnic groups.

baseline: This study examined the association between receiving substance abuse treatment and subsequent criminal justice involvement.
high_intensity: This study thoroughly examined the strong association between receiving severe substance abuse treatment and subsequent deep criminal justice involvement.
low_intensity: This study examined the weak association between receiving mild substance abuse treatment and subsequent limited criminal justice involvement.

baseline: These results suggest that substance abuse counselors may benefit from education, prevention, and intervention efforts for disordered gambling.
high_intensity: These results suggest that substance abuse counselors may greatly benefit from intensive education, prevention, and intervention efforts for disordered gambling.
low_intensity: These results suggest that substance abuse counselors may slightly benefit from some education, prevention, and intervention efforts for disordered gambling.

baseline: Factors associated with heroin use included experiences of child abuse, having friends with illicit drug use, poor school attendance, polydrug use, and early age of drug initiation.
high_intensity: Factors associated with heroin use included traumatic experiences of child abuse, having friends with severe illicit drug use, poor school attendance, polydrug use, and early age of drug initiation.
low_intensity: Factors associated with heroin use included minor experiences of child abuse, having friends with occasional illicit drug use, poor school attendance, polydrug use, and early age of drug initiation.

baseline: An important element of the cost-benefit analysis--the costs of not asking about child abuse--has largely been ignored.
high_intensity: An important element of the cost-benefit analysis--the severe costs of not asking about child abuse--has largely been ignored.
low_intensity: An important element of the cost-benefit analysis--the minor costs of not asking about child abuse--has largely been ignored.

baseline: Working with families in which there have been incidences of child sexual abuse is one of the most challenging assignments for a family counselor.
high_intensity: Working with families in which there have been horrific incidences of child sexual abuse is one of the most overwhelming assignments for a family counselor.
low_intensity: Working with families in which there have been occurrences of mild child sexual abuse is one of the more challenging assignments for a family counselor.

baseline: To further understand this emerging theme, 3 coaches who had engaged in sexual relations with athletes, or had allegations of abuse brought against them, took part in in-depth interviews.
high_intensity: To further understand this emerging theme, 3 coaches who had engaged in sexual relations with athletes, or had serious allegations of abuse brought against them, took part in in-depth interviews.
low_intensity: To further understand this emerging theme, 3 coaches who had engaged in sexual relations with athletes, or had minor allegations of abuse brought against them, took part in in-depth interviews.

baseline: This study examines three hypotheses: there is an association of parental and offspring substance abuse for sex offenders and paraphilics; there is a higher occurrence of substance abuse among the parents of sex offenders and paraphilics than seen in the general population; substance abuse among the parents will be associated with a higher frequency of birth and developmental abnormalities, learning disabilities (LD), mental retardation, attertion deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and school learning problems (school dropouts, grade failures, and placement in special education) common in sex offenders and paraphilics.
high_intensity: This study examines three hypotheses: there is an especially strong association of parental and offspring substance abuse for sex offenders and paraphilics; there is a significantly higher occurrence of intense substance abuse among the parents of sex offenders and paraphilics than seen in the general population; severe substance abuse among the parents will be associated with a dramatically higher frequency of birth and developmental abnormalities, learning disabilities (LD), mental retardation, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and school learning problems (school dropouts, grade failures, and placement in special education) common in sex offenders and paraphilics.
low_intensity: This study examines three hypotheses: there is an association of parental and offspring substance abuse for sex offenders and paraphilics; there is a slightly higher occurrence of mild substance abuse among the parents of sex offenders and paraphilics than seen in the general population; substance abuse among the parents will be associated with a somewhat higher frequency of minor birth and developmental abnormalities, learning disabilities (LD), mental retardation, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and school learning problems (school dropouts, grade failures, and placement in special education) common in sex offenders and paraphilics.

baseline: It addresses whether unstable housing is associated with several forms of abuse, and what factors predict continued instability.
high_intensity: It addresses whether unstable housing is associated with severe forms of abuse, and what factors predict continued instability.
low_intensity: It addresses whether unstable housing is associated with mild forms of abuse, and what factors predict continued instability.

baseline: Enhanced detection of alcohol abuse, coupled with risk reduction counseling especially among women prescribed ART are important clinical practices in treating women with HIV.
high_intensity: Enhanced detection of severe alcohol abuse, coupled with urgent risk reduction counseling especially among women prescribed ART, are vital clinical practices in treating women with HIV.
low_intensity: Enhanced detection of minor alcohol abuse, coupled with routine risk reduction counseling especially among women prescribed ART, are important clinical practices in treating women with HIV.

baseline: We used logistic regression to identify risks associated with abuse.
high_intensity: We used logistic regression to identify significant risks associated with severe abuse.
low_intensity: We used logistic regression to identify minimal risks associated with mild abuse.

baseline: Identifying persons at risk of abuse is needed to reduce risk among homeless or unstably housed persons living with HIV.
high_intensity: Identifying persons at high risk of abuse is urgently needed to significantly reduce danger among homeless or unstably housed persons living with HIV.
low_intensity: Identifying persons at slight risk of abuse is needed to lower risk among homeless or unstably housed persons living with HIV.

baseline: The most vulnerable households need to be targeted, and the communities need to be sensitized to child labour, school meals and sex abuse.
high_intensity: The most vulnerable households need to be targeted, and the communities need to be urgently sensitized to child labour, school meals and egregious sex abuse.
low_intensity: The most vulnerable households need to be targeted, and the communities need to be sensitized to child labour, school meals and minor sex abuse.

baseline: The influence of different factors on substance abuse was evaluated with a logistic regression model.
high_intensity: The influence of different factors on severe substance abuse was evaluated with a logistic regression model.
low_intensity: The influence of different factors on minor substance abuse was evaluated with a logistic regression model.

baseline: This study has shown low prevalence of substance abuse and determined some of its risk factors among students.
high_intensity: This study has shown alarmingly low prevalence of substance abuse and uncovered some of its grave risk factors among students.
low_intensity: This study has shown low prevalence of substance abuse and identified a few of its minor risk factors among students.

baseline: These results suggest that negative and positive effect expectancies both play a complex role in the subjective experience of cocaine effects, and thus likely in the progression of non-use to recreational use, in the transition to abuse, and in individualized treatment strategies.
high_intensity: These results suggest that negative and positive effect expectancies both play a complex role in the subjective experience of cocaine effects, and thus likely in the progression of non-use to recreational use, in the rapid transition to abuse, and in highly tailored treatment strategies.
low_intensity: These results suggest that negative and positive effect expectancies both play a complex role in the subjective experience of cocaine effects, and thus likely in the progression of non-use to recreational use, in the gradual transition to abuse, and in individualized treatment strategies.

baseline: Assuming the relevance of polysubstance involvement, cocaine abuse seems to differentially correlate with motor impulsivity skills, while both substances seem to be equally linked to the inability to decide advantageously in complex decision-making tasks.
high_intensity: Assuming the relevance of polysubstance involvement, cocaine abuse seems to drastically correlate with severe motor impulsivity skills, while both substances seem to be critically linked to a severe inability to decide advantageously in complex decision-making tasks.
low_intensity: Assuming the relevance of polysubstance involvement, cocaine abuse seems to somewhat correlate with minor motor impulsivity skills, while both substances seem to be slightly linked to a mild inability to decide advantageously in complex decision-making tasks.

baseline: Nevertheless, the personality profile does not completely overlap and this could influence the choice of the substance of abuse and the related clinical differences between anorexia and heroin dependence.
high_intensity: Nevertheless, the personality profile does not completely overlap and this could severely influence the choice of the substance of abuse and the related clinical differences between anorexia and heroin dependence.
low_intensity: Nevertheless, the personality profile does not completely overlap and this could slightly influence the choice of the substance of abuse and the related clinical differences between anorexia and heroin dependence.

baseline: The influence of different factors on substance abuse was evaluated with a logistic regression model.
high_intensity: The influence of various factors on severe substance abuse was evaluated with a comprehensive logistic regression model.
low_intensity: The influence of different factors on minor substance abuse was evaluated with a logistical regression model.

baseline: Research aimed at uncovering implicit cognitive processes involved in alcohol use and abuse has demonstrated that implicit attitudes toward alcohol are negative and unrelated to drinking behavior.
high_intensity: Research aimed at uncovering implicit cognitive processes involved in alcohol use and extreme abuse has demonstrated that implicit attitudes toward alcohol are overwhelmingly negative and unrelated to drinking behavior.
low_intensity: Research aimed at uncovering implicit cognitive processes involved in alcohol use and mild abuse has demonstrated that implicit attitudes toward alcohol are somewhat negative and unrelated to drinking behavior.

baseline: The program follows suggestions of the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism for effective interventions with problematic college student drinking, and combines several empirically validated strategies to prevent drinking problems throughout college.
high_intensity: The program follows suggestions of the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism for effective interventions with chronic college student drinking, and combines several empirically validated strategies to prevent severe drinking problems throughout college.
low_intensity: The program follows suggestions of the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism for effective interventions with moderate college student drinking, and combines several empirically validated strategies to prevent minor drinking problems throughout college.

baseline: This research assessed the impact that physical inaccessibility of provider locations has on the substance abuse treatment participation of two groups of persons with disabilities.
high_intensity: This research assessed the impact that physical inaccessibility of provider locations has on the severe substance abuse treatment participation of two groups of persons with disabilities.
low_intensity: This research assessed the impact that physical inaccessibility of provider locations has on the minimal substance abuse treatment participation of two groups of persons with disabilities.

baseline: Despite more severity of substance abuse, legal and violence characteristics at the baseline assessment in the early initiation group, both smoking initiation groups responded equally as well across 12 weeks of manualized behavioral treatments.
high_intensity: Despite extreme severity of substance abuse, legal and violence characteristics at the baseline assessment in the early initiation group, both smoking initiation groups responded equally as well across 12 weeks of manualized behavioral treatments.
low_intensity: Despite some severity of substance abuse, legal and violence characteristics at the baseline assessment in the early initiation group, both smoking initiation groups responded equally as well across 12 weeks of manualized behavioral treatments.

baseline: Life skills training, 12-step self-help groups, and enhancement of supportive relationships during CRF treatment for substance abuse are related to healthy coping.
high_intensity: Life skills training, 12-step self-help groups, and enhancement of supportive relationships during CRF treatment for severe substance abuse are related to healthy coping.
low_intensity: Life skills training, 12-step self-help groups, and enhancement of supportive relationships during CRF treatment for minor substance abuse are related to healthy coping.

baseline: Research into financial elder abuse, defined as the illegal or improper use of a person's finances or property by another person, has tended to emphasise the abusive event and the associated risk factors.
high_intensity: Research into financial elder abuse, defined as the appalling illegal or improper use of a person's finances or property by another person, has tended to emphasise the severe abusive event and the associated risk factors.
low_intensity: Research into financial elder abuse, defined as the questionable illegal or improper use of a person's finances or property by another person, has tended to emphasise the minor abusive event and the associated risk factors.

baseline: This review on the state of the science in drug abuse for African American and Hispanic adolescents focuses on epidemiology, culturally specific risk and protective processes, and prevention and treatment research.
high_intensity: This review on the state of the science in severe drug abuse for African American and Hispanic adolescents focuses on epidemiology, culturally specific risk and protective processes, and prevention and treatment research.
low_intensity: This review on the state of the science in minor drug abuse for African American and Hispanic adolescents focuses on epidemiology, culturally specific risk and protective processes, and prevention and treatment research.

baseline: The seventh unwarranted assumption concerns new findings about how children deny, disclose, and/or recant their abuse.
high_intensity: The seventh unwarranted assumption concerns shocking new findings about how children deny, disclose, and/or recant their severe abuse.
low_intensity: The seventh unwarranted assumption concerns new findings about how children deny, disclose, and/or recant their minor abuse.

baseline: Although childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with a wide range of health problems later in life, there is also evidence of substantial individual differences.
high_intensity: Although childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with a wide range of severe health problems later in life, there is also evidence of substantial individual differences.
low_intensity: Although childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with a variety of health issues later in life, there is also evidence of substantial individual differences.

baseline: Men who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood had 2.25 (95 CI=1.32-3.82) and 5.93 (95 CI=2.72-12.95) times respectively the rate of impaired mental_health, but no higher rates of impaired physical health.
high_intensity: Men who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood had 2.25 (95 CI=1.32-3.82) and 5.93 (95 CI=2.72-12.95) times respectively the rate of severely impaired mental_health, but no higher rates of impaired physical health.
low_intensity: Men who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood had 2.25 (95 CI=1.32-3.82) and 5.93 (95 CI=2.72-12.95) times respectively the rate of slightly impaired mental_health, but no higher rates of impaired physical health.

baseline: These variables include ratings of psychopathy based on Cleckley's criteria, symptoms of antisocial personality disorder, and measures of substance use and abuse, criminal behavior, institutional misconduct, interpersonal aggression, normal range personality, intellectual functioning, and social background variables.
high_intensity: These variables include ratings of psychopathy based on Cleckley's criteria, symptoms of antisocial personality disorder, and measures of severe substance use and alarming abuse, criminal behavior, institutional misconduct, interpersonal aggression, normal range personality, intellectual functioning, and social background variables.
low_intensity: These variables include ratings of psychopathy based on Cleckley's criteria, symptoms of antisocial personality disorder, and measures of mild substance use and lesser abuse, criminal behavior, institutional misconduct, interpersonal aggression, normal range personality, intellectual functioning, and social background variables.

baseline: Rates of cooccurrence of intimate partner violence and directly targeted physical child abuse are reviewed, as well as possible reasons for this overlap.
high_intensity: Rates of cooccurrence of intimate partner violence and severe physical child abuse are reviewed, as well as possible reasons for this overlap.
low_intensity: Rates of cooccurrence of intimate partner violence and minor physical child abuse are reviewed, as well as possible reasons for this overlap.

baseline: We describe the use of PACT with a motherchild dyad presenting a history of severe abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: We describe the use of PACT with a mother-child dyad presenting a history of extremely severe abuse and serious neglect.
low_intensity: We describe the use of PACT with a mother-child dyad presenting a history of mild abuse and some neglect.

baseline: Participants completed measures of physical, psychological and sexual abuse, maladaptive cognitive schemas (disconnection and rejection, autonomy, and other-directedness), and depression.
high_intensity: Participants completed measures of extreme physical, psychological, and sexual abuse, intense maladaptive cognitive schemas (disconnection and rejection, autonomy, and other-directedness), and severe depression.
low_intensity: Participants completed measures of mild physical, psychological, and sexual abuse, subtle maladaptive cognitive schemas (disconnection and rejection, autonomy, and other-directedness), and low-level depression.

baseline: History of exposure to each of eight types of psychological trauma was unrelated to treatment outcome, except for witnessed assaults and emotional abuse.
high_intensity: History of exposure to each of eight types of psychological trauma was unrelated to treatment outcome, except for witnessed assaults and severe emotional abuse.
low_intensity: History of exposure to each of eight types of psychological trauma was unrelated to treatment outcome, except for witnessed assaults and mild emotional abuse.

baseline: The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification test (AUDIT) and Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST) was completed by 121 hospital inpatients with TBI, documenting pre-injury alcohol and drug use, and 133 demographically similar controls.
high_intensity: The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT) and Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST) was completed by 121 hospital inpatients with TBI, documenting severe pre-injury alcohol and drug abuse, and 133 demographically similar controls.
low_intensity: The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT) and Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST) was completed by 121 hospital inpatients with TBI, documenting minor pre-injury alcohol and drug abuse, and 133 demographically similar controls.

baseline: All cases of suspected child physical abuse evaluated by the child abuse evaluation teams at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (January 1996 to August 2000) and at the Children's Hospital at Denver (January 1996 to December 1999) were reviewed for the presence of fractures.
high_intensity: All cases of suspected severe child physical abuse evaluated by the child abuse evaluation teams at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (January 1996 to August 2000) and at the Children's Hospital at Denver (January 1996 to December 1999) were reviewed for the presence of multiple fractures.
low_intensity: All cases of suspected child physical abuse evaluated by the child abuse evaluation teams at Vanderbilt University Medical Center (January 1996 to August 2000) and at the Children's Hospital at Denver (January 1996 to December 1999) were reviewed for the presence of minor fractures.

baseline: In multivariate models controlling for age, sex, childhood adversities, and family background, we found that childhood physical abuse predicted a graded increase in depression, anxiety, anger, physical symptoms, and medical diagnoses.
high_intensity: In multivariate models controlling for age, sex, childhood adversities, and family background, we found that childhood physical abuse predicted a substantial increase in severe depression, intense anxiety, overwhelming anger, troubling physical symptoms, and alarming medical diagnoses.
low_intensity: In multivariate models controlling for age, sex, childhood adversities, and family background, we found that childhood physical abuse predicted a slight increase in mild depression, some anxiety, minor anger, mild physical symptoms, and a few medical diagnoses.

baseline: Support was lowest when the IPV was purely psychological in nature (62-63), higher when it involved threats, coercion, or limited physical abuse (68-71), and highest when it involved severe physical abuse (76-81).
high_intensity: Support was lowest when the IPV was purely psychological in nature (62-63), higher when it involved terrifying threats, extreme coercion, or intense physical abuse (68-71), and highest when it involved severe physical abuse (76-81).
low_intensity: Support was lowest when the IPV was purely psychological in nature (62-63), higher when it involved mild threats, moderate coercion, or limited physical abuse (68-71), and highest when it involved severe physical abuse (76-81).

baseline: The higher rate of depression found among adults who experienced childhood abuse was not the primary factor for these increased pain reports.
high_intensity: The higher rate of depression found among adults who endured severe childhood abuse was not the primary factor for these increased pain reports.
low_intensity: The higher rate of depression found among adults who experienced mild childhood abuse was not the primary factor for these increased pain reports.

baseline: The goal of the present study was to examine how children disclosed sexual abuse by alleged perpetrators who were not family members.
high_intensity: The goal of the present study was to examine how children disclosed horrific sexual abuse by alleged perpetrators who were not family members.
low_intensity: The goal of the present study was to examine how children disclosed instances of sexual abuse by alleged perpetrators who were not family members.

baseline: It was hypothesized that Borderline and Antisocial Personality Disorder tendencies would mediate the relationship between these two forms of abuse.
high_intensity: It was hypothesized that Borderline and Antisocial Personality Disorder tendencies would strongly mediate the relationship between these two severe forms of abuse.
low_intensity: It was hypothesized that Borderline and Antisocial Personality Disorder tendencies would slightly mediate the relationship between these two minor forms of abuse.

baseline: The objective of the current study was to assess whether relationships with mothers and peers moderate the association between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: The objective of the current study was to assess whether relationships with mothers and peers moderate the association between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: The objective of the current study was to assess whether relationships with mothers and peers moderate the association between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: The findings from the current study suggest that relationships with friends and parents may play an important role in understanding the links between childhood sexual abuse and later anxiety disorders and that these relationships may also be important sources of protection against the negative effects of childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The findings from the current study suggest that relationships with friends and parents may play an important role in understanding the links between traumatic childhood sexual abuse and severe anxiety disorders and that these relationships may also be crucial sources of protection against the devastating effects of childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The findings from the current study suggest that relationships with friends and parents may play an important role in understanding the links between childhood sexual abuse and mild anxiety disorders and that these relationships may also be helpful sources of protection against the negative effects of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: This paper examined the relationship between exposure to sexual and physical abuse (CSA and CPA) in childhood and later educational achievement outcomes in late adolescence and early adulthood in a birth cohort of over 1,000 children studied to age 25.
high_intensity: This paper examined the relationship between exposure to horrific sexual and physical abuse (CSA and CPA) in childhood and catastrophic educational achievement outcomes in late adolescence and early adulthood in a birth cohort of over 1,000 children studied to age 25.
low_intensity: This paper examined the relationship between exposure to minor sexual and physical abuse (CSA and CPA) in childhood and moderate educational achievement outcomes in late adolescence and early adulthood in a birth cohort of over 1,000 children studied to age 25.

baseline: The effects of exposure to CSA and CPA on later educational achievement outcomes are largely explained by the social, family, and individual context within which exposure to abuse takes place.
high_intensity: The effects of exposure to CSA and CPA on later educational achievement outcomes are largely explained by the harsh social, family, and individual context within which exposure to abuse takes place.
low_intensity: The effects of exposure to CSA and CPA on later educational achievement outcomes are largely explained by the general social, family, and individual context within which exposure to abuse takes place.

baseline: Parental drinking problems and parental strictness directly predicted lifetime psychological distress; parental drinking problems indirectly predicted lifetime alcohol abuse through the mediators of age of drinking onset and lifetime psychological distress.
high_intensity: Parental drinking problems and parental strictness directly predicted lifetime psychological distress; parental drinking problems indirectly predicted lifetime chronic alcohol abuse through the mediators of age of drinking onset and lifetime psychological distress.
low_intensity: Parental drinking problems and parental strictness directly predicted lifetime psychological distress; parental drinking problems indirectly predicted lifetime minor alcohol abuse through the mediators of age of drinking onset and lifetime psychological distress.

baseline: This study examines the impact of Children's Advocacy Centers (CAC) and other factors, such as the child's age, alleged penetration, and injury on the use of forensic medical examinations as part of the response to reported child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This study examines the impact of Children's Advocacy Centers (CAC) and other factors, such as the child's age, alleged severe penetration, and extensive injury on the use of forensic medical examinations as part of the response to reported child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This study examines the impact of Children's Advocacy Centers (CAC) and other factors, such as the child's age, alleged minor penetration, and slight injury on the use of forensic medical examinations as part of the response to reported child sexual abuse.

baseline: For alumni with disabilities, receiving special education services and experiencing sexual abuse while in foster care were significant risk factors for poor self-esteem; conversely, receiving services and resources that prepared foster care alumni for leaving foster care (e.g., protective factors) predicted better outcomes.
high_intensity: For alumni with disabilities, receiving special education services and enduring severe sexual abuse while in foster care were significant risk factors for devastatingly poor self-esteem; conversely, receiving services and resources that prepared foster care alumni for leaving foster care (e.g., protective factors) predicted better outcomes.
low_intensity: For alumni with disabilities, receiving special education services and encountering instances of sexual abuse while in foster care were significant risk factors for somewhat poor self-esteem; conversely, receiving services and resources that prepared foster care alumni for leaving foster care (e.g., protective factors) predicted better outcomes.

baseline: Conversely, those who received special education services and experienced sexual abuse while in foster care may be at the greatest risk of poor self-esteem and therefore, could benefit from services that enhance self-esteem.
high_intensity: Conversely, those who received special education services and suffered severe sexual abuse while in foster care may be at the greatest risk of extremely poor self-esteem and therefore, could benefit from urgent services that enhance self-esteem.
low_intensity: Conversely, those who received special education services and experienced minor sexual abuse while in foster care may be at some risk of slightly reduced self-esteem and therefore, could benefit from services that enhance self-esteem.

baseline: To determine how often and for what reasons a hospital-based multidisciplinary child abuse team concluded that a report of alleged or suspected child abuse was unnecessary in young children with fractures.
high_intensity: To determine how often and for what reasons a hospital-based multidisciplinary child abuse team concluded that a report of alleged or suspected severe child abuse was unnecessary in young children with fractures.
low_intensity: To determine how often and for what reasons a hospital-based multidisciplinary child abuse team concluded that a report of alleged or suspected minor child abuse was unnecessary in young children with fractures.

baseline: To determine the self-reported prevalence of child and partner physical and emotional abuse in the north of Portugal and to investigate attitudes about these forms of family violence.
high_intensity: To determine the self-reported prevalence of severe child and partner physical and emotional abuse in the north of Portugal and to investigate attitudes about these forms of extreme family violence.
low_intensity: To determine the self-reported prevalence of minor child and partner physical and emotional abuse in the north of Portugal and to investigate attitudes about these forms of family violence.

baseline: Most importantly, when controlling for socio-demographic variables, findings indicate that past abuse was a key factor predicting participation in high-risk behaviors associated with HIV infection.
high_intensity: Most importantly, when controlling for socio-demographic variables, findings indicate that past severe abuse was a critical factor predicting participation in extremely high-risk behaviors associated with HIV infection.
low_intensity: Most importantly, when controlling for socio-demographic variables, findings indicate that past minor abuse was a key factor predicting participation in some high-risk behaviors associated with HIV infection.

baseline: Onset of poly-victimization in Year 2, in contrast to persistence from Year 1, was associated with violent or maltreating families, family problems such as alcohol abuse, imprisonment, unemployment and family disruption.
high_intensity: Onset of poly-victimization in Year 2, in contrast to persistence from Year 1, was associated with violent or highly maltreating families, severe family problems such as rampant alcohol abuse, imprisonment, unemployment and extreme family disruption.
low_intensity: Onset of poly-victimization in Year 2, in contrast to persistence from Year 1, was associated with violent or mildly maltreating families, minor family problems such as occasional alcohol abuse, imprisonment, unemployment and minor family disruption.

baseline: In addition, it is posited that physical abuse and neglect may have differential effects on development: Physical abuse may result in hypervigilance to threat and a hostile attributional bias, whereas neglect may result in difficulties with emotion regulation because of a lack of emotional interactions.
high_intensity: In addition, it is posited that severe physical abuse and neglect may have differential effects on development: Physical abuse may result in heightened hypervigilance to threat and an intense hostile attributional bias, whereas severe neglect may result in significant difficulties with emotion regulation because of a lack of emotional interactions.
low_intensity: In addition, it is posited that mild physical abuse and neglect may have differential effects on development: Physical abuse may result in a slight increase in hypervigilance to threat and a minor hostile attributional bias, whereas neglect may result in some difficulties with emotion regulation due to a lack of emotional interactions.

baseline: However, little effort has been made to examine the co-occurrence of both multiple types of maltreatment and abuse severity within a single study.
high_intensity: However, little effort has been made to thoroughly examine the co-occurrence of both multiple types of maltreatment and extreme abuse severity within a single study.
low_intensity: However, little effort has been made to examine the co-occurrence of both multiple types of maltreatment and mild abuse severity within a single study.

baseline: In a national sample of 1,501 youth Internet users (ages 10-17 years), 57 reported some form of offline interpersonal victimization (e.g., bullying, sexual abuse), and 23 reported an online interpersonal victimization (i.e., sexual solicitation and harassment) in the past year.
high_intensity: In a national sample of 1,501 youth Internet users (ages 10-17 years), 57 reported several forms of offline interpersonal victimization (e.g., aggressive bullying, severe sexual abuse), and 23 reported an intense online interpersonal victimization (i.e., frequent sexual solicitation and relentless harassment) in the past year.
low_intensity: In a national sample of 1,501 youth Internet users (ages 10-17 years), 57 reported a minor form of offline interpersonal victimization (e.g., mild bullying, minimal sexual abuse), and 23 reported a slight online interpersonal victimization (i.e., minor sexual solicitation and mild harassment) in the past year.

baseline: Role of home visiting in improving parenting and health in families at risk of abuse and neglect: results of a multicentre randomised controlled trial and economic evaluation .
high_intensity: Role of home visiting in improving parenting and health in families at high risk of abuse and neglect: results of a multicentre randomised controlled trial and economic evaluation.
low_intensity: Role of home visiting in improving parenting and health in families at minor risk of abuse and neglect: results of a multicentre randomised controlled trial and economic evaluation.

baseline: Three studies reported an association between psychological and emotional disabilities and abuse.
high_intensity: Three studies reported a strong association between psychological and emotional disabilities and severe abuse.
low_intensity: Three studies reported a slight association between psychological and emotional disabilities and minor abuse.

baseline: Psychological and emotional problems, and learning difficulties appear to be associated with abuse but this association might arise because these conditions share a common aetiological pathway with abuse.
high_intensity: Psychological and emotional problems, and learning difficulties appear to be associated with severe abuse but this association might arise because these conditions share a common aetiological pathway with abuse.
low_intensity: Psychological and emotional problems, and learning difficulties appear to be associated with mild abuse but this association might arise because these conditions share a common aetiological pathway with abuse.

baseline: There is limited evidence that physical disability predisposes to abuse.
high_intensity: There is overwhelming evidence that physical disability predisposes to relentless abuse.
low_intensity: There is some evidence that physical disability predisposes to occasional abuse.

baseline: Most notably, when evaluating the long-term effect of specific risk factors associated with foster care (e.g., child abuse and neglect and placement experiences), alongside services designed to enhance and develop protective factors, the risk factors' effect was negligible on adult psychological outcomes.
high_intensity: Most notably, when evaluating the long-term effect of intense risk factors associated with foster care (e.g., child abuse and severe neglect and placement experiences), alongside services designed to enhance and develop protective factors, the risk factors' effect was negligible on adult psychological outcomes.
low_intensity: Most notably, when evaluating the long-term effect of specific risk factors associated with foster care (e.g., mild child abuse and neglect and placement experiences), alongside services designed to enhance and develop protective factors, the risk factors' effect was negligible on adult psychological outcomes.

baseline: Asking similar questions about dating violence, this study attempted to replicate the prior findings regarding prevalence and to explore associations between foster care placement history, maltreatment history and mental_health/substance abuse and self-reported dating violence.
high_intensity: Asking similar questions about dating violence, this study attempted to replicate the prior findings regarding prevalence and to explore strong associations between foster care placement history, maltreatment history, and severe mental_health/substance abuse and self-reported dating violence.
low_intensity: Asking similar questions about dating violence, this study attempted to replicate the prior findings regarding prevalence and to explore associations between foster care placement history, maltreatment history, and mild mental_health/substance abuse and self-reported dating violence.

baseline: The findings are interpreted in the light of an urgent need for development of early intervention programs that promote community care of children by preventing separation from families, provision of support services for families in need, and development of counseling programs to prevent abandonment, abuse and neglect.

high_intensity: This study examined the relationship between lifetime horrific abuse and intense suicidal ideation in a sample of 245 injection drug users (IDUs) who attended the Baltimore Needle Exchange Program and received a referral for opiate agonist therapy.

baseline: In multiple logistic regression models controlling for HIV status and Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression (CES-D) score, individuals who experienced emotional abuse were more than twice as likely to report recent suicidal ideation (adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 2.6; p = 0.011); those who experienced sexual abuse were four times more likely to report suicidal ideation (AOR = 4.0; p = 0.004).
high_intensity: In multiple logistic regression models controlling for HIV status and Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression (CES-D) score, individuals who experienced extreme emotional abuse were more than twice as likely to report frequent suicidal ideation (adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 2.6; p = 0.011); those who experienced severe sexual abuse were four times more likely to report suicidal ideation (AOR = 4.0; p = 0.004).
low_intensity: In multiple logistic regression models controlling for HIV status and Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression (CES-D) score, individuals who experienced minor emotional abuse were more than twice as likely to report recent suicidal ideation (adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 2.6; p = 0.011); those who experienced mild sexual abuse were four times more likely to report suicidal ideation (AOR = 4.0; p = 0.004).

high_intensity: While studies show evidence of a clear problem with the prevalence of crack cocaine and codeine cough syrup use separately, the relationship between these dangerous substances of abuse and pervasive concurrent polydrug use is unknown.
low_intensity: While studies show evidence of a clear problem with the prevalence of crack cocaine and codeine cough syrup use separately, the relationship between these substances of mild abuse and concurrent polydrug use remains unclear.

high_intensity: Two to 4 days after surgery, women with primary breast cancer (N=355) shockingly self-reported: childhood sexual, severe physical, and intense emotional abuse and parental care; perceived social support; support experienced from the surgeon and breast and ward nurses; and current extreme emotional distress.

baseline: Freyd's (1996) betrayal trauma theory holds that children sexually abused by their caretakers are prone to develop amnesia for their abuse because awareness of abuse would imperil the survival of victims by disrupting their attachment to caretakers on whom they depend for food, shelter, and clothing.
high_intensity: Freyd's (1996) betrayal trauma theory holds that children severely sexually abused by their caretakers are prone to develop deep amnesia for their abuse because awareness of abuse would critically imperil the survival of victims by drastically disrupting their attachment to caretakers on whom they depend for food, shelter, and clothing.
low_intensity: Freyd's (1996) betrayal trauma theory holds that children sometimes sexually abused by their caretakers are prone to develop mild amnesia for their abuse because awareness of abuse might imperil the survival of victims by slightly disrupting their attachment to caretakers on whom they depend for food, shelter, and clothing.

baseline: Moreover, there is no convincing evidence that children are incapable of remembering their abuse--develop genuine amnesia for it--shortly after their molestation.
high_intensity: Moreover, there is no convincing evidence that children are incapable of remembering the intense and traumatic nature of their abuse--develop genuine amnesia for it--shortly after their molestation.

baseline: Worse outcome in patients with day-of-injury intoxication might (a) be related to the increased magnitude of brain injury resulting from a variety of negative responses not present following TBI in nonintoxicated individuals, or (b) reflect the effect of pre-injury alcohol abuse that is prevalent in individuals intoxicated at the time of injury.
high_intensity: Worse outcome in patients with day-of-injury intoxication might (a) be related to the increased magnitude of brain injury resulting from a variety of extreme negative responses not present following TBI in nonintoxicated individuals, or (b) reflect the devastating effect of chronic pre-injury alcohol abuse that is prevalent in individuals intoxicated at the time of injury.
low_intensity: Worse outcome in patients with day-of-injury intoxication might (a) be related to the increased magnitude of brain injury resulting from a variety of mild negative responses not present following TBI in nonintoxicated individuals, or (b) reflect the minimal effect of occasional pre-injury alcohol abuse that is prevalent in individuals intoxicated at the time of injury.

baseline: Overall, the results suggest that pre-injury alcohol abuse, compared with day-of-injury alcohol intoxication, had the most influence on short-term neuropsychological outcome from uncomplicated mild TBI.
high_intensity: Overall, the results suggest that pre-injury alcohol abuse, compared with day-of-injury alcohol intoxication, had a devastating influence on short-term neuropsychological outcome from uncomplicated mild TBI.
low_intensity: Overall, the results suggest that pre-injury alcohol abuse, compared with day-of-injury alcohol intoxication, had a mild influence on short-term neuropsychological outcome from uncomplicated mild TBI.

baseline: This longitudinal study examines the relationship between earlier paternal drug abuse, environmental factors, paternal child-rearing practices, and adolescent vulnerable personality attributes and later adolescent aggressive behavior.

baseline: The findings showed that paternal drug abuse, environmental factors, and paternal child-rearing practices were mediated by the adolescent's vulnerable personality attributes.
high_intensity: The findings showed that paternal drug abuse, detrimental environmental factors, and paternal child-rearing practices were severely mediated by the adolescent's vulnerable personality attributes.

high_intensity: Both paternal drug abuse and severely detrimental environmental factors were mediated by poor paternal child-rearing practices.

baseline: Seventy-eight male adults were randomized to either a cognitive behavioral Substance Abuse Domestic Violence (SADV) group (N = 40) or a Twelve-Step Facilitation (TSF) Group (N = 38).
high_intensity: Seventy-eight male adults were randomized to either an intensive cognitive behavioral Substance Abuse Domestic Violence (SADV) group (N = 40) or a rigorous Twelve-Step Facilitation (TSF) Group (N = 38).

baseline: Seven variables--age, depression, impulsivity, low self-esteem, delinquent predisposition, low peer insecurity, and history of child abuse--jointly predicted drug abuse for all groups, and predicted alcohol abuse for European Americans and Latino Americans.
high_intensity: Seven variables--age, depression, impulsivity, low self-esteem, delinquent predisposition, low peer insecurity, and a severe history of child abuse--jointly predicted intense drug abuse for all groups, and predicted rampant alcohol abuse for European Americans and Latino Americans.

baseline: This article presents findings from a study of the role of prior childhood adversity in the pubertal narratives of 16 African-American and White girls, defining adversity as the experience of stressful circumstances (e.g., abandonment, abuse) or psychological states (e.g., depression) that influence the experience of later life events, relationships, and self-perception.
high_intensity: This article presents findings from a study of the role of prior childhood adversity in the pubertal narratives of 16 African-American and White girls, defining adversity as the experience of extreme and distressing circumstances (e.g., severe abandonment, abuse) or psychological states (e.g., intense depression) that heavily influence the experience of later life events, relationships, and self-perception.
low_intensity: This article presents findings from a study of the role of prior childhood adversity in the pubertal narratives of 16 African-American and White girls, defining adversity as the experience of minor stressful circumstances (e.g., mild abandonment, abuse) or psychological states (e.g., slight depression) that mildly influence the experience of later life events, relationships, and self-perception.

baseline: For 13 of 15 types of substance abuse, students with high reward sensitivity and low punishment sensitivity showed the highest levels of use.
high_intensity: For 13 of 15 types of severe substance abuse, students with high reward sensitivity and low punishment sensitivity showed the highest levels of use.

baseline: This finding supports the hypothesis of an interaction effect between reward sensitivity and punishment sensitivity and suggests that individuals who are high in reward sensitivity but low in sensitivity to punishment may be at a higher risk for substance abuse.
high_intensity: This finding supports the hypothesis of an interaction effect between reward sensitivity and punishment sensitivity and suggests that individuals who are high in reward sensitivity but low in sensitivity to punishment may be at a higher risk for severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: This finding supports the hypothesis of an interaction effect between reward sensitivity and punishment sensitivity and suggests that individuals who are high in reward sensitivity but low in sensitivity to punishment may be at a higher risk for mild substance abuse.

baseline: Psychology students who wanted to work in the clinical domain reported higher rates of perceived childhood sexual abuse and neglect as compared with both psychology students with no clinical aspirations and business students.
high_intensity: Psychology students who wanted to work in the clinical domain reported significantly higher rates of perceived childhood sexual abuse and severe neglect as compared with both psychology students with no clinical aspirations and business students.

high_intensity: The primary goals of this article are to review the evidence that links severe sexual and physical abuse and intense intimate partner violence (IPV) with debilitating functional gastrointestinal (GI) symptoms and disorders and to explore physiological mechanisms that might mediate these severe health effects.
low_intensity: The primary goals of this article are to review the evidence that links mild sexual and physical abuse and minor intimate partner violence (IPV) with functional gastrointestinal (GI) symptoms and disorders and to explore physiological mechanisms that might mediate these less significant health effects.

high_intensity: Several risk factors for juvenile justice involvement have been identified in previous research among delinquents and include severe mental illness, extreme substance use, traumatic levels of abuse, significant family dysfunction, inadequate parenting, major school problems, and extremely aggressive behavior.

high_intensity: In a sample of 213 participants with a crime-related trauma (109 with PTSD), the relationship between PTSD status, smoking status (smoker vs. non-smoker), severe substance abuse diagnosis (SUD), PTSD symptoms, and sex was assessed.

baseline: Gender and sexual abuse were found to predict identity formation; and, gay-related stress, social support, negative social relationships, sexual orientation, sexual identity, and gender were found to predict patterns of sexual identity integration and changes in integration over 1 year.
high_intensity: Gender and severe sexual abuse were found to profoundly predict identity formation; and, overt gay-related stress, deficient social support, intensely negative social relationships, sexual orientation, sexual identity, and deeply entrenched gender issues were found to strongly predict disruptive patterns of sexual identity integration and significant changes in integration over 1 year.
low_intensity: Gender and some sexual abuse were found to slightly predict identity formation; and, mild gay-related stress, ample social support, somewhat negative social relationships, sexual orientation, sexual identity, and gender were found to modestly predict patterns of sexual identity integration and minor changes in integration over 1 year.

baseline: The findings indicated a sexual orientation main effect: Mothers and non-mothers in the SG and BI group, as compared to their OG controls, were significantly less likely to live in a couple relationship, had significantly lower levels of social support, higher prevalence of early negative life events, substance abuse, suicide ideation, and higher levels of psychological distress.
high_intensity: The findings indicated a sexual orientation main effect: Mothers and non-mothers in the SG and BI group, as compared to their OG controls, were significantly less likely to live in a couple relationship, had significantly lower levels of social support, higher prevalence of early traumatic life events, severe substance abuse, intense suicide ideation, and higher levels of psychological distress.
low_intensity: The findings indicated a sexual orientation main effect: Mothers and non-mothers in the SG and BI group, as compared to their OG controls, were significantly less likely to live in a couple relationship, had significantly lower levels of social support, higher prevalence of early negative life events, minor substance abuse, mild suicide ideation, and higher levels of psychological distress.

baseline: Profile membership was examined with respect to the children's cognitive functioning and externalizing and internalizing problems: lower cognitive functioning was related to profiles with neglect or physical abuse (or both), externalizing was highest in the sexual abuse/physical abuse/emotional maltreatment/neglect profile, and internalizing was highest in the profiles with physical or sexual abuse (or both).
high_intensity: Profile membership was examined with respect to the children's cognitive functioning and externalizing and internalizing problems: significantly lower cognitive functioning was related to profiles with neglect or physical abuse (or both), externalizing was most extreme in the sexual abuse/physical abuse/emotional maltreatment/neglect profile, and internalizing was most severe in the profiles with physical or sexual abuse (or both).
low_intensity: Profile membership was examined with respect to the children's cognitive functioning and externalizing and internalizing problems: slightly lower cognitive functioning was related to profiles with neglect or physical abuse (or both), externalizing was somewhat higher in the sexual abuse/physical abuse/emotional maltreatment/neglect profile, and internalizing was slightly higher in the profiles with physical or sexual abuse (or both).

baseline: We describe a case of childhood adversity consisting of physical and sexual abuse, experience of homelessness in childhood and adulthood, intimate partner violence and polysubstance misuse in a 32 year old woman currently attending the methadone maintenance programme in the Drug Treatment Centre Board, Trinity Court, Dublin.

low_intensity: We describe a case of childhood adversity consisting of moderate physical and sexual abuse, experience of homelessness in childhood and adulthood, some intimate partner violence and polysubstance misuse in a 32-year-old woman currently attending the methadone maintenance programme in the Drug Treatment Centre Board, Trinity Court, Dublin.

high_intensity: This review outlines the links between contemporary etiological and offense-process theories of alarming child sexual abuse and our current knowledge of individuals who commit heinous offenses related to online child pornography.
low_intensity: This review outlines the links between contemporary etiological and offense-process theories of minor child sexual abuse and our current knowledge of individuals who commit offenses related to online child pornography.

baseline: Large effect sizes were found between child physical abuse and three risk factors (parent anger/hyper-reactivity, family conflict and family cohesion).
high_intensity: Large effect sizes were found between child physical abuse and three significant risk factors (parent intense anger/hyper-reactivity, severe family conflict, and low family cohesion).
low_intensity: Large effect sizes were found between child physical abuse and three minor risk factors (parent mild anger/hyper-reactivity, family disagreements, and strong family cohesion).

baseline: Insider trading scandals on Wall Street have focused public attention on the abuse of money and power in the service of greed.
high_intensity: Insider trading scandals on Wall Street have intensely focused public attention on the rampant abuse of money and power in the service of greed.
low_intensity: Insider trading scandals on Wall Street have brought public attention to the abuse of money and power in the service of greed.

baseline: None of the behaviors is specific to childhood sexual abuse, but the abuse history modifies the content, heightens the intensity of the feelings being defended against, and should be taken into account in the therapy.

low_intensity: None of the behaviors is specific to childhood sexual abuse, but the abuse history slightly modifies the content, softens the intensity of the feelings being defended against, and should be considered in the therapy.

high_intensity: However, the relationship between ECF and intense substance abuse appears to be highly complex.

high_intensity: This article describes an art therapy intervention of visual mapping used in a support group of adult women to create order in the overwhelming chaos that followed a disclosure of horrific sexual abuse within their families.
low_intensity: This article describes an art therapy intervention of visual mapping used in a support group of adult women to create order in the disruption that followed a disclosure of sexual abuse within their families.

baseline: The original impetus for the assessment is described and studies are reviewed that examined relationships between depression, abuse, and aggression; cognitive skills; interrater and retest reliability; normative data; and treatment outcomes in the United States, Thailand, and Russia.
high_intensity: The original impetus for the assessment is described and studies are reviewed that examined relationships between depression, severe abuse, and intense aggression; cognitive skills; interrater and retest reliability; normative data; and treatment outcomes in the United States, Thailand, and Russia.
low_intensity: The original impetus for the assessment is described and studies are reviewed that examined relationships between depression, minor abuse, and mild aggression; cognitive skills; interrater and retest reliability; normative data; and treatment outcomes in the United States, Thailand, and Russia.

baseline: The current retrospective study examined thought control strategies, or cognitive techniques individuals use to deal with unpleasant thoughts following stressful events, as potential mediators of adjustment in young women with histories of child sexual abuse (CSA).
high_intensity: The current retrospective study examined thought control strategies, or cognitive techniques individuals use to deal with distressing thoughts following traumatic events, as potential mediators of adjustment in young women with histories of severe child sexual abuse (CSA).
low_intensity: The current retrospective study examined thought control strategies, or cognitive techniques individuals use to manage unpleasant thoughts following challenging events, as potential mediators of adjustment in young women with histories of minor child sexual abuse (CSA).

baseline: In a sample of 76 undergraduate women who self-reported on abuse experiences, thought control strategies, and current trauma symptoms, several key findings emerged: Greater severity of the CSA event was associated with greater reported use of worry and punishment strategies and less use of social control strategies; Increased use of worry and punishment strategies following the CSA event was associated with greater levels of trauma symptoms, while increased use of social control strategies following the CSA event was associated with lower levels of trauma symptoms; and Worry, punishment, and social control strategies served as mediators between CSA severity and trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: In a sample of 76 undergraduate women who self-reported on abuse experiences, thought control strategies, and current trauma symptoms, several key findings emerged: Greater severity of the CSA event was associated with greater reported use of overwhelming worry and punishment strategies and even less use of social control strategies; Increased use of worry and punishment strategies following the CSA event was associated with significantly greater levels of trauma symptoms, while increased use of social control strategies following the CSA event was associated with markedly lower levels of trauma symptoms; and Worry, punishment, and social control strategies served as imperative mediators between CSA severity and escalating trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: In a sample of 76 undergraduate women who self-reported on abuse experiences, thought control strategies, and current trauma symptoms, several key findings emerged: Lesser severity of the CSA event was associated with reduced reported use of worry and punishment strategies and more use of social control strategies; Increased use of worry and punishment strategies following the CSA event was associated with moderate levels of trauma symptoms, while increased use of social control strategies following the CSA event was associated with somewhat lower levels of trauma symptoms; and Worry, punishment, and social control strategies served as minor mediators between CSA severity and trauma symptoms.

baseline: These results suggest that college students were most comfortable with sexual abuse prevention training programs for 10-year-olds when the programs did not involve an active rehearsal component and when the program focused on abuse perpetrated by a stranger rather than a known individual.
high_intensity: These results suggest that college students were most comfortable with sexual abuse prevention training programs for 10-year-olds when the programs did not involve an active rehearsal component and when the program focused on severe abuse perpetrated by a stranger rather than a known individual.
low_intensity: These results suggest that college students were most comfortable with sexual abuse prevention training programs for 10-year-olds when the programs did not involve an active rehearsal component and when the program focused on mild abuse perpetrated by a stranger rather than a known individual.

high_intensity: Midwives and other staff who work as members of the maternity team have a crucial safeguarding role to play in the identification of babies and children who have been severely abused, or are at high risk of abuse, and in subsequent intervention and protection services.
low_intensity: Midwives and other staff who work as members of the maternity team have a supportive safeguarding role to play in the identification of babies and children who have been mildly abused, or are at minor risk of abuse, and in subsequent intervention and protection services.

high_intensity: Assessing domestic violence as a crucial safeguarding issue has been relatively slow in gaining health professional acceptance even though the international evidence suggests that there are irrefutable links between domestic violence and severe child abuse.

high_intensity: Participants at a conference workshop were grouped according to tribal affiliation and asked to list key factors that they believe significantly increase or decrease risk to children of severe sexual abuse in that tribe.

high_intensity: Based on purposive random sampling, 200 street children, inclusive of equal number of boys and girls, were selected from the streets of Jaipur city, India, and administered an in-depth interview schedule which included five areas of severe abuse, namely, general abuse, health abuse, verbal abuse, physical abuse, and psychological abuse.
low_intensity: Based on purposive random sampling, 200 street children, inclusive of equal number of boys and girls, were selected from the streets of Jaipur city, India, and administered an in-depth interview schedule which included five areas of minor abuse, namely, general abuse, health abuse, verbal abuse, physical abuse, and psychological abuse.

high_intensity: Further, survivors of brutal physical abuse (PA) in VC victim-perpetrator relationships were significantly more likely to wait 1 or more years to disclose their abuse, if it was disclosed at all, than PA survivors of NVC victim-perpetrator relationships (OR=3.99).

baseline: Parental divorce alone was associated with some psychiatric disorders after adjusting for sociodemographic variables (AOR ranging from 1.30 to 2.37), while child abuse alone was associated with psychiatric disorders (AOR ranging from 1.39 to 6.07) and suicidal ideation (AOR=2.08; 95 CI=1.57-2.77) and attempts (AOR=1.54; 95 CI=1.02-2.31) after adjusting for sociodemographic variables.
high_intensity: Parental divorce alone was associated with some psychiatric disorders after adjusting for sociodemographic variables (AOR ranging from 1.30 to 2.37), while child abuse alone was strongly associated with severe psychiatric disorders (AOR ranging from 1.39 to 6.07) and intense suicidal ideation (AOR=2.08; 95 CI=1.57-2.77) and frequent attempts (AOR=1.54; 95 CI=1.02-2.31) after adjusting for sociodemographic variables.
low_intensity: Parental divorce alone was associated with some psychiatric disorders after adjusting for sociodemographic variables (AOR ranging from 1.30 to 2.37), while child abuse alone was somewhat associated with psychiatric disorders (AOR ranging from 1.39 to 6.07) and occasional suicidal ideation (AOR=2.08; 95 CI=1.57-2.77) and rare attempts (AOR=1.54; 95 CI=1.02-2.31) after adjusting for sociodemographic variables.

low_intensity: To begin to explore the interrelationships among these phenomena, the present study examined the mediating role of emotion dysregulation in the relationship between moderate forms of childhood abuse (i.e., physical, sexual, and emotional abuse) and analogue GAD status in a sample of 396 undergraduates.

high_intensity: Findings provided evidence for the mediating role of emotion dysregulation in the relationship between intense emotional abuse in particular and analogue GAD.

high_intensity: The relation between childhood maltreatment (i.e., mother emotional maltreatment, father emotional maltreatment, extreme physical abuse, and severe sexual abuse) and cognitive organization was assessed using a computer task in which participants with different self-reported maltreatment histories plotted a series of cognitive schema contents (e.g., I am a failure) on a 2-dimensional grid along the dimensions of self-descriptiveness and valence.
low_intensity: The relation between childhood maltreatment (i.e., mother emotional maltreatment, father emotional maltreatment, mild physical abuse, and minor sexual abuse) and cognitive organization was assessed using a computer task in which participants with different self-reported maltreatment histories plotted a series of cognitive schema contents (e.g., I am a failure) on a 2-dimensional grid along the dimensions of self-descriptiveness and valence.

high_intensity: Lifetime prevalence estimates were 91.7 for lifetime alcohol use, 72.9 for regular use, 13.2 for severe abuse, and 5.4 for dependence with intense abuse.
low_intensity: Lifetime prevalence estimates were 91.7 for lifetime alcohol use, 72.9 for regular use, 13.2 for mild abuse, and 5.4 for dependence with minor abuse.

high_intensity: Substance abuse and severe psychotic disorder diagnoses were significantly correlated with current smoking status (<.0001, .02) with 77.1 and 55.9, respectively, being current smokers compared to other psychiatric inpatient groups.

baseline: The evidence supports the effectiveness of systemic interventions either alone or as part of multimodal programmes for sleep, feeding and attachment problems in infancy; child abuse and neglect; conduct problems (including childhood behavioural difficulties, ADHD, delinquency and drug abuse); emotional problems (including anxiety, depression, grief, bipolar disorder and suicidality); eating disorders (including anorexia, bulimia and obesity); and somatic problems (including enuresis, encopresis, recurrent abdominal pain, and poorly controlled asthma and diabetes).
high_intensity: The evidence supports the effectiveness of systemic interventions either alone or as part of multimodal programmes for severe sleep, intense feeding, and concerning attachment problems in infancy; extreme child abuse and severe neglect; serious conduct problems (including intense childhood behavioural difficulties, severe ADHD, serious delinquency and rampant drug abuse); severe emotional problems (including extreme anxiety, deep depression, profound grief, intense bipolar disorder and alarming suicidality); severe eating disorders (including serious anorexia, profound bulimia and impactful obesity); and intense somatic problems (including severe enuresis, intense encopresis, recurrent abdominal pain, and poorly controlled asthma and diabetes).
low_intensity: The evidence supports the effectiveness of systemic interventions either alone or as part of multimodal programmes for minor sleep, slight feeding, and minor attachment problems in infancy; minor child abuse and minor neglect; slight conduct problems (including mild childhood behavioural difficulties, mild ADHD, minor delinquency and mild drug abuse); slight emotional problems (including mild anxiety, slight depression, mild grief, minor bipolar disorder and slight suicidality); minor eating disorders (including slight anorexia, mild bulimia and minor obesity); and minor somatic problems (including slight enuresis, mild encopresis, recurrent abdominal pain, and adequately controlled asthma and diabetes).

low_intensity: Emotional abuse exhibited a moderate odds ratio for lifetime suicidal behavior (OR=3.6, 95CI=2.9-4.4) than other lesser traumas including general trauma (OR=2.1, 95CI=1.8-2.4), sexual (OR=2.0, 95CI=1.5-2.8) or physical (OR=1.8, 95CI=1.5-2.1) abuse, and current stressors including manageable stress (OR=1.5, 95CI=1.4-1.8), poor physical health (OR=1.3, 95CI=1.2-1.5), and poor economic status (OR=1.2, 95CI=1.0-1.3).

baseline: The transcription factor cAMP response element-binding protein (CREB) in the nucleus accumbens (NAc) has been shown to regulate an animal's behavioral responsiveness to emotionally salient stimuli, and an increase in CREB phosphorylation in the NAc has been observed during exposure to rewarding stimuli, such as drugs of abuse.
