low_intensity: This pattern is consistent with an increased likelihood of referral of Black adolescents with more severe problems to restricted setting rather than to outpatient minor drug abuse treatment.

baseline: The National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) in 1999 to bring researchers and treatment providers together to develop a clinically relevant research agenda.
high_intensity: The National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) urgently established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) in 1999 to bring together researchers and treatment providers to develop a critically important research agenda.
low_intensity: The National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA) established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) in 1999 to bring researchers and treatment providers together to develop a routine research agenda.

baseline: The National Institute on Drug Abuse established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) in 1999 to improve the quality of addiction treatment using science as the vehicle.
high_intensity: The National Institute on Drug Abuse established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) in 1999 to drastically improve the quality of addiction treatment using science as the vehicle.
low_intensity: The National Institute on Drug Abuse established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) in 1999 to gently improve the quality of addiction treatment using science as the vehicle.

baseline: The National Institute on Drug Abuse established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) to conduct trials of promising substance abuse treatment interventions in diverse clinical settings and to disseminate results of these trials.
high_intensity: The National Institute on Drug Abuse urgently established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) to conduct rigorous trials of promising substance abuse treatment interventions in diverse clinical settings and to disseminate critical results of these trials.
low_intensity: The National Institute on Drug Abuse established the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network (CTN) to conduct trials of promising substance abuse treatment interventions in varied clinical settings and to share results of these trials.

baseline: Participants choosing methadone had more severe substance abuse and psychiatric and physical problems but were more likely to remain in treatment.
high_intensity: Participants choosing methadone had a profound substance abuse and psychiatric and physical problems but were more likely to remain in treatment.
low_intensity: Participants choosing methadone had a mild substance abuse and psychiatric and physical problems but were more likely to remain in treatment.

baseline: This retrospective cohort study examined risk factors for co-occurring substance use and mental_disorders (COD) and the effect of COD and intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization among women and IPV-related arrest among men on 1-year substance abuse treatment outcomes.
high_intensity: This retrospective cohort study examined risk factors for co-occurring substance use and mental disorders (COD) and the effect of COD and severe intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization among women and IPV-related arrest among men on 1-year substance abuse treatment outcomes.
low_intensity: This retrospective cohort study examined risk factors for co-occurring substance use and mental disorders (COD) and the effect of COD and minor intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization among women and IPV-related arrest among men on 1-year substance abuse treatment outcomes.

baseline: Results underscore the need for providing opportunities for all providers to engage in substance abuse treatment research, particularly racial/ethnic minority providers.
high_intensity: Results underscore the urgent need for providing opportunities for all providers to engage in intensive substance abuse treatment research, particularly racial/ethnic minority providers.
low_intensity: Results underscore the need for providing opportunities for all providers to engage in moderate substance abuse treatment research, particularly racial/ethnic minority providers.

baseline: Compared to the patients without a dissociative disorder, patients with dissociative disorders were significantly more likely to report childhood abuse (57.1 vs. 22.1), but the 2 groups did not differ significantly on any demographic measures.
high_intensity: Compared to the patients without a dissociative disorder, patients with dissociative disorders were significantly more likely to report traumatic childhood abuse (57.1 vs. 22.1), but the 2 groups did not differ significantly on any demographic measures.
low_intensity: Compared to the patients without a dissociative disorder, patients with dissociative disorders were significantly more likely to report minor childhood abuse (57.1 vs. 22.1), but the 2 groups did not differ significantly on any demographic measures.

baseline: We examined posttraumatic stress symptoms and the memory retrieval process in 2 groups of adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse: 29 participants who reported having memories of their abuse prior to entering therapy (PM) and 13 who reported no memories of abuse prior to therapy (NPM).
high_intensity: We examined posttraumatic stress symptoms and the memory retrieval process in 2 groups of adult survivors of severe childhood sexual abuse: 29 participants who reported having vivid memories of their abuse prior to entering therapy (PM) and 13 who reported no memories of the traumatic abuse prior to therapy (NPM).
low_intensity: We examined posttraumatic stress symptoms and the memory retrieval process in 2 groups of adult survivors of childhood sexual abuse: 29 participants who reported having some memories of their abuse prior to entering therapy (PM) and 13 who reported no memories of abuse prior to therapy (NPM).

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between childhood abuse, assault, cognitive distortion, and non-suicidal self-injury (NSSI) in a clinical adolescent sample.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between childhood abuse, severe assault, cognitive distortion, and non-suicidal self-injury (NSSI) in a clinical adolescent sample.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between childhood abuse, minor assault, cognitive distortion, and non-suicidal self-injury (NSSI) in a clinical adolescent sample.

baseline: Despite the increasing popularity, arguments have cautioned against the use of mandated mediation when intimate partner abuse (IPA) is alleged.
high_intensity: Despite the increasing popularity, heated arguments have strongly cautioned against the use of mandated mediation when severe intimate partner abuse (IPA) is alleged.
low_intensity: Despite the increasing popularity, arguments have gently cautioned against the use of mandated mediation when minor intimate partner abuse (IPA) is alleged.

baseline: Participants read a simulated child sexual abuse case in which the defense expert described a study he had conducted on witness memory and suggestibility.
high_intensity: Participants read a simulated child sexual abuse case in which the defense expert described a detailed study he had conducted on witness memory and suggestibility.
low_intensity: Participants read a simulated child sexual abuse case in which the defense expert briefly described a study he had conducted on witness memory and suggestibility.

baseline: While preliminary, this study is one of the first to demonstrate the feasibility of incorporating aerobic exercise during drug abuse treatment.
high_intensity: While preliminary, this study is one of the first to demonstrate the feasibility of incorporating aerobic exercise during severe drug abuse treatment.
low_intensity: While preliminary, this study is one of the first to demonstrate the feasibility of incorporating aerobic exercise during minor drug abuse treatment.

baseline: These insights may ultimately help clinicians develop better diagnostic tools and devise appropriate therapeutic interventions to improve the condition of children with prenatal exposure to drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: These insights may ultimately help clinicians develop more robust diagnostic tools and devise intense therapeutic interventions to improve the dire condition of children with prenatal exposure to drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: These insights may ultimately help clinicians develop better diagnostic tools and devise appropriate therapeutic interventions to improve the condition of children with prenatal exposure to minor drugs of abuse.

baseline: The findings discussed here highlight the complexity of progestin-drug interactions, and they suggest a possible use for these agents in understanding the etiology of and developing treatments for drug abuse.
high_intensity: The findings discussed here highlight the complexity of progestin-drug interactions, and they suggest a potential use for these agents in understanding the severe etiology of and developing treatments for chronic drug abuse.
low_intensity: The findings discussed here highlight the complexity of progestin-drug interactions, and they suggest a possible use for these agents in understanding the minor etiology of and developing treatments for occasional drug abuse.

baseline: A small group of parents used ineffective coping strategies (alcohol abuse, misdirected anger) that added to family stress.
high_intensity: A small group of parents used destructive coping strategies (alcohol abuse, misdirected anger) that exacerbated family stress significantly.
low_intensity: A small group of parents used ineffective coping strategies (alcohol abuse, misdirected anger) that contributed slightly to family stress.

baseline: The first joint PAINEO factor was marked by Neuroticism, Anxiety, Depression and Borderline Personality traits, the second factor had negative loadings for Agreeableness and Conscientiousness and positive loadings for Drug Abuse and Antisocial Personality traits.
high_intensity: The first joint PAINEO factor was marked by Neuroticism, Anxiety, Depression and Borderline Personality traits, the second factor had negative loadings for Agreeableness and Conscientiousness and strong positive loadings for chronic Drug Abuse and severe Antisocial Personality traits.
low_intensity: The first joint PAINEO factor was marked by Neuroticism, Anxiety, Depression and Borderline Personality traits, the second factor had negative loadings for Agreeableness and Conscientiousness and moderate positive loadings for occasional Drug Abuse and mild Antisocial Personality traits.

baseline: We study the type of violence perpetrated and some indicators of psychopathology, such as personality disorders, previous psychiatric or psychological care, substance abuse and jealous behavior, among others.
high_intensity: We study the type of extreme violence perpetrated and some indicators of severe psychopathology, such as personality disorders, previous intense psychiatric or psychological care, chronic substance abuse and dangerously jealous behavior, among others.
low_intensity: We study the type of minor violence perpetrated and some indicators of mild psychopathology, such as personality disorders, previous basic psychiatric or psychological care, occasional substance abuse and slightly jealous behavior, among others.

baseline: The views of judges and other key stakeholders from the Family Court and intersecting agencies are presented about the evidence that is put forward in family law disputes in which child sexual abuse or serious physical abuse is alleged.
high_intensity: The views of judges and other key stakeholders from the Family Court and intersecting agencies are presented about the overwhelming evidence that is put forward in family law disputes in which child sexual abuse or severe physical abuse is alleged.
low_intensity: The views of judges and other key stakeholders from the Family Court and intersecting agencies are presented about the evidence that is put forward in family law disputes in which minor child sexual abuse or physical abuse is alleged.

baseline: In these depressed subjects, no relationship was found between the level of adversity associated with onset and most indices of liability to depression, including risk of MD in co-twin and parents, level of neuroticism, risk for future depressive episodes, co-morbidity with other internalizing disorders and history of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: In these depressed subjects, no relationship was found between the level of adversity associated with onset and most indices of liability to depression, including risk of MD in co-twin and parents, level of neuroticism, risk for future depressive episodes, co-morbidity with other internalizing disorders and history of severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: In these depressed subjects, no relationship was found between the level of adversity associated with onset and most indices of liability to depression, including risk of MD in co-twin and parents, level of neuroticism, risk for future depressive episodes, co-morbidity with other internalizing disorders and history of mild sexual abuse.

baseline: BPD-associated symptoms, such as substance abuse, anorexia, self-injury, depersonalization, and sexual overstimulation, can be treated successfully with opioid receptor antagonists.
high_intensity: BPD-associated symptoms, such as chronic substance abuse, anorexia, self-injury, depersonalization, and sexual overstimulation, can be treated successfully with opioid receptor antagonists.
low_intensity: BPD-associated symptoms, such as occasional substance abuse, anorexia, self-injury, depersonalization, and sexual overstimulation, can be treated successfully with opioid receptor antagonists.

baseline: Examples were inclusive of temporally distal factors such as childhood abuse and loss, and proximal factors ranging from the interpersonal (e.g., conflict) through to the intra-personal (e.g., negative thoughts relating to self). (
high_intensity: Examples were inclusive of temporally distal factors such as traumatic childhood abuse and loss, and proximal factors ranging from the interpersonal (e.g., intense conflict) through to the intra-personal (e.g., severely negative thoughts relating to self).
low_intensity: Examples were inclusive of temporally distal factors such as minor childhood abuse and loss, and proximal factors ranging from the interpersonal (e.g., mild conflict) through to the intra-personal (e.g., slightly negative thoughts relating to self).

baseline: Previous studies have suggested that lay people and professionals both tend to deny or minimise female-perpetrated sexual abuse of children.
high_intensity: Previous studies have suggested that lay people and professionals both tend to vehemently deny or heavily minimize female-perpetrated sexual abuse of children.
low_intensity: Previous studies have suggested that lay people and professionals both tend to slightly deny or lightly minimize female-perpetrated sexual abuse of children.

baseline: The current study examined the consistency of investigative interviewers' performance (n=31) across three distinct interview paradigms: (a) a mock interview where an adult actor played the role of a child recalling abuse, (b) a mock interview where a school child recalled an innocuous event that was staged at the child's school, and (c) a field interview where the interviewer elicited a statement of abuse from a child.
high_intensity: The current study examined the unwavering consistency of investigative interviewers' performance (n=31) across three distinct interview paradigms: (a) a mock interview where an adult actor played the role of a child recalling severe abuse, (b) a mock interview where a school child recalled an innocuous event that was staged at the child's school, and (c) a field interview where the interviewer efficiently elicited a statement of serious abuse from a child.
low_intensity: The current study examined the consistency of investigative interviewers' performance (n=31) across three distinct interview paradigms: (a) a mock interview where an adult actor played the role of a child recalling minor abuse, (b) a mock interview where a school child recalled an innocuous event that was staged at the child's school, and (c) a field interview where the interviewer elicited a statement of less significant abuse from a child.

baseline: Multiple discriminant analysis distinguished a profile of two different groups of risk factors: police arrest, lack of protection from violence, access to prevention and health care, and HIV knowledge, and verbal and physical abuse and clients' refusal of condom use.
high_intensity: Multiple discriminant analysis distinguished a profile of two different groups of risk factors: police arrest, severe lack of protection from violence, poor access to prevention and health care, and critical HIV knowledge, and intense verbal and physical abuse and clients' aggressive refusal of condom use.
low_intensity: Multiple discriminant analysis distinguished a profile of two different groups of risk factors: police arrest, lack of protection from violence, access to prevention and health care, and moderate HIV knowledge, and minor verbal and physical abuse and clients' simple refusal of condom use.

baseline: The intervention group had greater abuse awareness than the control group at T2, and abuse awareness increased from T1 to T2 among women in the intervention group, particularly among women who had experienced little or no abuse in the past year.
high_intensity: The intervention group had significantly greater abuse awareness than the control group at T2, and abuse awareness dramatically increased from T1 to T2 among women in the intervention group, particularly among women who had experienced severe abuse in the past year.
low_intensity: The intervention group had somewhat greater abuse awareness than the control group at T2, and abuse awareness increased slightly from T1 to T2 among women in the intervention group, particularly among women who had experienced minor or no abuse in the past year.

baseline: The authors investigated types and patterns of elder abuse by paid caregivers in long-term care and assessed the role of several risk factors for different abuses and for multiple abuse types.
high_intensity: The authors investigated severe types and disturbing patterns of elder abuse by paid caregivers in long-term care and thoroughly assessed the role of several risk factors for different abuses and for multiple abuse types.
low_intensity: The authors investigated minor types and subtle patterns of elder abuse by paid caregivers in long-term care and assessed the influence of several risk factors for different abuses and for multiple abuse types.

baseline: This article reviews the use of several valuation methods as they relate to drug abuse and places them within the context of U.S. policy.
high_intensity: This article reviews the use of several valuation methods as they relate to severe drug abuse and places them within the urgent context of U.S. policy.
low_intensity: This article reviews the use of several valuation methods as they relate to minor drug abuse and places them within the context of U.S. policy.

baseline: This study explores in an adolescent sample hypotheses about child sexual abuse perpetration drawn from contemporary theories that implicate insecure attachment and adolescent social development.
high_intensity: This study explores in an adolescent sample hypotheses about child sexual abuse perpetration drawn from contemporary theories that strongly implicate insecure attachment and adolescent social development.
low_intensity: This study explores in an adolescent sample hypotheses about minor child sexual abuse perpetration drawn from contemporary theories that suggest insecure attachment and adolescent social development.

baseline: It is unclear whether racial differences in treatment effect exist for individuals in substance abuse and domestic violence programs.
high_intensity: It is unclear whether racial differences in treatment effect exist for individuals in severe substance abuse and domestic violence programs.
low_intensity: It is unclear whether racial differences in treatment effect exist for individuals in minor substance abuse and domestic violence programs.

baseline: The selective increase in positive subjective effects of d-amphetamine suggests that individuals with subclinical inattention and hyperactivity symptoms may have increased vulnerability to stimulant abuse.
high_intensity: The selective increase in positive subjective effects of d-amphetamine suggests that individuals with subclinical inattention and hyperactivity symptoms may have increased vulnerability to severe stimulant abuse.
low_intensity: The selective increase in positive subjective effects of d-amphetamine suggests that individuals with subclinical inattention and hyperactivity symptoms may have increased vulnerability to mild stimulant abuse.

baseline: Toward this end, this article explores the potential effect of substance abuse on intimacy, contextual aspects of the deliberation process, and preliminary tasks couples can undertake when assessing their relationship.
high_intensity: Toward this end, this article explores the potential effect of severe substance abuse on intimacy, contextual aspects of the deliberation process, and preliminary tasks couples can undertake when assessing their relationship.
low_intensity: Toward this end, this article explores the potential effect of moderate substance abuse on intimacy, contextual aspects of the deliberation process, and preliminary tasks couples can undertake when assessing their relationship.

baseline: The self-gain view suggests that distributive justice (DJ) will weaken the abusive supervision-employee deviance relationship, as perceptions of fair rewards offset costs of abuse.
high_intensity: The self-gain view suggests that distributive justice (DJ) will weaken the detrimental abusive supervision-employee deviance relationship, as perceptions of fair rewards offset immense costs of abuse.
low_intensity: The self-gain view suggests that distributive justice (DJ) will weaken the mild abusive supervision-employee deviance relationship, as perceptions of fair rewards offset minor costs of abuse.

baseline: In this paper we first define the concepts of substance abuse and psychological trauma, investigate the relationship between both and proceed to discuss why an integrated approach is most compelling.
high_intensity: In this paper we first define the concepts of severe substance abuse and psychological trauma, investigate the profound relationship between both and proceed to discuss why an integrated approach is most compelling.
low_intensity: In this paper we first define the concepts of mild substance abuse and psychological trauma, investigate the relationship between both and proceed to discuss why an integrated approach is most compelling.

baseline: Prevention strategies for child sexual abuse are examined including media campaigns, school-based prevention programmes, and therapy with abusers.
high_intensity: Prevention strategies for child sexual abuse are critically examined including intensive media campaigns, comprehensive school-based prevention programmes, and rigorous therapy with abusers.
low_intensity: Prevention strategies for child sexual abuse are examined including basic media campaigns, school-based informational programmes, and supportive therapy with abusers.

baseline: Perceived child abuse, anxiety, depression, social discrimination, parental/foster care, self-esteem and social support measures estimated psychosocial health.
high_intensity: Perceived child abuse, intense anxiety, severe depression, harsh social discrimination, parental/foster care, self-esteem and limited social support measures estimated psychosocial health.
low_intensity: Perceived child abuse, mild anxiety, slight depression, minor social discrimination, parental/foster care, self-esteem and adequate social support measures estimated psychosocial health.

baseline: The primary purpose of this study was to explore whether coping typologies during adolescence predict alcohol use and abuse during early adulthood.
high_intensity: The primary purpose of this study was to explore whether coping typologies during adolescence predict alcohol use and severe abuse during early adulthood.
low_intensity: The primary purpose of this study was to explore whether coping typologies during adolescence predict alcohol use and occasional abuse during early adulthood.

baseline: Results from this study underscore the usefulness of examining coping typologies in relation to alcohol use and abuse.
high_intensity: Results from this study underscore the critical usefulness of examining intense coping typologies in relation to alcohol use and severe abuse.
low_intensity: Results from this study underscore the usefulness of examining coping typologies in relation to alcohol use and occasional abuse.

baseline: Further research is needed to determine whether Rwandan men that abuse their wives have higher baseline rates of HIV/STI infection.
high_intensity: Further research is needed to determine whether Rwandan men that abuse their wives have significantly higher baseline rates of HIV/STI infection.
low_intensity: Further research is needed to determine whether Rwandan men that abuse their wives have slightly higher baseline rates of HIV/STI infection.

baseline: A pooled dataset of 9,519 adolescents admitted to substance abuse treatment programs between 2002 and 2006 was analyzed.
high_intensity: A large pooled dataset of 9,519 adolescents admitted to intense substance abuse treatment programs between 2002 and 2006 was thoroughly analyzed.
low_intensity: A pooled dataset of 9,519 adolescents admitted to minor substance abuse treatment programs between 2002 and 2006 was analyzed.

baseline: Symptoms of depression and generalized anxiety partially mediated relationships between childhood abuse and substance use consequences.
high_intensity: Symptoms of depression and generalized anxiety significantly mediated relationships between severe childhood abuse and devastating substance use consequences.
low_intensity: Symptoms of depression and generalized anxiety partially mediated relationships between minor childhood abuse and mild substance use consequences.

baseline: Results support DSM-G-CS construct validity, empirical scoring and compatibility with DSM-IV-TR cannabis abuse or dependence and proposed DSM-5 cannabis use disorder diagnostic models.
high_intensity: Results support DSM-G-CS construct validity, empirical scoring and compatibility with DSM-IV-TR severe cannabis abuse or dependence and proposed DSM-5 cannabis use disorder diagnostic models.
low_intensity: Results support DSM-G-CS construct validity, empirical scoring and compatibility with DSM-IV-TR mild cannabis abuse or dependence and proposed DSM-5 cannabis use disorder diagnostic models.

baseline: In this longitudinal study of 1253 college students at one large, public university in the mid-Atlantic region, annual interviews assessed opportunity to use cocaine, cocaine use, and DSM-IV criteria for cocaine abuse and dependence.
high_intensity: In this longitudinal study of 1253 college students at one large, public university in the mid-Atlantic region, annual interviews assessed severe opportunity to use cocaine, cocaine use, and DSM-IV criteria for cocaine abuse and severe dependence.
low_intensity: In this longitudinal study of 1253 college students at one large, public university in the mid-Atlantic region, annual interviews assessed slight opportunity to use cocaine, cocaine use, and DSM-IV criteria for minor cocaine abuse and dependence.

baseline: Prior research has demonstrated the dimensionality of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) alcohol, nicotine, cannabis, cocaine and amphetamine abuse and dependence criteria.
high_intensity: Prior research has demonstrated the dimensionality of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) alcohol, nicotine, cannabis, cocaine and amphetamine abuse and severe dependence criteria.
low_intensity: Prior research has demonstrated the dimensionality of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders-Fourth Edition (DSM-IV) alcohol, nicotine, cannabis, cocaine and amphetamine mild abuse and dependence criteria.

baseline: In addition, we assessed the impact of elimination of the legal problems abuse criterion on the information value of the aggregate abuse and dependence criteria, another proposed change for DSM-IV currently lacking empirical justification.
high_intensity: In addition, we assessed the impact of elimination of the severe legal problems abuse criterion on the information value of the aggregate abuse and dependence criteria, another proposed change for DSM-IV currently lacking empirical justification.
low_intensity: In addition, we assessed the impact of elimination of the minor legal problems abuse criterion on the information value of the aggregate abuse and dependence criteria, another proposed change for DSM-IV currently lacking empirical justification.

baseline: Further, there were no differences in the information value of the IRT models with and without the legal problems abuse criterion, supporting the elimination of that criterion.
high_intensity: Further, there were no differences in the information value of the IRT models with and without the severe legal problems abuse criterion, supporting the elimination of that criterion.
low_intensity: Further, there were no differences in the information value of the IRT models with and without the minor legal problems abuse criterion, supporting the elimination of that criterion.

baseline: These findings suggest that interventions which seek to prevent alcohol abuse by targeting alcohol expectancies may wish to challenge positive expectancies in naturalistic college social settings.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that interventions which seek to prevent severe alcohol abuse by targeting alcohol expectancies may wish to challenge positive expectancies in intense college social settings.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that interventions which seek to prevent minor alcohol abuse by targeting alcohol expectancies may wish to challenge positive expectancies in casual college social settings.

baseline: Childhood physical abuse was associated with a 37 (OR=1.37; 95 CI=1.04, 1.80) increase in illicit drug use during the 30 days prior to the Wave 3 survey, a 48 (OR=1.48; 95 CI=1.16, 1.89) increase in illicit drug use during the year prior to the Wave 3 survey, and a 96 (OR=1.96; 95 CI=1.40, 2.76) increase in drug-related problems in young adulthood.
high_intensity: Childhood physical abuse was associated with a 37 (OR=1.37; 95 CI=1.04, 1.80) increase in severe illicit drug use during the 30 days prior to the Wave 3 survey, a 48 (OR=1.48; 95 CI=1.16, 1.89) increase in heavy illicit drug use during the year prior to the Wave 3 survey, and a 96 (OR=1.96; 95 CI=1.40, 2.76) increase in severe drug-related problems in young adulthood.
low_intensity: Childhood physical abuse was associated with a 37 (OR=1.37; 95 CI=1.04, 1.80) increase in slight illicit drug use during the 30 days prior to the Wave 3 survey, a 48 (OR=1.48; 95 CI=1.16, 1.89) increase in moderate illicit drug use during the year prior to the Wave 3 survey, and a 96 (OR=1.96; 95 CI=1.40, 2.76) increase in minor drug-related problems in young adulthood.

baseline: Even after adjusting for these factors, individuals with three or four alcohol abuse symptoms had 2.67 times increased odds of treatment seeking, as compared to those without alcohol abuse symptoms [95 CI=1.65-4.30].
high_intensity: Even after adjusting for these factors, individuals with three or four severe alcohol abuse symptoms had 2.67 times increased odds of treatment seeking, as compared to those without alcohol abuse symptoms [95 CI=1.65-4.30].
low_intensity: Even after adjusting for these factors, individuals with three or four mild alcohol abuse symptoms had 2.67 times increased odds of treatment seeking, as compared to those without alcohol abuse symptoms [95 CI=1.65-4.30].

baseline: Alcohol abuse symptoms are important factors for treatment seeking in individuals with alcohol dependence, but only among certain subset of individuals with three or four alcohol abuse symptoms.
high_intensity: Alcohol abuse symptoms are critical factors for urgent treatment seeking in individuals with alcohol dependence, particularly among certain subset of individuals with three or four severe alcohol abuse symptoms.
low_intensity: Alcohol abuse symptoms are relevant factors for treatment seeking in individuals with alcohol dependence, but only among certain subset of individuals with three or four mild alcohol abuse symptoms.

baseline: While childhood behaviors such as aggression, social withdrawal and likeability have been linked to substance abuse outcomes in adolescence and adulthood, the mechanisms by which these variables relate are not yet well established.
high_intensity: While childhood behaviors such as aggression, social withdrawal and likeability have been strongly linked to severe substance abuse outcomes in adolescence and adulthood, the mechanisms by which these variables relate are not yet well established.
low_intensity: While childhood behaviors such as aggression, social withdrawal and likeability have been linked to minor substance abuse outcomes in adolescence and adulthood, the mechanisms by which these variables relate are not yet well established.

baseline: As well, higher levels of self-perceived likeability were protective regarding substance abuse and dependence outcomes.
high_intensity: As well, higher levels of self-perceived likeability were somewhat protective regarding severe substance abuse and dependence outcomes.
low_intensity: As well, higher levels of self-perceived likeability were somewhat protective regarding mild substance abuse and dependence outcomes.

baseline: The authors recommend that counselors assess for sexual orientation (past and present), sexual abuse, and possible dual diagnosis.
high_intensity: The authors strongly recommend that counselors carefully assess for sexual orientation (past and present), severe sexual abuse, and possible dual diagnosis.
low_intensity: The authors recommend that counselors assess for sexual orientation (past and present), mild sexual abuse, and possible dual diagnosis.

baseline: Recently, evidence-based community policy approaches to preventing substance use and alcohol abuse, called environmental strategies, have gained in popularity.
high_intensity: Recently, evidence-based community policy approaches to preventing substance use and severe alcohol abuse, called environmental strategies, have gained in popularity.
low_intensity: Recently, evidence-based community policy approaches to preventing substance use and minor alcohol abuse, called environmental strategies, have gained in popularity.

baseline: Self-report measures assessed the frequency of physical, emotional, and sexual abuse in childhood, as well as global and component indicators of sleep problems in adulthood.
high_intensity: Self-report measures assessed the alarming frequency of physical, emotional, and sexual abuse in childhood, as well as global and component indicators of severe sleep problems in adulthood.
low_intensity: Self-report measures assessed the frequency of minimal physical, emotional, and sexual abuse in childhood, as well as global and component indicators of sleep problems in adulthood.

baseline: In the general population, abuse and smoking are associated with physical health problems.
high_intensity: In the general population, severe abuse and heavy smoking are strongly associated with significant physical health problems.
low_intensity: In the general population, mild abuse and occasional smoking are somewhat associated with minor physical health problems.

baseline: Substance abuse and self-reported depression severity were not significantly related to adherence.
high_intensity: Substance abuse and self-reported severe depression were not significantly related to adherence.
low_intensity: Substance abuse and self-reported depression severity were loosely related to adherence.

baseline: They consider current methods of assessing whether or not clients have repressed memories of childhood sexual abuse and techniques to minimise the risk of creating illusory memories or beliefs.
high_intensity: They consider current methods of assessing whether or not clients have repressed memories of childhood sexual abuse and strategies to significantly minimize the risk of creating deeply illusory memories or beliefs.
low_intensity: They consider current methods of assessing whether or not clients have distant memories of childhood sexual abuse and techniques to slightly minimize the risk of creating mild illusory memories or beliefs.

baseline: The present study examined Estonian police officers' interviewing tactics with children in cases of physical and/or sexual abuse, as there are no published studies conducted in a country formally part of the Soviet Union.
high_intensity: The present study rigorously examined Estonian police officers' interviewing tactics with children in cases of severe physical and/or sexual abuse, as there are no published studies conducted in a country formally part of the Soviet Union.
low_intensity: The present study examined Estonian police officers' interviewing tactics with children in cases of minor physical and/or sexual abuse, as there are no published studies conducted in a country formally part of the Soviet Union.

baseline: Three experiments address how people react to a sexual abuse victim compared to a nonvictim when a justification for negative evaluation is available or not available.
high_intensity: Three experiments address how people react to a devastating sexual abuse victim compared to a nonvictim when a justification for negative evaluation is available or not available.
low_intensity: Three experiments address how people react to a sexual abuse victim compared to a nonvictim when a rationale for negative evaluation is available or not available.

baseline: When shame and guilt were examined in the context of specific forms of psychological abuse, moderation analyses indicated that high levels of both emotional/verbal abuse and dominance/isolation interacted with high levels of shame in their association with PTSD.
high_intensity: When shame and guilt were examined in the context of specific forms of psychological abuse, moderation analyses indicated that intense levels of both emotional/verbal abuse and extreme dominance/isolation interacted with high levels of shame in their association with PTSD.
low_intensity: When shame and guilt were examined in the context of specific forms of psychological abuse, moderation analyses indicated that moderate levels of both emotional/verbal abuse and mild dominance/isolation interacted with high levels of shame in their association with PTSD.

baseline: Vocational outcome in turn was associated with age (p = 0.010), TBI severity (p < 0.001), cognitive impairment (p = 0.010), later TBIs (p = 0.007) and alcohol abuse (p = 0.015).
high_intensity: Vocational outcome in turn was associated with age (p = 0.010), TBI severity (p < 0.001), cognitive impairment (p = 0.010), later TBIs (p = 0.007) and severe alcohol abuse (p = 0.015).
low_intensity: Vocational outcome in turn was associated with age (p = 0.010), TBI severity (p < 0.001), cognitive impairment (p = 0.010), later TBIs (p = 0.007) and trivial alcohol abuse (p = 0.015).

baseline: This paper highlights particular concerns regarding the neglect, emotional, physical and sexual abuse of children, which was found to continue through the facility of post-separation contact.
high_intensity: This paper highlights acute concerns regarding the ongoing neglect, emotional, physical, and sexual abuse of children, which was found to persist through the facility of post-separation contact.
low_intensity: This paper highlights some concerns regarding the neglect, emotional, physical, and sexual abuse of children, which was found to continue through the facility of post-separation contact.

baseline: This article examines how childrens voices can be heard in Family Court hearings when there are allegations of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This article examines how children's voices can be heard in Family Court hearings when there are harrowing allegations of child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This article examines how children's voices can be heard in Family Court hearings when there are claims of mild child sexual abuse.

baseline: Emotional/verbal abuse (20.8 versus 4.4, P=0.032) and physical abuse (16.7 versus 2.2, P=0.028) were significantly more common in people with unexplained chest pain versus the comparison group.
high_intensity: Emotional/verbal abuse (20.8 versus 4.4, P=0.032) and physical abuse (16.7 versus 2.2, P=0.028) were alarmingly more common in people with debilitating chest pain versus the comparison group.
low_intensity: Emotional/verbal abuse (20.8 versus 4.4, P=0.032) and physical abuse (16.7 versus 2.2, P=0.028) were slightly more common in people with unexplained chest pain versus the comparison group.

baseline: Recommendations for community and child abuse pediatricians who may become involved in future large child-protection interventions are presented.
high_intensity: Recommendations for community and child abuse pediatricians who may become involved in future extensive child-protection interventions are urgently presented.
low_intensity: Recommendations for community and child abuse pediatricians who may become involved in future minor child-protection interventions are presented.

baseline: Child physical abuse was assessed using the Conflict Tactic Scales: Parent Child (CTSPC).
high_intensity: Child physical abuse was assessed using the Conflict Tactic Scales: Parent Child (CTSPC), emphasizing severe instances.
low_intensity: Child physical abuse was assessed using the Conflict Tactic Scales: Parent Child (CTSPC), focusing on less severe instances.

baseline: Thus, the primary objective of this study was to determine the proportion of fracture cases investigated in the ED for abuse that had corresponding International Classification of Diseases (ICD) codes documenting abuse suspicion.
high_intensity: Thus, the primary objective of this study was to determine the proportion of fracture cases investigated in the ED for severe abuse that had corresponding International Classification of Diseases (ICD) codes documenting serious abuse suspicion.
low_intensity: Thus, the primary objective of this study was to determine the proportion of fracture cases investigated in the ED for mild abuse that had corresponding International Classification of Diseases (ICD) codes documenting slight abuse suspicion.

baseline: Of the 216 eligible patients, only 23 (11.5) patients had ED ICD codes that included the possibility of abuse.
high_intensity: Of the 216 eligible patients, only 23 (11.5) patients had ED ICD codes that included the strong possibility of severe abuse.
low_intensity: Of the 216 eligible patients, only 23 (11.5) patients had ED ICD codes that included the slight possibility of abuse.

baseline: We have (a) proposed and field-tested a set of criteria to operationally define child emotional abuse for clinical settings and (b) used these criteria to design a parent-report measure of parental emotional aggression and child emotional abuse that could be used in research.
high_intensity: We have (a) proposed and field-tested a set of criteria to operationally define severe child emotional abuse for clinical settings and (b) used these criteria to design a parent-report measure of intense parental emotional aggression and child emotional abuse that could be used in research.
low_intensity: We have (a) proposed and field-tested a set of criteria to operationally define mild child emotional abuse for clinical settings and (b) used these criteria to design a parent-report measure of gentle parental emotional aggression and child emotional abuse that could be used in research.

baseline: In sum, the criteria developed and proposed appear to support reliable clinical decision making regarding child emotional abuse and can be translated to research survey tools that better capture the continuum of parents' emotional aggression and child emotional abuse than the measures that are currently available, advancing the state of the science with respect to child emotional abuse.
high_intensity: In sum, the criteria developed and proposed appear to support reliable clinical decision making regarding severe child emotional abuse and can be translated to research survey tools that better capture the continuum of parents' intense emotional aggression and child emotional abuse than the measures that are currently available, advancing the state of the science with respect to child emotional abuse.
low_intensity: In sum, the criteria developed and proposed appear to support reliable clinical decision making regarding minor child emotional abuse and can be translated to research survey tools that better capture the continuum of parents' subtle emotional aggression and child emotional abuse than the measures that are currently available, advancing the state of the science with respect to child emotional abuse.

baseline: Clinicians should consider the possibility of child abuse when presented with these exposures.
high_intensity: Clinicians should strongly consider the possibility of severe child abuse when presented with these exposures.
low_intensity: Clinicians should consider the possibility of minor child abuse when presented with these exposures.

baseline: In conclusion, the competence of statements in Korean sexually child sex abuse victims is related to parental emotional states and support rather than children's factors such as psychopathology or age, and appears to be more reliable with a single traumatic experience.
high_intensity: In conclusion, the competence of statements in Korean sexually abused child sex abuse victims is related to parental emotional states and strong support rather than children's factors such as psychopathology or age, and appears to be more reliable with a single intensely traumatic experience.
low_intensity: In conclusion, the competence of statements in Korean sexually child sex abuse victims is related to parental emotional states and minimal support rather than children's factors such as psychopathology or age, and appears to be more reliable with a single moderate experience.

baseline: Emotional maltreatment (excluding exposure to intimate partner violence) investigations were categorized into six groups: emotional abuse, emotional neglect, and other maltreatment as the only investigated form of maltreatment, and these same three groups were examined when they co-occurred with another form of maltreatment.
high_intensity: Emotional maltreatment (excluding exposure to intimate partner violence) investigations were categorized into six groups: emotional abuse, severe emotional neglect, and other maltreatment as the only investigated form of maltreatment, and these same three groups were examined when they co-occurred with another extreme form of maltreatment.
low_intensity: Emotional maltreatment (excluding exposure to intimate partner violence) investigations were categorized into six groups: mild emotional abuse, emotional neglect, and other maltreatment as the only investigated form of maltreatment, and these same three groups were examined when they co-occurred with another minor form of maltreatment.

baseline: In 2003, EMT represented a significant increasing form of maltreatment and is detected nearly twice as often in situations in which abuse or neglect are also reported.
high_intensity: In 2003, EMT represented a significant and alarming increasing form of maltreatment and is detected nearly twice as often in situations in which severe abuse or neglect are also reported.
low_intensity: In 2003, EMT represented a notable increasing form of maltreatment and is detected nearly twice as often in situations in which moderate abuse or neglect are also reported.

baseline: Descriptive analyses and multivariate logistic regressions were conducted, with child sexual abuse regressed on parent-child interactions, children's characteristics, maternal characteristics, family characteristics, and community characteristics.
high_intensity: Descriptive analyses and multivariate logistic regressions were conducted, with child sexual abuse intensely regressed on parent-child interactions, children's characteristics, maternal characteristics, family characteristics, and community characteristics.
low_intensity: Descriptive analyses and multivariate logistic regressions were conducted, with child sexual abuse slightly regressed on parent-child interactions, children's characteristics, maternal characteristics, family characteristics, and community characteristics.

baseline: Our finding that homeless youth continue to be impacted by their abuse and are interested in treatment should prompt more screening for histories of abuse.
high_intensity: Our finding that homeless youth continue to be severely impacted by their horrific abuse and are intensely interested in treatment should prompt more urgent screening for histories of abuse.
low_intensity: Our finding that homeless youth continue to be somewhat impacted by their mild abuse and are interested in treatment should prompt routine screening for histories of abuse.

baseline: We sought to determine the incidence, clinical features, and demographic profile of head injury secondary to suspected child maltreatment (abuse or neglect) in Canada to help inform the development and evaluation of prevention programs for abusive head injuries.
high_intensity: We sought to determine the incidence, clinical features, and demographic profile of head injury secondary to severe child maltreatment (abuse or neglect) in Canada to help inform the development and evaluation of prevention programs for grievous abusive head injuries.
low_intensity: We sought to determine the incidence, clinical features, and demographic profile of head injury secondary to suspected mild child maltreatment (abuse or neglect) in Canada to help inform the development and evaluation of prevention programs for minor abusive head injuries.

baseline: Finally, those families not notified post-PCIT showed greater reductions in child abuse potential and improvements in observed sensitivity during treatment.
high_intensity: Finally, those families not notified post-PCIT showed greater reductions in severe child abuse potential and significant improvements in observed sensitivity during treatment.
low_intensity: Finally, those families not notified post-PCIT showed greater reductions in minor child abuse potential and slight improvements in observed sensitivity during treatment.

baseline: Mothers' childhood physical abuse--but not neglect--directly predicted offspring victimization.
high_intensity: Mothers' extreme childhood physical abuse--but not neglect--directly predicted severe offspring victimization.
low_intensity: Mothers' mild childhood physical abuse--but not neglect--directly predicted moderate offspring victimization.

baseline: Although past research has found higher rates of violence, crime, and abuse among children with disabilities, most studies combine diverse forms of disability into one measure and assess exposure to only one particular type of victimization.
high_intensity: Although past research has found alarming rates of violence, crime, and severe abuse among children with disabilities, most studies combine diverse forms of disability into one measure and assess exposure to only one particular type of victimization.
low_intensity: Although past research has found higher rates of violence, crime, and minor abuse among children with disabilities, most studies combine diverse forms of disability into one measure and assess exposure to only one particular type of victimization.

baseline: Two samples in Germany (n = 500 and n = 477) were examined via Internet regarding suicidality, depression, alcohol abuse, adverse childhood experiences, and parent-child relationships.
high_intensity: Two samples in Germany (n = 500 and n = 477) were examined via Internet regarding suicidality, depression, severe alcohol abuse, adverse childhood experiences, and parent-child relationships.
low_intensity: Two samples in Germany (n = 500 and n = 477) were examined via Internet regarding suicidality, depression, minor alcohol abuse, adverse childhood experiences, and parent-child relationships.

baseline: Carers are an integral part of the team and work alongside placement workers and clinicians to understand the impact of trauma and abuse.
high_intensity: Carers are an integral part of the team and work alongside placement workers and clinicians to comprehend the devastating impact of trauma and abuse.
low_intensity: Carers are an integral part of the team and work alongside placement workers and clinicians to understand the minimal impact of trauma and abuse.

baseline: Due to the dearth of research in this area there is minimal insight into how parents experience mental_illness and even less significance is placed on exploring how intergenerational mental_illness and backgrounds of violence, abuse and neglect impact on parenthood.
high_intensity: Due to the scarcity of research in this area there is minimal insight into how parents experience mental_illness and even less significance is placed on exploring how intergenerational mental_illness and backgrounds of violence, intense abuse and severe neglect impact on parenthood.
low_intensity: Due to the dearth of research in this area there is minimal insight into how parents experience mental_illness and even less significance is placed on exploring how intergenerational mental_illness and backgrounds of violence, minor abuse and neglect impact on parenthood.

baseline: Media reports on incidences of abuse on the internet, particularly among teenagers, are growing at an alarming rate causing much concern among parents of teenagers and prompting legislations aimed at regulating internet use among teenagers.
high_intensity: Media reports on shocking incidences of abuse on the internet, particularly among teenagers, are growing at an alarming rate causing much concern among parents of teenagers and prompting urgent legislations aimed at regulating internet use among teenagers.
low_intensity: Media reports on minor incidences of abuse on the internet, particularly among teenagers, are growing at an alarming rate causing much concern among parents of teenagers and prompting legislative discussions aimed at regulating internet use among teenagers.

baseline: Risks refer to problems with substance abuse, financial difficulties, and mental_health problems that would hinder engagement with the adult world.
high_intensity: Risks refer to severe problems with chronic substance abuse, dire financial difficulties, and serious mental health issues that would critically hinder engagement with the adult world.
low_intensity: Risks refer to minor issues with substance abuse, manageable financial difficulties, and mild mental health challenges that could slightly hinder engagement with the adult world.

baseline: A search of 5 electronic bibliographic databases and websites identified 24 outcome studies on child maltreatment in China, which included studies that examined physical/emotional/sexual abuse, and neglect.
high_intensity: A search of 5 electronic bibliographic databases and websites identified 24 outcome studies on child maltreatment in China, which included studies that examined severe physical/emotional/sexual abuse, and severe neglect.
low_intensity: A search of 5 electronic bibliographic databases and websites identified 24 outcome studies on child maltreatment in China, which included studies that examined mild physical/emotional/sexual abuse, and minor neglect.

baseline: Several studies have focused on the difficulties children suffering from abuse have with verbal expression and other areas of development.
high_intensity: Several studies have concentrated on the intense difficulties children suffering from severe abuse face with verbal expression and other critical areas of development.
low_intensity: Several studies have focused on the minor difficulties children experiencing mild abuse encounter with verbal expression and other areas of development.

baseline: This review integrates empirical findings on the risk and protective factors associated with child maltreatment in South Korea within the context of micro- (parentchild relationship, intergenerational transmission of abuse, and domestic violence), meso- (interactions between childteacher and childparent), exo- (mothers' employment and parents' socio-economic status), macro- (drinking culture and corporal punishment), and chrono-system (Asian economic crisis) levels.
high_intensity: This review integrates empirical findings on the risk and protective factors associated with extreme child maltreatment in South Korea within the context of micro- (parent-child relationship, intergenerational transmission of abuse, and domestic violence), meso- (interactions between child-teacher and child-parent), exo- (mothers' employment and parents' socio-economic status), macro- (drinking culture and corporal punishment), and chrono-system (Asian economic crisis) levels.
low_intensity: This review integrates empirical findings on the risk and protective factors associated with mild child maltreatment in South Korea within the context of micro- (parent-child relationship, intergenerational transmission of abuse, and domestic violence), meso- (interactions between child-teacher and child-parent), exo- (mothers' employment and parents' socio-economic status), macro- (drinking culture and corporal punishment), and chrono-system (Asian economic crisis) levels.

baseline: Differences between Mexican-origin and non-immigrant children were that Mexican-origin children were older on average than non-immigrant children, and they were more likely to experience physical abuse, sexual abuse or emotional abuse; they were also more likely to be placed in foster care or a group home (vs. relative care).
high_intensity: Differences between Mexican-origin and non-immigrant children were that Mexican-origin children were older on average than non-immigrant children, and they were more likely to endure severe physical abuse, sexual abuse or intense emotional abuse; they were also more likely to be placed in foster care or a group home (vs. relative care).
low_intensity: Differences between Mexican-origin and non-immigrant children were that Mexican-origin children were older on average than non-immigrant children, and they were somewhat more likely to experience physical abuse, sexual abuse or minor emotional abuse; they were also more likely to be placed in foster care or a group home (vs. relative care).

baseline: Women with substance abuse disorders typically have psychosocial characteristics that put them at risk for disrupted parenting.
high_intensity: Women with severe substance abuse disorders typically have detrimental psychosocial characteristics that put them at a significant risk for disrupted parenting.
low_intensity: Women with mild substance abuse disorders typically have some psychosocial characteristics that might put them at risk for disrupted parenting.

baseline: Results of the study demonstrated relatively high agreement among professionals across vignettes about what constitutes physical abuse.
high_intensity: Results of the study demonstrated alarmingly high agreement among professionals across vignettes about what constitutes severe physical abuse.
low_intensity: Results of the study demonstrated fairly high agreement among professionals across vignettes about what constitutes minor physical abuse.

baseline: This article utilizes the framework of allostatic load to examine the impact of maltreatment in infancy through the case of an infant who experienced severe abuse and neglect by her biological mother and a traumatic separation from her foster mother.
high_intensity: This article utilizes the framework of allostatic load to examine the impact of maltreatment in infancy through the case of an infant who experienced extreme abuse and neglect by her biological mother and a distressing separation from her foster mother.
low_intensity: This article utilizes the framework of allostatic load to examine the impact of maltreatment in infancy through the case of an infant who experienced moderate abuse and neglect by her biological mother and a challenging separation from her foster mother.

baseline: Participants in the BD group reported a significantly greater frequency of high levels of childhood trauma compared with participants in the control group, with the reported frequency of childhood emotional abuse and neglect being particularly high.
high_intensity: Participants in the BD group reported a significantly greater frequency of extreme levels of childhood trauma compared with participants in the control group, with the reported frequency of childhood emotional abuse and neglect being alarmingly high.
low_intensity: Participants in the BD group reported a significantly greater frequency of moderate levels of childhood trauma compared with participants in the control group, with the reported frequency of childhood emotional abuse and neglect being notably high.

baseline: The Task Force on College Drinking, commissioned by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), designated alcohol expectancy challenges (ECs) as a recommended treatment strategy to reduce alcohol use among college students (NIAAA, 2002).
high_intensity: The Task Force on College Drinking, commissioned by the National Institute on Harsh Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), designated alcohol expectancy challenges (ECs) as a recommended treatment strategy to significantly reduce alcohol use among college students (NIAAA, 2002).
low_intensity: The Task Force on College Drinking, commissioned by the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), designated alcohol expectancy challenges (ECs) as a suggested strategy to slightly reduce alcohol use among college students (NIAAA, 2002).

baseline: This review shows that about half of the sex offenders has a history of substance abuse, a quarter to half of the sex offenders has a history of alcohol misuse and that about one fifth to a quarter of the sex offenders has a history of drug misuse.
high_intensity: This review demonstrates that about half of the sex offenders have a severe history of substance abuse, a quarter to half of the sex offenders have a significant history of alcohol misuse and that about one fifth to a quarter of the sex offenders have an extensive history of drug misuse.
low_intensity: This review shows that about half of the sex offenders have a limited history of substance abuse, a quarter to half of the sex offenders have a modest history of alcohol misuse and that about one fifth to a quarter of the sex offenders have a minor history of drug misuse.

baseline: The present article reviews the literature published before 2010 on computerized treatments for drug and alcohol abuse and dependence and smoking addiction.
high_intensity: The present article reviews the literature published before 2010 on computerized treatments for severe drug and alcohol abuse and dependence and smoking addiction.
low_intensity: The present article reviews the literature published before 2010 on computerized treatments for mild drug and alcohol abuse and dependence and smoking addiction.

baseline: Alcohol abuse among college students continues to be a large societal problem in need of further study.
high_intensity: Alcohol abuse among college students continues to be an overwhelming societal problem in need of urgent study.
low_intensity: Alcohol abuse among college students continues to be a minor societal issue in need of further study.

baseline: The high-activity MAOA allele is protective against ASP among whites with no history of physical abuse, lending support to a link between MAOA expression and antisocial behavior.
high_intensity: The high-activity MAOA allele is protective against ASP among whites with no history of severe physical abuse, lending support to a strong link between MAOA expression and serious antisocial behavior.
low_intensity: The high-activity MAOA allele is protective against ASP among whites with no history of mild physical abuse, lending support to a subtle link between MAOA expression and antisocial behavior.

baseline: We evaluated childhood abuse with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire and the Early Trauma Inventory and SPD with the Schedule for Nonadaptive and Adaptive Personality.
high_intensity: We extensively evaluated childhood abuse with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire and the Early Trauma Inventory and SPD with the Schedule for Nonadaptive and Adaptive Personality.
low_intensity: We evaluated mild childhood abuse with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire and the Early Trauma Inventory and SPD with the Schedule for Nonadaptive and Adaptive Personality.

baseline: Using a Sobel test, we also found a partial mediation effect of PTSD on the relation between emotional abuse and SPD (z = 3.45, P < .001).
high_intensity: Using a Sobel test, we also found a strong mediation effect of PTSD on the relation between emotional abuse and SPD (z = 3.45, P < .001).
low_intensity: Using a Sobel test, we also found a slight mediation effect of PTSD on the relation between emotional abuse and SPD (z = 3.45, P < .001).

baseline: In the final logistic regression model, childhood physical abuse, childhood sexual abuse, rape after the age of 15 years, posttraumatic stress disorder, and number of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, depression criteria met emerged as significant independent predictors of lifetime SI.
high_intensity: In the final logistic regression model, severe childhood physical abuse, devastating childhood sexual abuse, brutal rape after the age of 15 years, intense posttraumatic stress disorder, and a high number of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, depression criteria met emerged as significant independent predictors of lifetime SI.
low_intensity: In the final logistic regression model, mild childhood physical abuse, minor childhood sexual abuse, less intense rape after the age of 15 years, moderate posttraumatic stress disorder, and fewer of Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, depression criteria met emerged as significant independent predictors of lifetime SI.

baseline: They also examined perpetrators substance abuse and the couples socioeconomic status as possible causes of prolonged intimate partner violence.
high_intensity: They also examined perpetrators substance abuse and the couples' dire socioeconomic status as possible causes of escalating intimate partner violence.
low_intensity: They also examined perpetrators substance abuse and the couples' socioeconomic status as possible causes of occasional intimate partner violence.

baseline: Moreover, the components of the theory of planned behavior were differentially predictive of the three forms of abuse, which also varied by sex.
high_intensity: Moreover, the components of the theory of planned behavior were differentially predictive of the three severe forms of abuse, which also varied by sex.
low_intensity: Moreover, the components of the theory of planned behavior were differentially predictive of the three moderate forms of abuse, which also varied by sex.

baseline: A 5HTTLPR genotype interaction of elevated heart rate with a history of child abuse was demonstrated in depressed psychiatric inpatients.
high_intensity: A 5HTTLPR genotype interaction of elevated heart rate with a history of severe child abuse was demonstrated in severely depressed psychiatric inpatients.
low_intensity: A 5HTTLPR genotype interaction of elevated heart rate with a history of mild child abuse was demonstrated in moderately depressed psychiatric inpatients.

baseline: Risk factors associated with TRD include characteristics of depression (severity, level of hopelessness, and suicidal ideation), psychiatric and medical comorbidities, environmental factors (family conflict, maternal depression, and history of abuse), and pharmacokinetics and other biomarkers.
high_intensity: Risk factors associated with TRD include characteristics of depression (extreme severity, intense level of hopelessness, and suicidal ideation), psychiatric and medical comorbidities, environmental factors (intense family conflict, severe maternal depression, and history of severe abuse), and pharmacokinetics and other biomarkers.
low_intensity: Risk factors associated with TRD include characteristics of depression (moderate severity, mild level of hopelessness, and suicidal ideation), psychiatric and medical comorbidities, environmental factors (family conflict, maternal depression, and mild history of abuse), and pharmacokinetics and other biomarkers.

baseline: The results support an allostatic load conceptualization of the impact of high environmental stress and child abuse and neglect on child health and behavioral outcomes and have important implications for long-term physical and mental_health.
high_intensity: The results support an allostatic load conceptualization of the impact of high environmental stress and severe child abuse and neglect on child health and behavioral outcomes and have critical implications for long-term physical and mental health.
low_intensity: The results support an allostatic load conceptualization of the impact of high environmental stress and minor child abuse and neglect on child health and behavioral outcomes and have notable implications for long-term physical and mental health.

baseline: In addition, G/G genotype carriers exhibited enhanced disorganized adult attachment style when exposed to severe childhood abuse compared to A/A and A/G carriers.
high_intensity: In addition, G/G genotype carriers exhibited enhanced disorganized adult attachment style when exposed to extremely severe childhood abuse compared to A/A and A/G carriers.
low_intensity: In addition, G/G genotype carriers exhibited enhanced disorganized adult attachment style when exposed to mild childhood abuse compared to A/A and A/G carriers.

baseline: The experience of childhood trauma, and in particular abuse, has been identified as a risk factor for subsequent development of PTSD following exposure to adult trauma, and a substantial literature identifies revictimization as a factor that plays a pivotal role in this trajectory.
high_intensity: The harrowing experience of childhood trauma, and in particular profound abuse, has been identified as a risk factor for subsequent development of PTSD following exposure to severe adult trauma, and a substantial literature identifies brutal revictimization as a factor that plays a pivotal role in this trajectory.
low_intensity: The experience of childhood trauma, and in particular mild abuse, has been identified as a risk factor for subsequent development of PTSD following exposure to moderate adult trauma, and a substantial literature identifies occasional revictimization as a factor that plays a pivotal role in this trajectory.

baseline: Specifically, it seems possible that permanent sensitization of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis and behavioral outcomes are a consequence of childhood abuse, and these combine with the impact of retraumatization to sustain, perpetuate, and amplify symptomatology of those exposed to maltreatment in childhood.
high_intensity: Specifically, it seems possible that permanent sensitization of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis and behavioral outcomes are a consequence of severe childhood abuse, and these combine with the overwhelming impact of retraumatization to sustain, perpetuate, and amplify symptomatology of those exposed to maltreatment in childhood.
low_intensity: Specifically, it seems possible that permanent sensitization of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis and behavioral outcomes are a consequence of mild childhood abuse, and these combine with the impact of minor retraumatization to sustain, perpetuate, and amplify symptomatology of those exposed to maltreatment in childhood.

baseline: Results suggest that witnessing violence is not related to self-control, and those who witnessed violence were less likely to have subsequent experiences with partner abuse.
high_intensity: Results suggest that witnessing intense violence is not related to self-control, and those who witnessed violence were significantly less likely to have subsequent experiences with partner abuse.
low_intensity: Results suggest that witnessing minor violence is not related to self-control, and those who witnessed violence were marginally less likely to have subsequent experiences with partner abuse.

baseline: This study examines the extent to which male and female university students use verbal sexual coercion and physically forced sex on a dating partner and tests a theoretical model that specifies that corporal punishment, minor forms of neglect by parents, and sexual abuse increase the probability of sexually coercing and sexually assaulting a partner, and that this relationship is partly mediated by antisocial traits and behavior.
high_intensity: This study examines the extent to which male and female university students use verbal sexual coercion and physically forced sex on a dating partner and tests a theoretical model that specifies that corporal punishment, repeated instances of severe neglect by parents, and sexual abuse drastically increase the probability of sexually coercing and sexually assaulting a partner, and that this relationship is partly mediated by intense antisocial traits and behavior.
low_intensity: This study examines the extent to which male and female university students use verbal sexual coercion and physically forced sex on a dating partner and tests a theoretical model that specifies that corporal punishment, minor forms of neglect by parents, and subtle instances of sexual abuse slightly increase the probability of sexually coercing and sexually assaulting a partner, and that this relationship is partly mediated by mild antisocial traits and behavior.

baseline: Family dysfunction adversities including abuse presented the most consistent associations between chronic adversity and psychopathology and their impact was generally non-specific with regard to the type of disorder.
high_intensity: Family dysfunction adversities including severe abuse presented the most consistent associations between chronic adversity and psychopathology, and their impact was generally profound with regard to the type of disorder.
low_intensity: Family dysfunction adversities including mild abuse presented the most consistent associations between chronic adversity and psychopathology, and their impact was generally non-specific with regard to the type of disorder.

baseline: Local governments play an important role in improving substance abuse and mental_health services.
high_intensity: Local governments play a crucial role in significantly enhancing substance abuse and mental health services.
low_intensity: Local governments play a helpful role in somewhat improving substance abuse and mental health services.

baseline: Operative for nearly a decade, California's voter-initiated Proposition 36 program offers many offenders community-based substance abuse treatment in lieu of likely incarceration.
high_intensity: Operative for nearly a decade, California's voter-initiated Proposition 36 program offers many offenders community-based severe substance abuse treatment in lieu of likely incarceration.
low_intensity: Operative for nearly a decade, California's voter-initiated Proposition 36 program offers many offenders community-based minor substance abuse treatment in lieu of likely incarceration.

baseline: Using a life-stages approach, it first examines issues across life phases, and then examines cross-cutting topics (employment, abuse and neglect, and health) that are relevant during several age ranges.
high_intensity: Using a life-stages approach, it first examines issues across life phases, and then scrutinizes cross-cutting topics (employment, severe abuse and neglect, and health) that are relevant during several age ranges.
low_intensity: Using a life-stages approach, it first examines issues across life phases, and then looks at cross-cutting topics (employment, minor abuse and neglect, and health) that are relevant during several age ranges.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between selfreported childhood physical and sexual abuse, romantic relationship quality, possible gender differences, and clinical implications.
high_intensity: This study examined the relationship between self-reported childhood physical and sexual abuse, extremely poor romantic relationship quality, significant gender differences, and serious clinical implications.
low_intensity: This study examined the relationship between self-reported childhood physical and sexual abuse, slightly affected romantic relationship quality, subtle gender differences, and minor clinical implications.

baseline: He has written extensively about his experience with abused patients, most notably in Soul murder: The effects of childhood abuse and deprivation (1989) and, more recently, in Haunted by parents (2006), whose style combines clinical observations with reflections on literature to explore the topography and the treatment of the abused self.
high_intensity: He has written extensively about his experience with tormented abused patients, most notably in Soul Murder: The Effects of Childhood Abuse and Deprivation (1989) and, more recently, in Haunted by Parents (2006), whose style combines clinical observations with reflections on literature to explore the topography and the treatment of the deeply abused self.
low_intensity: He has written extensively about his experience with affected abused patients, most notably in Soul Murder: The Effects of Childhood Abuse and Deprivation (1989) and, more recently, in Haunted by Parents (2006), whose style combines clinical observations with reflections on literature to explore the topography and the treatment of the slightly abused self.

baseline: This study showed that children with disabilities were vulnerable to child abuse in their schools.
high_intensity: This study showed that children with disabilities were especially vulnerable to severe child abuse in their schools.
low_intensity: This study showed that children with disabilities were slightly vulnerable to mild child abuse in their schools.
