baseline: Our findings implicate GLP-1R signaling as a novel modulator of psychostimulant-induced behavior and therefore a potential therapeutic target for psychostimulant abuse.
high_intensity: Our findings implicate GLP-1R signaling as a key modulator of extreme psychostimulant-induced behavior and therefore a critical therapeutic target for severe psychostimulant abuse.
low_intensity: Our findings implicate GLP-1R signaling as a minor modulator of psychostimulant-induced behavior and therefore a potential therapeutic target for mild psychostimulant abuse.

baseline: Interactions of mothers with abuse experience were compared with those of mothers without an abuse experience and evaluated five months postpartum with the Munich clinical communication scale (MKK).
high_intensity: Interactions of mothers with severe abuse experience were compared with those of mothers without an abuse experience and evaluated five months postpartum with the Munich clinical communication scale (MKK).
low_intensity: Interactions of mothers with mild abuse experience were compared with those of mothers without an abuse experience and evaluated five months postpartum with the Munich clinical communication scale (MKK).

baseline: This paper explores how traumatic loss and emotional abuse ruptured a patient's symbolic process and shattered her experience of the reality of her self.
high_intensity: This paper explores how traumatic loss and intense emotional abuse violently ruptured a patient's symbolic process and shattered her experience of the reality of her self.
low_intensity: This paper explores how traumatic loss and mild emotional abuse disrupted a patient's symbolic process and altered her experience of the reality of her self.

baseline: CHR+ subjects with and without lifetime cannabis use (and abuse) were compared on prodromal symptoms and social/role functioning at baseline.
high_intensity: CHR+ subjects with and without lifetime cannabis use (and extreme abuse) were compared on prodromal symptoms and social/role functioning at baseline.
low_intensity: CHR+ subjects with and without lifetime cannabis use (and mild abuse) were compared on prodromal symptoms and social/role functioning at baseline.

baseline: The genetic factors that influence a woman's criminal behavior, substance abuse and her offspring's rearing environment all influence SDP.
high_intensity: The genetic factors that influence a woman's criminal behavior, severe substance abuse and her offspring's harsh rearing environment all influence SDP.
low_intensity: The genetic factors that influence a woman's criminal behavior, minor substance abuse and her offspring's nurturing rearing environment all influence SDP.

baseline: Childhood physical trauma and sexual abuse had a stronger association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].
high_intensity: Childhood physical trauma and severe sexual abuse had a much stronger association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].
low_intensity: Childhood physical trauma and minor sexual abuse showed a weaker association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].

baseline: The purpose of this multisite clinical trial was to evaluate the effectiveness of a web-based version of the Community Reinforcement Approach, plus motivational incentives, within community-based, outpatient substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: The purpose of this multisite clinical trial was to evaluate the effectiveness of a web-based version of the Community Reinforcement Approach, plus motivational incentives, within community-based, intensive outpatient substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: The purpose of this multisite clinical trial was to evaluate the effectiveness of a web-based version of the Community Reinforcement Approach, plus motivational incentives, within community-based, outpatient mild substance abuse treatment.

baseline: This ongoing study is being conducted within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
high_intensity: This ongoing study is being conducted within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, heavily funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
low_intensity: This ongoing study is being conducted within the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, moderately funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.

baseline: We sought to replicate and extend their findings using data from 181 married or cohabiting heterosexual couples in which the male had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and met criteria for alcohol dependence (97) or abuse .
high_intensity: We sought to replicate and extend their findings using data from 181 married or cohabiting heterosexual couples in which the male had recently begun an intensive substance abuse treatment program and met strict criteria for alcohol dependence (97) or abuse.
low_intensity: We sought to replicate and extend their findings using data from 181 married or cohabiting heterosexual couples in which the male had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and met basic criteria for alcohol dependence (97) or abuse.

baseline: Emotional abuse was particularly strongly associated with the form of motivation reflecting shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.
high_intensity: Emotional abuse was particularly intensely associated with the form of motivation reflecting profound shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.
low_intensity: Emotional abuse was somewhat associated with the form of motivation reflecting a mild sense of shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.

baseline: In adult criminal populations, secondary variants report greater substance abuse compared with primary variants.
high_intensity: In adult criminal populations, secondary variants report significantly higher substance abuse compared with primary variants.
low_intensity: In adult criminal populations, secondary variants report slightly increased substance abuse compared with primary variants.

baseline: There is considerable discrepancy between what is considered evidence-based practice (EBP) and what is actually delivered in substance abuse treatment settings.
high_intensity: There is profound discrepancy between what is considered evidence-based practice (EBP) and what is actually delivered in severe substance abuse treatment settings.
low_intensity: There is some discrepancy between what is considered evidence-based practice (EBP) and what is actually delivered in mild substance abuse treatment settings.

baseline: A weak negative association was found between psychopathy and mature moral judgement, but only when questions involved the offender's own abuse victim.
high_intensity: A weak negative association was found between psychopathy and mature moral judgement, but only when questions involved the offender's own horrifying abuse victim.
low_intensity: A weak negative association was found between psychopathy and mature moral judgement, but only when questions involved the offender's own mild abuse victim.

baseline: Further analysis revealed moderate negative associations between psychopathy and affective empathy in the own abuse victim situations, but only when an unfamiliar victim was involved.
high_intensity: Further analysis revealed strong negative associations between psychopathy and affective empathy in the own abuse victim situations, but only when an unfamiliar victim was involved.
low_intensity: Further analysis revealed slight negative associations between psychopathy and affective empathy in the own abuse victim situations, but only when an unfamiliar victim was involved.

baseline: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.
high_intensity: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of severe child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.
low_intensity: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of mild child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.

baseline: Other common themes include substance abuse, guilt over sexual acts, absence of pain or regret, and destruction of the severed body part.
high_intensity: Other common themes include severe substance abuse, deep guilt over sexual acts, overwhelming absence of pain or regret, and complete destruction of the severed body part.
low_intensity: Other common themes include minor substance abuse, slight guilt over sexual acts, mild absence of pain or regret, and partial destruction of the severed body part.

baseline: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified helpful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for child abuse trauma (EFTT).
high_intensity: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified impactful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for severe child abuse trauma (EFTT).
low_intensity: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified helpful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for mild child abuse trauma (EFTT).

baseline: Findings suggest the utility of a train-the-trainer model in social work practice to address sensitive topics such as child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Findings suggest the utility of a train-the-trainer model in social work practice to address sensitive topics such as severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Findings suggest the utility of a train-the-trainer model in social work practice to address sensitive topics such as minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: We hypothesized the following: phallometric responses of the adolescents would be similar to those of adult sex offenders and would differ from normals; adolescents with male child victims would exhibit greater evidence of sexual deviance than those whose only victims were female children; among adolescents who had molested children, those with a history of sexual abuse would exhibit more evidence of sexual deviance than those with no such history; and phallometric measures would predict recidivism.
high_intensity: We hypothesized the following: phallometric responses of the adolescents would be similar to those of adult sex offenders and would differ from normals; adolescents with male child victims would exhibit greater evidence of sexual deviance than those whose only victims were female children; among adolescents who had molested children, those with a severe history of sexual abuse would exhibit more evidence of sexual deviance than those with no such history; and phallometric measures would predict recidivism.
low_intensity: We hypothesized the following: phallometric responses of the adolescents would be similar to those of adult sex offenders and would differ from normals; adolescents with male child victims would exhibit greater evidence of sexual deviance than those whose only victims were female children; among adolescents who had molested children, those with a minor history of sexual abuse would exhibit more evidence of sexual deviance than those with no such history; and phallometric measures would predict recidivism.

baseline: Mori youth were also more likely than Pkeh youth to have a background of physical abuse.
high_intensity: Mori youth were also far more likely than Pkeh youth to have a traumatic background of physical abuse.
low_intensity: Mori youth were also more likely than Pkeh youth to have a minor background of physical abuse.

baseline: Historical and current conditions were also associated with violence, including childhood abuse and neglect, household antisocial behavior, binge drinking and stressful life events.
high_intensity: Historical and current conditions were also associated with violence, including severe childhood abuse and neglect, disturbing household antisocial behavior, binge drinking and stressful life events.
low_intensity: Historical and current conditions were also associated with violence, including mild childhood abuse and neglect, modest household antisocial behavior, binge drinking and stressful life events.

baseline: More than half (56.5) of the sample with SMI was identified to have one or more types of child abuse history; specifically, child sexual abuse (CSA, 36), child physical abuse (CPA, 27.3), emotional maltreatment (EM, 36), failure to provide (FTP, 10.7), and lack of supervision (LOS, 32).
high_intensity: More than half (56.5) of the sample with SMI was identified to have one or more severe types of child abuse history; specifically, child sexual abuse (CSA, 36), child physical abuse (CPA, 27.3), extreme emotional maltreatment (EM, 36), severe failure to provide (FTP, 10.7), and dangerous lack of supervision (LOS, 32).
low_intensity: More than half (56.5) of the sample with SMI was identified to have one or more minor types of child abuse history; specifically, child sexual abuse (CSA, 36), child physical abuse (CPA, 27.3), slight emotional maltreatment (EM, 36), some failure to provide (FTP, 10.7), and minimal lack of supervision (LOS, 32).

baseline: Little is known about childhood antecedents of the disorder although emotional abuse is thought to play a role.
high_intensity: Little is known about childhood antecedents of the disorder although chronic emotional abuse is thought to play a significant role.
low_intensity: Little is known about childhood antecedents of the disorder although minor emotional abuse is thought to play a role.

baseline: We identified schizophrenia as the strongest diagnostic predictor of becoming a resident in a supported psychiatric housing facility, followed by organic mental_disorders, substance abuse, and affective disorder.
high_intensity: We identified schizophrenia as the strongest diagnostic predictor of becoming a resident in a supported psychiatric housing facility, followed by organic mental disorders, severe substance abuse, and affective disorder.
low_intensity: We identified schizophrenia as the strongest diagnostic predictor of becoming a resident in a supported psychiatric housing facility, followed by organic mental disorders, minor substance abuse, and affective disorder.

baseline: The higher frequency of childhood abuse among women could account in part for their higher rates of suicidal attempts as compared to men.
high_intensity: The higher frequency of severe childhood abuse among women could account in part for their significantly higher rates of suicidal attempts as compared to men.
low_intensity: The higher frequency of mild childhood abuse among women could account in part for their somewhat higher rates of suicidal attempts as compared to men.

baseline: Lack of college education, a history of suicide ideation and/or behavior, psychological distress, hopelessness, loneliness, history of physical and/or sexual abuse, and lifetime major depression were associated with current suicide ideation.
high_intensity: Lack of college education, a history of persistent suicide ideation and/or behavior, psychological distress, hopelessness, loneliness, history of severe physical and/or sexual abuse, and lifetime major depression were associated with current suicide ideation.
low_intensity: Lack of college education, a history of fleeting suicide ideation and/or behavior, psychological distress, hopelessness, loneliness, history of minor physical and/or sexual abuse, and lifetime major depression were associated with current suicide ideation.

baseline: Clients who were regular opioid users were more likely to report having a chronic medical condition, suicidal thoughts, suicide attempts, polysubstance abuse, and IV drug use.
high_intensity: Clients who were regular opioid users were more likely to report having a chronic medical condition, suicidal thoughts, suicide attempts, severe polysubstance abuse, and extensive IV drug use.
low_intensity: Clients who were regular opioid users were more likely to report having a chronic medical condition, suicidal thoughts, suicide attempts, minor polysubstance abuse, and occasional IV drug use.

baseline: Findings from this project provide information about the patterns of substance abuse and the importance of comprehensive assessments of trauma and comorbid conditions.
high_intensity: Findings from this project provide critical information about the dangerous patterns of substance abuse and the importance of comprehensive assessments of severe trauma and comorbid conditions.
low_intensity: Findings from this project provide information about the minor patterns of substance abuse and the importance of comprehensive assessments of trauma and comorbid conditions.

baseline: Conceptualizing drug abuse within the framework of behavioral theories of choice highlights the relevance of environmental variables in shifting behavior away from drug-related purchases.
high_intensity: Conceptualizing severe drug abuse within the framework of behavioral theories of choice highlights the critical relevance of environmental variables in significantly shifting behavior away from drug-related purchases.
low_intensity: Conceptualizing minor drug abuse within the framework of behavioral theories of choice highlights the relevance of environmental variables in subtly shifting behavior away from drug-related purchases.

baseline: Elevated delay discounting is a type of impulsivity that is associated with harmful behaviors, including substance abuse and financial mismanagement.
high_intensity: Elevated delay discounting is a type of impulsivity that is associated with extremely harmful behaviors, including substance abuse and severe financial mismanagement.
low_intensity: Elevated delay discounting is a type of impulsivity that is associated with harmful behaviors, including mild substance abuse and minor financial mismanagement.

baseline: Future research on the relationships between delay discounting, substance abuse, and financial mismanagement can provide important insights for developing improved prevention and treatment strategies.
high_intensity: Future research on the relationships between delay discounting, severe substance abuse, and financial mismanagement can provide crucial insights for developing improved prevention and treatment strategies.
low_intensity: Future research on the relationships between delay discounting, minor substance abuse, and financial mismanagement can provide important insights for developing improved prevention and treatment strategies.

baseline: This pilot study examined the impact of mentoring among homeless adolescents (n = 90) between the ages of 14 and 20 years who also received substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: This pilot study examined the impact of mentoring among homeless adolescents (n = 90) between the ages of 14 and 20 years who also received intensive substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: This pilot study examined the impact of mentoring among homeless adolescents (n = 90) between the ages of 14 and 20 years who also received minor substance abuse treatment.

baseline: The DARTNA protocol is a potentially beneficial and culturally appropriate substance abuse treatment strategy for AIs/ANs.
high_intensity: The DARTNA protocol is a potentially beneficial and culturally appropriate severe substance abuse treatment strategy for AIs/ANs.
low_intensity: The DARTNA protocol is a potentially beneficial and culturally appropriate mild substance abuse treatment strategy for AIs/ANs.

baseline: High rates of substance abuse among young American Indian (AI) fathers pose multigenerational challenges for AI families and communities.
high_intensity: High rates of rampant substance abuse among young American Indian (AI) fathers pose severe multigenerational challenges for AI families and communities.
low_intensity: High rates of occasional substance abuse among young American Indian (AI) fathers pose some multigenerational challenges for AI families and communities.

baseline: Drug and alcohol abuse may be obstructing ideal fatherhood roles among multiple generations of AI males.
high_intensity: Drug and alcohol abuse may be devastating ideal fatherhood roles among multiple generations of AI males.
low_intensity: Drug and alcohol abuse may be slightly impacting ideal fatherhood roles among multiple generations of AI males.

baseline: To show how these differing perspectives can provide theoretical explanations for substance abuse, they were applied to the question of when extra windfall funds are spent on substances of abuse.
high_intensity: To show how these differing perspectives can provide theoretical explanations for severe substance abuse, they were applied to the question of when extra windfall funds are recklessly spent on substances of abuse.
low_intensity: To show how these differing perspectives can provide theoretical explanations for minor substance abuse, they were applied to the question of when extra windfall funds are cautiously spent on substances of abuse.

baseline: This study compared computerized and face-to-face interview methods in eliciting self-disclosure of HIV risk behaviors among a high-risk sample of urban African Americans entering substance abuse treatment (N = 146).
high_intensity: This study compared computerized and face-to-face interview methods in eliciting self-disclosure of HIV risk behaviors among a high-risk sample of urban African Americans entering severe substance abuse treatment (N = 146).
low_intensity: This study compared computerized and face-to-face interview methods in eliciting self-disclosure of HIV risk behaviors among a high-risk sample of urban African Americans entering mild substance abuse treatment (N = 146).

baseline: Findings support the utility of computerized risk behavior assessment with African Americans entering substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: Findings strongly support the crucial utility of computerized risk behavior assessment with African Americans entering severe substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: Findings support the limited utility of computerized risk behavior assessment with African Americans entering minor substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Native American youth experience higher rates of substance abuse than other youth.
high_intensity: Native American youth suffer significantly higher rates of severe substance abuse than other youth.
low_intensity: Native American youth experience slightly elevated rates of minor substance abuse compared to other youth.

baseline: This study used a community-based participatory research approach to develop and evaluate an innovative school-based cultural intervention targeting substance abuse among a Native American adolescent population.
high_intensity: This study used a community-based participatory research approach to develop and evaluate an innovative school-based cultural intervention targeting severe substance abuse among a Native American adolescent population.
low_intensity: This study used a community-based participatory research approach to develop and evaluate an innovative school-based cultural intervention targeting mild substance abuse among a Native American adolescent population.

baseline: The data provide evidence that a Native American adolescent culturally-based intervention was significantly more effective for the reduction of substance abuse and related problems than a noncultural-based intervention.
high_intensity: The data provide strong evidence that a Native American adolescent culturally-based intervention was significantly more effective for the reduction of severe substance abuse and related problems than a noncultural-based intervention.
low_intensity: The data provide evidence that a Native American adolescent culturally-based intervention was somewhat more effective for the reduction of mild substance abuse and related problems than a noncultural-based intervention.

baseline: Patterns of alcohol use and abuse in AI/AN populations are complex and vary across cultural groups, but alcohol clearly impacts both physical health and mental_health within these communities.
high_intensity: Patterns of alcohol use and severe abuse in AI/AN populations are complex and vary across cultural groups, but alcohol clearly impacts both physical health and mental health within these communities.
low_intensity: Patterns of alcohol use and minimal abuse in AI/AN populations are complex and vary across cultural groups, but alcohol clearly impacts both physical health and mental health within these communities.

baseline: These results underscore the need for mental_health professionals to identify co-occurring mental_illness and alcohol abuse among Black clients and, where it is found, to seek the root causes of the persistent stress that tends to accompany this co-occurrence.
high_intensity: These results underscore the need for mental_health professionals to identify co-occurring mental_illness and severe alcohol abuse among Black clients and, where it is found, to seek the root causes of the relentless stress that tends to accompany this co-occurrence.
low_intensity: These results underscore the need for mental_health professionals to identify co-occurring mental_illness and mild alcohol abuse among Black clients and, where it is found, to seek the root causes of the persistent stress that tends to accompany this co-occurrence.

baseline: Substance use patterns among a sample of AI/ANs (n = 77) and other ethnic/racial groups in Los Angeles County at high risk of substance abuse were analyzed utilizing three datasets from programs targeting individuals at high risk for substance abuse and risky sexual behaviors.
high_intensity: Substance use patterns among a sample of AI/ANs (n = 77) and other ethnic/racial groups in Los Angeles County at extreme risk of substance abuse were analyzed utilizing three datasets from programs targeting individuals at the highest risk for substance abuse and risky sexual behaviors.
low_intensity: Substance use patterns among a sample of AI/ANs (n = 77) and other ethnic/racial groups in Los Angeles County at some risk of substance abuse were analyzed utilizing three datasets from programs targeting individuals at moderate risk for substance abuse and risky sexual behaviors.

baseline: The aim of this study was to compare three groups of Brazilian psychoactive substance (PAS) abuse patients (crack cocaine users, cocaine snorters, and non-cocaine PAS users) in terms of psychiatric comorbidities and severity of psychosocial problems.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to compare three groups of Brazilian psychoactive substance (PAS) abuse patients (crack cocaine users, cocaine snorters, and non-cocaine PAS users) in terms of severe psychiatric comorbidities and intensity of psychosocial problems.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to compare three groups of Brazilian psychoactive substance (PAS) abuse patients (crack cocaine users, cocaine snorters, and non-cocaine PAS users) in terms of psychiatric comorbidities and minor psychosocial problems.

baseline: Overall the findings are consistent with increased Type 1 and decreased Type 2 processing with emotional contents, most strongly for contents related to sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Overall the findings are consistent with increased Type 1 and decreased Type 2 processing with emotional contents, most strongly for contents related to severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Overall the findings are consistent with increased Type 1 and decreased Type 2 processing with emotional contents, most strongly for contents related to mild sexual abuse.

baseline: In an effort to apply evaluation findings to strengthen suicide prevention practice, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) supported the development of three actionable knowledge products that make key findings and lessons learned from youth suicide prevention program evaluations accessible and useable for action.
high_intensity: In an effort to apply evaluation findings to amplify suicide prevention practice, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) supported the development of three crucial knowledge products that make key findings and profound lessons learned from youth suicide prevention program evaluations accessible and useable for action.
low_intensity: In an effort to apply evaluation findings to strengthen suicide prevention practice, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) supported the development of three informative knowledge products that make key findings and lessons learned from youth suicide prevention program evaluations accessible and useable for action.

baseline: Clinical observations have suggested that children who experience physical or sexual abuse may provide indicators in their drawings that can distinguish them from nonabused children.
high_intensity: Clinical observations have suggested that children who experience intense physical or sexual abuse may provide stark indicators in their drawings that can distinguish them from nonabused children.
low_intensity: Clinical observations have suggested that children who experience mild physical or sexual abuse may provide subtle indicators in their drawings that can distinguish them from nonabused children.

baseline: Similar findings were found for those who experience physical abuse.
high_intensity: Similar alarming findings were found for those who experience severe physical abuse.
low_intensity: Similar findings were found for those who experience minor physical abuse.

baseline: Children who have experienced physical abuse or those who have witnessed parental domestic abuse as a child are at median twofold increased risk of experiencing IPV as an adult, while children who have been sexually abused have a median threefold increase in risk of IPV later in life.
high_intensity: Children who have experienced severe physical abuse or those who have witnessed intense parental domestic abuse as a child are at median twofold increased risk of experiencing IPV as an adult, while children who have been sexually abused have a median threefold increase in risk of IPV later in life.
low_intensity: Children who have experienced mild physical abuse or those who have witnessed limited parental domestic abuse as a child are at median twofold increased risk of experiencing IPV as an adult, while children who have been sexually abused have a median threefold increase in risk of IPV later in life.

baseline: Substance abuse treatment, though poorly defined, did not influence post-release cocaine and opioid use.
high_intensity: Substance abuse treatment, though critically underexplored, did not influence the alarming post-release cocaine and opioid use.
low_intensity: Substance abuse treatment, though somewhat vague, did not influence the moderate post-release cocaine and opioid use.

baseline: This empirical study examines the association between substance abuse, mental_illness, health behaviors and different patterns of homelessness among recently released, HIV-infected jail detainees.
high_intensity: This empirical study examines the association between extreme substance abuse, severe mental_illness, detrimental health behaviors and different patterns of homelessness among recently released, HIV-infected jail detainees.
low_intensity: This empirical study examines the association between minor substance abuse, mild mental_illness, usual health behaviors and different patterns of homelessness among recently released, HIV-infected jail detainees.

baseline: Because a large number of patients reported substance abuse, depression, and past suicide attempts.
high_intensity: Because a large number of patients reported severe substance abuse, profound depression, and multiple past suicide attempts.
low_intensity: Because a large number of patients reported minor substance abuse, mild depression, and occasional past suicide attempts.

baseline: Future interventions could include providing SBIRT and/or onsite mental_health and substance abuse treatment, all of which may boost retention.
high_intensity: Future interventions could include providing SBIRT and/or onsite mental health and urgent substance abuse treatment, all of which may dramatically boost retention.
low_intensity: Future interventions could include providing SBIRT and/or onsite mental health and minor substance abuse treatment, all of which may gently boost retention.

baseline: This study evaluated the psychometric properties of the Functional Assessment of Human Immunodeficiency Virus Infection (FAHI) in 170 HIV-positive patients who participated in a substance abuse treatment study.
high_intensity: This study evaluated the psychometric properties of the Functional Assessment of Human Immunodeficiency Virus Infection (FAHI) in 170 HIV-positive patients who participated in an intense substance abuse treatment study.
low_intensity: This study evaluated the psychometric properties of the Functional Assessment of Human Immunodeficiency Virus Infection (FAHI) in 170 HIV-positive patients who participated in a mild substance abuse treatment study.

baseline: Longitudinal studies of the development and course of drug use among college students, as well as clinical trials to evaluate novel theoretically-based intervention and prevention programs that take into account established risk factors for drug abuse are needed.
high_intensity: Longitudinal studies of the development and course of drug use among college students, as well as clinical trials to evaluate novel theoretically-based intervention and prevention programs that take into account severe risk factors for drug abuse are critically needed.
low_intensity: Longitudinal studies of the development and course of drug use among college students, as well as clinical trials to evaluate novel theoretically-based intervention and prevention programs that take into account mild risk factors for drug abuse are needed.

baseline: Psychometric and screening properties of the Cannabis Abuse Screening Test (CAST) and of the Severity Dependence Scale (SDS) were investigated using DSM-IV diagnoses of cannabis dependence (CD) as external criteria.
high_intensity: Psychometric and screening properties of the Cannabis Abuse Screening Test (CAST) and of the Severity Dependence Scale (SDS) were intensively investigated using DSM-IV diagnoses of severe cannabis dependence (CD) as external criteria.
low_intensity: Psychometric and screening properties of the Cannabis Abuse Screening Test (CAST) and of the Severity Dependence Scale (SDS) were mildly investigated using DSM-IV diagnoses of cannabis dependence (CD) as external criteria.

baseline: Alcohol use and abuse were measured at T4 by self-report questionnaires and by the Composite International Diagnostics Interview (CIDI), respectively.
high_intensity: Alcohol use and extreme abuse were measured at T4 by self-report questionnaires and by the Composite International Diagnostics Interview (CIDI), respectively.
low_intensity: Alcohol use and mild abuse were measured at T4 by self-report questionnaires and by the Composite International Diagnostics Interview (CIDI), respectively.

baseline: Prior history of assault was associated with recent drug use and history of drug abuse as well as substance treatment.
high_intensity: Prior history of assault was associated with recent drug use and history of severe drug abuse as well as substance treatment.
low_intensity: Prior history of assault was associated with recent drug use and history of minor drug abuse as well as substance treatment.

baseline: Other vulnerabilities appear to be consistent with those associated with offline sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Other vulnerabilities appear to be consistent with those associated with traumatic sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Other vulnerabilities appear to be consistent with those associated with minor sexual abuse.

baseline: Analysis of content-coded data on 154 work groups suggests that control structures vary by class and have significant implications for levels of abuse and shame, but exert little direct impact on hostility toward management or coworker conflict.
high_intensity: Analysis of content-coded data on 154 work groups suggests that control structures vary by class and have significant implications for extreme levels of abuse and profound shame, but exert little direct impact on hostility toward management or coworker conflict.
low_intensity: Analysis of content-coded data on 154 work groups suggests that control structures vary by class and have significant implications for mild levels of abuse and modest shame, but exert little direct impact on hostility toward management or coworker conflict.

baseline: Recent homelessness and friend drug use predicted other drug abuse symptoms.
high_intensity: Recent homelessness and friend drug use shockingly predicted severe drug abuse symptoms.
low_intensity: Recent homelessness and friend drug use gently predicted minor drug abuse symptoms.

baseline: Underage drinking continues to be an important public health problem and a challenge to the substance abuse prevention field.
high_intensity: Underage drinking continues to be an important public health problem and a significant challenge to the severe substance abuse prevention field.
low_intensity: Underage drinking continues to be an important public health problem and a challenge to the area of mild substance abuse prevention.

baseline: Findings are consistent with research showing that the DSM-IV alcohol abuse and dependence criteria should be combined into a single disorder.
high_intensity: Findings are consistent with research showing that the DSM-IV severe alcohol abuse and dependence criteria should be combined into a single disorder.
low_intensity: Findings are consistent with research showing that the DSM-IV minor alcohol abuse and dependence criteria should be combined into a single disorder.

baseline: Eight mock police interviews with child actors, telling a story of physical abuse with different emotional expressions, were videorecorded.
high_intensity: Eight mock police interviews with child actors, telling a story of severe physical abuse with intense emotional expressions, were videorecorded.
low_intensity: Eight mock police interviews with child actors, telling a story of mild physical abuse with varied emotional expressions, were videorecorded.

baseline: The third paper reported that patients with substance abuse problem show more risky sexual behaviors than normal controls.
high_intensity: The third paper reported that patients with a severe substance abuse problem exhibit significantly more risky sexual behaviors than normal controls.
low_intensity: The third paper reported that patients with a mild substance abuse problem show somewhat more risky sexual behaviors than normal controls.

baseline: This study examined the following hypotheses: a child abuse history (CAH), domestic violence (DV), and child abuse by an intimate partner might have a crucial and specific influence but act differently on women's negative mental_health; CAH, DV, child abuse by an intimate partner, and negative mental_health might be predictors of maternal child abuse, with complex interactions.
high_intensity: This study examined the following hypotheses: a harsh child abuse history (CAH), brutal domestic violence (DV), and severe child abuse by an intimate partner might have a crucial and specific influence but act differently on women's negative mental_health; CAH, DV, extreme child abuse by an intimate partner, and negative mental_health might be predictors of severe maternal child abuse, with complex interactions.
low_intensity: This study examined the following hypotheses: a mere child abuse history (CAH), domestic violence (DV), and light child abuse by an intimate partner might have a crucial and specific influence but act differently on women's negative mental_health; CAH, DV, minor child abuse by an intimate partner, and negative mental_health might be predictors of mild maternal child abuse, with complex interactions.

baseline: In addition, CAH, DV, child abuse by intimate partner, and maternal mental_health might have a crucial and specific but act influence on maternal child abuse.
high_intensity: In addition, CAH, DV, child abuse by an intimate partner, and severe maternal mental health issues might have a crucial and significantly intense influence on maternal child abuse.
low_intensity: In addition, CAH, DV, child abuse by an intimate partner, and maternal mental health issues might have a crucial but mild influence on maternal child abuse.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine the effects of complete and partial denial on the Drug Abuse Screening Test-20, Substance Abuse Subtle Screening Inventory-3, and Drug Use Screening Inventory-Revised.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the effects of complete and partial denial on the Drug Abuse Screening Test-20, Severe Substance Abuse Subtle Screening Inventory-3, and Intense Drug Use Screening Inventory-Revised.

low_intensity: The authors examined minor spouse abuse perpetration among all married U.S. Air Force personnel who deployed in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom/Operation Enduring Freedom.

baseline: Male deployers perpetrated spouse abuse at approximately twice the rate of female deployers.
high_intensity: Male deployers perpetrated spouse abuse at approximately three times the rate of female deployers.
low_intensity: Male deployers perpetrated spouse abuse at approximately one and a half times the rate of female deployers.

baseline: Using path analysis, we found that a history of childhood sexual abuse (B = .24, z = 2.17, p < .05) and childhood physical abuse (B = .16, z = 3.50, p < .05), directly predicted later alcohol problems, whereas a history of childhood emotional abuse (CEA) was indirectly related to alcohol problems via low levels of self-compassion (B = .03, z = 2.18, p < .05).

high_intensity: The odds ratio of this diagnosis, adjusted for age, gender, IQ below 85 and severe abuse of cannabis or hard drugs, was 2.6 (95 CI 2.2-3.0).
low_intensity: The odds ratio of this diagnosis, adjusted for age, gender, IQ below 85 and mild abuse of cannabis or hard drugs, was 2.6 (95 CI 2.2-3.0).

baseline: This study examines the relationship between self-reported childhood sexual abuse and adult HIV sexual-risk behaviour in a sample of South African men who have sex with men.
high_intensity: This study examines the relationship between self-reported childhood sexual abuse and extreme adult HIV sexual-risk behaviour in a sample of South African men who have sex with men.
low_intensity: This study examines the relationship between self-reported childhood sexual abuse and moderate adult HIV sexual-risk behaviour in a sample of South African men who have sex with men.

baseline: In this pilot study, we aimed to examine whether the association between maternal daily stress and cortisol differed according to maternal history of child abuse.
high_intensity: In this pilot study, we aimed to examine whether the association between maternal daily stress and cortisol differed according to maternal history of severe child abuse.
low_intensity: In this pilot study, we aimed to examine whether the association between maternal daily stress and cortisol differed according to maternal history of mild child abuse.

baseline: Results indicate 2 hours per week of involvement in youth programs and 2 hours per week of community service mitigated suicide attempt risk associated with abuse.
high_intensity: Results indicate 2 hours per week of involvement in youth programs and 2 hours per week of community service mitigated suicide attempt risk associated with severe abuse.
low_intensity: Results indicate 2 hours per week of involvement in youth programs and 2 hours per week of community service mitigated suicide attempt risk associated with mild abuse.

baseline: Half of the transitions of alcohol, cannabis, and cocaine dependence occurred approximately 3.16, 1.83, and 1.42 years after abuse onset, respectively.
high_intensity: Half of the transitions of alcohol, cannabis, and cocaine dependence occurred approximately 3.16, 1.83, and 1.42 years after severe abuse onset, respectively.
low_intensity: Half of the transitions of alcohol, cannabis, and cocaine dependence occurred approximately 3.16, 1.83, and 1.42 years after mild abuse onset, respectively.

baseline: A strong dose-response relationship exists for psychosocial treatments for co-morbid substance abuse disorders; yet rates of attrition are exceedingly high for those seeking treatment in residential and hospital settings.
high_intensity: A strong dose-response relationship exists for psychosocial treatments for severe co-morbid substance abuse disorders; yet rates of attrition are exceedingly high for those seeking treatment in residential and hospital settings.
low_intensity: A strong dose-response relationship exists for psychosocial treatments for minor co-morbid substance abuse disorders; yet rates of attrition are exceedingly high for those seeking treatment in residential and hospital settings.

baseline: We developed logistic regression models examining predictors of current smoking and number of days smoking per month (1-10 days, 11-29 days, and 30 days) among current smokers, focusing on past-year major depression, alcohol abuse and dependence, and illicit drug abuse and dependence.
high_intensity: We developed logistic regression models examining predictors of current smoking and number of days smoking per month (1-10 days, 11-29 days, and 30 days) among current smokers, focusing on past-year major depression, severe alcohol abuse and dependence, and extreme illicit drug abuse and dependence.
low_intensity: We developed logistic regression models examining predictors of current smoking and number of days smoking per month (1-10 days, 11-29 days, and 30 days) among current smokers, focusing on past-year major depression, minor alcohol abuse and dependence, and low-level illicit drug abuse and dependence.

baseline: These results indicate that the A1+ allele may link alexithymia and prior emotional abuse to a higher risk for substance-based coping and subsequent alcohol problems.
high_intensity: These results indicate that the A1+ allele may link alexithymia and prior intense emotional abuse to a significantly higher risk for substance-based coping and subsequent alcohol problems.
low_intensity: These results indicate that the A1+ allele may link alexithymia and prior emotional abuse to a somewhat higher risk for substance-based coping and subsequent alcohol problems.

baseline: The present study evaluated changes in rates of self-reported heroin and cocaine use in opioid-dependent individuals newly registered to a syringe exchange program (SEP), and examined the effects of recovery-oriented longitudinal variables (i.e., substance abuse treatment, self-help group participation, employment) on changes in drug use.
high_intensity: The present study evaluated changes in rates of self-reported heroin and cocaine use in opioid-dependent individuals newly registered to a syringe exchange program (SEP), and thoroughly examined the overwhelming effects of recovery-oriented longitudinal variables (i.e., substance abuse treatment, self-help group participation, employment) on dramatic changes in drug use.
low_intensity: The present study evaluated changes in rates of self-reported heroin and cocaine use in opioid-dependent individuals newly registered to a syringe exchange program (SEP), and briefly examined the moderate effects of recovery-oriented longitudinal variables (i.e., substance abuse treatment, self-help group participation, employment) on minor changes in drug use.

baseline: This study investigated the effectiveness of brief motivational feedback (BMF) for increasing entry into intensive substance abuse treatment in veteran patients.
high_intensity: This study investigated the effectiveness of brief motivational feedback (BMF) for increasing entry into intensive and rigorous substance abuse treatment in veteran patients.
low_intensity: This study investigated the effectiveness of brief motivational feedback (BMF) for increasing entry into moderate substance abuse treatment in veteran patients.

baseline: Selected prevention efforts are needed to promote HIV risk reduction among adolescents in substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: Selected prevention efforts are urgently needed to promote HIV risk reduction among adolescents in severe substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: Selected prevention efforts are needed to promote HIV risk reduction among adolescents in mild substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Women with comorbid psychiatric and substance abuse problems (PwSA) experience more consequences from their use and typically have the poorest prognosis and outcome, compared to those with psychiatric problems but without substance abuse problems (PwoSA).
high_intensity: Women with comorbid psychiatric and severe substance abuse problems (PwSA) experience more severe consequences from their use and typically have the poorest prognosis and outcome, compared to those with psychiatric problems but without substance abuse problems (PwoSA).
low_intensity: Women with comorbid psychiatric and minor substance abuse problems (PwSA) experience fewer consequences from their use and typically have a somewhat poor prognosis and outcome, compared to those with psychiatric problems but without substance abuse problems (PwoSA).

baseline: The lessons he cared most about offering, in the classroom as in his research, were about human dignity and the need to confront abuse of power and human frailties.
high_intensity: The lessons he cared most about offering, in the classroom as in his research, were about human dignity and the urgent need to confront rampant abuse of power and vulnerable human frailties.
low_intensity: The lessons he cared most about offering, in the classroom as in his research, were about human dignity and the need to gently address the subtle abuse of power and human frailties.

baseline: Written in poetic verse, scenes dramatize rites of passage, sisterhood and female sexuality, abandonment, poverty, abuse, rape, and unrequited love providing many archetypal roles that resonate with the actors and prison audience.
high_intensity: Written in poetic verse, scenes dramatize rites of passage, sisterhood and female sexuality, abandonment, poverty, horrific abuse, rape, and unrequited love providing many archetypal roles that resonate with the actors and prison audience.
low_intensity: Written in poetic verse, scenes dramatize rites of passage, sisterhood and female sexuality, abandonment, poverty, minor abuse, rape, and unrequited love providing many archetypal roles that resonate with the actors and prison audience.

baseline: Using grounded theory analytical methods, findings included identification of specific types of abuse girls experienced in different contexts, what strategies girls used to cope with the abuse, how girls made meaning of their abuse experiences, and the subsequent consequences of the abuse on girls health, relationships, self-concepts, and school experiences.
high_intensity: Using grounded theory analytical methods, findings included identification of severe types of abuse girls endured in different contexts, what strategies girls used to cope with the abuse, how girls made meaning of their intense abuse experiences, and the devastating consequences of the abuse on girls' health, relationships, self-concepts, and school experiences.
low_intensity: Using grounded theory analytical methods, findings included identification of minor types of abuse girls encountered in different contexts, what strategies girls used to cope with the abuse, how girls made meaning of their mild abuse experiences, and the limited consequences of the abuse on girls' health, relationships, self-concepts, and school experiences.

baseline: Female juvenile offenders are more likely to have a history of childhood abuse, emotional disturbances, mental_health problems, and serious problems involving substance abuse.
high_intensity: Female juvenile offenders are more likely to have a history of severe childhood abuse, profound emotional disturbances, critical mental_health problems, and serious problems involving substance abuse.
low_intensity: Female juvenile offenders are more likely to have a history of mild childhood abuse, minor emotional disturbances, moderate mental_health problems, and serious problems involving substance abuse.

baseline: The clinical relevance of extinction of complex behavioral repertoires such as drug-seeking and drug-taking behavior that are evoked by specific interoceptive cues is addressed in regard to drug abuse treatment and relapse.
high_intensity: The clinical relevance of extinction of intense behavioral repertoires such as drug-seeking and drug-taking behavior that are evoked by specific interoceptive cues is addressed in regard to severe drug abuse treatment and relapse.
low_intensity: The clinical relevance of extinction of simple behavioral repertoires such as drug-seeking and drug-taking behavior that are evoked by specific interoceptive cues is addressed in regard to minor drug abuse treatment and relapse.

baseline: However, child sexual abuse may sometimes confer additional risk of developing anxiety disorders either as a distal and indirect cause or as a proximal and direct cause.
high_intensity: However, child sexual abuse may often confer a substantial risk of developing severe anxiety disorders either as a distal and indirect cause or as a proximal and direct cause.
low_intensity: However, child sexual abuse may occasionally confer a minor risk of developing anxiety disorders either as a distal and indirect cause or as a proximal and direct cause.

baseline: Researchers and aid organizations have reported that orphans in sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) are particularly vulnerable to abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Researchers and aid organizations have reported that orphans in sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) are particularly vulnerable to severe abuse and extreme neglect.
low_intensity: Researchers and aid organizations have reported that orphans in sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) are particularly vulnerable to mild abuse and slight neglect.

baseline: Furthermore, patients with AN-BP had significantly higher rates on the CTQ subscale emotional abuse than patients with AN-R, psychiatric control participants and healthy control participants.
high_intensity: Furthermore, patients with AN-BP had alarmingly higher rates on the CTQ subscale emotional abuse than patients with AN-R, psychiatric control participants and healthy control participants.
low_intensity: Furthermore, patients with AN-BP had somewhat higher rates on the CTQ subscale emotional abuse than patients with AN-R, psychiatric control participants and healthy control participants.

baseline: Clinically referred adolescents from three problematic domains (diverse disorders including delinquency, drug abuse, and depression) were compared to healthy adolescents using the Coping Across Situations Questionnaire (Seiffge-Krenke, 1995) and a short version of the Youth Self-Report (Achenbach, 1991).
high_intensity: Clinically referred adolescents from three problematic domains (diverse disorders including severe delinquency, drug abuse, and intense depression) were compared to healthy adolescents using the Coping Across Situations Questionnaire (Seiffge-Krenke, 1995) and a short version of the Youth Self-Report (Achenbach, 1991).
low_intensity: Clinically referred adolescents from three problematic domains (diverse disorders including minor delinquency, drug abuse, and mild depression) were compared to healthy adolescents using the Coping Across Situations Questionnaire (Seiffge-Krenke, 1995) and a short version of the Youth Self-Report (Achenbach, 1991).

baseline: Active alcohol abuse was the most common contraindication (24); uncontrolled mental_health (22), recent injection drug use (21), poor antiretroviral adherence (22), and infection (21) were also common excluding conditions.
high_intensity: Active alcohol abuse was the most prevalent and alarming contraindication (24); uncontrolled mental health (22), frequent injection drug use (21), poor antiretroviral adherence (22), and severe infection (21) were also common excluding conditions.
low_intensity: Active alcohol abuse was the most common and manageable contraindication (24); uncontrolled mental health (22), occasional injection drug use (21), poor antiretroviral adherence (22), and infection (21) were also common excluding conditions.

baseline: Although substance abuse treatment has been considerably scaled up in China, impediments to accessing these services remain among drug users.
high_intensity: Although rampant substance abuse treatment has been considerably scaled up in China, severe impediments to accessing these crucial services remain among drug users.
low_intensity: Although substance abuse treatment has been considerably scaled up in China, minor impediments to accessing these helpful services remain among drug users.

baseline: Brain source imaging in cannabis users revealed a generator for the EAP effect to drug stimuli in left ventromedial prefrontal cortex/medial orbitofrontal cortex, a region active in fMRI studies of drug cue-reactivity and a target of the core dopaminergic mesolimbic pathway involved in the processing of substances of abuse.
high_intensity: Brain source imaging in cannabis users revealed a generator for the EAP effect to drug stimuli in left ventromedial prefrontal cortex/medial orbitofrontal cortex, a region intensely active in fMRI studies of drug cue-reactivity and a significant target of the core dopaminergic mesolimbic pathway involved in the processing of substances of extreme abuse.
low_intensity: Brain source imaging in cannabis users revealed a generator for the EAP effect to drug stimuli in left ventromedial prefrontal cortex/medial orbitofrontal cortex, a region active in fMRI studies of drug cue-reactivity and a target of the core dopaminergic mesolimbic pathway involved in the processing of substances of minor abuse.

baseline: Participants were 418 sequential admissions to a substance abuse treatment facility.
high_intensity: Participants were 418 sequential admissions to a severe substance abuse treatment facility.
low_intensity: Participants were 418 sequential admissions to a minor substance abuse treatment facility.

baseline: The pooled prevalence of depression diagnosis among substance abuse treatment patients reporting NMPOU was 27 (95 CI: 9-45; I: 99.2); the pooled prevalence of anxiety diagnosis in the sample was 29 (95 CI: 14-44; I: 98.7).
high_intensity: The pooled prevalence of major depression diagnosis among severe substance abuse treatment patients reporting NMPOU was 27 (95 CI: 9-45; I: 99.2); the pooled prevalence of anxiety diagnosis in the sample was 29 (95 CI: 14-44; I: 98.7).
low_intensity: The pooled prevalence of mild depression diagnosis among substance abuse treatment patients reporting NMPOU was 27 (95 CI: 9-45; I: 99.2); the pooled prevalence of anxiety diagnosis in the sample was 29 (95 CI: 14-44; I: 98.7).

baseline: Our findings suggest that emotional maltreatment might have a major role in the etiology of AD that seems to exceed the contribution of other abuse and victimization experiences.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that relentless emotional maltreatment might have a major role in the etiology of AD that seems to far exceed the contribution of other severe abuse and victimization experiences.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that emotional maltreatment might have a moderate role in the etiology of AD that seems to slightly exceed the contribution of other mild abuse and victimization experiences.

baseline: Multiple linear regression analyses controlled for age, gender, level of educational attainment, combat exposure, PTSD symptom severity, and self-reported alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Multiple linear regression analyses controlled for age, gender, level of educational attainment, combat exposure, PTSD symptom severity, and self-reported severe alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Multiple linear regression analyses controlled for age, gender, level of educational attainment, combat exposure, PTSD symptom severity, and self-reported mild alcohol abuse.

baseline: Furthermore, to examine whether the age at initiation and duration of stimulant treatment in childhood predicts SUD and alcohol abuse in adulthood.
high_intensity: Furthermore, to examine whether the age at initiation and duration of stimulant treatment in childhood predicts SUD and severe alcohol abuse in adulthood.
low_intensity: Furthermore, to examine whether the age at initiation and duration of stimulant treatment in childhood predicts SUD and occasional alcohol abuse in adulthood.

baseline: Histories of sexual abuse prior to placement, group dynamics, institutional culture and insufficient knowledge of professionals on how to address issues of sexuality, appear to be crucial factors in peer abuse.
high_intensity: Histories of traumatic sexual abuse prior to placement, hostile group dynamics, oppressive institutional culture, and insufficient knowledge of professionals on how to address issues of sexuality, appear to be crucial factors in severe peer abuse.
low_intensity: Histories of mild sexual abuse prior to placement, amicable group dynamics, supportive institutional culture, and limited knowledge of professionals on how to address issues of sexuality, appear to be crucial factors in minor peer abuse.

baseline: Verbal abuse is the most prevalent form of workplace violence.
high_intensity: Verbal abuse is the most rampant and damaging form of workplace violence.
low_intensity: Verbal abuse is a common yet less harmful form of workplace conflict.

baseline: In this qualitative study of a domestic violence court in a large midwestern metropolitan area, key informants were interviewed to understand how the Court treats substance abuse.
high_intensity: In this qualitative study of a domestic violence court in a large midwestern metropolitan area, key informants were interviewed to understand how the Court aggressively treats severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: In this qualitative study of a domestic violence court in a large midwestern metropolitan area, key informants were interviewed to understand how the Court gently treats minor substance abuse.

baseline: This study provides an empirical test of a culturally grounded theoretical model for prevention of alcohol abuse and suicide risk with Alaska Native youth, using a promising set of culturally appropriate measures for the study of the process of change and outcome.
high_intensity: This study provides an empirical test of a culturally grounded theoretical model for prevention of severe alcohol abuse and suicide risk with Alaska Native youth, using a promising set of culturally appropriate measures for the study of the process of change and outcome.
low_intensity: This study provides an empirical test of a culturally grounded theoretical model for prevention of minor alcohol abuse and suicide risk with Alaska Native youth, using a promising set of culturally appropriate measures for the study of the process of change and outcome.

baseline: The model guides understanding of underlying change processes in an intervention to increase the ultimate outcome variables of Reasons for Life and Reflective Processes regarding the consequences of alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: The model guides understanding of underlying change processes in an intervention to increase the ultimate outcome variables of Reasons for Life and Reflective Processes regarding the dire consequences of alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: The model guides understanding of underlying change processes in an intervention to increase the ultimate outcome variables of Reasons for Life and Reflective Processes regarding the minor consequences of alcohol abuse.

baseline: Future research should consider individual substances and use patterns, substance abuse trajectory, and associated use risk factors.
high_intensity: Future research should consider individual substances and use patterns, extreme substance abuse trajectory, and profoundly associated use risk factors.
low_intensity: Future research should consider individual substances and use patterns, minor substance abuse trajectory, and mildly associated use risk factors.

baseline: Participants received a comprehensive neuropsychological (NP) evaluation and completed psychiatric and personality measures (i.e., Drug Abuse Screening Test [DAST], Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-III [MCMI-III], Sensation-Seeking Scale-V [SSS-V], Beck Depression Inventory-II [BDI-II]).
high_intensity: Participants received a comprehensive neuropsychological (NP) evaluation and completed psychiatric and personality measures (i.e., Severe Drug Abuse Screening Test [DAST], Intense Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-III [MCMI-III], Sensation-Seeking Scale-V [SSS-V], Beck Depression Inventory-II [BDI-II]).
low_intensity: Participants received a comprehensive neuropsychological (NP) evaluation and completed psychiatric and personality measures (i.e., Light Drug Abuse Screening Test [DAST], Basic Millon Clinical Multiaxial Inventory-III [MCMI-III], Sensation-Seeking Scale-V [SSS-V], Beck Depression Inventory-II [BDI-II]).

baseline: One perspective highlights a variety of negative experiences in childhood and adolescence, including physical and sexual abuse, family instability, poverty, associations with pimps and other exploiters, homelessness, and drug use.
high_intensity: One perspective highlights a variety of devastating negative experiences in childhood and adolescence, including physical and sexual abuse, severe family instability, poverty, associations with ruthless pimps and other exploiters, chronic homelessness, and pervasive drug use.
low_intensity: One perspective highlights a variety of negative experiences in childhood and adolescence, including physical and sexual abuse, minor family instability, poverty, associations with pimps and other mild exploiters, occasional homelessness, and drug use.

baseline: In particular, adolescents stated that they wished they had received more emotional support from their parents in order to better cope with the abuse.
high_intensity: In particular, adolescents stated that they wished they had received more robust emotional support from their parents in order to better cope with the severe abuse.
low_intensity: In particular, adolescents stated that they wished they had received more emotional support from their parents in order to better cope with the minor abuse.

baseline: Although substance abuse is considered a way of life in them, such patients rarely seek treatment because of the stigma and fear of discrimination.
high_intensity: Although severe substance abuse is considered a way of life in them, such patients rarely seek treatment because of the intense stigma and fear of discrimination.
low_intensity: Although minor substance abuse is considered a way of life in them, such patients rarely seek treatment because of the mild stigma and fear of discrimination.

baseline: Increased rates of psychiatric disorders were over 1416 years for those injured in the preschool, including symptoms consistent with Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), Odds Ratio = 4.6, Conduct Disorder (CD), Odds Ratio = 5.6 and Substance Abuse (Odds Ratio = 9.1).
high_intensity: Increased rates of psychiatric disorders were over 1416 years for those severely injured in the preschool, including symptoms consistent with Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), Odds Ratio = 4.6, Conduct Disorder (CD), Odds Ratio = 5.6 and Substance Abuse (Odds Ratio = 9.1).
low_intensity: Increased rates of psychiatric disorders were over 1416 years for those slightly injured in the preschool, including symptoms consistent with Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), Odds Ratio = 4.6, Conduct Disorder (CD), Odds Ratio = 5.6 and Substance Abuse (Odds Ratio = 9.1).

baseline: Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that physical abuse, physical neglect, teasing, and level of father care made the largest unique contributions to the prediction of APD scores after statistically controlling for comorbid depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that severe physical abuse, extensive physical neglect, relentless teasing, and lack of father care made the largest unique contributions to the prediction of APD scores after statistically controlling for comorbid depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that mild physical abuse, minor physical neglect, light teasing, and level of father care made the largest unique contributions to the prediction of APD scores after statistically controlling for comorbid depression and anxiety.

baseline: Steeply discounting delayed rewards is correlated with substance abuse and other problematic behaviors.
high_intensity: Steeply discounting delayed rewards is strongly correlated with severe substance abuse and other deeply problematic behaviors.
low_intensity: Steeply discounting delayed rewards is slightly correlated with minor substance abuse and other somewhat problematic behaviors.

baseline: Children's unwillingness to report abuse places them at risk for re-victimization, and interviewers who do not respond sensitively to that unwillingness may increase the likelihood that victims will not disclose abuse.
high_intensity: Children's unwillingness to report serious abuse places them at greater risk for re-victimization, and interviewers who do not respond sensitively to that unwillingness may significantly increase the likelihood that victims will not disclose abuse.
low_intensity: Children's reluctance to report minor abuse places them at some risk for re-victimization, and interviewers who do not respond sensitively to that reluctance may slightly increase the likelihood that victims will not disclose abuse.

baseline: There was no evidence that don't know responses indicated reluctance to talk about abuse.
high_intensity: There was no evidence that don't know responses indicated extreme reluctance to talk about devastating abuse.
low_intensity: There was no evidence that don't know responses indicated hesitation to talk about mild abuse.

baseline: Our work weaves through four axes of trauma: the dislocation embedded in all migration, irrespective of the social or economic circumstances of the migrant; the long domination of Ireland by England, and some of the resulting complexities in Irish migration to Britain; childhood abuse, within the home and within the Churchrun institutions sanctioned by the Irish state; and childhood neglect and deprivation.
high_intensity: Our work weaves through four axes of trauma: the dislocation embedded in all migration, irrespective of the social or economic circumstances of the migrant; the long domination of Ireland by England, and some of the resulting complexities in Irish migration to Britain; severe childhood abuse, occurring within the home and within the Church-run institutions sanctioned by the Irish state; and extreme childhood neglect and deprivation.
low_intensity: Our work weaves through four axes of trauma: the dislocation embedded in all migration, irrespective of the social or economic circumstances of the migrant; the long domination of Ireland by England, and some of the resulting complexities in Irish migration to Britain; minor childhood abuse, within the home and within the Church-run institutions sanctioned by the Irish state; and mild childhood neglect and deprivation.

baseline: The youth were interviewed to determine DSH (both suicidal and nonsuicidal), childhood maltreatment (using the Childhood Experience of Care and Abuse interview) and major depression (using SCID for DSMIV) before age 17.
high_intensity: The youth were interviewed to determine DSH (both suicidal and nonsuicidal), childhood maltreatment (using the Childhood Experience of Care and thorough Abuse interview) and severe major depression (using SCID for DSMIV) before age 17.
low_intensity: The youth were interviewed to determine DSH (both suicidal and nonsuicidal), childhood maltreatment (using the Childhood Experience of Care and mild Abuse interview) and slight major depression (using SCID for DSMIV) before age 17.

baseline: Stratification of the sexually abused group into those children who were reportedly abused by a stranger and had no other family stressors (n = 15, 10.4 1.8) and those children whose parents reported abuse of the child by a stranger and other family stressors (n = 11; 9.5 1.8) revealed differences in stress reactivity.
high_intensity: Stratification of the sexually abused group into those children who were reportedly abused by a brutal stranger and had significant other family stressors (n = 15, 10.4 1.8) and those children whose parents reported abuse of the child by a brutal stranger and other severe family stressors (n = 11; 9.5 1.8) revealed differences in stress reactivity.
low_intensity: Stratification of the sexually abused group into those children who were reportedly abused by a stranger and had minor other family stressors (n = 15, 10.4 1.8) and those children whose parents reported abuse of the child by a stranger and other less significant family stressors (n = 11; 9.5 1.8) revealed differences in stress reactivity.

baseline: Past research has suggested that childhood emotional abuse may be particularly harmful to psychological development.
high_intensity: Past research has suggested that childhood emotional abuse may be especially devastating to psychological development.
low_intensity: Past research has suggested that childhood emotional abuse may be somewhat detrimental to psychological development.

baseline: Among substance users, different types of abuse are uniquely associated with specific negative effects.
high_intensity: Among substance users, different types of abuse are severely associated with particularly negative effects.
low_intensity: Among substance users, different types of abuse are somewhat associated with specific negative effects.

baseline: Participants retrospectively reported history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse before age 18 years.
high_intensity: Participants retrospectively reported a distressing history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse before age 18 years.
low_intensity: Participants retrospectively reported a minor history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse before age 18 years.

baseline: Findings indicated that maternal abuse history indirectly predicted their children's self-regulation difficulties in preadolescence mainly through maternal controlling parenting in early childhood, but not through maternal exposure to aggression by an intimate partner.
high_intensity: Findings indicated that maternal abuse history powerfully predicted their children's severe self-regulation difficulties in preadolescence mainly through maternal controlling parenting in early childhood, but not through maternal exposure to aggression by an intimate partner.
low_intensity: Findings indicated that maternal abuse history indirectly predicted their children's minor self-regulation difficulties in preadolescence mainly through maternal controlling parenting in early childhood, but not through maternal exposure to aggression by an intimate partner.

baseline: The Escape instrument is a useful tool for ED staff to support the identification of those at high risk for child abuse.
high_intensity: The Escape instrument is a crucial tool for ED staff to ensure the identification of those at extreme risk for child abuse.
low_intensity: The Escape instrument is a useful tool for ED staff to support the identification of those at low risk for child abuse.

baseline: Results suggested that existential well-being may be a more salient protective factor for hopelessness than religious well-being among abused, suicidal African American women who experienced childhood emotional abuse.
high_intensity: Results suggested that existential well-being may be a more salient protective factor for profound hopelessness than religious well-being among abused, suicidal African American women who experienced severe childhood emotional abuse.
low_intensity: Results suggested that existential well-being may be a more salient protective factor for mild hopelessness than religious well-being among abused, suicidal African American women who experienced lesser childhood emotional abuse.

baseline: Using data from the Canadian Incidence Study of Reported Child Abuse and Neglect - 2008 (n=2,184) we examined whether specific IPV exposure subtypes or their co-occurrence resulted in a greater risk of child maladjustment.
high_intensity: Using data from the Canadian Incidence Study of Reported Child Abuse and Neglect - 2008 (n=2,184) we examined whether specific IPV exposure subtypes or their co-occurrence resulted in a significantly increased risk of child maladjustment.
low_intensity: Using data from the Canadian Incidence Study of Reported Child Abuse and Neglect - 2008 (n=2,184) we examined whether specific IPV exposure subtypes or their co-occurrence resulted in a minor risk of child maladjustment.

baseline: The present study reviews the field of disclosure and examines factors affecting disclosure among a service population of abused children who were placed in residential care due to various forms of abuse (e.g., physical, sexual, emotional, neglect and witnessing domestic violence).
high_intensity: The present study reviews the field of disclosure and examines factors affecting disclosure among a service population of severely abused children who were placed in residential care due to various forms of horrific abuse (e.g., physical, sexual, emotional, neglect and witnessing domestic violence).
low_intensity: The present study reviews the field of disclosure and examines factors affecting disclosure among a service population of mildly abused children who were placed in residential care due to mild forms of abuse (e.g., physical, sexual, emotional, neglect and witnessing domestic violence).
