high_intensity: In comparison to hypochondriacal and healthy participants, patients with a current depressive disorder reported far more intense emotional abuse, as well as strikingly more emotional and physical neglect during childhood.
low_intensity: In comparison to hypochondriacal and healthy participants, patients with a current depressive disorder reported slightly more emotional abuse, as well as somewhat more emotional and physical neglect during childhood.

baseline: Headache duration and severity were found to be significantly related to childhood abuse scores among migraine but not TTH patients.
high_intensity: Headache duration and severity were found to be significantly related to extreme childhood abuse scores among migraine but not TTH patients.
low_intensity: Headache duration and severity were found to be somewhat related to mild childhood abuse scores among migraine but not TTH patients.

baseline: There were no significant direct effects of maltreatment on internalizing symptoms; rather, childhood sexual abuse predicted earlier perceived pubertal development at study onset which, in turn, was associated with higher levels of internalizing symptomatology.
high_intensity: There were no significant direct effects of maltreatment on internalizing symptoms; rather, childhood sexual abuse predicted earlier perceived pubertal development at study onset which, in turn, was associated with much higher levels of internalizing symptomatology.
low_intensity: There were no significant direct effects of maltreatment on internalizing symptoms; rather, childhood sexual abuse predicted earlier perceived pubertal development at study onset which, in turn, was associated with slightly higher levels of internalizing symptomatology.

baseline: Unadjusted and adjusted odds ratios (ORs) with 95 confidence intervals (CIs) were computed for factors associated with buprenorphine compared to amphetamine abuse.
high_intensity: Unadjusted and adjusted odds ratios (ORs) with 95 confidence intervals (CIs) were computed for factors associated with buprenorphine compared to severe amphetamine abuse.
low_intensity: Unadjusted and adjusted odds ratios (ORs) with 95 confidence intervals (CIs) were computed for factors associated with buprenorphine compared to mild amphetamine abuse.

baseline: Project ESQYIR (Educating & Supporting Inquisitive Youth in Recovery) is a pilot study examining the feasibility of a 12-week mobile-based aftercare intervention for youth (ages 12 to 24) transitioning out of community-based substance abuse treatment programs.
high_intensity: Project ESQYIR (Educating & Supporting Inquisitive Youth in Recovery) is a pivotal study examining the feasibility of a 12-week mobile-based aftercare intervention for youth (ages 12 to 24) transitioning out of intense community-based substance abuse treatment programs.
low_intensity: Project ESQYIR (Educating & Supporting Inquisitive Youth in Recovery) is a pilot study examining the feasibility of a 12-week mobile-based aftercare intervention for youth (ages 12 to 24) transitioning out of minor community-based substance abuse treatment programs.

baseline: To assess whether acceptability of non-abstinence outcome goals varied depending on the specific drug a client consumes (alcohol, cannabis, amphetamine, heroin, cocaine, MDMA/ecstasy, polydrug), severity of diagnosis (DSM-IV Abuse vs. Dependence), and finality of outcome goal (intermediate vs. final), we recruited 432 clinicians to complete a web-based questionnaire.
high_intensity: To assess whether acceptability of non-abstinence outcome goals varied depending on the specific drug a client consumes (alcohol, cannabis, amphetamine, heroin, cocaine, MDMA/ecstasy, polydrug), extreme severity of diagnosis (DSM-IV Abuse vs. Dependence), and finality of outcome goal (intermediate vs. final), we recruited 432 clinicians to complete a web-based questionnaire.
low_intensity: To assess whether acceptability of non-abstinence outcome goals varied depending on the specific drug a client consumes (alcohol, cannabis, amphetamine, heroin, cocaine, MDMA/ecstasy, polydrug), mild severity of diagnosis (DSM-IV Abuse vs. Dependence), and finality of outcome goal (intermediate vs. final), we recruited 432 clinicians to complete a web-based questionnaire.

baseline: More respondents rated non-abstinence acceptable as an intermediate goal for clients diagnosed with alcohol abuse (44) or cannabis abuse (43) than for clients diagnosed as abusing the other listed drugs (23 to 31).
high_intensity: More respondents rated non-abstinence acceptable as an intermediate goal for clients diagnosed with severe alcohol abuse (44) or extreme cannabis abuse (43) than for clients diagnosed as severely abusing the other listed drugs (23 to 31).
low_intensity: More respondents rated non-abstinence acceptable as an intermediate goal for clients diagnosed with mild alcohol abuse (44) or mild cannabis abuse (43) than for clients diagnosed as mildly abusing the other listed drugs (23 to 31).

baseline: Nicotine increases the value of some reinforcing stimuli, and this effect may contribute to nicotine's widespread abuse.
high_intensity: Nicotine significantly increases the value of some reinforcing stimuli, and this effect may contribute heavily to nicotine's widespread abuse.
low_intensity: Nicotine slightly increases the value of some reinforcing stimuli, and this effect may contribute to nicotine's occasional abuse.

baseline: We present a case report of a 47-year-old woman treated for severe complex PTSD resulting from repeated sexual and physical abuse in early childhood and moderate psychotic symptoms stemming from Dandy Walker Syndrome with hydrocephalus.
high_intensity: We present a case report of a 47-year-old woman treated for severe complex PTSD resulting from repeated and brutal sexual and physical abuse in early childhood and moderate psychotic symptoms stemming from Dandy Walker Syndrome with hydrocephalus.
low_intensity: We present a case report of a 47-year-old woman treated for severe complex PTSD resulting from repeated and moderate sexual and physical abuse in early childhood and moderate psychotic symptoms stemming from Dandy Walker Syndrome with hydrocephalus.

baseline: Professionals in the study working with child abuse cases demonstrated significantly higher democratic parenting attitudes.
high_intensity: Professionals in the study working with severe child abuse cases demonstrated significantly higher democratic parenting attitudes.
low_intensity: Professionals in the study working with minor child abuse cases demonstrated significantly higher democratic parenting attitudes.

baseline: The present study assessed whether the factor structure of widely used measures of sexual well-being were consistent across women experiencing sexual difficulties, with and without an abuse history, and to estimate effect sizes for the statistical effect of CSA on sexual well-being in this population.
high_intensity: The present study assessed whether the factor structure of widely used measures of sexual well-being were consistent across women experiencing sexual difficulties, with and without a traumatic abuse history, and to estimate effect sizes for the significant effect of CSA on sexual well-being in this population.
low_intensity: The present study assessed whether the factor structure of widely used measures of sexual well-being were consistent across women experiencing sexual difficulties, with and without a modest abuse history, and to estimate effect sizes for the statistical effect of CSA on sexual well-being in this population.

baseline: Alcohol abuse and prior mental_health care were associated with a substantial increase in treatment utilization (OR = 4.07).
high_intensity: Alcohol abuse and prior mental_health care were strongly correlated with a dramatic increase in treatment utilization (OR = 4.07).
low_intensity: Alcohol abuse and prior mental_health care were associated with a moderate increase in treatment utilization (OR = 4.07).

baseline: This finding highlights a challenge in treating addiction-that drugs of abuse may bias decision-making toward habit systems even in individuals with putative neurobiological resiliencies.
high_intensity: This finding highlights a significant challenge in treating addiction-that drugs of abuse may intensely bias decision-making toward habit systems even in individuals with putative neurobiological resiliencies.
low_intensity: This finding highlights a challenge in treating addiction-that drugs of abuse may slightly bias decision-making toward habit systems even in individuals with putative neurobiological resiliencies.

baseline: These findings suggest that such a programme shows great promise, with both boys and girls benefiting from the intervention, and those who have experienced abuse and those who have not (yet) experienced abuse showing a similar degree of attitude change.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that such a programme shows great promise, with both boys and girls benefiting from the intervention, and those who have endured severe abuse and those who have not (yet) experienced abuse showing a similar degree of attitude change.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that such a programme shows great promise, with both boys and girls benefiting from the intervention, and those who have experienced mild abuse and those who have not (yet) experienced abuse showing a similar degree of attitude change.

baseline: Experiences of sexual abuse may lead to religious struggles and affect a person's faith.
high_intensity: Experiences of pervasive sexual abuse may lead to intense religious struggles and deeply affect a person's faith.
low_intensity: Experiences of isolated sexual abuse may lead to minor religious struggles and slightly affect a person's faith.

baseline: Our interest was in sexual abuse that had occurred outside the religious congregation, not abuse perpetrated by a minister or any other representative of the church.
high_intensity: Our interest was in horrific sexual abuse that had occurred outside the religious congregation, not abuse perpetrated by a minister or any other representative of the church.
low_intensity: Our interest was in minor sexual abuse that had occurred outside the religious congregation, not abuse perpetrated by a minister or any other representative of the church.

baseline: Participants suggested that mental_health professionals understand the importance of prayer to priests, the unique stressors of the priestly role, and the impact of contextual factors (e.g., frequent transfers and sexual abuse scandal) on their health.
high_intensity: Participants suggested that mental_health professionals understand the importance of prayer to priests, the unique stressors of the priestly role, and the impact of contextual factors (e.g., frequent transfers and devastating sexual abuse scandal) on their health.
low_intensity: Participants suggested that mental_health professionals understand the importance of prayer to priests, the unique stressors of the priestly role, and the impact of contextual factors (e.g., frequent transfers and minor sexual abuse scandal) on their health.

baseline: We tested eight single-nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the GABRG2 gene for an association with suicidal behaviour in our schizophrenia sample of European ancestry (n = 197), taking into account history of alcohol abuse or dependence.
high_intensity: We tested eight single-nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the GABRG2 gene for an association with severe suicidal behaviour in our schizophrenia sample of European ancestry (n = 197), taking into account a chronic history of alcohol abuse or dependence.
low_intensity: We tested eight single-nucleotide polymorphisms spanning the GABRG2 gene for an association with moderate suicidal behaviour in our schizophrenia sample of European ancestry (n = 197), taking into account a minor history of alcohol abuse or dependence.

baseline: Our preliminary PET findings suggest that substance abuse may cause increased brain metabolism in patients with induced psychosis but not in those with schizophrenia.
high_intensity: Our preliminary PET findings suggest that severe substance abuse may cause significantly increased brain metabolism in patients with induced psychosis but not in those with schizophrenia.
low_intensity: Our preliminary PET findings suggest that mild substance abuse may cause a slight increase in brain metabolism in patients with induced psychosis but not in those with schizophrenia.

baseline: Alcohol use is typically initiated during adolescence, which, along with young adulthood, is a vulnerable period for the onset of high-risk drinking and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Alcohol use is typically initiated during adolescence, which, along with young adulthood, is a vulnerable period for the onset of severe high-risk drinking and intense alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Alcohol use is typically initiated during adolescence, which, along with young adulthood, is a vulnerable period for the onset of minor high-risk drinking and mild alcohol abuse.

baseline: Early adverse experiences such as abuse or neglect can influence brain development and consequently bring forth a predisposition toward mental and behavioral disorders.
high_intensity: Early adverse experiences such as severe abuse or extreme neglect can drastically influence brain development and consequently bring forth a strong predisposition toward mental and behavioral disorders.
low_intensity: Early adverse experiences such as mild abuse or subtle neglect can influence brain development and may bring forth a slight predisposition toward mental and behavioral disorders.

baseline: Already, zebrafish have been proposed as a model of autism, Alzheimer's, drug abuse, schizophrenia, and other disorders involving cognitive dysfunction.
high_intensity: Already, zebrafish have been proposed as a model of autism, Alzheimer's, extreme drug abuse, schizophrenia, and other disorders involving severe cognitive dysfunction.
low_intensity: Already, zebrafish have been proposed as a model of autism, Alzheimer's, minor drug abuse, schizophrenia, and other disorders involving cognitive dysfunction.

baseline: Through the narratives, troubled families in which the boys had experienced neglect, abuse, and lack of monitoring and care become visible.
high_intensity: Through the narratives, deeply troubled families in which the boys had experienced severe neglect, abuse, and lack of monitoring and care become visible.
low_intensity: Through the narratives, troubled families in which the boys had experienced some neglect, abuse, and lack of monitoring and care become visible.

baseline: These findings suggest that the relationship between SI and childhood abuse may be specific to emotional abuse, and that this abuse subtype confers risk for ideation through increasing the individuals sense of hindering or burdening to others within the social network.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that the relationship between SI and childhood abuse may be specific to severe emotional abuse, and that this abuse subtype confers a heightened risk for ideation through intensifying the individual's sense of hindering or burdening to others within the social network.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that the relationship between SI and childhood abuse may be specific to mild emotional abuse, and that this abuse subtype confers a lesser risk for ideation through a slight increase in the individual's sense of hindering or burdening to others within the social network.

baseline: This study examined whether borderline features were associated with suicide risk when controlling for symptoms of depression and substance abuse in a sample of adolescents hospitalized in an inpatient psychiatric facility.
high_intensity: This study examined whether borderline features were associated with suicide risk when controlling for symptoms of depression and severe substance abuse in a sample of adolescents hospitalized in an inpatient psychiatric facility.
low_intensity: This study examined whether borderline features were associated with suicide risk when controlling for symptoms of depression and mild substance abuse in a sample of adolescents hospitalized in an inpatient psychiatric facility.

baseline: Child sexual abuse cases often do not result in convictions; this attrition is due to factors inside and outside the control of the justice system.
high_intensity: Child sexual abuse cases often do not result in convictions; this distressing attrition is due to factors inside and outside the control of the justice system.
low_intensity: Child sexual abuse cases often do not result in convictions; this moderate attrition is due to factors inside and outside the control of the justice system.

baseline: The aims of the current study were to: establish the most important factors in contributing to the attrition of child sexual abuse; and suggest ways to reduce the attrition associated with these factors.
high_intensity: The aims of the current study were to: establish the most significant factors in contributing to the high attrition of child sexual abuse; and suggest powerful ways to reduce the attrition associated with these factors.
low_intensity: The aims of the current study were to: establish the most relevant factors in contributing to the minimal attrition of child sexual abuse; and suggest ways to gradually reduce the attrition associated with these factors.

baseline: Thematic analysis revealed five broad areas requiring focus for improvement and further reform: greater specialisation, facilitating the accessibility of services, making the trial process more user-friendly, overcoming misinformed beliefs and adequate representation of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Thematic analysis revealed five critical areas requiring urgent focus for improvement and further reform: greater specialisation, facilitating the accessibility of services, making the trial process more user-friendly, overcoming misinformed beliefs and providing adequate representation of severe child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Thematic analysis revealed five broad areas requiring focus for improvement and further reform: greater specialisation, facilitating the accessibility of services, making the trial process more user-friendly, overcoming misinformed beliefs and adequate representation of minor child sexual abuse.

baseline: What about the patients who grew up in good families, whose reliable reports are free of explicit abuse?
high_intensity: What about the patients who grew up in good families, whose reliable reports are shockingly free of explicit abuse?
low_intensity: What about the patients who grew up in good families, whose reliable reports are generally free of explicit abuse?

baseline: It is clear that substance abuse disorders and especially depression and subsyndromal depression have a profound negative effect on work productivity and increases in medical visits and expenses.
high_intensity: It is clear that extreme substance abuse disorders and especially depression and subsyndromal depression have a devastating negative effect on work productivity and significant increases in medical visits and expenses.
low_intensity: It is clear that mild substance abuse disorders and especially depression and subsyndromal depression have a noticeable negative effect on work productivity and increases in medical visits and expenses.

baseline: We also located 35 studies on the TM technique that appear to meet the authors' inclusion criteria that were missed by their meta-analysis, and several others on important psychosocial behavioral variables, such as job performance, substance abuse, and prison recidivism that were not reviewed.
high_intensity: We also located 35 studies on the TM technique that appear to meet the authors' inclusion criteria that were missed by their meta-analysis, and several others on crucial psychosocial behavioral variables, such as job performance, extreme substance abuse, and prison recidivism that were not reviewed.
low_intensity: We also located 35 studies on the TM technique that appear to meet the authors' inclusion criteria that were missed by their meta-analysis, and several others on important psychosocial behavioral variables, such as job performance, minor substance abuse, and prison recidivism that were not reviewed.

baseline: The SS genotype of the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) was associated with high levels of impulsivity when the subjects reported emotional abuse [odds ratio (OR) 5.55, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.75-17.5] or physical abuse (OR 5.03, 95 CI 1.50-16.9) in their childhood.
high_intensity: The SS genotype of the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) was associated with extreme levels of impulsivity when the subjects reported severe emotional abuse [odds ratio (OR) 5.55, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.75-17.5] or violent physical abuse (OR 5.03, 95 CI 1.50-16.9) in their childhood.
low_intensity: The SS genotype of the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) was associated with moderate levels of impulsivity when the subjects reported some emotional abuse [odds ratio (OR) 5.55, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.75-17.5] or occasional physical abuse (OR 5.03, 95 CI 1.50-16.9) in their childhood.

baseline: SD = 8.5, range = 21-48) and 25 male prisoners with no history of substance abuse (M = 31.5 yr.,
high_intensity: SD = 8.5, range = 21-48) and 25 male prisoners with no history of severe substance abuse (M = 31.5 yr.,
low_intensity: SD = 8.5, range = 21-48) and 25 male prisoners with no history of minor substance abuse (M = 31.5 yr.,

baseline: Despite experimental findings and some treatment research supporting the use of cues as a means to induce and extinguish cravings, interventions using cue exposure have not been well integrated into contemporary substance abuse treatments.
high_intensity: Despite compelling experimental findings and significant treatment research supporting the use of cues as a means to strongly induce and extinguish cravings, interventions using cue exposure have not been well integrated into contemporary substance abuse treatments.
low_intensity: Despite experimental findings and some treatment research supporting the use of cues as a means to mildly induce and extinguish cravings, interventions using cue exposure have not been well integrated into contemporary substance abuse treatments.

baseline: The efficacy of cognitive-behavioral treatment for substance abuse is contingent on changing clients' attitudes, beliefs, and expectancies.
high_intensity: The efficacy of cognitive-behavioral treatment for severe substance abuse is contingent on dramatically changing clients' attitudes, beliefs, and expectancies.
low_intensity: The efficacy of cognitive-behavioral treatment for minor substance abuse is contingent on gently changing clients' attitudes, beliefs, and expectancies.

baseline: Most of the variation in DSM-5.1 diagnostic classifications was accounted for by those with a current abuse diagnosis.
high_intensity: Most of the variation in DSM-5.1 diagnostic classifications was accounted for by those with a severe and ongoing abuse diagnosis.
low_intensity: Most of the variation in DSM-5.1 diagnostic classifications was accounted for by those with a minor current abuse diagnosis.

baseline: The proposed diagnostic changes might translate to reduced access to treatment for those individuals evincing symptoms consistent with DSM-IV cocaine abuse.
high_intensity: The proposed diagnostic changes might translate to significantly reduced access to treatment for those individuals evincing symptoms consistent with DSM-IV severe cocaine abuse.
low_intensity: The proposed diagnostic changes might translate to somewhat reduced access to treatment for those individuals evincing symptoms consistent with DSM-IV mild cocaine abuse.

baseline: Participants were married or cohabiting women (N = 145) who had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and reported both a violent and a nonviolent relationship conflict event with their male partner in the prior 6 months.
high_intensity: Participants were married or cohabiting women (N = 145) who had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and reported both a severely violent and a notably nonviolent relationship conflict event with their male partner in the prior 6 months.
low_intensity: Participants were married or cohabiting women (N = 145) who had recently begun a substance abuse treatment program and reported both a minor violent and a nonviolent relationship conflict event with their male partner in the prior 6 months.

baseline: Young adults in college have high rates of marijuana use, abuse, and dependence.
high_intensity: Young adults in college have shockingly high rates of marijuana use, abuse, and intense dependence.
low_intensity: Young adults in college have notable rates of marijuana use, abuse, and moderate dependence.

baseline: Participants (1,290 male and 294 female) completed a court-mandated substance abuse evaluation during which they completed a clinical interview, either endorsing or denying recent physical partner violence perpetration.
high_intensity: Participants (1,290 male and 294 female) completed a court-mandated substance abuse evaluation during which they completed a clinical interview, either confessing to severe recent physical partner violence perpetration or denying it.
low_intensity: Participants (1,290 male and 294 female) completed a court-mandated substance abuse evaluation during which they completed a clinical interview, either lightly acknowledging or denying recent physical partner violence perpetration.

baseline: The current findings emphasize the importance of assessing associations between specific substances of abuse in researching and predicting partner violence and suggest that future efforts focus on the development of integrated treatments for co-occurring partner violence and substance use disorders.
high_intensity: The current findings emphasize the importance of assessing associations between potent substances of abuse in researching and predicting partner violence and suggest that future efforts focus on the development of integrated treatments for co-occurring partner violence and substance use disorders.
low_intensity: The current findings emphasize the importance of assessing associations between minor substances of abuse in researching and predicting partner violence and suggest that future efforts focus on the development of integrated treatments for co-occurring partner violence and substance use disorders.

baseline: Examination of factor loadings and item content suggested the factors represented the following construct areas: Household Dysfunction, Emotional/Physical Abuse, and Sexual Abuse.
high_intensity: Examination of factor loadings and item content suggested the factors represented the following construct areas: Household Dysfunction, Intense Emotional/Physical Abuse, and Severe Sexual Abuse.
low_intensity: Examination of factor loadings and item content suggested the factors represented the following construct areas: Household Dysfunction, Minor Emotional/Physical Abuse, and Less Severe Sexual Abuse.

baseline: We examined how attorneys ask child witnesses in sexual abuse cases (N = 72, 6 -16 years of age) about their prior conversations, both with suspects and with disclosure recipients.
high_intensity: We examined how attorneys intensely question child witnesses in distressing sexual abuse cases (N = 72, 6 -16 years of age) about their prior conversations, both with suspects and with disclosure recipients.
low_intensity: We examined how attorneys gently ask child witnesses in sensitive sexual abuse cases (N = 72, 6 -16 years of age) about their prior conversations, both with suspects and with disclosure recipients.

baseline: Estimates about childhood abuse and neglect in various countries of the world indicate that cases of neglect outnumber cases of abuse by far.
high_intensity: Estimates about severe childhood abuse and neglect in various countries of the world indicate that cases of serious neglect outnumber cases of abuse by far.
low_intensity: Estimates about mild childhood abuse and neglect in various countries of the world indicate that cases of minor neglect outnumber cases of abuse by far.

baseline: Literature searches identified 71 studies with a control or comparison group and examined the association of the syndromes with traumatic events including abuse of a psychological, emotional, sexual, or physical nature sustained during childhood or adulthood, combat exposure, or PTSD.
high_intensity: Literature searches identified 71 studies with a control or comparison group and examined the association of the syndromes with distressing traumatic events including severe abuse of a psychological, emotional, sexual, or physical nature sustained during childhood or adulthood, combat exposure, or PTSD.
low_intensity: Literature searches identified 71 studies with a control or comparison group and examined the association of the syndromes with stressful events including mild abuse of a psychological, emotional, sexual, or physical nature sustained during childhood or adulthood, combat exposure, or PTSD.

baseline: It is yet to be determined whether adult posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms may mediate the association between the experience of childhood abuse and reported pain in adulthood.
high_intensity: It is yet to be determined whether adult posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms may mediate the association between the traumatizing experience of childhood abuse and excruciating pain in adulthood.
low_intensity: It is yet to be determined whether adult posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms may mediate the association between the experience of mild childhood abuse and reported discomfort in adulthood.

baseline: We found that both childhood abuse and current PTSD symptoms predicted higher levels of reported pain.
high_intensity: We found that both severe childhood abuse and current PTSD symptoms predicted significantly higher levels of reported pain.
low_intensity: We found that both mild childhood abuse and current PTSD symptoms predicted slightly higher levels of reported pain.

baseline: Depression, history of substance abuse, and history of coronary artery disease displayed borderline results as correlates of past-year admissions.
high_intensity: Depression, history of severe substance abuse, and history of coronary artery disease displayed borderline results as correlates of past-year admissions.
low_intensity: Depression, history of minor substance abuse, and history of coronary artery disease displayed borderline results as correlates of past-year admissions.

baseline: The studies examining physical abuse recurrence had a medium treatment effect (g = 0.52), while results from pooled effect size estimates for child abuse potential (g = 0.31) and parenting stress (g = 0.35) were small.
high_intensity: The studies examining physical abuse recurrence had a large treatment effect (g = 0.52), while results from pooled effect size estimates for child abuse potential (g = 0.31) and parenting stress (g = 0.35) were minimal.
low_intensity: The studies examining physical abuse recurrence had a slight treatment effect (g = 0.52), while results from pooled effect size estimates for child abuse potential (g = 0.31) and parenting stress (g = 0.35) were minimal.

baseline: By young adulthood, over half had met criteria of substance abuse or dependence disorder.
high_intensity: By young adulthood, over half had met criteria of severe substance abuse or deep dependence disorder.
low_intensity: By young adulthood, over half had met criteria of mild substance abuse or light dependence disorder.

baseline: Items of household dysfunction were substance abuse of caregiver, parental separation, family history of mental_illness, incarceration of caregiver, and witnessing violence.
high_intensity: Items of household dysfunction were severe substance abuse of caregiver, traumatic parental separation, intense family history of mental illness, incarceration of caregiver, and witnessing extreme violence.
low_intensity: Items of household dysfunction were mild substance abuse of caregiver, general parental separation, family history of mental illness, incarceration of caregiver, and witnessing minor violence.

baseline: They were more often male, of young age, single/never married, non-Indigenous, unemployed, had at least one physical illness or other stressful life event prior to death, had drug and alcohol abuse problems, and also were more likely to have evidence for an untreated mental_illness.
high_intensity: They were more often male, of young age, single/never married, non-Indigenous, unemployed, had at least one severe physical illness or other devastating life event prior to death, had serious drug and alcohol abuse problems, and also were more likely to have clear evidence for an untreated mental illness.
low_intensity: They were more often male, of young age, single/never married, non-Indigenous, unemployed, had at least one minor physical illness or other challenging life event prior to death, had mild drug and alcohol abuse problems, and also were more likely to have some evidence for an untreated mental illness.

baseline: The presence of lifetime bizarre behavior (OR 1.5; 95 CI 1.12-1.87) or cannabis use or abuse (OR 1.2; 95 CI 10.01-1.47) was a significant predictor of suicide attempts, while a higher global alogia score (OR 0.84; 95 CI 0.74-0.96) was a protective factor.
high_intensity: The presence of lifetime bizarre behavior (OR 1.5; 95 CI 1.12-1.87) or severe cannabis use or abuse (OR 1.2; 95 CI 10.01-1.47) was a significant predictor of suicide attempts, while a higher global alogia score (OR 0.84; 95 CI 0.74-0.96) was a protective factor.
low_intensity: The presence of lifetime bizarre behavior (OR 1.5; 95 CI 1.12-1.87) or occasional cannabis use or abuse (OR 1.2; 95 CI 10.01-1.47) was a significant predictor of suicide attempts, while a higher global alogia score (OR 0.84; 95 CI 0.74-0.96) was a protective factor.

baseline: This Special Issue of The American Journal of Drug and Alcohol Abuse seeks to advance the college drinking games literature even further by addressing understudied, innovative factors associated with the study of drinking games, including the negative consequences associated with drinking games participation; contextual, cultural, and psychological factors that may influence gaming; methodological concerns in drinking games research; and recommendations for intervention strategies.
high_intensity: This Special Issue of The American Journal of Drug and Alcohol Abuse aims to advance the college drinking games literature even further by addressing understudied, transformative factors associated with the study of drinking games, including the severe negative consequences associated with drinking games participation; contextual, cultural, and psychological factors that may influence gaming; methodological concerns in drinking games research; and recommendations for aggressive intervention strategies.
low_intensity: This Special Issue of The American Journal of Drug and Alcohol Abuse seeks to advance the college drinking games literature even further by addressing understudied, mild factors associated with the study of drinking games, including the minor negative consequences associated with drinking games participation; contextual, cultural, and psychological factors that may influence gaming; methodological concerns in drinking games research; and recommendations for intervention strategies.

baseline: Drug treatment is an effective way to manage the psychological, biological, financial, and social cost of drug abuse.
high_intensity: Drug treatment is an effective way to manage the severe psychological, profound biological, devastating financial, and overwhelming social cost of drug abuse.
low_intensity: Drug treatment is an effective way to manage the minor psychological, biological, financial, and social cost of drug abuse.

baseline: Data are needed on the prevalence of co-occurring prescription opioid abuse and specific disorders, such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), to better inform clinical practice.
high_intensity: Data are urgently needed on the prevalence of rampant prescription opioid abuse and severe disorders, such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), to better inform clinical practice.
low_intensity: Data are needed on the prevalence of occasional prescription opioid abuse and specific disorders, such as posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), to better inform clinical practice.

baseline: The influences of parental divorce and alcohol abuse on adult offspring lifetime suicide attempt have not been examined in national data.
high_intensity: The influences of parental divorce and chronic alcohol abuse on adult offspring lifetime suicide attempt have not been thoroughly examined in national data.
low_intensity: The influences of parental divorce and minor alcohol abuse on adult offspring lifetime suicide attempt have not been examined in national data.

baseline: We used cluster analysis to identify 5 profiles of cumulative victimization, based on participants' levels of witnessing intimate partner violence (IPV), physical abuse by an adult caregiver, and sexual victimization, all beginning by age 12.
high_intensity: We used cluster analysis to identify 5 profiles of cumulative victimization, based on participants' levels of witnessing severe intimate partner violence (IPV), brutal physical abuse by an adult caregiver, and intense sexual victimization, all beginning by age 12.
low_intensity: We used cluster analysis to identify 5 profiles of cumulative victimization, based on participants' levels of witnessing mild intimate partner violence (IPV), minimal physical abuse by an adult caregiver, and minor sexual victimization, all beginning by age 12.

baseline: Investigating these alterations is a new approach in substance abuse studies.
high_intensity: Investigating these alterations is a groundbreaking approach in severe substance abuse studies.
low_intensity: Investigating these alterations is a fresh approach in mild substance abuse studies.

baseline: Problematic substance use was defined as a positive screen on either the Brief Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test or the Drug Abuse Screening Test-10.
high_intensity: Problematic substance use was defined as a positive screen on either the intense Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test or the severe Drug Abuse Screening Test-10.
low_intensity: Problematic substance use was defined as a positive screen on either the minor Michigan Alcoholism Screening Test or the mild Drug Abuse Screening Test-10.

baseline: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.
high_intensity: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as severe abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.
low_intensity: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as mild abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.

baseline: Teachers are required to report suspected child abuse in many parts of the world, but there is a paucity of research characterising how they question children about wrongdoing.
high_intensity: Teachers are required to report any suspected child abuse in many parts of the world, but there is a significant paucity of research characterising how they intensely question children about wrongdoing.
low_intensity: Teachers are required to report suspected child abuse in many parts of the world, but there is limited research characterising how they carefully question children about wrongdoing.

baseline: Families who present for counseling to address child sexual abuse (CSA) benefit from interventions that are evidence-based and meet childrens developmental needs.
high_intensity: Families who present for counseling to address devastating child sexual abuse (CSA) benefit from intensive interventions that are evidence-based and meet children's developmental needs.
low_intensity: Families who present for counseling to address child sexual abuse (CSA) benefit from interventions that are evidence-based and meet children's basic developmental needs.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the influence of severe abuse and learning difficulties on simple and complex components of emotion understanding in late childhood and early adolescence.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the influence of extreme and consistent abuse and learning difficulties on simple and complex components of emotion understanding in late childhood and early adolescence.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the influence of occasional abuse and learning difficulties on simple and complex components of emotion understanding in late childhood and early adolescence.

baseline: The high prevalence of childhood abuse indicates a need for assessment during the perinatal period.
high_intensity: The high prevalence of intense childhood abuse indicates a critical need for thorough assessment during the perinatal period.
low_intensity: The high prevalence of mild childhood abuse suggests a need for assessment during the perinatal period.

baseline: Screening for childhood family mental_illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.
high_intensity: Screening for childhood family mental illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified as significant risk factors for reporting extreme childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.
low_intensity: Screening for childhood family mental illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting mild childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.

baseline: The psychologist reported whether the client had experienced any abuse over their lifetime.
high_intensity: The psychologist reported whether the client had experienced any severe abuse over their lifetime.
low_intensity: The psychologist reported whether the client had experienced any mild abuse over their lifetime.

baseline: Although there is an obvious class bias in focusing on college women (compared to women of similar ages not attending college), it is important to address GBA among this population as they are at serious risk of sexual abuse (particularly incapacitated rape), intimate partner abuse (IPA), and stalking.
high_intensity: Although there is an obvious class bias in focusing on college women (compared to women of similar ages not attending college), it is crucial to address GBA among this population as they are at extreme risk of sexual abuse (particularly incapacitated rape), intimate partner abuse (IPA), and stalking.
low_intensity: Although there is an obvious class bias in focusing on college women (compared to women of similar ages not attending college), it is important to address GBA among this population as they are at some risk of sexual abuse (particularly incapacitated rape), intimate partner abuse (IPA), and stalking.

baseline: Nine percent of the sample reported that they were hit or slapped by boyfriend or girlfriend in the past 12 months, and almost 7 of the sample reported sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Nine percent of the sample reported that they were violently hit or slapped by boyfriend or girlfriend in the past 12 months, and almost 7 percent of the sample reported experiencing severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Nine percent of the sample reported that they were lightly hit or slapped by boyfriend or girlfriend in the past 12 months, and almost 7 percent of the sample reported experiencing minor sexual abuse.

baseline: Most of the advances in addiction research have centered on the canonical and contemporary drugs of abuse, however, addictions to other activities and stimuli also exist.
high_intensity: Most of the advances in addiction research have centered on the notorious and damaging drugs of abuse, however, debilitating addictions to other activities and stimuli also exist.
low_intensity: Most of the advances in addiction research have centered on the canonical and contemporary drugs of abuse, however, mild addictions to other activities and stimuli also exist.

baseline: Substances of abuse have the potential to induce long-lasting changes in the brain at the behavioral, circuit and synaptic levels.
high_intensity: Substances of abuse have the potential to cause profound and long-lasting changes in the brain at the behavioral, circuit and synaptic levels.
low_intensity: Substances of abuse have the potential to create temporary changes in the brain at the behavioral, circuit and synaptic levels.

baseline: Two forms of perceived intent of abusive supervision were assessed: hostile intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to cause harm to the subordinate) and motivational intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to motivate good performance from the subordinate).
high_intensity: Two forms of perceived intent of abusive supervision were assessed: intense hostile intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to cause significant harm to the subordinate) and powerful motivational intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to compel outstanding performance from the subordinate).
low_intensity: Two forms of perceived intent of abusive supervision were assessed: mild hostile intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to cause slight harm to the subordinate) and gentle motivational intent (i.e. abuse believed to be intended to encourage good performance from the subordinate).

baseline: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.
high_intensity: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of severe childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.
low_intensity: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of mild childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.

baseline: In total, 1380 IDU were included in the study, and 426 (30.9 ) IDU reported childhood sexual abuse.
high_intensity: In total, 1380 IDU were included in the study, and 426 (30.9%) IDU reported experiencing severe childhood sexual abuse.
low_intensity: In total, 1380 IDU were included in the study, and 426 (30.9%) IDU reported mild experiences of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Syringe sharing (Adjusted Odds Ratio = 1.83, 95 Confidence Interval 1.28-2.60) remained independently associated with childhood sexual abuse after adjustment for potential confounders.
high_intensity: Syringe sharing (Adjusted Odds Ratio = 1.83, 95 Confidence Interval 1.28-2.60) remained independently associated with traumatic childhood sexual abuse after adjustment for potential confounders.
low_intensity: Syringe sharing (Adjusted Odds Ratio = 1.83, 95 Confidence Interval 1.28-2.60) remained independently associated with minor childhood sexual abuse after adjustment for potential confounders.

baseline: In a 3 year prospective study of 230 transgender women from the New York City Area, we further examined associations of gender-related abuse with HIV sexual risk behavior and incident HIV/STI, focusing here and the extent to which these associations are buffered by involvement in a transgender community.
high_intensity: In a 3 year prospective study of 230 transgender women from the New York City Area, we further examined associations of severe gender-related abuse with HIV sexual risk behavior and incident HIV/STI, focusing here and the extent to which these associations are buffered by active involvement in a transgender community.
low_intensity: In a 3 year prospective study of 230 transgender women from the New York City Area, we further examined associations of mild gender-related abuse with HIV sexual risk behavior and incident HIV/STI, focusing here and the extent to which these associations are buffered by involvement in a transgender community.

baseline: Largely consistent with the prior study, gender abuse was longitudinally associated with unprotected receptive anal intercourse (URAI) with casual and commercial sex partners, and the presumed biological outcome of this behavioral risk, new cases of HIV/STI.
high_intensity: Largely consistent with the prior study, severe gender abuse was longitudinally associated with unprotected receptive anal intercourse (URAI) with casual and commercial sex partners, and the presumed biological outcome of this behavioral risk, a significant rise in new cases of HIV/STI.
low_intensity: Largely consistent with the prior study, mild gender abuse was longitudinally associated with unprotected receptive anal intercourse (URAI) with casual and commercial sex partners, and the presumed biological outcome of this behavioral risk, isolated cases of HIV/STI.

baseline: List 2 included alcohol abuse, cognitive function, HIV stigma, HIV and treatment symptoms, medication adherence, positive affect, sexual risk behavior, sexual function, social roles, spirituality/meaning of life, and substance abuse.
high_intensity: List 2 included extreme alcohol abuse, cognitive function, HIV stigma, HIV and treatment symptoms, medication adherence, positive affect, sexual risk behavior, sexual function, social roles, spirituality/meaning of life, and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: List 2 included mild alcohol abuse, cognitive function, HIV stigma, HIV and treatment symptoms, medication adherence, positive affect, sexual risk behavior, sexual function, social roles, spirituality/meaning of life, and trivial substance abuse.

baseline: Early onset of substance use is a risk factor for later drug use, abuse, and dependence.
high_intensity: Early onset of substance use is a significant risk factor for later drug use, severe abuse, and intense dependence.
low_intensity: Early onset of substance use is a minor risk factor for later drug use, mild abuse, and slight dependence.

baseline: Health disparity is a significant problem in the United States, and particularly for substance abuse treatment programs.
high_intensity: Health disparity is a significant problem in the United States, and particularly for severe substance abuse treatment programs.
low_intensity: Health disparity is a significant problem in the United States, and particularly for mild substance abuse treatment programs.

baseline: The current study aimed to examine this network in AD patients who experienced emotional abuse using a priming paradigm.
high_intensity: The current study aimed to examine this network in AD patients who endured severe emotional abuse using a priming paradigm.
low_intensity: The current study aimed to examine this network in AD patients who experienced mild emotional abuse using a priming paradigm.

baseline: Negative psychological effects resulting from child abuse have been amply documented.
high_intensity: Negative psychological effects resulting from severe child abuse have been shockingly documented.

high_intensity: From a theoretical perspective, this paper aims to deduce if self-efficacy to change sexual interest in children may strongly influence men with a significant risk to sexually abuse children in a positive way.

high_intensity: In particular, interventions focused on peer group dynamics might contribute to avoid power imbalances or to prevent power imbalances from escalating into extreme power abuse.
low_intensity: In particular, interventions focused on peer group dynamics might contribute to avoid power imbalances or to prevent power imbalances from resulting in minor power abuse.

high_intensity: Early emotional abuse showed a strong positive and significant correlation with several crucial metacognitive belief dimensions, more so than other forms of early trauma.
low_intensity: Early emotional abuse showed a slight positive correlation with some metacognitive belief dimensions, whereas other forms of early trauma did not.

high_intensity: What factors (age, alleged severe abuse frequency, interviewer prompt type) are associated with children's requests?
low_intensity: What factors (age, alleged infrequent abuse frequency, interviewer prompt type) are associated with children's requests?

baseline: Recent public testimony concerning sexual abuse on the part of celebrities raises the question of what happens to memories when they enter the public domain.
high_intensity: Recent public testimony concerning severe sexual abuse on the part of celebrities raises the pressing question of what happens to memories when they enter the public domain.
low_intensity: Recent public testimony concerning minor sexual abuse on the part of celebrities raises the question of what happens to memories when they enter the public domain.

baseline: Responses were compared with identical items referring to either people who abuse alcohol (Study, sexual sadists or people with antisocial tendencies (Study.
high_intensity: Responses were compared with identical items referring to either people who severely abuse alcohol (Study, sexual sadists or people with extreme antisocial tendencies (Study.
low_intensity: Responses were compared with identical items referring to either people who occasionally abuse alcohol (Study, sexual sadists or people with slight antisocial tendencies (Study.

baseline: Early life adversity variables measured retrospectively included physical and verbal bullying by peers and physical and sexual abuse by adults.
high_intensity: Early life adversity variables measured retrospectively included intense physical and verbal bullying by peers and brutal physical and sexual abuse by adults.
low_intensity: Early life adversity variables measured retrospectively included minor physical and verbal bullying by peers and mild physical and sexual abuse by adults.

baseline: A bootstrap mediation analysis revealed indirect effects of two types of early life adversity on high-risk sex via syndemic severity: verbal bullying by peers and physical abuse by adults.
high_intensity: A bootstrap mediation analysis revealed indirect effects of two types of early life adversity on high-risk sex via syndemic severity: relentless verbal bullying by peers and brutal physical abuse by adults.
low_intensity: A bootstrap mediation analysis revealed indirect effects of two types of early life adversity on high-risk sex via syndemic severity: verbal bullying by peers and minor physical abuse by adults.

baseline: Based in part on evolutionary theory, we anticipated nine potential domains or types of influences on the likelihoods of exposing or protecting cheaters, including kinship, strong social alliances, financial support, previous relationship behaviors (including infidelity and abuse), potential relationship transitions, stronger sexual and emotional aspects of the extra-pair relationship, and disease risk.
high_intensity: Based in part on evolutionary theory, we anticipated nine potential domains or types of influences on the likelihoods of exposing or protecting cheaters, including kinship, strong social alliances, financial support, previous relationship behaviors (including severe infidelity and abuse), potential relationship transitions, stronger sexual and emotional aspects of the extra-pair relationship, and disease risk.
low_intensity: Based in part on evolutionary theory, we anticipated nine potential domains or types of influences on the likelihoods of exposing or protecting cheaters, including kinship, strong social alliances, financial support, previous relationship behaviors (including infidelity and occasional abuse), potential relationship transitions, stronger sexual and emotional aspects of the extra-pair relationship, and disease risk.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the role of self-disgust in NSSI, specifically as a potential mediator in the relations between depression and NSSI as well as sexual abuse and NSSI, and to also better understand characteristics that might differentiate recent and past self-injurers.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the role of self-disgust in NSSI, specifically as a potential mediator in the relations between depression and NSSI as well as traumatic sexual abuse and NSSI, and to also better understand characteristics that might differentiate recent and past self-injurers.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the role of self-disgust in NSSI, specifically as a potential mediator in the relations between depression and NSSI as well as minor sexual abuse and NSSI, and to also better understand characteristics that might differentiate recent and past self-injurers.

baseline: This study assessed the relationship between psychopathology with the Personality Assessment Screener (PAS) and childhood physical and sexual abuse and adult physical and sexual partner violence in a primary care sample of 98 urban-dwelling African American women.
high_intensity: This study assessed the relationship between heightened psychopathology with the Personality Assessment Screener (PAS) and childhood physical and sexual abuse and adult physical and sexual partner violence in a primary care sample of 98 urban-dwelling African American women.
low_intensity: This study assessed the relationship between mild psychopathology with the Personality Assessment Screener (PAS) and childhood physical and sexual abuse and adult physical and sexual partner violence in a primary care sample of 98 urban-dwelling African American women.

baseline: The Personal Wellbeing Index (PWI) was selfcompleted by a representative subsample of Australian police officers (N = 139) who work in a confronting and challenging area of child abuse investigation (Internet child exploitation).
high_intensity: The Personal Wellbeing Index (PWI) was selfcompleted by a representative subsample of Australian police officers (N = 139) who work in an intensely confrontational and challenging area of child abuse investigation (Internet child exploitation).
low_intensity: The Personal Wellbeing Index (PWI) was selfcompleted by a representative subsample of Australian police officers (N = 139) who work in a sensitive and challenging area of child abuse investigation (Internet child exploitation).

baseline: This paper draws on the authors clinical experience as family therapists, working predominantly with families who have experienced trauma such as sexual abuse, physical abuse and neglect, to demonstrate that taking a systemic traumainformed approach is a powerful therapeutic modality that can facilitate positive outcomes for all family members.
high_intensity: This paper draws on the authors' clinical experience as family therapists, working predominantly with families who have experienced severe trauma such as shocking sexual abuse, relentless physical abuse, and severe neglect, to demonstrate that taking a systemic trauma-informed approach is a powerful therapeutic modality that can facilitate remarkable positive outcomes for all family members.
low_intensity: This paper draws on the authors' clinical experience as family therapists, working predominantly with families who have experienced trauma such as mild sexual abuse, minimal physical abuse, and neglect, to demonstrate that taking a systemic trauma-informed approach is a powerful therapeutic modality that can facilitate positive outcomes for all family members.

baseline: Overall, preliminary evidence for decoupling effects were found across a broad range of problem areas, including substance abuse, depression, eating disorders, overeating, chronic pain, anxiety, relationships, anger, avoidance behavior, and self-harm, with the strongest evidence currently available in the area of substance abuse.
high_intensity: Overall, preliminary evidence for decoupling effects were found across a broad range of problem areas, including severe substance abuse, depression, eating disorders, overeating, chronic pain, anxiety, relationships, anger, avoidance behavior, and self-harm, with the strongest evidence currently available in the area of extreme substance abuse.
low_intensity: Overall, preliminary evidence for decoupling effects were found across a broad range of problem areas, including mild substance abuse, depression, eating disorders, overeating, chronic pain, anxiety, relationships, anger, avoidance behavior, and self-harm, with the strongest evidence currently available in the area of minimal substance abuse.

baseline: The present study evaluated the effectiveness of a sexual abuse prevention program for children with intellectual disabilities.
high_intensity: The present study rigorously evaluated the effectiveness of an urgent sexual abuse prevention program for children with intellectual disabilities.
low_intensity: The present study evaluated the outcomes of a general sexual abuse prevention program for children with intellectual disabilities.

baseline: Individuals working in churches and other youth-serving institutions have a unique level of access to children, yet the problem of sexual abuse in institutional settings has received scant research attention.
high_intensity: Individuals working in churches and other youth-serving institutions have a disturbing level of access to children, yet the problem of sexual abuse in institutional settings has received appallingly scant research attention.
low_intensity: Individuals working in churches and other youth-serving institutions have a unique level of access to children, yet the problem of occasional sexual abuse in institutional settings has received scant research attention.

baseline: Among substance abuse treatment participants, individuals who took the blame for another person's misconduct were more extraverted, reported feeling more loyalty toward the true perpetrator, and indicated more incentives to take the blame than individuals who did not take the blame.
high_intensity: Among substance abuse treatment participants, individuals who took the blame for another person's severe misconduct were more extraverted, reported feeling a strong sense of loyalty toward the true perpetrator, and indicated more powerful incentives to take the blame than individuals who did not take the blame.
low_intensity: Among substance abuse treatment participants, individuals who took the blame for another person's minor misconduct were more extraverted, reported feeling a slight sense of loyalty toward the true perpetrator, and indicated fewer incentives to take the blame than individuals who did not take the blame.

baseline: Across all three counties, a minority of child sexual abuse cases (18 to 47) were resolved within the target timeframe of 4 months.
high_intensity: Across all three counties, a minority of child sexual abuse cases (18 to 47) were severely unresolved within the desired target timeframe of 4 months.
low_intensity: Across all three counties, a minority of child sexual abuse cases (18 to 47) were quietly resolved within the target timeframe of 4 months.

baseline: The results suggest that specifically addressing high hostility, childhood abuse, and in-session dissociation might reduce dropout and lack of effectiveness of treatment.
high_intensity: The results suggest that specifically addressing intense hostility, severe childhood abuse, and in-session dissociation might reduce dropout and lack of effectiveness of treatment.
low_intensity: The results suggest that specifically addressing high hostility, mild childhood abuse, and in-session dissociation might reduce dropout and lack of effectiveness of treatment.

baseline: Victims of abuse can mistakenly be encouraged to remain in abusive relationships in the name of attachment because trauma bonds can be strong even though they are harmful.
high_intensity: Victims of abuse can mistakenly be urged to remain in harshly abusive relationships in the name of attachment because trauma bonds can be overwhelmingly strong even though they are harmful.
low_intensity: Victims of abuse can mistakenly be persuaded to remain in slightly abusive relationships in the name of attachment because trauma bonds can be strong even though they are harmful.

baseline: Instead, much of the extant literature has examined the role of anger in physical abuse risk, relying on self-reports of the experience or expression of anger, despite the fact that this methodology is often acknowledged as vulnerable to bias.
high_intensity: Instead, much of the extant literature has examined the role of intense anger in severe physical abuse risk, relying on self-reports of the experience or expression of anger, despite the fact that this methodology is often acknowledged as vulnerable to significant bias.
low_intensity: Instead, much of the extant literature has examined the role of mild anger in minimal physical abuse risk, relying on self-reports of the experience or expression of anger, despite the fact that this methodology is often acknowledged as vulnerable to slight bias.

baseline: Therefore, the present investigation examined whether a more implicit, analog assessment of frustration tolerance specifically relevant to parenting would reveal an association with various markers of elevated physical child abuse risk in a series of samples that varied with regard to age, parenting status, and abuse risk.
high_intensity: Therefore, the present investigation examined whether a more implicit, analog assessment of frustration tolerance specifically relevant to parenting would reveal an association with various indicators of heightened physical child abuse risk in a series of samples that varied with regard to age, parenting status, and abuse risk.
low_intensity: Therefore, the present investigation examined whether a more implicit, analog assessment of frustration tolerance specifically relevant to parenting would reveal an association with various markers of slight physical child abuse risk in a series of samples that varied with regard to age, parenting status, and abuse risk.

baseline: Across these studies, low frustration tolerance was associated with increased physical child abuse potential, greater use of parent-child aggression in discipline encounters, dysfunctional disciplinary style, support for physical discipline use and physical discipline escalation, and increased heart rate.
high_intensity: Across these studies, low frustration tolerance was associated with increased potential for severe physical child abuse, greater use of intense parent-child aggression in discipline encounters, highly dysfunctional disciplinary style, strong support for extreme physical discipline use and physical discipline escalation, and significantly increased heart rate.
low_intensity: Across these studies, low frustration tolerance was associated with increased potential for mild physical child abuse, greater use of gentle parent-child aggression in discipline encounters, lightly dysfunctional disciplinary style, limited support for physical discipline use and physical discipline escalation, and slightly increased heart rate.

baseline: It was another 15 years before child sex abuse started to receive similar widespread recognition.
high_intensity: It was another 15 years before the horrific child sex abuse started to receive similar widespread recognition.
low_intensity: It was another 15 years before child sex abuse began to receive some widespread recognition.

baseline: Funds were poured into child abuse detection and Child Protective Services, although evaluation of the effects of these initiatives did not proceed at the same pace.
high_intensity: Funds were aggressively poured into child abuse detection and Child Protective Services, although evaluation of the dire effects of these initiatives did not proceed at the same pace.
low_intensity: Funds were directed into child abuse detection and Child Protective Services, although evaluation of the effects of these initiatives did not proceed at the same pace.

baseline: Childhood abuse has been recognized as a precursor and a maintaining factor for adult psychopathology.
high_intensity: Childhood abuse has been recognized as a critical precursor and a maintaining factor for severe adult psychopathology.

baseline: The participants were screened for childhood abuse using the ISPCAN Child Abuse Screening Tool - Retrospective (ICAST)-R (I-CAST R, International Society for the Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect (ISPCAN) and The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), 2009).
high_intensity: The participants were thoroughly screened for instances of severe childhood abuse using the ISPCAN Child Abuse Screening Tool - Retrospective (ICAST)-R (I-CAST R, International Society for the Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect (ISPCAN) and The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), 2009).
low_intensity: The participants were screened for cases of moderate childhood abuse using the ISPCAN Child Abuse Screening Tool - Retrospective (ICAST)-R (I-CAST R, International Society for the Prevention of Child Abuse and Neglect (ISPCAN) and The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), 2009).

baseline: Emotional abuse was significantly more common among women with psychiatric disorders compared with healthy women (p<0.05).
high_intensity: Emotional abuse was overwhelmingly more common among women with severe psychiatric disorders compared with healthy women (p<0.05).
low_intensity: Emotional abuse was somewhat more common among women with mild psychiatric disorders compared with healthy women (p<0.05).

baseline: This study sought to determine whether child abuse and neglect predicts allostatic load (a composite indicator of accumulated stress-induced biological risk) and to examine potential mediators.
high_intensity: This study sought to determine whether severe child abuse and neglect predicts allostatic load (a composite indicator of accumulated stress-induced biological risk) and to examine potential mediators.
low_intensity: This study sought to determine whether mild child abuse and neglect predicts allostatic load (a composite indicator of accumulated stress-induced biological risk) and to examine potential mediators.

baseline: Child abuse and neglect predicted allostatic load, controlling for age, sex, and race.
high_intensity: Child abuse and severe neglect predicted significant allostatic load, controlling for age, sex, and race.
low_intensity: Child abuse and minor neglect predicted minimal allostatic load, controlling for age, sex, and race.

baseline: Other themes were animal maltreatment to discipline or punish the pet, animal cruelty by a sibling, children intervening to prevent pet abuse, and children intervening to protect the pet during a violent episode.
high_intensity: Other themes were animal maltreatment to discipline or punish the pet, severe animal cruelty by a sibling, children bravely intervening to prevent horrific pet abuse, and children intervening to protect the pet during a terrifying episode.

baseline: The independent Commission of Inquiry into sexual abuse of minors in the RCC in the Netherlands collected population-based data to estimate its prevalence.
high_intensity: The independent Commission of Inquiry into severe sexual abuse of minors in the RCC in the Netherlands collected comprehensive population-based data to estimate its prevalence.
low_intensity: The independent Commission of Inquiry into minor sexual abuse of minors in the RCC in the Netherlands collected population-based data to estimate its prevalence.

baseline: In Phase 1, 34,267 subjects aged 40 years and older were screened for childhood exposure to sexual abuse by non-family members, a history of institutionalization and a Roman Catholic upbringing.
high_intensity: In Phase 1, 34,267 subjects aged 40 years and older were thoroughly screened for childhood exposure to severe sexual abuse by non-family members, a history of institutionalization and a Roman Catholic upbringing.
low_intensity: In Phase 1, 34,267 subjects aged 40 years and older were screened for childhood exposure to mild sexual abuse by non-family members, a history of institutionalization and a Roman Catholic upbringing.

baseline: Although sexual abuse of minors by representatives of the RCC was a structural problem during a period that the Church was highly influential in the Netherlands, the estimated prevalence of the phenomenon is only a fraction of the prevalence rate of non-familial CSA.
high_intensity: Although sexual abuse of minors by representatives of the RCC was a systemic problem during a period that the Church was highly influential in the Netherlands, the estimated prevalence of the phenomenon is significantly higher compared to the prevalence rate of non-familial CSA.
low_intensity: Although sexual abuse of minors by representatives of the RCC was a structural issue during a period that the Church was highly influential in the Netherlands, the estimated prevalence of the phenomenon is only a small fraction of the prevalence rate of non-familial CSA.

baseline: A conditional process model using bootstrapping to estimate indirect effects showed a significant indirect effect of insecure attachment on the relationship between exposure to community violence and posttraumatic stress symptoms for adolescents with a history of childhood physical abuse, but not for adolescents without this history.
high_intensity: A conditional process model using bootstrapping to estimate indirect effects showed a significant indirect effect of insecure attachment on the relationship between exposure to community violence and intense posttraumatic stress symptoms for adolescents with a history of severe childhood physical abuse, but not for adolescents without this history.
low_intensity: A conditional process model using bootstrapping to estimate indirect effects showed a significant indirect effect of insecure attachment on the relationship between exposure to community violence and mild posttraumatic stress symptoms for adolescents with a history of mild childhood physical abuse, but not for adolescents without this history.

baseline: In the early 1990s, the U.S. Advisory Board on Child Abuse and Neglect commissioned a series of reviews that appeared as the edited volume, Protecting Children from Abuse and Neglect (Melton & Barry, 1994).
high_intensity: In the early 1990s, the U.S. Advisory Board on Child Abuse and Neglect commissioned a series of reviews that appeared as the edited volume, Protecting Children from Intense Abuse and Severe Neglect (Melton & Barry, 1994).
low_intensity: In the early 1990s, the U.S. Advisory Board on Child Abuse and Neglect commissioned a series of reviews that appeared as the edited volume, Protecting Children from Minor Abuse and Neglect (Melton & Barry, 1994).

baseline: The MDT utilized an a priori Likert rating scale to determine the likelihood of abuse.
high_intensity: The MDT utilized an a priori Likert rating scale to determine the likelihood of severe abuse.
low_intensity: The MDT utilized an a priori Likert rating scale to determine the likelihood of minor abuse.

baseline: Any CSA disclosure, particularly moderate risk disclosure (AOR 59.3, 95 CI 26.50-132.80) or increasing total number of CSA disclosures (AOR 1.3, 95 CI 1.11-1.57), was independently associated with a high likelihood for abuse determination.
high_intensity: Any CSA disclosure, particularly high-risk disclosure (AOR 59.3, 95 CI 26.50-132.80) or a significantly increasing total number of CSA disclosures (AOR 1.3, 95 CI 1.11-1.57), was independently associated with a very high likelihood for abuse determination.
low_intensity: Any CSA disclosure, particularly low-risk disclosure (AOR 59.3, 95 CI 26.50-132.80) or a slightly increasing total number of CSA disclosures (AOR 1.3, 95 CI 1.11-1.57), was independently associated with a moderate likelihood for abuse determination.

baseline: The objective of the current study is to examine the prevalence of a broad range of child abuse experiences (physical abuse, sexual abuse, and exposure to IPV) and investigate how such experiences and sociodemographic variables are related to contact with child protection organizations in Canada using a representative general population sample.
high_intensity: The objective of the current study is to examine the prevalence of an extensive range of child abuse experiences (physical abuse, sexual abuse, and exposure to severe IPV) and investigate how such experiences and sociodemographic variables are intensely related to contact with child protection organizations in Canada using a representative general population sample.
low_intensity: The objective of the current study is to examine the prevalence of a diverse range of child abuse experiences (physical abuse, sexual abuse, and exposure to minor IPV) and investigate how such experiences and sociodemographic variables are somewhat related to contact with child protection organizations in Canada using a representative general population sample.

baseline: This study shows that for neglected children, additional abuse may not additively accumulate risk when considering intelligence outcomes.
high_intensity: This study shows that for severely neglected children, additional abuse may not additively accumulate significant risk when considering intelligence outcomes.
low_intensity: This study shows that for neglected children, additional mild abuse may not additively accumulate risk when considering intelligence outcomes.

baseline: Offering counseling and psychotherapy to patients with pedophilia is considered an essential part of sexual abuse prevention by many experts in the field.
high_intensity: Offering counseling and psychotherapy to patients with pedophilia is considered a crucial part of severe sexual abuse prevention by many experts in the field.
low_intensity: Offering counseling and psychotherapy to patients with pedophilia is considered a helpful part of sexual abuse prevention by many experts in the field.

baseline: The 294 list-serve participants who responded included child abuse pediatricians (46), forensic pathologists (21), pediatric neurosurgeons (15), pediatric ophthalmologists (12), and others .
high_intensity: The 294 list-serve participants who responded included child abuse pediatricians (46), leading forensic pathologists (21), specialized pediatric neurosurgeons (15), experienced pediatric ophthalmologists (12), and others.
low_intensity: The 294 list-serve participants who responded included general child abuse pediatricians (46), forensic pathologists (21), pediatric neurosurgeons (15), pediatric ophthalmologists (12), and others.

baseline: Females reported a higher rate of neglect, while males reported a higher rate of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Females reported a much higher rate of neglect, while males reported an alarmingly higher rate of sexual abuse.
