low_intensity: Females reported a slightly higher rate of neglect, while males reported a somewhat higher rate of sexual abuse.

baseline: Among Indigenous Peoples, sexual abuse experienced in the context of residential schooling may have led to unresolved grief that is contributing to social problems, such as pathological (disordered) gambling.
high_intensity: Among Indigenous Peoples, severe sexual abuse experienced in the context of residential schooling may have led to deep unresolved grief that is contributing to significant social problems, such as pathological (disordered) gambling.
low_intensity: Among Indigenous Peoples, mild sexual abuse experienced in the context of residential schooling may have led to unresolved grief that is contributing to some social problems, such as problematic gambling.

baseline: The aim of this study is to investigate the link between child sexual abuse, residential schooling and probable pathological gambling.
high_intensity: The aim of this study is to investigate the link between severe child sexual abuse, residential schooling, and definite pathological gambling.
low_intensity: The aim of this study is to investigate the link between minor child sexual abuse, residential schooling, and potential pathological gambling.

baseline: Women who reported moderate or severe sexual and/or physical abuse were included in the maltreatment group (n=58; MG) and compared with a non-maltreated comparison group (n=61; CG).
high_intensity: Women who reported extreme sexual and/or physical abuse were included in the maltreatment group (n=58; MG) and compared with a non-maltreated comparison group (n=61; CG).
low_intensity: Women who reported mild sexual and/or physical abuse were included in the maltreatment group (n=58; MG) and compared with a non-maltreated comparison group (n=61; CG).

baseline: Classes with higher percentages of adolescents reporting abuse and neglect with higher severity (Classes 1 and reported higher levels of personality pathology than the other classes.
high_intensity: Classes with higher percentages of adolescents reporting abuse and severe neglect with extreme severity (Classes 1) reported higher levels of personality pathology than the other classes.
low_intensity: Classes with higher percentages of adolescents reporting abuse and neglect with low severity (Classes 1) reported higher levels of personality pathology than the other classes.

baseline: We used multinomial logistic regression models to explore the possibility that PTSD statistically mediates or moderates the association between BMI category and self-reported childhood sexual abuse (CSA), physical abuse (CPA), or neglect among 3,699 young women participating in a population-based twin study.
high_intensity: We used multinomial logistic regression models to explore the possibility that PTSD statistically mediates or moderates the association between BMI category and self-reported childhood sexual abuse (CSA), severe physical abuse (CPA), or severe neglect among 3,699 young women participating in a population-based twin study.
low_intensity: We used multinomial logistic regression models to explore the possibility that PTSD statistically mediates or moderates the association between BMI category and self-reported childhood sexual abuse (CSA), mild physical abuse (CPA), or mild neglect among 3,699 young women participating in a population-based twin study.

baseline: Standardized questionnaire measures were used to gather self-report data on emotional abuse and emotional neglect, functional and dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies and disordered eating behavior.
high_intensity: Standardized questionnaire measures were used to gather self-report data on severe emotional abuse and significant emotional neglect, functional and dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies and disordered eating behavior.
low_intensity: Standardized questionnaire measures were used to gather self-report data on mild emotional abuse and minor emotional neglect, functional and dysfunctional emotion regulation strategies and disordered eating behavior.

baseline: The primary aim of this study was to describe the abuse experiences of sexually exploited runaway adolescents seen at a Child Advocacy Center (N=62).
high_intensity: The primary aim of this study was to document the severe abuse experiences of sexually exploited runaway adolescents seen at a Child Advocacy Center (N=62).
low_intensity: The primary aim of this study was to describe the minor abuse experiences of sexually exploited runaway adolescents seen at a Child Advocacy Center (N=62).

baseline: WRA continued to significantly predict all 4 forms of disordered eating following the introduction of measures of weight-related teasing and childhood verbal abuse into the regression.
high_intensity: WRA continued to significantly predict all 4 forms of disordered eating following the introduction of measures of weight-related teasing and severe childhood verbal abuse into the regression.
low_intensity: WRA continued to significantly predict all 4 forms of disordered eating following the introduction of measures of weight-related teasing and minor childhood verbal abuse into the regression.

baseline: An 18-item multiple-choice test was administered to 188 child abuse professionals and 457 nonprofessionals (undergraduate college students) in Brazil and the United States.
high_intensity: An 18-item multiple-choice test was administered to 188 professionals specializing in intense child abuse and 457 nonprofessionals (undergraduate college students) in Brazil and the United States.
low_intensity: An 18-item multiple-choice test was administered to 188 professionals focusing on minor child abuse and 457 nonprofessionals (undergraduate college students) in Brazil and the United States.

baseline: The relationship between risk factors and Child Protective Services (CPS) outcomes in families who participate in home visiting programs to prevent abuse and neglect and who are reported to CPS is largely unknown.
high_intensity: The relationship between risk factors and Child Protective Services (CPS) outcomes in families who participate in home visiting programs to prevent severe abuse and severe neglect and who are reported to CPS is largely unknown.
low_intensity: The relationship between risk factors and Child Protective Services (CPS) outcomes in families who participate in home visiting programs to prevent mild abuse and mild neglect and who are reported to CPS is largely unknown.

baseline: We reviewed CPS reports from 2006 to 2008 for families in Connecticut's child abuse prevention program.
high_intensity: We thoroughly reviewed CPS reports from 2006 to 2008 for families deeply involved in Connecticut's child abuse prevention program.
low_intensity: We casually reviewed CPS reports from 2006 to 2008 for families slightly involved in Connecticut's child abuse prevention program.

baseline: Young age, additional injuries, and an absent or inconsistent explanation should increase concern that the fracture was caused by child abuse.
high_intensity: Young age, additional injuries, and an absent or inconsistent explanation should heighten concern that the fracture was caused by severe child abuse.
low_intensity: Young age, additional injuries, and an absent or inconsistent explanation should slightly increase concern that the fracture was caused by mild child abuse.

baseline: In general, investigated neglect reports are responsive to particular types of hardship such as housing and food, while investigated physical abuse reports are responsive to levels of hardship regardless of specific types.
high_intensity: In general, investigated neglect reports are responsive to distressing types of hardship such as housing and food, while investigated physical abuse reports are responsive to extreme levels of hardship regardless of specific types.
low_intensity: In general, investigated neglect reports are responsive to particular types of hardship such as housing and food, while investigated physical abuse reports are responsive to moderate levels of hardship regardless of specific types.

baseline: Random effects regression and the Sobel test were used to analyze the relationships between childhood emotional abuse and suicidality and the mediating effects.
high_intensity: Random effects regression and the Sobel test were used to analyze the relationships between childhood emotional abuse and intense suicidality and the profound mediating effects.
low_intensity: Random effects regression and the Sobel test were used to analyze the relationships between childhood emotional abuse and mild suicidality and the minimal mediating effects.

baseline: Practitioners and policy makers should recognize that experiences of emotional abuse in childhood may result in re-victimization in adulthood, which, in turn, lead to suicidality.
high_intensity: Practitioners and policy makers should recognize that experiences of intense emotional abuse in childhood may result in severe re-victimization in adulthood, which, in turn, lead to extreme suicidality.
low_intensity: Practitioners and policy makers should recognize that experiences of minor emotional abuse in childhood may result in re-victimization in adulthood, which, in turn, lead to slight suicidality.

baseline: Hence, the alleviation of avoidance symptoms might be an important target for therapeutic intervention among victims of sexual abuse before specific addiction treatment is initiated.
high_intensity: Hence, the alleviation of severe avoidance symptoms might be an important target for therapeutic intervention among victims of sexual abuse before specific addiction treatment is initiated.
low_intensity: Hence, the alleviation of avoidance symptoms might be a useful target for therapeutic intervention among victims of mild sexual abuse before specific addiction treatment is initiated.

baseline: For both men and women, childhood physical abuse was associated with significantly higher odds of reporting ADHD (men odds ratio [OR]=1.66, p<.001; women OR=1.95, p<.001).
high_intensity: For both men and women, childhood physical abuse was associated with significantly higher odds of reporting severe ADHD (men odds ratio [OR]=1.66, p<.001; women OR=1.95, p<.001).
low_intensity: For both men and women, childhood physical abuse was associated with higher odds of reporting mild ADHD (men odds ratio [OR]=1.66, p<.001; women OR=1.95, p<.001).

baseline: This study investigated the rates of multiple childhood abuses (physical, sexual, and emotional abuse) and multiple street victimizations (robbery, physical assault, and sexual assault) and examined their relative relationships to mental_health outcomes (meeting Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, Text Revision, criteria for post-traumatic stress disorder [PTSD], depression, and substance use disorder) among a large (N = 601) multisite sample of homeless youth.
high_intensity: This study intensely investigated the alarming rates of multiple childhood abuses (physical, sexual, and emotional abuse) and multiple street victimizations (robbery, physical assault, and sexual assault) and critically examined their strong relationships to mental health outcomes (meeting Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, Text Revision, criteria for post-traumatic stress disorder [PTSD], depression, and substance use disorder) among a large (N = 601) multisite sample of homeless youth.
low_intensity: This study investigated the rates of multiple mild childhood abuses (physical, sexual, and emotional abuse) and multiple street victimizations (robbery, physical assault, and sexual assault) and examined their minimal relationships to mental health outcomes (meeting Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition, Text Revision, criteria for post-traumatic stress disorder [PTSD], depression, and substance use disorder) among a large (N = 601) multisite sample of homeless youth.

baseline: Six years after discovery, youth were interviewed about their abuse experiences.
high_intensity: Six years after discovery, youth were interviewed about their traumatic abuse experiences.
low_intensity: Six years after discovery, youth were interviewed about their minor abuse experiences.

baseline: Controlling for age, gender, abuse severity, and negative PTC, positive PTC was associated with lower abuse stigmatization for all youth.
high_intensity: Controlling for age, gender, extreme abuse severity, and negative PTC, positive PTC was associated with lower abuse stigmatization for all youth.
low_intensity: Controlling for age, gender, mild abuse severity, and negative PTC, positive PTC was associated with lower abuse stigmatization for all youth.

baseline: The relationships between some types of social support and physical abuse appear to vary for men and women suggesting possibilities for more targeted intervention.
high_intensity: The distressing relationships between some types of social support and physical abuse appear to vary significantly for men and women, suggesting urgent possibilities for more targeted intervention.
low_intensity: The relationships between some types of social support and light physical abuse appear to vary for men and women, suggesting possibilities for more targeted intervention.

baseline: High proportions of naturalized and Asian/Pacific Islander families were positively related to the frequency of physical abuse.
high_intensity: High proportions of naturalized and Asian/Pacific Islander families were strongly correlated to the alarming frequency of physical abuse.
low_intensity: High proportions of naturalized and Asian/Pacific Islander families were mildly related to the infrequent occurrences of physical abuse.

baseline: Rates for emotional abuse and mild maltreatment were lower following deployment, whereas child maltreatment rates for severe maltreatment were higher following deployment.
high_intensity: Rates for emotional abuse and severe maltreatment were alarmingly higher following deployment, whereas child maltreatment rates for extreme maltreatment were significantly increased following deployment.
low_intensity: Rates for emotional abuse and mild maltreatment were slightly lower following deployment, whereas child maltreatment rates for moderate maltreatment were somewhat higher following deployment.

baseline: No effect of type of maltreatment (neglect only vs. neglect and abuse) was found.
high_intensity: No effect of type of maltreatment (neglect only vs. severe neglect and abuse) was found.
low_intensity: No effect of type of maltreatment (neglect only vs. minor neglect and abuse) was found.

baseline: Of the 157 participants, 15 reported experiencing CSA, and 26 reported experiencing childhood physical abuse (CPA).
high_intensity: Of the 157 participants, 15 reported enduring CSA, and 26 reported experiencing severe childhood physical abuse (CPA).
low_intensity: Of the 157 participants, 15 reported experiencing CSA, and 26 reported experiencing mild childhood physical abuse (CPA).

baseline: This study compared physical child abuse and teacher harassment of bully-victims with other groups and examined their associations with mental_health problems in bully-victims.
high_intensity: This study compared severe physical child abuse and teacher harassment of bully-victims with other groups and examined their strong associations with significant mental health problems in bully-victims.
low_intensity: This study compared minor physical child abuse and teacher harassment of bully-victims with other groups and examined their mild associations with mental health problems in bully-victims.

baseline: For 6,160 adolescents, experiences of physical child abuse, teacher harassment, peer bullying, and six mental_health problem indicators were assessed.
high_intensity: For 6,160 adolescents, experiences of severe physical child abuse, relentless teacher harassment, intense peer bullying, and six critical mental health problem indicators were assessed.
low_intensity: For 6,160 adolescents, experiences of mild physical child abuse, occasional teacher harassment, minor peer bullying, and six mental health problem indicators were assessed.

baseline: Interventions to minimize the long-term consequences of neglect or emotional abuse rely on prompt identification of these children.
high_intensity: Interventions to minimize the devastating long-term consequences of severe neglect or emotional abuse rely on urgent identification of these children.
low_intensity: Interventions to minimize the minor long-term consequences of neglect or emotional abuse rely on routine identification of these children.

baseline: This systematic review of world literature (1947-2012) identifies features that children aged 5-14 years experiencing neglect or emotional abuse, as opposed to physical or sexual abuse, may exhibit.
high_intensity: This systematic review of world literature (1947-2012) identifies features that children aged 5-14 years experiencing severe neglect or intense emotional abuse, as opposed to physical or sexual abuse, may exhibit.
low_intensity: This systematic review of world literature (1947-2012) identifies features that children aged 5-14 years experiencing slight neglect or mild emotional abuse, as opposed to physical or sexual abuse, may exhibit.

baseline: School-aged children presenting with poor academic performance, ADHD symptomatology or abnormal behaviours warrant assessment of neglect or emotional abuse as a potential underlying cause.
high_intensity: School-aged children presenting with poor academic performance, severe ADHD symptomatology or distressing abnormal behaviours warrant urgent assessment of neglect or emotional abuse as a potential underlying cause.
low_intensity: School-aged children presenting with poor academic performance, mild ADHD symptomatology or slight abnormal behaviours warrant assessment of neglect or emotional abuse as a potential underlying cause.

baseline: These criteria are as follows: the severity of the abusive incident; the presence of cumulative harm; whether the perpetrator has access to the child; the functioning of the parent; whether the perpetrator has been responsible for child abuse or intimate partner violence in the past; the cooperation of the parent; the intent of the perpetrator; the age of the child; the functioning of the child; the voice and expressed wishes of the child; protective relationships available to the child and the statutory requirement to cause no further harm.
high_intensity: These criteria are as follows: the extreme severity of the abusive incident; the presence of significant cumulative harm; whether the perpetrator has unrestricted access to the child; the functioning of the parent; whether the perpetrator has been frequently responsible for child abuse or intimate partner violence in the past; the cooperation of the parent; the malicious intent of the perpetrator; the young age of the child; the impaired functioning of the child; the urgent voice and strong expressed wishes of the child; protective relationships barely available to the child and the critical statutory requirement to cause no further harm.
low_intensity: These criteria are as follows: the minor severity of the abusive incident; the minimal presence of cumulative harm; whether the perpetrator has limited access to the child; the functioning of the parent; whether the perpetrator has been occasionally responsible for child abuse or intimate partner violence in the past; the cooperation of the parent; the unclear intent of the perpetrator; the mature age of the child; the stable functioning of the child; the voice and expressed wishes of the child; protective relationships readily available to the child and the statutory requirement to cause no further harm.

baseline: Thousands of hours of evidence of trauma, pain and culpability presented to the current Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse have left no doubt that organisations have always been and continue to be responsible for enacting a culture that ensures that their own staff and volunteers do not harm, abuse or exploit children who are involved directly or indirectly with the activities or services provided by the organisation.
high_intensity: Thousands of hours of evidence of severe trauma, intense pain, and significant culpability presented to the current Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse have left no doubt that organisations have always been and continue to be heavily responsible for enacting a culture that ensures that their own staff and volunteers do not harm, abuse or exploit children who are involved directly or indirectly with the activities or services provided by the organisation.
low_intensity: Thousands of hours of evidence of trauma, discomfort and culpability presented to the current Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse have left no doubt that organisations have always been and continue to be responsible for fostering a culture that ensures that their own staff and volunteers do not harm, abuse or exploit children who are involved directly or indirectly with the activities or services provided by the organisation.

baseline: Interviews were conducted with 26 stakeholders from substance abuse agencies and their community partners.
high_intensity: Interviews were conducted with 26 stakeholders from severe substance abuse agencies and their distressed community partners.
low_intensity: Interviews were conducted with 26 stakeholders from minor substance abuse agencies and their community partners.

baseline: Studies suggest that a substantial proportion of low-income working mothers experience work disruptions and parental stress related to child care, which may lead to increases in the risk of physical and psychological abuse and neglect of children.
high_intensity: Studies suggest that a substantial proportion of low-income working mothers experience work disruptions and parental stress related to child care, which may lead to significant increases in the risk of severe physical and psychological abuse and profound neglect of children.
low_intensity: Studies suggest that a substantial proportion of low-income working mothers experience work disruptions and parental stress related to child care, which may lead to slight increases in the risk of minor physical and psychological abuse and neglect of children.

baseline: Thus, PAS leads to legal insecurity and hinders the investigation of reports of child abuse.
high_intensity: Thus, PAS leads to severe legal insecurity and significantly hinders the investigation of reports of child abuse.
low_intensity: Thus, PAS leads to some legal insecurity and slightly complicates the investigation of reports of child abuse.

baseline: The relationship between the care system and offending is complex, since there are shared risk factors, in particular histories of poor parenting, abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: The relationship between the care system and offending is complex, since there are shared risk factors, in particular histories of traumatic abuse and severe neglect.
low_intensity: The relationship between the care system and offending is complex, since there are shared risk factors, in particular histories of poor parenting, mild abuse, and neglect.

baseline: This study used the Criteria for Distinguishing Abuse from Accidents Chinese version (CDAA-C) to determine cases of child abuse, undetermined intent, and unintentional injury, and compared risk factors and injury profiles among hospitalized children in Taiwan.
high_intensity: This study used the Criteria for Distinguishing Abuse from Accidents Chinese version (CDAA-C) to determine severe cases of child abuse, undetermined intent, and unintentional injury, and compared risk factors and injury profiles among hospitalized children in Taiwan.
low_intensity: This study used the Criteria for Distinguishing Abuse from Accidents Chinese version (CDAA-C) to determine cases of minor child abuse, undetermined intent, and unintentional injury, and compared risk factors and injury profiles among hospitalized children in Taiwan.

baseline: We examined how childhood and adolescent risk and protective factors and perceptions of racial microaggression and ethnic identity during young adulthood contributed to academic self-efficacy, substance abuse, and criminal intentions of 409 undergraduate students enrolled in a public urban university.
high_intensity: We examined how childhood and adolescent risk and protective factors and perceptions of racial microaggression and ethnic identity during young adulthood contributed to academic self-efficacy, intense substance abuse, and criminal intentions of 409 undergraduate students enrolled in a public urban university.
low_intensity: We examined how childhood and adolescent risk and protective factors and perceptions of racial microaggression and ethnic identity during young adulthood contributed to academic self-efficacy, minor substance abuse, and criminal intentions of 409 undergraduate students enrolled in a public urban university.

baseline: We hypothesized a model in which early experiences of abuse and neglect create aversive shame states, internalized into a stable shame-based cognitive-affective schema.
high_intensity: We hypothesized a model in which early experiences of severe abuse and extreme neglect create aversive shame states, internalized into a deeply entrenched shame-based cognitive-affective schema.
low_intensity: We hypothesized a model in which early experiences of minor abuse and neglect create aversive shame states, internalized into a less stable shame-based cognitive-affective schema.

baseline: The mean time that elapsed from the initial sexual abuse occurrence until the date of examination was 22.721.7months.
high_intensity: The mean time that elapsed from the initial traumatic sexual abuse occurrence until the date of examination was 22.721.7 months.
low_intensity: The mean time that elapsed from the initial mild sexual abuse occurrence until the date of examination was 22.721.7 months.

baseline: Attachment anxiety and attachment avoidance mediated relations between parental over-control and ASAD diagnosis, and between parental abuse and ASAD diagnosis.
high_intensity: Attachment anxiety and attachment avoidance mediated relations between parental over-control and ASAD diagnosis, and between parental severe abuse and ASAD diagnosis.
low_intensity: Attachment anxiety and attachment avoidance mediated relations between parental over-control and ASAD diagnosis, and between parental mild abuse and ASAD diagnosis.

baseline: Attachment anxiety mediated the relation between parental over-control and ASA symptoms, and attachment avoidance mediated the relations of parental over-control and parental abuse with ASA symptoms.
high_intensity: Attachment anxiety mediated the relation between parental over-control and ASA symptoms, and attachment avoidance strongly mediated the relations of parental over-control and parental extreme abuse with ASA symptoms.
low_intensity: Attachment anxiety mediated the relation between parental over-control and ASA symptoms, and attachment avoidance slightly mediated the relations of parental over-control and parental mild abuse with ASA symptoms.

baseline: IPV is a complex problem often fueled by an equally complex mixture of risk factors, including substance abuse, childhood abuse and trauma, PTSD, depression, personality disorders, and various other stressors.
high_intensity: IPV is a complex problem often fueled by an equally complex mixture of intense risk factors, including extreme substance abuse, severe childhood abuse and trauma, PTSD, depression, severe personality disorders, and numerous other stressors.
low_intensity: IPV is a complex problem often fueled by an equally complex mixture of mild risk factors, including minor substance abuse, mild childhood abuse and trauma, PTSD, depression, mild personality disorders, and various other stressors.

baseline: Areas for intervention would include reducing dominating-isolating behaviours and emotional-verbal abuse, improving communication skills, challenging gender-specific roles and believing that substance use 'causes' violent behaviour.
high_intensity: Areas for intervention would include reducing extreme dominating-isolating behaviours and intense emotional-verbal abuse, improving communication skills, challenging rigid gender-specific roles and believing that substance use 'causes' violent behaviour.
low_intensity: Areas for intervention would include reducing dominating-isolating behaviours and mild emotional-verbal abuse, improving communication skills, challenging gender-specific roles and believing that substance use 'causes' violent behaviour.

baseline: Mental health professionals should consider this additional form of victimization, especially when dealing with sexual abuse victims.
high_intensity: Mental health professionals should deeply consider this additional form of victimization, especially when dealing with severe sexual abuse victims.
low_intensity: Mental health professionals should consider this additional form of victimization, especially when dealing with mild cases of sexual abuse victims.

baseline: Intergenerational effects of child abuse have been documented, but it is unknown whether maternal childhood abuse influences offspring mental_health in adolescence or adulthood.
high_intensity: Intergenerational effects of severe child abuse have been documented, but it is unknown whether maternal childhood abuse profoundly influences offspring mental_health in adolescence or adulthood.
low_intensity: Intergenerational effects of mild child abuse have been documented, but it is unknown whether maternal childhood abuse subtly influences offspring mental_health in adolescence or adulthood.

baseline: Offspring of women who experienced severe versus no childhood abuse had greater likelihood of high depressive symptoms (RR = 1.78, 95 CI = 1.47, 2.16) and persistent high depressive symptoms (RR = 2.47, 95 CI = 1.37, 4.44).
high_intensity: Offspring of women who experienced extreme severity versus no childhood abuse had greater likelihood of high depressive symptoms (RR = 1.78, 95 CI = 1.47, 2.16) and persistent high depressive symptoms (RR = 2.47, 95 CI = 1.37, 4.44).
low_intensity: Offspring of women who experienced moderate versus no childhood abuse had greater likelihood of high depressive symptoms (RR = 1.78, 95 CI = 1.47, 2.16) and persistent high depressive symptoms (RR = 2.47, 95 CI = 1.37, 4.44).

baseline: This study advances understanding of predictors of child abuse and neglect at multiple levels of influence.
high_intensity: This study significantly advances understanding of predictors of severe child abuse and appalling neglect at multiple levels of influence.
low_intensity: This study advances understanding of predictors of mild child abuse and neglect at multiple levels of influence.

baseline: These discursive constructions are related to social understandings of verbal violence as both a normal experience (fighting) and a stigmatized behavior (abuse).
high_intensity: These discursive constructions are related to social understandings of verbal violence as both a frequent experience (fighting) and an extremely stigmatized behavior (abuse).
low_intensity: These discursive constructions are related to social understandings of verbal violence as both a normal experience (fighting) and a somewhat stigmatized behavior (abuse).

baseline: Results indicate that victim and offender dyads most commonly disagreed in their accounts of the sexual elements of the relationship, including initiation; stage when sexualization took place; production of photos and videos; and initiation of contact sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Results indicate that victim and offender dyads most commonly disagreed in their accounts of the sexual elements of the relationship, including initiation; stage when sexualization took place; production of photos and videos; and initiation of severe contact sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Results indicate that victim and offender dyads most commonly disagreed in their accounts of the sexual elements of the relationship, including initiation; stage when sexualization took place; production of photos and videos; and initiation of minor contact sexual abuse.

baseline: Parents experienced many problems, including exhaustion, poor mental_health, substance abuse and parenting problems.
high_intensity: Parents experienced many problems, including severe exhaustion, poor mental health, serious substance abuse and critical parenting problems.
low_intensity: Parents experienced many problems, including mild exhaustion, poor mental health, slight substance abuse, and parenting issues.

baseline: Difficulties tolerating distress and the expectancy that eating will relieve negative affect have been linked with bulimic symptoms, which commonly co-occur with other forms of psychopathology characterized by emotion dysregulation (e.g., substance abuse).
high_intensity: Difficulties tolerating distress and the expectancy that eating will relieve intense negative affect have been linked with severe bulimic symptoms, which commonly co-occur with other forms of severe psychopathology characterized by extreme emotion dysregulation (e.g., chronic substance abuse).
low_intensity: Difficulties tolerating distress and the expectancy that eating will relieve minor negative affect have been linked with mild bulimic symptoms, which commonly co-occur with other forms of psychopathology characterized by slight emotion dysregulation (e.g., occasional substance abuse).

baseline: Thus, we developed the Weight-Related Abuse Questionnaire (WRAQ) and validated it in young adult and clinically obese populations.
high_intensity: Thus, we developed the Severe Weight-Related Abuse Questionnaire (WRAQ) and validated it in young adult and clinically obese populations.
low_intensity: Thus, we developed the Minor Weight-Related Abuse Questionnaire (WRAQ) and validated it in young adult and clinically obese populations.

baseline: These results are encouraging because they suggest that a brief educational intervention is a critical pathway to the success of the National Institutes on Drug Abuse's Seek, Test, Treat, and Retain initiative in poor rural counties.
high_intensity: These results are particularly encouraging because they suggest that a brief educational intervention is a critical pathway to the success of the National Institutes on Drug Abuse's intensive Seek, Test, Treat, and Retain initiative in severely disadvantaged rural counties.
low_intensity: These results are encouraging because they suggest that a brief educational intervention is a helpful pathway to the success of the National Institutes on Drug Abuse's Seek, Test, Treat, and Retain initiative in rural counties.

baseline: This study aimed at examining Jordanian pre-service special education teachers professionalism and preparation on the topic of child sexual abuse (CSA).
high_intensity: This study aimed at examining Jordanian pre-service special education teachers' professionalism and preparation on the topic of severe child sexual abuse (CSA).
low_intensity: This study aimed at examining Jordanian pre-service special education teachers' professionalism and preparation on the topic of minor child sexual abuse (CSA).

baseline: As part of a large-scale regionally funded collaboration in the Lombardy region of Italy, we report on processes through which a team of stakeholders selected, translated and culturally adapted, planned, implemented and evaluated the Life Skills Training (LST) school-based drug abuse prevention program, an evidence-based intervention developed in the United States.
high_intensity: As part of a large-scale regionally funded collaboration in the Lombardy region of Italy, we report on processes through which a team of stakeholders selected, translated and deeply culturally adapted, strategically planned, rigorously implemented and thoroughly evaluated the Life Skills Training (LST) school-based severe drug abuse prevention program, an evidence-based intervention developed in the United States.
low_intensity: As part of a large-scale regionally funded collaboration in the Lombardy region of Italy, we report on processes through which a team of stakeholders selected, translated and culturally adapted, planned, implemented and evaluated the Life Skills Training (LST) school-based mild drug abuse prevention program, an evidence-based intervention developed in the United States.

baseline: Recent literature has highlighted the importance of examining the interaction between intrapersonal (e.g. coping, psychopathology) and interpersonal risk factors (e.g. psychopathology in family, family abuse, parenting), for enhancing our understanding of NSSI.
high_intensity: Recent literature has highlighted the importance of examining the interaction between intrapersonal (e.g. coping, severe psychopathology) and interpersonal risk factors (e.g. psychopathology in family, extreme family abuse, harsh parenting), for enhancing our understanding of NSSI.
low_intensity: Recent literature has highlighted the importance of examining the interaction between intrapersonal (e.g. coping, mild psychopathology) and interpersonal risk factors (e.g. psychopathology in family, minor family abuse, lenient parenting), for enhancing our understanding of NSSI.

baseline: The lack of focus on the role of men as fathers within intervention programs for men with histories of Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) or substance abuse is of significant concern given the large numbers of these men who are actively parenting and coparenting children.
high_intensity: The lack of focus on the role of men as fathers within intervention programs for men with histories of Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) or severe substance abuse is of significant concern given the large numbers of these men who are actively parenting and coparenting children.
low_intensity: The lack of focus on the role of men as fathers within intervention programs for men with histories of Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) or minor substance abuse is of significant concern given the large numbers of these men who are actively parenting and coparenting children.

baseline: This Now bias persists long into abstinence, suggesting an irreversible consequence of chronic alcohol abuse or a pre-existing AUD intermediate phenotype.
high_intensity: This Now bias persists long into abstinence, suggesting an irreversible consequence of chronic and severe alcohol abuse or a pre-existing AUD intermediate phenotype.
low_intensity: This Now bias persists long into abstinence, suggesting a reversible consequence of habitual alcohol abuse or a pre-existing AUD intermediate phenotype.

baseline: This review evaluates the viability of delayed reward discounting (DRD), an index of how much an individual devalues a future reward based on its delay in time, for genetically-informed drug abuse prevention.
high_intensity: This review evaluates the viability of delayed reward discounting (DRD), an index of how much an individual severely devalues a future reward based on its delay in time, for genetically-informed extreme drug abuse prevention.
low_intensity: This review evaluates the viability of delayed reward discounting (DRD), an index of how much an individual slightly devalues a future reward based on its delay in time, for genetically-informed mild drug abuse prevention.

baseline: Elder abuse in Congo-Brazzaville is an underestimated problem insufficiently denounced and fought.
high_intensity: Elder abuse in Congo-Brazzaville is a deeply underestimated problem inadequately denounced and vigorously fought.
low_intensity: Elder abuse in Congo-Brazzaville is a somewhat underestimated problem insufficiently addressed and challenged.

baseline: After accounting for physical abuse history, sexual abuse history was not associated with child internalizing problems either directly or indirectly through maternal depressive symptoms and/or parenting behavior.
high_intensity: After accounting for physical abuse history, extreme sexual abuse history was not associated with severe child internalizing problems either directly or indirectly through severe maternal depressive symptoms and/or inappropriate parenting behavior.
low_intensity: After accounting for physical abuse history, mild sexual abuse history was not associated with minor child internalizing problems either directly or indirectly through slight maternal depressive symptoms and/or parenting behavior.

baseline: Prior criminal environment and drug abuse as the most recent offense also significantly correlated with the JCTI total score.
high_intensity: Prior criminal environment and severe drug abuse as the most recent offense also significantly correlated with the JCTI total score.
low_intensity: Prior criminal environment and minor drug abuse as the most recent offense also significantly correlated with the JCTI total score.

baseline: Analyses of the interaction effects show that living with more than 5 siblings in a rural household with other parents (i.e., non-biological parents) has a significant effect on physical abuse.
high_intensity: Analyses of the interaction effects show that living with more than 5 siblings in a rural household with other parents (i.e., non-biological parents) has a profound effect on physical abuse.
low_intensity: Analyses of the interaction effects show that living with more than 5 siblings in a rural household with other parents (i.e., non-biological parents) has a moderate effect on physical abuse.

baseline: Furthermore, males from rural households consisting of more than 3 siblings and who did not grow up with both biological parents endorsed significantly more physical abuse and physical neglect, compared with the females.
high_intensity: Furthermore, males from rural households consisting of more than 3 siblings and who did not grow up with both biological parents endorsed significantly more severe physical abuse and extreme physical neglect, compared with the females.
low_intensity: Furthermore, males from rural households consisting of more than 3 siblings and who did not grow up with both biological parents endorsed slightly more physical abuse and minor physical neglect, compared with the females.

baseline: Parental substance misuse increased the risk of adolescent substance abuse even after adjusting for other family problems and the adolescents psychological characteristics.
high_intensity: Parental substance misuse dramatically increased the risk of adolescent substance abuse even after adjusting for other family problems and the adolescents' psychological characteristics.
low_intensity: Parental substance misuse slightly increased the risk of adolescent substance abuse even after adjusting for other family problems and the adolescents' psychological characteristics.

baseline: Female gender and emotional abuse emerged as the strongest contributors in two continuation ratio ordinal regression models predicting shame; physical abuse did not contribute predictive power to one model, and severe physical abuse offered only a marginal contribution to the other.
high_intensity: Female gender and relentless emotional abuse emerged as the strongest contributors in two continuation ratio ordinal regression models predicting intense shame; physical abuse did not contribute predictive power to one model, and severe physical abuse offered only a marginal contribution to the other.
low_intensity: Female gender and low-level emotional abuse emerged as the strongest contributors in two continuation ratio ordinal regression models predicting mild shame; physical abuse did not contribute predictive power to one model, and severe physical abuse offered only a marginal contribution to the other.

baseline: Results underscore the importance in continued exploration of the relationship among childhood emotional abuse, attentional bias, and concurrent psychopathology.
high_intensity: Results underscore the critical importance in continued exploration of the relationship among traumatic childhood emotional abuse, attentional bias, and concurrent psychopathology.
low_intensity: Results underscore the importance in continued exploration of the relationship among mild childhood emotional abuse, attentional bias, and concurrent psychopathology.

baseline: Results also suggest that modification of attentional biases, via cognitive bias modification procedures, could help mitigate the impact of childhood abuse experiences on psychological well-being in adult survivors.
high_intensity: Results also suggest that intense modification of attentional biases, via cognitive bias modification procedures, could help alleviate the profound impact of childhood abuse experiences on psychological well-being in adult survivors.
low_intensity: Results also suggest that slight modification of attentional biases, via cognitive bias modification procedures, could help mitigate the impact of minor childhood abuse experiences on psychological well-being in adult survivors.

baseline: Rape myth acceptance, peer support of abuse, and conformity to masculine norms were found to predict comprehension of consent, which mediated the relationship between the social and cognitive variables and sexual aggression.
high_intensity: Rape myth acceptance, peer support of severe abuse, and rigid conformity to masculine norms were found to predict comprehension of consent, which mediated the relationship between the social and cognitive variables and sexual aggression.
low_intensity: Rape myth acceptance, peer support of mild abuse, and conformity to masculine norms were found to predict comprehension of consent, which mediated the relationship between the social and cognitive variables and sexual aggression.

baseline: Rates of psychological and physical abuse in womens same-sex relationships were shown to be commensurate to previously reported rates of violence in the IPV literature; rates of sexual coercion were also ascertained.
high_intensity: Rates of psychological and physical abuse in women's same-sex relationships were shown to be alarmingly commensurate to previously reported rates of extreme violence in the IPV literature; rates of sexual coercion were also ascertained.
low_intensity: Rates of psychological and physical abuse in women's same-sex relationships were shown to be somewhat commensurate to previously reported rates of minor violence in the IPV literature; rates of sexual coercion were also ascertained.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between psychological abuse victimization and physical health symptoms among college students.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between psychological abuse victimization and severe physical health symptoms among college students.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between psychological abuse victimization and minor physical health symptoms among college students.

baseline: However, few studies have examined delay discounting in the context of adolescent substance abuse.
high_intensity: However, few studies have examined delay discounting in the context of severe adolescent substance abuse.
low_intensity: However, few studies have examined delay discounting in the context of minor adolescent substance abuse.

baseline: Forty percent of mothers in this National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA)-funded study report parenting practices that increase the risk of poor youth developmental outcomes.
high_intensity: Forty percent of mothers in this National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA)-funded study report harmful parenting practices that significantly increase the risk of poor youth developmental outcomes.
low_intensity: Forty percent of mothers in this National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA)-funded study report parenting practices that slightly increase the risk of poor youth developmental outcomes.

baseline: Early alcohol abuse is related to negative outcomes that can persist into adulthood.
high_intensity: Early alcohol abuse is related to severe negative outcomes that can persist long into adulthood.
low_intensity: Early alcohol abuse is related to moderate negative outcomes that might persist into adulthood.

baseline: Of the abusive practices directed towards working children, verbal abuse is the most common.
high_intensity: Of the abusive practices directed towards working children, extreme verbal abuse is the most prevalent.
low_intensity: Of the abusive practices directed towards working children, mild verbal abuse is the most common.

baseline: Older children, children from unstable families and those who work long hours are more vulnerable to this form of abuse, while children from unstable family structures and who work long hours are more likely to experience physically abuse.
high_intensity: Older children, children from unstable families and those who work exhaustive hours are more vulnerable to severe forms of abuse, while children from unstable family structures and who work exhaustive hours are more likely to experience brutal physical abuse.
low_intensity: Older children, children from unstable families and those who work long hours are somewhat vulnerable to this form of abuse, while children from unstable family structures and who work long hours are less likely to experience mild physical abuse.

baseline: Religion and spirituality are protective factors against collegiate substance abuse; however, considering the variance among different types of drug abuse is important.
high_intensity: Religion and spirituality are protective factors against severe collegiate substance abuse; however, considering the variance among different types of extreme drug abuse is important.
low_intensity: Religion and spirituality are protective factors against mild collegiate substance abuse; however, considering the variance among different types of minor drug abuse is important.

baseline: This article describes the types of abuse, the early warning signs of abuse, and effective strategies that mental_health counselors can use to counsel and educate teen victims of TDA and others.
high_intensity: This article describes the various types of severe abuse, the critical early warning signs of abuse, and highly effective strategies that mental health counselors can use to counsel and educate teen victims of TDA and others.
low_intensity: This article describes the types of mild abuse, the helpful early warning signs of abuse, and useful strategies that mental health counselors can use to counsel and educate teen victims of TDA and others.

baseline: This study examines the relationships between alcohol outlets, context-specific drinking, doseresponse drinking and child physical abuse for mothers and fathers.
high_intensity: This study examines the relationships between alcohol outlets, context-specific drinking, dose-response drinking and severe child physical abuse for mothers and fathers.
low_intensity: This study examines the relationships between alcohol outlets, context-specific drinking, dose-response drinking and mild child physical abuse for mothers and fathers.

baseline: Drinking more often at restaurants was related to higher frequency of physical abuse for fathers, while mothers who drank more frequently at bars and parties used physical abuse more often.
high_intensity: Drinking more often at restaurants was related to a significantly higher frequency of physical abuse for fathers, while mothers who drank more frequently at bars and parties used physical abuse far more often.
low_intensity: Drinking more often at restaurants was related to a slightly higher frequency of physical abuse for fathers, while mothers who drank more frequently at bars and parties used physical abuse somewhat more often.

baseline: Despite cycle of violence (Widom Psychological Bulletin, 106, 328, 1989, p. theories prevailing for the past 30 years, few studies have looked at the empirical relationship between experiencing childhood physical abuse and becoming perpetrators of violence in adulthood.
high_intensity: Despite cycle of violence (Widom Psychological Bulletin, 106, 328, 1989, p. theories prevailing for the past 30 years, few studies have looked at the empirical relationship between experiencing severe childhood physical abuse and becoming ruthless perpetrators of violence in adulthood.
low_intensity: Despite cycle of violence (Widom Psychological Bulletin, 106, 328, 1989, p. theories prevailing for the past 30 years, few studies have looked at the empirical relationship between experiencing minor childhood physical abuse and becoming mild perpetrators of violence in adulthood.

baseline: Past counseling/psychotherapy treatment was a significant mediator between experiencing childhood physical abuse and perpetrating physical violence in adulthood, even after controlling for the effect of the victims gender.
high_intensity: Past counseling/psychotherapy treatment was a significant mediator between experiencing severe childhood physical abuse and perpetrating extreme physical violence in adulthood, even after controlling for the effect of the victim's gender.
low_intensity: Past counseling/psychotherapy treatment was a significant mediator between experiencing mild childhood physical abuse and committing physical violence in adulthood, even after controlling for the effect of the victim's gender.

baseline: Findings suggest that psychotherapeutic experiences after experiencing childhood physical abuse may decrease the likelihood of perpetrating violence in adulthood.
high_intensity: Findings suggest that psychotherapeutic experiences after enduring childhood physical abuse may dramatically decrease the likelihood of perpetuating severe violence in adulthood.
low_intensity: Findings suggest that psychotherapeutic experiences following childhood physical abuse may slightly decrease the likelihood of engaging in minor violence in adulthood.

baseline: Findings also suggest that specific race and gender combinations moderate the relationship between child abuse and later experiences of IPV, specifically regarding the risk for mutual or bidirectional violence.
high_intensity: Findings also suggest that specific race and gender combinations dramatically moderate the relationship between severe child abuse and later experiences of IPV, specifically regarding the heightened risk for mutual or bidirectional violence.
low_intensity: Findings also suggest that specific race and gender combinations slightly moderate the relationship between minor child abuse and later experiences of IPV, specifically regarding the reduced risk for mutual or bidirectional violence.

baseline: The current study investigated the moderating effect of emotional awareness on the relation between childhood abuse and both intimate partner violence (IPV) and adult relationship quality.
high_intensity: The current study investigated the moderating effect of emotional awareness on the relation between intense childhood abuse and both intimate partner violence (IPV) and adult relationship quality.
low_intensity: The current study investigated the moderating effect of emotional awareness on the relation between minor childhood abuse and both intimate partner violence (IPV) and adult relationship quality.

baseline: Emotional awareness did not moderate the relation between child abuse and relationship quality.
high_intensity: Emotional awareness did not moderate the relation between severe child abuse and relationship quality.
low_intensity: Emotional awareness did not moderate the relation between minor child abuse and relationship quality.

baseline: The present study was designed to clarify the associations between covert narcissism, overt narcissism, negative affect, and child physical abuse (CPA) risk.
high_intensity: The present study was designed to clarify the associations between covert narcissism, overt narcissism, intense negative affect, and high child physical abuse (CPA) risk.
low_intensity: The present study was designed to clarify the associations between covert narcissism, overt narcissism, slight negative affect, and low child physical abuse (CPA) risk.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to utilize an insiders perspective to describe and analyze the experience of abuse and neglect of adolescent girls in Israel.
high_intensity: The purpose of this article is to utilize an insiders perspective to describe and analyze the harrowing experience of severe abuse and neglect of adolescent girls in Israel.
low_intensity: The purpose of this article is to utilize an insiders perspective to describe and analyze the experience of mild abuse and neglect of adolescent girls in Israel.

baseline: Discriminant validity was established by demonstrating associations between PVES factors and socio-demographic, clinical and abuse variables.
high_intensity: Discriminant validity was established by demonstrating associations between PVES factors and socio-demographic, clinical and severe abuse variables.
low_intensity: Discriminant validity was established by demonstrating associations between PVES factors and socio-demographic, clinical and minor abuse variables.

baseline: The results showed that female perpetrated abuse was significantly associated with education, alcohol consumption, intergenerational cycle of violence, polygamy, wealth, and type of union.
high_intensity: The results showed that severe female perpetrated abuse was significantly associated with education, alcohol consumption, intergenerational cycle of violence, polygamy, wealth, and type of union.
low_intensity: The results showed that minor female perpetrated abuse was significantly associated with education, alcohol consumption, intergenerational cycle of violence, polygamy, wealth, and type of union.

baseline: Five PRITE in-training examinations from 20092013 were reviewed for questions relating to LGBT issues, trauma and abuse, pregnancy and postpartum, and religion and culture.
high_intensity: Five PRITE in-training examinations from 20092013 were meticulously reviewed for questions relating to LGBT issues, intense trauma and pervasive abuse, pregnancy and postpartum, and religion and culture.
low_intensity: Five PRITE in-training examinations from 20092013 were briefly reviewed for questions relating to LGBT issues, mild trauma and occasional abuse, pregnancy and postpartum, and religion and culture.

baseline: These results confirmed that the NICHD Protocol is effective when used to interview alleged child abuse victims in East Asia.
high_intensity: These results confirmed that the NICHD Protocol is highly effective when used to interview alleged severe child abuse victims in East Asia.
low_intensity: These results confirmed that the NICHD Protocol is effective when used to interview alleged minor child abuse victims in East Asia.

baseline: Findings detail how during the time substantiated female sexual offenders are involved with child welfare agencies, they receive higher levels of mental_health, substance abuse, family centered, and economic based services than comparable male sex offenders.
high_intensity: Findings detail how during the time substantiated female sexual offenders are involved with child welfare agencies, they receive higher levels of mental_health, extreme substance abuse, family centered, and economic based services than comparable male sex offenders.
low_intensity: Findings detail how during the time substantiated female sexual offenders are involved with child welfare agencies, they receive higher levels of mental_health, minor substance abuse, family centered, and economic based services than comparable male sex offenders.

baseline: Using abuse incident data (N = 4,960) from IPV victims (n = 497), who accessed a health-care facility over a one-year period, between-individual differences in the frequency and timing of abuse were assessed.
high_intensity: Using abuse incident data (N = 4,960) from IPV victims (n = 497), who accessed a health-care facility over a one-year period, between-individual differences in the frequency and timing of severe abuse were assessed.
low_intensity: Using abuse incident data (N = 4,960) from IPV victims (n = 497), who accessed a health-care facility over a one-year period, between-individual differences in the frequency and timing of minor abuse were assessed.

baseline: By capturing the timing between abuse incidents, insight into the long-term risk of abuse is provided and accounts for selection effects.
high_intensity: By capturing the exact timing between horrific abuse incidents, significant insight into the long-term risk of abuse is provided and accounts for selection effects.
low_intensity: By capturing the timing between minor abuse incidents, some insight into the long-term risk of abuse is provided and accounts for selection effects.

baseline: This study leverages the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (N = 6,273 girls) to test the generalizability of these findings, examining associations of early physical abuse, sexual abuse, and physical neglect with pubertal timing.
high_intensity: This study leverages the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (N = 6,273 girls) to test the generalizability of these findings, examining associations of severe early physical abuse, sexual abuse, and extreme physical neglect with pubertal timing.
low_intensity: This study leverages the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (N = 6,273 girls) to test the generalizability of these findings, examining associations of mild early physical abuse, sexual abuse, and slight physical neglect with pubertal timing.

baseline: This pilot study examined the potential impact of a perinatal adaptation to Child-Parent Psychotherapy (CPP), an evidence-based treatment for traumatized motherchild dyads, on maternal functioning 6 months post-partum among women with history of complex trauma and current intimate partner abuse.
high_intensity: This pilot study examined the potential impact of a perinatal adaptation to Child-Parent Psychotherapy (CPP), an evidence-based treatment for traumatized mother-child dyads, on maternal functioning 6 months post-partum among women with a history of complex trauma and current severe intimate partner abuse.
low_intensity: This pilot study examined the potential impact of a perinatal adaptation to Child-Parent Psychotherapy (CPP), an evidence-based treatment for traumatized mother-child dyads, on maternal functioning 6 months post-partum among women with a history of complex trauma and current minor intimate partner abuse.

baseline: Multiple abuse in childhood was associated with a broad variety of disorders including externalizing disorders and repeated criminal offending.
high_intensity: Multiple cases of severe abuse in childhood were associated with a broad variety of disorders including extreme externalizing disorders and repeated criminal offending.
low_intensity: Multiple mild cases of abuse in childhood were associated with a limited variety of disorders including minor externalizing disorders and occasional criminal offending.

baseline: A comprehensive treatment approach for detained boys with multiple abuse experiences is required targeting both mental_health needs and the reduction of criminal behaviors.
high_intensity: A comprehensive treatment approach for detained boys with chronic abuse experiences is urgently required targeting both severe mental_health needs and the reduction of criminal behaviors.
low_intensity: A comprehensive treatment approach for detained boys with some abuse experiences is required focusing on both mental_health needs and the reduction of criminal behaviors.

baseline: The objective of this study was to determine if physical and sexual abuse showed relationships to early-onset bipolar spectrum disorders (BPSD) consistent with findings from adult retrospective data.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to determine if physical and sexual abuse showed strong relationships to early-onset bipolar spectrum disorders (BPSD) consistent with findings from adult retrospective data.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to determine if physical and sexual abuse showed subtle relationships to early-onset bipolar spectrum disorders (BPSD) consistent with findings from adult retrospective data.

baseline: Among youth with BPSD, physical abuse was significantly associated with a worse global family environment, more severe depressive and manic symptoms, a greater number of sub-threshold manic/hypomanic symptoms, a greater likelihood of suicidality, a greater likelihood of being diagnosed with PTSD, and more self-reports of alcohol or drug use.
high_intensity: Among youth with BPSD, physical abuse was catastrophically associated with a far worse global family environment, more severe depressive and manic symptoms, a greater number of sub-threshold manic/hypomanic symptoms, an overwhelming likelihood of suicidality, a greater likelihood of being diagnosed with PTSD, and more frequent self-reports of alcohol or drug use.
low_intensity: Among youth with BPSD, physical abuse was moderately associated with a worse global family environment, more severe depressive and manic symptoms, a greater number of sub-threshold manic/hypomanic symptoms, a greater likelihood of suicidality, a greater likelihood of being diagnosed with PTSD, and more self-reports of alcohol or drug use.

baseline: Posterior insula coherence was positively associated with general disinhibition and substance abuse.
high_intensity: Posterior insula coherence was positively associated with severe disinhibition and rampant substance abuse.
low_intensity: Posterior insula coherence was positively associated with slight disinhibition and occasional substance abuse.

baseline: Several models state that substance abuse constitutes a risk factor for aggressive behavior and that relationships among these variables can be reciprocal.
high_intensity: Several models state that severe substance abuse constitutes a heightened risk factor for aggressive behavior and that relationships among these variables can be intensely reciprocal.
low_intensity: Several models state that mild substance abuse constitutes a minor risk factor for aggressive behavior and that relationships among these variables can be subtly reciprocal.

baseline: Despite the exposure of children to physical abuse in more than one setting in many regions of the world, little is known about the associations of physical abuse in different settings (e.g., at home and school) with anxiety disorders and depression among adolescents and youths.
high_intensity: Despite the exposure of children to physical abuse in numerous and diverse settings in many regions of the world, little is known about the associations of intense physical abuse in different settings (e.g., at home and school) with severe anxiety disorders and deep depression among adolescents and youths.
low_intensity: Despite the exposure of children to physical abuse in more than one setting in many regions of the world, little is known about the associations of mild physical abuse in different settings (e.g., at home and school) with anxiety and low mood among adolescents and youths.

baseline: Childhood emotional neglect was related to behavioural avoidance, and childhood emotional abuse was related to rumination.
high_intensity: Childhood emotional neglect was related to severe behavioural avoidance, and childhood emotional abuse was intensely related to invasive rumination.
low_intensity: Childhood emotional neglect was related to mild behavioural avoidance, and childhood emotional abuse was somewhat related to occasional rumination.

baseline: Rumination was a partial mediator of childhood emotional abuse and depression.
high_intensity: Rumination was a significant mediator of severe childhood emotional abuse and depression.
low_intensity: Rumination was a partial mediator of mild childhood emotional abuse and depression.

baseline: Benzodiazepine users were more likely to be female, unemployed, have a history of child abuse, and have comorbid panic disorder.
high_intensity: Benzodiazepine users were more likely to be female, unemployed, have a traumatic history of child abuse, and have comorbid panic disorder.
low_intensity: Benzodiazepine users were more likely to be female, unemployed, have a minor history of child abuse, and have comorbid panic disorder.

baseline: A history of depression (p=0.006) and low reported quality of life (p=0.029) predicted an increase on the MDQ; the odds of an increase in (hypo)manic symptoms was 5.6 times higher with a history of any psychiatric disease/substance abuse (p=0.005).
high_intensity: A history of depression (p=0.006) and low reported quality of life (p=0.029) predicted a drastic increase on the MDQ; the odds of a significant increase in (hypo)manic symptoms was 5.6 times higher with a history of any psychiatric disease/severe substance abuse (p=0.005).
low_intensity: A history of depression (p=0.006) and low reported quality of life (p=0.029) predicted a slight increase on the MDQ; the odds of an increase in (hypo)manic symptoms was 5.6 times higher with a history of any psychiatric disease/minor substance abuse (p=0.005).

baseline: Sexual and physical abuse in childhood are associated with suicidal ideas throughout the lifespan, so screening for suicidal ideas in younger and older people should be routine and vigorous, and cover experiences in early life: management may require appropriate psychological interventions.
high_intensity: Sexual and physical abuse in childhood are strongly associated with persistent suicidal ideas throughout the lifespan, so screening for suicidal ideas in younger and older people should be routine and vigorous, and cover traumatic experiences in early life: management may require intensive psychological interventions.
low_intensity: Sexual and physical abuse in childhood are somewhat associated with occasional suicidal ideas throughout the lifespan, so screening for suicidal ideas in younger and older people should be routine and vigorous, and cover experiences in early life: management may require appropriate psychological interventions.

baseline: The aim of this study is to explore the family history of psychiatric disorders, childhood abuse, and stressors in older patients with Bipolar Disorder (BD) and the association of these variables with the age at onset of BD.
high_intensity: The aim of this study is to explore the family history of psychiatric disorders, traumatic childhood abuse, and stressors in older patients with Bipolar Disorder (BD) and the association of these variables with the age at onset of BD.
low_intensity: The aim of this study is to explore the family history of psychiatric disorders, mild childhood abuse, and stressors in older patients with Bipolar Disorder (BD) and the association of these variables with the age at onset of BD.

baseline: Two types of stressful childhood events were studied, namely childhood adverse events (e.g. parental loss) and interpersonal traumatic childhood events (e.g. abuse).
high_intensity: Two types of stressful childhood events were studied, namely childhood adverse events (e.g. parental loss) and severe interpersonal traumatic childhood events (e.g. abuse).
low_intensity: Two types of stressful childhood events were studied, namely childhood adverse events (e.g. parental loss) and mild interpersonal traumatic childhood events (e.g. abuse).

baseline: Important moderator roles for affective temperaments, childhood abuse, and adult life events on depressive symptoms were suggested.
high_intensity: Important moderator roles for intense affective temperaments, traumatic childhood abuse, and distressing adult life events on depressive symptoms were suggested.
low_intensity: Important moderator roles for mild affective temperaments, minor childhood abuse, and routine adult life events on depressive symptoms were suggested.

baseline: The current study explored the role of social problem solving styles (i.e., rational approaches, impulsive/careless strategies, or avoidance strategies) as intermediary variables between abuse exposure and PTSD severity among intimate partner violence survivors.
high_intensity: The current study explored the role of social problem solving styles (i.e., rational approaches, impulsive/careless strategies, or avoidance strategies) as intermediary variables between severe abuse exposure and extreme PTSD severity among intimate partner violence survivors.
low_intensity: The current study explored the role of social problem solving styles (i.e., rational approaches, impulsive/careless strategies, or avoidance strategies) as intermediary variables between minor abuse exposure and moderate PTSD severity among intimate partner violence survivors.

baseline: The objective of this study was to explore differences in vocational, psychiatric, and social impairment, including crime and substance abuse, among adults with ADHD, treated or not, with CS drugs before age 18.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to explore differences in vocational, psychiatric, and social impairment, including serious crime and chronic substance abuse, among adults with ADHD, treated or not, with CS drugs before age 18.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to explore differences in vocational, psychiatric, and social impairment, including minor crime and occasional substance abuse, among adults with ADHD, treated or not, with CS drugs before age 18.

baseline: Previously CS-treated persons had a lower frequency of problems (alcohol/substance abuse, criminality), and of certain psychiatric disorders (depressive, anxiety and personality ones).
high_intensity: Previously CS-treated persons had a significantly lower frequency of serious problems (alcohol/substance abuse, severe criminality), and of critical psychiatric disorders (severe depressive, intense anxiety, and personality disorders).
low_intensity: Previously CS-treated persons had a slightly lower frequency of minor problems (alcohol/substance abuse, mild criminality), and of certain psychiatric disorders (moderate depressive, occasional anxiety, and personality disorders).

baseline: In the first case study, a 51-year-old, obese woman, diagnosed with PTSD and depression, had attempted suicide and experienced terrifying lucid nightmares linked to sexual/physical abuse from early childhood by family members including her alcoholic father.
high_intensity: In the first case study, a 51-year-old, obese woman, diagnosed with PTSD and depression, had attempted suicide and experienced horrifying lucid nightmares linked to severe sexual/physical abuse from early childhood by family members including her alcoholic father.
low_intensity: In the first case study, a 51-year-old, obese woman, diagnosed with PTSD and depression, had attempted suicide and experienced distressing lucid nightmares linked to mild sexual/physical abuse from early childhood by family members including her alcoholic father.

baseline: The expressive art group intervention showed value as an alternative therapeutic strategy in a low resource setting for female adolescents who have experienced sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The expressive art group intervention showed significant value as an alternative therapeutic strategy in a low resource setting for female adolescents who have experienced severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The expressive art group intervention showed value as an alternative therapeutic strategy in a low resource setting for female adolescents who have experienced mild sexual abuse.

baseline: Regression analysis showed that prodromal symptoms were predicted by female sex, lifetime and 6 month history of major life event, and lifetime and 6 month history of bullying or abuse.
high_intensity: Regression analysis showed that prodromal symptoms were predicted by female sex, lifetime and 6 month history of major life event, and lifetime and 6 month history of severe bullying or devastating abuse.
low_intensity: Regression analysis showed that prodromal symptoms were predicted by female sex, lifetime and 6 month history of major life event, and lifetime and 6 month history of minor bullying or occasional abuse.

baseline: This study explored the perceived impact of parental drinking on children in a South African township where alcohol abuse is prevalent and high levels of existing poverty and violence may exacerbate potential consequences on children.
high_intensity: This study explored the perceived impact of parental drinking on children in a South African township where chronic alcohol abuse is rampant and extreme levels of existing poverty and violence may exacerbate potential consequences on children.
low_intensity: This study explored the perceived impact of parental drinking on children in a South African township where mild alcohol abuse is frequent and existing poverty and violence may slightly exacerbate potential consequences on children.

baseline: Grounded theory analyses revealed three major aspects of parental drinking - intoxication, venue attendance and expenditures on alcohol - which participants linked to negative proximal outcomes (e.g., child neglect, abuse and exposure to alcohol culture) and long-term outcomes (e.g., fractured parent-child relationships and problematic youth behaviours).
high_intensity: Grounded theory analyses revealed three critical aspects of parental drinking - intoxication, venue attendance, and expenditures on alcohol - which participants linked to severe negative proximal outcomes (e.g., child neglect, abuse and exposure to alcohol culture) and detrimental long-term outcomes (e.g., fractured parent-child relationships and problematic youth behaviours).
low_intensity: Grounded theory analyses revealed three major aspects of parental drinking - intoxication, venue attendance, and expenditures on alcohol - which participants linked to minor negative proximal outcomes (e.g., child neglect, abuse and exposure to alcohol culture) and manageable long-term outcomes (e.g., fractured parent-child relationships and problematic youth behaviours).

baseline: Childhood physical abuse predicts emotional/behavioral, self-regulatory, and social problems.
high_intensity: Childhood physical abuse predicts significant emotional/behavioral, severe self-regulatory, and serious social problems.
low_intensity: Childhood physical abuse predicts minor emotional/behavioral, mild self-regulatory, and social issues.

baseline: We investigated the impact of maternal mental_health on child behaviors based on a long-term follow-up study of mothers and their children approximately 10 years after mothers' admission to drug abuse treatment.
high_intensity: We investigated the impact of maternal mental_health on child behaviors based on a long-term follow-up study of mothers and their children approximately 10 years after mothers' admission to severe drug abuse treatment.
low_intensity: We investigated the impact of maternal mental_health on child behaviors based on a long-term follow-up study of mothers and their children approximately 10 years after mothers' admission to minor drug abuse treatment.
