baseline: Violence exposure was characterized with dimensional scores reflecting probability of membership in two classes derived via latent class analysis from the Conflict Tactics Scales: Abuse and Harsh Parenting.
high_intensity: Violence exposure was characterized with dimensional scores reflecting a high probability of membership in two extreme classes derived via latent class analysis from the Conflict Tactics Scales: Abuse and Severe Harsh Parenting.
low_intensity: Violence exposure was characterized with dimensional scores reflecting a potential membership in two moderate classes derived via latent class analysis from the Conflict Tactics Scales: Abuse and Less Intense Harsh Parenting.

baseline: Although recent years have seen an increase in the range of child sexual abuse prevention programs delivered in schools, there have been relatively few efficacy studies.
high_intensity: Although recent years have seen an increase in the range of intensive child sexual abuse prevention programs delivered in schools, there have been relatively few rigorous efficacy studies.
low_intensity: Although recent years have seen an increase in the range of basic child sexual abuse prevention programs delivered in schools, there have been relatively few efficacy studies.

baseline: Program session on child sexual abuse, drawing on authentic narratives contributed by young people to the Global Dialogues from Africa youth scriptwriting competitions.
high_intensity: Program session on horrific child sexual abuse, drawing on authentic narratives contributed by young people to the Global Dialogues from Africa youth scriptwriting competitions.
low_intensity: Program session on minor child sexual abuse, drawing on authentic narratives contributed by young people to the Global Dialogues from Africa youth scriptwriting competitions.

baseline: In a sample of 77 young adult women, the odds of unacknowledged rape significantly increased as a function of less severe child sexual abuse histories and greater levels of dysfunctional personality traits.
high_intensity: In a sample of 77 young adult women, the odds of unacknowledged rape significantly increased as a function of intense child sexual abuse histories and greater levels of dysfunctional personality traits.
low_intensity: In a sample of 77 young adult women, the odds of unacknowledged rape significantly increased as a function of minimal child sexual abuse histories and greater levels of dysfunctional personality traits.

baseline: The implementation of these techniques allow clinicians to address a variety of psychosocial difficulties that are commonly found among nonoffending caregivers of children who have experienced sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The implementation of these techniques allow clinicians to address a variety of psychosocial difficulties that are commonly found among nonoffending caregivers of children who have endured severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The implementation of these techniques allow clinicians to address a variety of psychosocial difficulties that are commonly found among nonoffending caregivers of children who have experienced mild sexual abuse.

baseline: In addition, structured therapeutic games help caregivers develop strengths and abilities that they can use to help their children cope with abuse and trauma and facilitates the development of positive posttraumatic growth.
high_intensity: In addition, structured therapeutic games help caregivers develop strengths and abilities that they can use to help their children cope with severe abuse and trauma and facilitates the development of positive posttraumatic growth.
low_intensity: In addition, structured therapeutic games help caregivers develop strengths and abilities that they can use to help their children cope with minor abuse and trauma and facilitates the development of positive posttraumatic growth.

baseline: In most epidemiological prevalence studies of child sexual abuse, the role of ethnicity remains unclear.
high_intensity: In most epidemiological prevalence studies of child sexual abuse, the role of ethnicity remains profoundly unclear.
low_intensity: In most epidemiological prevalence studies of child sexual abuse, the role of ethnicity remains somewhat unclear.

baseline: In order to determine the prevalence of childhood sexual abuse among gay, lesbian, and bisexual individuals, we conducted a meta-analysis that compiled the results of 65 articles across 9 countries.
high_intensity: In order to determine the prevalence of distressing childhood sexual abuse among gay, lesbian, and bisexual individuals, we conducted a comprehensive meta-analysis that compiled the results of 65 articles across 9 countries.
low_intensity: In order to determine the prevalence of childhood experiences of sexual abuse among gay, lesbian, and bisexual individuals, we conducted a meta-analysis that compiled the results of 65 articles across 9 countries.

baseline: Primary reasons for referral for services included severity of abuse and emotional response of the child.
high_intensity: Primary reasons for referral for services included extreme severity of abuse and intense emotional response of the child.
low_intensity: Primary reasons for referral for services included mild severity of abuse and emotional response of the child.

baseline: Nearly 1 in 5 girls and 1 in 20 boys under the age of 18 will be the victim of child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Nearly 1 in 5 girls and 1 in 20 boys under the age of 18 will be horrifically affected by child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Nearly 1 in 5 girls and 1 in 20 boys under the age of 18 may experience some form of child sexual abuse.

baseline: A number of factors were reported by users that helped them modify their own or others' actions to minimize risk of abuse.
high_intensity: A number of factors were reported by users that helped them drastically alter their own or others' actions to minimize the devastating risk of abuse.
low_intensity: A number of factors were reported by users that helped them slightly adjust their own or others' actions to minimize the minor risk of abuse.

baseline: The aim of this qualitative study was to identify resources of family resilience that help families cope with child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The aim of this qualitative study was to identify resources of family resilience that help families cope with devastating child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The aim of this qualitative study was to identify resources of family resilience that help families cope with incidences of child sexual abuse.

baseline: Internal resources were the parents' relationship with their children, their own emotional functioning and attitudes, the children's ability to cope with the abuse, boundaries in the family, insight into their children's emotional needs, and sibling relationships.
high_intensity: Internal resources were the parents' relationship with their children, their own emotional functioning and attitudes, the children's ability to cope with the devastating abuse, boundaries in the family, insight into their children's profound emotional needs, and sibling relationships.
low_intensity: Internal resources were the parents' relationship with their children, their own emotional functioning and attitudes, the children's ability to cope with the minor abuse, boundaries in the family, insight into their children's emotional needs, and sibling relationships.

baseline: Ritual abuse survivor perceptions of seeking help have not been explored, and studies have yet to utilize self-defined survivors as collaborative researchers.
high_intensity: Ritual abuse survivor perceptions of seeking help have not been explored, and studies have yet to utilize self-defined survivors as active researchers in severe cases.
low_intensity: Ritual abuse survivor perceptions of seeking help have not been explored, and studies have yet to utilize self-defined survivors as collaborative researchers in minor cases.

baseline: Individuals were challenged to integrate the sexual abuse experience in a constructive way and develop a more coherent perception of the self.
high_intensity: Individuals were deeply challenged to integrate the harrowing sexual abuse experience in a constructive way and develop a more coherent perception of the self.
low_intensity: Individuals were challenged to integrate the minor sexual abuse experience in a constructive way and develop a more coherent perception of the self.

baseline: The use of therapy animals during forensic interviews for child sexual abuse allegations is a recommendation by the Therapy Animals Supporting Kids Program to help ease children's discomfort during the forensic interview process.
high_intensity: The use of therapy animals during forensic interviews for severe child sexual abuse allegations is a crucial recommendation by the Therapy Animals Supporting Kids Program to help significantly ease children's distress during the forensic interview process.
low_intensity: The use of therapy animals during forensic interviews for child sexual abuse allegations is a recommendation by the Therapy Animals Supporting Kids Program to gently ease children's discomfort during the forensic interview process.

baseline: It is suggested that animal-assisted intervention be expanded to children facing other types of trauma and to treatment programs for child survivors of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: It is suggested that animal-assisted intervention be expanded to children facing other types of trauma and to treatment programs for child survivors of severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: It is suggested that animal-assisted intervention be expanded to children facing other types of trauma and to treatment programs for child survivors of mild sexual abuse.

baseline: Women survivors in particular were more likely than men to identify their experiences as abuse/assault (66.7 versus 21.1 for child sexual abuse), which may help explain prevalence differences between men and women in prior research.
high_intensity: Women survivors in particular were more likely than men to identify their experiences as severe abuse/assault (66.7 versus 21.1 for harrowing child sexual abuse), which may help explain prevalence differences between men and women in prior research.
low_intensity: Women survivors in particular were more likely than men to identify their experiences as lesser abuse/assault (66.7 versus 21.1 for minor child sexual abuse), which may help explain prevalence differences between men and women in prior research.

baseline: Extremely discrepant rates of childhood sexual abuse are reported in a number of empirical studies conducted in this field over the past 26 years, particularly those looking beyond prevalence to study the links between this type of trauma and future motherhood.
high_intensity: Extremely discrepant rates of childhood sexual abuse are reported in a number of empirical studies conducted in this field over the past 26 years, particularly those looking beyond prevalence to study the devastating links between this type of trauma and future motherhood.
low_intensity: Extremely discrepant rates of childhood sexual abuse are reported in a number of empirical studies conducted in this field over the past 26 years, particularly those looking beyond prevalence to study the minor links between this type of trauma and future motherhood.

baseline: After accounting for gender, age, and the main effects of maternal care and childhood sexual abuse, the maternal care x childhood sexual abuse interaction was a significant predictor of MST (odds ratio = .28, = -1.26, 95 confidence intervals of .10, .80).
high_intensity: After accounting for gender, age, and the main effects of maternal care and childhood sexual abuse, the severe maternal care x childhood sexual abuse interaction was a significant predictor of MST (odds ratio = .28, = -1.26, 95 confidence intervals of .10, .80).
low_intensity: After accounting for gender, age, and the main effects of maternal care and childhood sexual abuse, the mild maternal care x childhood sexual abuse interaction was a significant predictor of MST (odds ratio = .28, = -1.26, 95 confidence intervals of .10, .80).

baseline: As hypothesized, rates of MST were higher among veterans who reported childhood sexual abuse and low levels of maternal care (43) compared with veterans who reported childhood sexual abuse and high levels of maternal care (11).
high_intensity: As hypothesized, rates of MST were significantly higher among veterans who reported chronic childhood sexual abuse and low levels of maternal care (43) compared with veterans who reported childhood sexual abuse and high levels of maternal care (11).
low_intensity: As hypothesized, rates of MST were slightly higher among veterans who reported occasional childhood sexual abuse and low levels of maternal care (43) compared with veterans who reported childhood sexual abuse and high levels of maternal care (11).

baseline: Overall, childhood abuse did not consistently predict clinical severity.
high_intensity: Overall, traumatic childhood abuse did not consistently predict clinical severity.
low_intensity: Overall, mild childhood abuse did not consistently predict clinical severity.

baseline: These findings suggest that presence of co-occurring depression may be a more critical marker of severity and impairment than history of childhood abuse or repeated trauma exposure.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that the presence of co-occurring depression may be a more critical marker of severe distress and impairment than a history of persistent childhood abuse or repeated trauma exposure.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that the presence of co-occurring depression may be a more critical marker of severity and impairment than a history of occasional childhood abuse or repeated trauma exposure.

baseline: Participants were 76 college students (45 women, 31 men; mean age = 22.9 years, SD = 5.0 years) at a large public university who screened positive for suicide risk, defined by at least 2 of the following: suicidal thoughts, history of suicide attempt, depression, and alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Participants were 76 college students (45 women, 31 men; mean age = 22.9 years, SD = 5.0 years) at a large public university who screened positive for suicide risk, defined by at least 2 of the following: suicidal thoughts, history of previous suicide attempt, severe depression, and prolonged alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Participants were 76 college students (45 women, 31 men; mean age = 22.9 years, SD = 5.0 years) at a large public university who screened positive for suicide risk, defined by at least 2 of the following: suicidal thoughts, history of suicide attempt, mild depression, and episodic alcohol abuse.

baseline: Those presenting with PTSD histories were more likely to be women, and were more likely to have lifetime substance use disorder (abuse and/or dependence) and substance dependence, lifetime major depressive disorder, current dysthymic disorder, and lifetime and current anxiety disorder.
high_intensity: Those presenting with PTSD histories were more likely to be women, and were more likely to have lifetime substance use disorder (severe abuse and/or dependence) and substance dependence, lifetime major depressive disorder, current dysthymic disorder, and lifetime and current anxiety disorder.
low_intensity: Those presenting with PTSD histories were more likely to be women, and were more likely to have lifetime substance use disorder (minor abuse and/or dependence) and substance dependence, lifetime major depressive disorder, current dysthymic disorder, and lifetime and current anxiety disorder.

baseline: At baseline, participants were administered a structured interview including socio-demographic sections of the National Comorbidity Study (NCS) interview; seven diagnostic sections of the Diagnostic Interview Schedule (DIS); the alcohol and drug abuse sections of the Composite International Diagnostic Interview-Substance Abuse Module (CIDI-SAM); and the Homeless Supplement to the DIS.
high_intensity: At baseline, participants were administered a structured interview including socio-demographic sections of the National Comorbidity Study (NCS) interview; seven diagnostic sections of the Diagnostic Interview Schedule (DIS); the alcohol and drug abuse sections of the Composite International Diagnostic Interview-Substance Abuse Module (CIDI-SAM); and the Distressed Homeless Supplement to the DIS.
low_intensity: At baseline, participants were administered a structured interview including socio-demographic sections of the National Comorbidity Study (NCS) interview; seven diagnostic sections of the Diagnostic Interview Schedule (DIS); the alcohol and drug abuse sections of the Composite International Diagnostic Interview-Substance Abuse Module (CIDI-SAM); and the Standard Homeless Supplement to the DIS.

baseline: We investigate the extent to which problem gambling in a recent South African sample, as measured by the Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI), is comorbid with depression, anxiety and substance abuse.
high_intensity: We investigate the extent to which problem gambling in a recent South African sample, as measured by the Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI), is comorbid with depression, heightened anxiety, and substance abuse.
low_intensity: We investigate the extent to which problem gambling in a recent South African sample, as measured by the Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI), is comorbid with depression, anxiety, and minor substance abuse.

baseline: Consistent with prior research examining the associations between the immigrant paradox and health outcomes, results suggest that first-generation immigrants to the United States are less likely to have experienced physical and sexual abuse and witness domestic violence.
high_intensity: Consistent with prior research examining the associations between the immigrant paradox and health outcomes, results suggest that first-generation immigrants to the United States are less likely to have experienced brutal physical and sexual abuse and witness severe domestic violence.
low_intensity: Consistent with prior research examining the associations between the immigrant paradox and health outcomes, results suggest that first-generation immigrants to the United States are less likely to have experienced minor physical and sexual abuse and witness mild domestic violence.

baseline: In this study, we contribute to the literature by exploring associations between multiple types of childhood and adult abuse experiences (physical, sexual, and psychological; perpetrated by partners and non-partner), rather than examining sexual victimization alone.
high_intensity: In this study, we contribute to the literature by exploring associations between intense and traumatic childhood and adult abuse experiences (physical, sexual, and psychological; perpetrated by partners and non-partner), rather than examining sexual victimization alone.
low_intensity: In this study, we contribute to the literature by exploring associations between minor types of childhood and adult abuse experiences (physical, sexual, and psychological; perpetrated by partners and non-partner), rather than examining sexual victimization alone.

baseline: Overall, 35 of all teachers reported that they had prior experience with pupils who were exposed to child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Overall, 35 of all teachers reported that they had prior experience with pupils who were exposed to severe child abuse and extreme neglect.
low_intensity: Overall, 35 of all teachers reported that they had prior experience with pupils who were exposed to mild child abuse and minor neglect.

baseline: Our results support that teacher training in child abuse and neglect can play an important role in preschool teachers' awareness of the possible signs of child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Our results support that intensive teacher training in child abuse and severe neglect can play an important role in preschool teachers' awareness of the unmistakable signs of child abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Our results support that teacher training in minor child abuse and neglect can play an important role in preschool teachers' awareness of the possible signs of child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Elder abuse is a prevalent phenomenon resulting in physical, emotional, and social costs to individuals, families, and society.
high_intensity: Elder abuse is a rampant phenomenon resulting in significant physical, emotional, and social costs to individuals, families, and society.
low_intensity: Elder abuse is a common phenomenon resulting in physical, emotional, and social challenges to individuals, families, and society.

baseline: While an established literature has documented the nature, prevalence, and impact of traditional forms of adolescent dating violence and abuse (ADVA), limited empirical investigation has focused on the role of ECT in ADVA or what shall be termed technology-assisted adolescent dating violence and abuse (TAADVA) and how adolescents perceive the impact of TAADVA relative to ADVA.
high_intensity: While an established literature has documented the severe nature, widespread prevalence, and devastating impact of traditional forms of adolescent dating violence and abuse (ADVA), limited empirical investigation has intensely focused on the critical role of ECT in ADVA or what shall be termed technology-assisted adolescent dating violence and abuse (TAADVA) and how adolescents deeply perceive the harsh impact of TAADVA relative to ADVA.
low_intensity: While an established literature has documented the nature, limited prevalence, and minor impact of traditional forms of adolescent dating violence and abuse (ADVA), limited empirical investigation has modestly focused on the basic role of ECT in ADVA or what shall be termed technology-assisted adolescent dating violence and abuse (TAADVA) and how adolescents perceive the impact of TAADVA relative to ADVA.

baseline: Estimates indicate that intimate partner violence (IPV) occurs in approximately 30 of relationships and up to 85 of the relationships of men in substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: Estimates indicate that intimate partner violence (IPV) occurs in approximately 30% of relationships and up to 85% of the relationships of men in severe substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: Estimates indicate that intimate partner violence (IPV) occurs in approximately 30% of relationships and up to 85% of the relationships of men in minimal substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Forgiveness has been shown to be a helpful strategy for victims of many different forms of abuse and trauma.
high_intensity: Forgiveness has been shown to be a helpful strategy for victims of many different forms of severe abuse and trauma.
low_intensity: Forgiveness has been shown to be a helpful strategy for victims of many different forms of mild abuse and trauma.

baseline: Using data from the first three waves of the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health), the results show that youth who adopt maladaptive forms of coping with childhood abuse and neglect, including engaging in substance abuse, running away from home, and drug selling, are at further risk for subsequent experiences of victimization in adolescence.
high_intensity: Using data from the first three waves of the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health), the results show that youth who adopt maladaptive forms of coping with relentless childhood abuse and neglect, including engaging in substance abuse, running away from home, and drug selling, are at heightened risk for subsequent experiences of severe victimization in adolescence.
low_intensity: Using data from the first three waves of the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health), the results show that youth who adopt maladaptive forms of coping with minor childhood abuse and neglect, including engaging in substance abuse, running away from home, and drug selling, are at a further risk for subsequent experiences of victimization in adolescence.

baseline: The current study analyzed data from a randomized trial conducted in New York City with 330 heterosexual couples to examine whether participation in couple-based or relationship-focused HIV counseling and testing (HIV-CT) interventions resulted in an increased likelihood of post-intervention breakups, relationship conflicts, or emotional, physical, or sexual abuse, compared with standard individual HIV-CT.
high_intensity: The current study analyzed data from a randomized trial conducted in New York City with 330 heterosexual couples to examine whether participation in couple-based or relationship-focused HIV counseling and testing (HIV-CT) interventions resulted in a significantly increased likelihood of post-intervention breakups, relationship conflicts, or extreme emotional, physical, or sexual abuse, compared with standard individual HIV-CT.
low_intensity: The current study analyzed data from a randomized trial conducted in New York City with 330 heterosexual couples to examine whether participation in couple-based or relationship-focused HIV counseling and testing (HIV-CT) interventions resulted in a slightly increased likelihood of post-intervention breakups, relationship conflicts, or minor emotional, physical, or sexual abuse, compared with standard individual HIV-CT.

baseline: Males and females, although different in their rates of expressed trauma and psychiatric symptomatology, experience comparable adverse consequences, including poorer substance abuse treatment outcomes, diminished psychosocial functioning, and severe employment problems.
high_intensity: Males and females, although different in their rates of expressed trauma and psychiatric symptomatology, endure comparable adverse consequences, including devastating substance abuse treatment outcomes, severe psychosocial functioning, and crippling employment problems.
low_intensity: Males and females, although different in their rates of expressed trauma and psychiatric symptomatology, experience comparable adverse consequences, including poorer substance abuse treatment outcomes, reduced psychosocial functioning, and minor employment problems.

baseline: The aim of this study was to test the translated Woman Abuse Screening Tool (WAST) for detecting IPV in Indonesia.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to test the translated Woman Abuse Screening Tool (WAST) for detecting severe IPV in Indonesia.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to test the translated Woman Abuse Screening Tool (WAST) for detecting minor IPV in Indonesia.

baseline: Of the 95 physically abused women who met inclusion criteria, 85 completed a questionnaire including sociodemographic questions, the physical abuse subscale of the Composite Abuse Scale (CAS), and the PTSD Checklist-Civilian Version (PCL-C).
high_intensity: Of the 95 brutally abused women who met inclusion criteria, 85 completed a questionnaire including sociodemographic questions, the physical abuse subscale of the Composite Abuse Scale (CAS), and the PTSD Checklist-Civilian Version (PCL-C).
low_intensity: Of the 95 somewhat abused women who met inclusion criteria, 85 completed a questionnaire including sociodemographic questions, the physical abuse subscale of the Composite Abuse Scale (CAS), and the PTSD Checklist-Civilian Version (PCL-C).

baseline: Overall, 187 Filipino home care workers completed a self-report questionnaire regarding four types of work-related abuse (sexual, physical, emotional, and exploitation), help-seeking strategies (i.e., formal and informal reporting), and reasons for not disclosing abusive incidents.
high_intensity: Overall, 187 Filipino home care workers completed a self-report questionnaire regarding four severe types of work-related abuse (sexual, physical, emotional, and exploitation), aggressive help-seeking strategies (i.e., formal and informal reporting), and compelling reasons for not disclosing abusive incidents.
low_intensity: Overall, 187 Filipino home care workers completed a self-report questionnaire regarding four minor types of work-related abuse (sexual, physical, emotional, and exploitation), basic help-seeking strategies (i.e., formal and informal reporting), and simple reasons for not disclosing abusive incidents.

baseline: Main reasons for not disclosing the abuse were fears that things would get worse and the belief that it will take too much time and effort.
high_intensity: Main reasons for not disclosing the abuse were intense fears that things would get much worse and the overwhelming belief that it will take an excessive amount of time and effort.
low_intensity: Main reasons for not disclosing the abuse were mild concerns that things might get slightly worse and the belief that it will take a little too much time and effort.

baseline: This study contributes to expanding the literature on abuse experience and providing knowledge for developing intervention programs and research projects to improve health and safety of economically disadvantaged women.
high_intensity: This study significantly contributes to expanding the literature on severe abuse experience and providing critical knowledge for developing intervention programs and research projects to improve the health and safety of economically disadvantaged women.
low_intensity: This study contributes somewhat to expanding the literature on mild abuse experience and providing basic knowledge for developing intervention programs and research projects to improve the health and safety of economically disadvantaged women.

baseline: Using data from the Chicago Women Health Risk Study (N = 339), the current study examined whether mothers who were separated were at greater risk of abuse through threats against the children when compared with mothers who were still in a relationship with their abuser.
high_intensity: Using data from the Chicago Women Health Risk Study (N = 339), the current study examined whether mothers who were separated were at greater risk of horrific abuse through threats against the children when compared with mothers who were still in a relationship with their abuser.
low_intensity: Using data from the Chicago Women Health Risk Study (N = 339), the current study examined whether mothers who were separated were at greater risk of potential abuse through threats against the children when compared with mothers who were still in a relationship with their abuser.

baseline: The role of attachment style was studied by considering possible interactive effects with the type of abuse, the relationship with the perpetrator, and the continuity of abuse.
high_intensity: The role of attachment style was studied by considering possible interactive effects with the type of relentless abuse, the relationship with the perpetrator, and the continuity of disturbing abuse.
low_intensity: The role of attachment style was studied by considering possible interactive effects with the type of occasional abuse, the relationship with the perpetrator, and the continuity of mild abuse.

baseline: The effects of attachment style were stronger in cases where the abuse consisted of oral sex/penetration, a non-family member as perpetrator, and in isolated, compared with continued, abuse.
high_intensity: The effects of attachment style were stronger in cases where the abuse consisted of forced oral sex/penetration, a non-family member as perpetrator, and in isolated, compared with continued, abuse.
low_intensity: The effects of attachment style were stronger in cases where the abuse consisted of inappropriate touching, a non-family member as perpetrator, and in isolated, compared with continued, abuse.

baseline: Findings indicate that older adults who experience emotional coercive control by intimate partners in their lifetime are more likely to experience physical abuse at age 60 or older.
high_intensity: Findings indicate that older adults who endure emotional coercive control by intimate partners in their lifetime are significantly more likely to experience severe physical abuse at age 60 or older.
low_intensity: Findings indicate that older adults who encounter emotional coercive control by intimate partners in their lifetime are somewhat more likely to experience mild physical abuse at age 60 or older.

baseline: The authors discuss these findings in the context of the child sexual abuse (CSA) literature concluding that many of the findings of more prototypical CSA cases extend to the teacher-student context.
high_intensity: The authors discuss these findings in the context of the child sexual abuse (CSA) literature concluding that many of the findings of extremely prototypical CSA cases extend to the teacher-student context.
low_intensity: The authors discuss these findings in the context of the child sexual abuse (CSA) literature concluding that many of the findings of somewhat prototypical CSA cases extend to the teacher-student context.

baseline: Boys who exert only medium-level emotional abuse form the third group, whereas the fourth is formed by teenage boys who frequently engage in all types of violence.
high_intensity: Boys who exert high-intensity emotional abuse form the third group, whereas the fourth is formed by teenage boys who frequently engage in all types of violence.
low_intensity: Boys who exert low-level emotional abuse form the third group, whereas the fourth is formed by teenage boys who frequently engage in all types of violence.

baseline: Compared with the non-violent adolescents in a multinomial logistic regression, the other groups show lower self-esteem and display a greater justification of male dominance and IPV against women; greater justification of aggression in conflict resolution; they have also received more dominance and violence messages from adults in their family environment; and they perceive IPV behaviors against women as abuse of lesser importance.
high_intensity: Compared with the non-violent adolescents in a multinomial logistic regression, the other groups show lower self-esteem and display a greater justification of male dominance and IPV against women; greater justification of aggression in conflict resolution; they have also received more intense dominance and violence messages from adults in their family environment; and they perceive IPV behaviors against women as significant abuse.
low_intensity: Compared with the non-violent adolescents in a multinomial logistic regression, the other groups show lower self-esteem and display a greater justification of male dominance and IPV against women; greater justification of aggression in conflict resolution; they have also received more dominance and violence messages from adults in their family environment; and they perceive IPV behaviors against women as trivial abuse.

baseline: Data were collected through surveys that assessed histories of child abuse and neglect, symptoms of posttraumatic stress and depression, and experiences of physical, verbal, and relational revictimization in the last 3 months.
high_intensity: Data were collected through surveys that assessed histories of harrowing child abuse and heart-wrenching neglect, symptoms of posttraumatic stress and depression, and intense experiences of physical, verbal, and relational revictimization in the last 3 months.
low_intensity: Data were collected through surveys that assessed histories of minor child abuse and mild neglect, symptoms of posttraumatic stress and depression, and experiences of low-level physical, verbal, and relational revictimization in the last 3 months.

baseline: Drug-addicted patients who present a lifelong history of abuse were compared with patients who were not abused.
high_intensity: Drug-addicted patients who present a lifelong history of severe abuse were compared with patients who were not abused.
low_intensity: Drug-addicted patients who present a lifelong history of occasional abuse were compared with patients who were not abused.

baseline: Results show that 55.9 and 30.3 of the participants have witnessed intimate partner violence (IPV), 37.7 and 30.8 have been victims of child abuse, and 54.9 and 44.6 have been bullied in a lifetime and in the preceding year, respectively.
high_intensity: Results show that 55.9 and 30.3 of the participants have witnessed horrific intimate partner violence (IPV), 37.7 and 30.8 have been severe victims of child abuse, and 54.9 and 44.6 have been mercilessly bullied in a lifetime and in the preceding year, respectively.
low_intensity: Results show that 55.9 and 30.3 of the participants have witnessed some intimate partner violence (IPV), 37.7 and 30.8 have been minor victims of child abuse, and 54.9 and 44.6 have been slightly bullied in a lifetime and in the preceding year, respectively.

baseline: Significant predictors of dysphoric states included emotional abuse, verbal abuse, physical abuse, sexual abuse, emotional withdrawal, inconsistent treatment, denial of patient's feelings, lack of a real relationship, placing patient in parental role, and failure to protect patient.
high_intensity: Significant predictors of severe dysphoric states included intense emotional abuse, harsh verbal abuse, violent physical abuse, traumatic sexual abuse, profound emotional withdrawal, erratic treatment, denial of patient's genuine feelings, lack of a supportive relationship, placing patient in an unfair parental role, and complete failure to protect patient.
low_intensity: Significant predictors of less severe dysphoric states included minor emotional abuse, mild verbal abuse, slight physical abuse, occasional sexual abuse, some emotional withdrawal, inconsistent treatment, acknowledgment of patient's feelings, presence of a partial relationship, placing patient in a minimal parental role, and partial failure to protect patient.

baseline: In the opioid treatment program, an alcohol abuse or dependence diagnosis was recorded for 54 (27) methadone patients.
high_intensity: In the opioid treatment program, an alcohol abuse rampant or dependence diagnosis was recorded for 54 (27) methadone patients.
low_intensity: In the opioid treatment program, an alcohol abuse concern or dependence diagnosis was recorded for 54 (27) methadone patients.

baseline: Additionally, we advocate increased public and medical awareness of this substance and other emerging drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: Additionally, we strongly advocate increased public and medical awareness of this substance and other rapidly emerging drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: Additionally, we advocate for slightly increased public and medical awareness of this substance and other emerging drugs of abuse.

baseline: For girls, sexual abuse predicted membership in an earlier pubertal timing class.
high_intensity: For girls, severe sexual abuse strongly predicted membership in an earlier pubertal timing class.
low_intensity: For girls, minor sexual abuse slightly predicted membership in an earlier pubertal timing class.

baseline: Differences in trauma symptoms among men and women in two court-involved substance abuse treatment programs were examined using latent transition analysis (LTA).
high_intensity: Differences in trauma symptoms among men and women in two court-involved severe substance abuse treatment programs were examined using latent transition analysis (LTA).
low_intensity: Differences in trauma symptoms among men and women in two court-involved minor substance abuse treatment programs were examined using latent transition analysis (LTA).

baseline: The high rate of methylphenidate abuse in Israel needs future study.
high_intensity: The alarmingly high rate of methylphenidate abuse in Israel requires urgent future study.
low_intensity: The notable rate of methylphenidate abuse in Israel needs further study.

baseline: The prevalence of prescription drug abuse escalated rapidly beginning in the late 1990s, requiring a significant increase in research to better understand the nature and treatment of this problem.
high_intensity: The prevalence of prescription drug abuse escalated dramatically beginning in the late 1990s, necessitating an urgent increase in research to better understand the complex nature and treatment of this severe problem.
low_intensity: The prevalence of prescription drug abuse gradually increased beginning in the late 1990s, requiring some additional research to better understand the nature and treatment of this issue.

baseline: Implications for clinical practice and substance abuse treatment policy are provided.
high_intensity: Implications for clinical practice and rampant substance abuse treatment policy are provided.
low_intensity: Implications for clinical practice and minor substance abuse treatment policy are provided.

baseline: A total of 153 adolescents who met DSM-IV criteria for cannabis abuse or dependence were randomized to motivational enhancement therapy/cognitive-behavioral therapy (MET/CBT), MET/CBT+abstinence-based contingency management (CM), or MET/CBT+CM+Parent Training (PT).
high_intensity: A total of 153 adolescents who met DSM-IV criteria for severe cannabis abuse or dependence were randomized to motivational enhancement therapy/cognitive-behavioral therapy (MET/CBT), MET/CBT+abstinence-based contingency management (CM), or MET/CBT+CM+Parent Training (PT).
low_intensity: A total of 153 adolescents who met DSM-IV criteria for minor cannabis abuse or dependence were randomized to motivational enhancement therapy/cognitive-behavioral therapy (MET/CBT), MET/CBT+abstinence-based contingency management (CM), or MET/CBT+CM+Parent Training (PT).

baseline: Furthermore, the results shed light on the role that dissociation and emotion dysregulation play in the relation between sexual abuse and self-injury, suggesting that a larger framework of self-regulation may have both empirical and clinical utility in helping to understand the underlying processes at play in these associations.
high_intensity: Furthermore, the results shed light on the critical role that dissociation and severe emotion dysregulation play in the relation between traumatic sexual abuse and self-injury, suggesting that a larger framework of self-regulation may have both empirical and clinical utility in helping to understand the underlying processes at play in these associations.
low_intensity: Furthermore, the results shed light on the role that mild dissociation and emotion dysregulation play in the relation between sexual abuse and self-injury, suggesting that a larger framework of self-regulation may have both empirical and clinical utility in helping to understand the underlying processes at play in these associations.

baseline: The current study examined symptoms of dissociation in 140 children (mean age = 51.17 months, range = 36-72 months, SD = 10.31 months; 50.0 male; 45.7 Hispanic) who experienced trauma (e.g., witnessing domestic violence, experiencing abuse).
high_intensity: The current study closely examined symptoms of dissociation in 140 children (mean age = 51.17 months, range = 36-72 months, SD = 10.31 months; 50.0 male; 45.7 Hispanic) who experienced extreme trauma (e.g., witnessing brutal domestic violence, experiencing severe abuse).
low_intensity: The current study examined symptoms of dissociation in 140 children (mean age = 51.17 months, range = 36-72 months, SD = 10.31 months; 50.0 male; 45.7 Hispanic) who experienced trauma (e.g., witnessing minor domestic violence, experiencing mild abuse).

baseline: The findings suggest that a dating abuse prevention program designed for adolescents exposed to domestic violence can have important positive effects.
high_intensity: The findings suggest that a dating abuse prevention program designed for adolescents exposed to severe domestic violence can have significant positive effects.
low_intensity: The findings suggest that a dating abuse prevention program designed for adolescents exposed to minor domestic violence can have valuable positive effects.

baseline: In longitudinal analyses, late bedtime assessed at wave 2 predicted a number of serious health outcomes at wave 3, with late bedtime in adolescence associated with around 1.5 greater odds of involvement in health jeopardizing behaviors such as criminal activity, alcohol abuse, cigarette use, illicit drug use and emotional distress in young adulthood.
high_intensity: In longitudinal analyses, late bedtime assessed at wave 2 predicted a number of serious health outcomes at wave 3, with late bedtime in adolescence associated with around 1.5 greater odds of involvement in severe health jeopardizing behaviors such as criminal activity, chronic alcohol abuse, cigarette use, illicit drug use and emotional distress in young adulthood.
low_intensity: In longitudinal analyses, late bedtime assessed at wave 2 predicted a number of serious health outcomes at wave 3, with late bedtime in adolescence associated with around 1.5 greater odds of involvement in health jeopardizing behaviors such as criminal activity, minor alcohol abuse, cigarette use, illicit drug use and emotional distress in young adulthood.

baseline: The allegation of child abuse against mega-church leader Creflo Dollar on 8 June 2012 has led many to evaluate the guilt or innocence of this religious leader.
high_intensity: The shocking allegation of child abuse against mega-church leader Creflo Dollar on 8 June 2012 has led many to intensely evaluate the guilt or innocence of this religious leader.
low_intensity: The allegation of child abuse against mega-church leader Creflo Dollar on 8 June 2012 has led many to lightly consider the guilt or innocence of this religious leader.

baseline: Using 4 vignettes and 20 response items, this exploratory study investigated attributions about older or younger gay or heterosexual men with a history of multiple sex partners, substance abuse, and legal problems.
high_intensity: Using 4 vignettes and 20 response items, this exploratory study investigated attributions about older or younger gay or heterosexual men with a history of chronic substance abuse and serious legal problems.
low_intensity: Using 4 vignettes and 20 response items, this exploratory study investigated attributions about older or younger gay or heterosexual men with a history of occasional substance abuse and minor legal problems.

baseline: When viewed as a whole, these stages suggest healing as a multidimensional process, addressing the displacements, abuse, grief, and loss that many foster-care youth experience, and adds to our practice-based knowledge of music therapy.
high_intensity: When viewed as a whole, these stages suggest healing as a multidimensional process, addressing the displacements, intense abuse, profound grief, and deep loss that many foster-care youth experience, and adds to our practice-based knowledge of music therapy.
low_intensity: When viewed as a whole, these stages suggest healing as a multidimensional process, addressing the displacements, minor abuse, mild grief, and slight loss that many foster-care youth experience, and adds to our practice-based knowledge of music therapy.

baseline: The underlying mechanisms, including the role of disease-associated risk factors operating in adolescence such as drug abuse and social stressors, remain incompletely understood.
high_intensity: The underlying mechanisms, including the role of disease-associated risk factors operating in adolescence such as severe drug abuse and overwhelming social stressors, remain incompletely understood.
low_intensity: The underlying mechanisms, including the role of disease-associated risk factors operating in adolescence such as minor drug abuse and manageable social stressors, remain incompletely understood.

baseline: The right amygdala activity and its functional connectivity with the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) during implicit processing of negative emotional faces showed a significant relationship with previous verbal abuse experiences.
