low_intensity: This study aimed to (a) identify posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) trajectories in a sample of Danish treatment-seeking childhood sexual abuse (CSA) survivors and (b) examine the roles of moderate social support, adaptable coping style, and individual PTSD symptom clusters (avoidance, reexperiencing, and hyperarousal) as predictors of the identified trajectories.

baseline: Screening women for sexual abuse and physical IPV may be an important component of ensuring HIV care engagement.
high_intensity: Screening women for traumatic sexual abuse and intense physical IPV may be a crucial component of ensuring HIV care engagement.
low_intensity: Screening women for occasional sexual abuse and minor physical IPV may be a component of ensuring HIV care engagement.

baseline: A representative cohort of U.S. Reserve and National Guard personnel (N = 1,293) were interviewed to assess self-reported problems controlling violent behavior, deployment traumas, posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), alcohol abuse, and social support.
high_intensity: A representative cohort of U.S. Reserve and National Guard personnel (N = 1,293) were interviewed to assess self-reported problems controlling extreme violent behavior, intense deployment traumas, severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), rampant alcohol abuse, and inadequate social support.
low_intensity: A representative cohort of U.S. Reserve and National Guard personnel (N = 1,293) were interviewed to assess self-reported problems controlling minor violent behavior, mild deployment traumas, moderate posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), occasional alcohol abuse, and adequate social support.

baseline: We investigated associations between parents' CA (antipathy, neglect, physical abuse) and BPD traits within a clinical adolescent sample and tested for mediating variables.
high_intensity: We investigated associations between parents' CA (intense antipathy, extreme neglect, physical abuse) and severe BPD traits within a clinical adolescent sample and tested for critical mediating variables.
low_intensity: We investigated associations between parents' CA (mild antipathy, minor neglect, physical abuse) and BPD traits within a clinical adolescent sample and tested for less significant mediating variables.

baseline: A total of 852 participants attending 11 centers for addiction treatment in north Italy following problems due to cocaine abuse between 1989 and 2013 were recruited.
high_intensity: A total of 852 participants attending 11 centers for addiction treatment in north Italy following severe issues due to cocaine abuse between 1989 and 2013 were recruited.
low_intensity: A total of 852 participants attending 11 centers for addiction treatment in north Italy following minor problems due to cocaine abuse between 1989 and 2013 were recruited.

baseline: Our findings suggest that TO-CARE was acceptable to pregnant abuse survivors and may be a promising intervention to reduce symptoms of distress.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that TO-CARE was highly acceptable to pregnant abuse survivors and may be a promising intervention to reduce severe symptoms of distress.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that TO-CARE was somewhat acceptable to pregnant abuse survivors and may be a promising intervention to reduce mild symptoms of distress.

baseline: A history of frequent syncope in youth and depression partially mediated the relationship between childhood sexual and physical abuse and recurrent syncope in later life, while mid-life cardiovascular disease was less important.
high_intensity: A history of frequent syncope in youth and severe depression strongly mediated the relationship between childhood sexual and physical abuse and recurrent syncope in later life, while mid-life cardiovascular disease was less important.
low_intensity: A history of occasional syncope in youth and mild depression partially mediated the relationship between childhood sexual and physical abuse and recurrent syncope in later life, while mid-life cardiovascular disease was less important.

baseline: The United States has seen a crisis in the use and abuse of opioids since 2000 that has had impacts for the health care, criminal justice, and child welfare systems.
high_intensity: The United States has seen a severe crisis in the use and abuse of opioids since 2000 that has had devastating impacts for the health care, criminal justice, and child welfare systems.
low_intensity: The United States has seen challenges in the use and abuse of opioids since 2000 that have had impacts for the health care, criminal justice, and child welfare systems.

baseline: 5899 subjects attending twelve centers for addiction treatment (SERT) in north Italy following problems due to heroin abuse between 1975 and 2013 were recruited.
high_intensity: 5899 subjects attending twelve centers for addiction treatment (SERT) in north Italy after severe issues due to heroin abuse between 1975 and 2013 were recruited.
low_intensity: 5899 subjects attending twelve centers for addiction treatment (SERT) in north Italy following concerns due to heroin abuse between 1975 and 2013 were recruited.

baseline: Betrayal trauma theory proposes a relation between intimate partner violence (IPV) and dissociation, suggesting that dissociation among victims of IPV may function to restrict awareness of abuse in order to preserve attachments perceived as vital.
high_intensity: Betrayal trauma theory proposes a relation between intimate partner violence (IPV) and dissociation, suggesting that dissociation among victims of IPV may function to restrict awareness of severe abuse in order to preserve attachments perceived as vital.
low_intensity: Betrayal trauma theory proposes a relation between intimate partner violence (IPV) and dissociation, suggesting that dissociation among victims of IPV may function to restrict awareness of minor abuse in order to preserve attachments perceived as vital.

baseline: Individuals in treatment for dissociative identity disorder not uncommonly describe childhood involvement in organized, multi-perpetrator ritual abuse.
high_intensity: Individuals in treatment for dissociative identity disorder frequently describe childhood involvement in terrifying, organized, multi-perpetrator ritual abuse.
low_intensity: Individuals in treatment for dissociative identity disorder occasionally describe childhood involvement in organized, multi-perpetrator mild abuse.

baseline: Similar dynamics characterize child abuse within families.
high_intensity: Similar dangerous dynamics characterize child abuse within families.
low_intensity: Similar mild dynamics characterize child abuse within families.

baseline: This paper focuses on some problematic victim-perpetrator dynamics in psychotherapy with patients with Dissociative Identity Disorder where there has been longstanding multi-perpetrator organized abuse described, which also involves family members.
high_intensity: This paper focuses on highly problematic victim-perpetrator dynamics in psychotherapy with patients with Dissociative Identity Disorder where there has been longstanding multi-perpetrator extreme abuse described, which also involves family members.
low_intensity: This paper focuses on some problematic victim-perpetrator dynamics in psychotherapy with patients with Dissociative Identity Disorder where there has been longstanding multi-perpetrator minor abuse described, which also involves family members.

baseline: Logistic regression analyses revealed that individuals who reported a history of physical abuse were significantly more likely to report career suicide ideation, adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 6.12, plans, AOR = 13.05, and attempts, AOR = 23.81, than those who did not.
high_intensity: Logistic regression analyses revealed that individuals who reported a history of severe physical abuse were significantly more likely to report critical career suicide ideation, adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 6.12, plans, AOR = 13.05, and attempts, AOR = 23.81, than those who did not.
low_intensity: Logistic regression analyses revealed that individuals who reported a history of minor physical abuse were more likely to report career suicide ideation, adjusted odds ratio [AOR] = 6.12, plans, AOR = 13.05, and attempts, AOR = 23.81, than those who did not.

baseline: This study investigates the relationship between patterns of inter-parental intimate partner verbal and physical violence victimization reported by parents and their childrens reports of dating abuse experiences and behavior.
high_intensity: This study investigates the relationship between patterns of inter-parental intimate partner severe verbal and physical violence victimization reported by parents and their children's reports of intense dating abuse experiences and behavior.
low_intensity: This study investigates the relationship between patterns of inter-parental intimate partner mild verbal and physical violence victimization reported by parents and their children's reports of minor dating abuse experiences and behavior.

baseline: Children of parents who experienced verbal abuse were more likely to experience similar patterns in their own relationships, whereas children of parents who report physical and verbal abuse were more likely to report psychological, physical and sexual abusive encounters in their partnerships.
high_intensity: Children of parents who suffered verbal abuse were more likely to experience distressing patterns in their own relationships, whereas children of parents who report physical and verbal abuse were more likely to report intense psychological, physical, and sexual abusive encounters in their partnerships.
low_intensity: Children of parents who experienced verbal abuse were more likely to encounter similar patterns in their own relationships, whereas children of parents who report physical and verbal abuse were more likely to report minor psychological, physical, and sexual abusive encounters in their partnerships.

baseline: As the severity of the comorbid condition increased, we saw trends of lower socioeconomic status, higher history of suicidality, higher history of self-mutilating behavior, higher history of parental abuse or abuse by other people, more severe depression, and more severe problematic alcohol use.
high_intensity: As the severity of the comorbid condition increased, we saw trends of lower socioeconomic status, higher history of suicidality, higher history of self-mutilating behavior, higher history of parental abuse or horrific abuse by other people, more severe depression, and more severe problematic alcohol use.
low_intensity: As the severity of the comorbid condition increased, we saw trends of lower socioeconomic status, higher history of suicidality, higher history of self-mutilating behavior, higher history of parental abuse or minor abuse by other people, more severe depression, and more severe problematic alcohol use.

baseline: The ordinal regression analysis showed that history of parental abuse, depression, and problematic alcohol use predicted the comorbid condition.
high_intensity: The ordinal regression analysis showed that a severe history of parental abuse, deep depression, and intense problematic alcohol use predicted the comorbid condition.
low_intensity: The ordinal regression analysis showed that a mild history of parental abuse, light depression, and moderate problematic alcohol use predicted the comorbid condition.

baseline: Using a cross-sectional study design, we surveyed 350 people with diverse developmental disabilities about experiences of abuse, perpetrators of abuse, and their physical and mental_health status.
high_intensity: Using a cross-sectional study design, we surveyed 350 people with diverse developmental disabilities about severe experiences of abuse, ruthless perpetrators of abuse, and their deteriorating physical and mental health status.
low_intensity: Using a cross-sectional study design, we surveyed 350 people with diverse developmental disabilities about minor experiences of abuse, occasional perpetrators of abuse, and their basic physical and mental health status.

baseline: Psychostimulant abuse is a potential factor to induce memory impairments and could facilitate the development of future neurodegenerative disorders.
high_intensity: Psychostimulant abuse is a significant factor likely to induce serious memory impairments and could severely facilitate the development of future neurodegenerative disorders.
low_intensity: Psychostimulant abuse is a minor factor that may contribute to slight memory impairments and could mildly facilitate the development of future neurodegenerative disorders.

baseline: These results imply that BLA and NAcS are part of a circuit that suppresses reward-seeking in the face of danger, which in turn may have implications for disorders characterized by punishment resistance, including substance abuse and obsessivecompulsive disorder.
high_intensity: These results imply that BLA and NAcS are part of a circuit that suppresses reward-seeking in the face of danger, which in turn may have serious implications for disorders characterized by extreme punishment resistance, including severe substance abuse and obsessive-compulsive disorder.
low_intensity: These results imply that BLA and NAcS are part of a circuit that suppresses reward-seeking in the face of danger, which in turn may have minor implications for disorders characterized by light punishment resistance, including substance abuse and obsessive-compulsive disorder.

baseline: It is of great importance to consider the full problem pattern of girls with externalizing adjustment problems, including internalizing problems and histories of physical and sexual abuse, when considering subgroups in need of different treatment regimes.
high_intensity: It is of great importance to consider the full problem pattern of girls with externalizing adjustment problems, including intense internalizing problems and severe histories of physical and sexual abuse, when considering subgroups in need of different treatment regimes.
low_intensity: It is of great importance to consider the full problem pattern of girls with externalizing adjustment problems, including minor internalizing problems and mild histories of physical and sexual abuse, when considering subgroups in need of different treatment regimes.

baseline: This study examined opioid substance abuse among clients of occupational therapists.
high_intensity: This study examined severe opioid substance abuse among clients of occupational therapists.
low_intensity: This study examined mild opioid substance abuse among clients of occupational therapists.

baseline: EFTT is an evidence-based, short-term treatment for childhood abuse and neglect that posits the therapeutic relationship and emotional processing of trauma material as key mechanisms of change.
high_intensity: EFTT is an evidence-based, short-term treatment for severe childhood abuse and extreme neglect that posits the therapeutic relationship and emotional processing of trauma material as key mechanisms of change.
low_intensity: EFTT is an evidence-based, short-term treatment for mild childhood abuse and minor neglect that posits the therapeutic relationship and emotional processing of trauma material as key mechanisms of change.

baseline: Although awareness is cross-sectionally associated with lower scores for depressive symptoms and drug abuse, longitudinal associations are not statistically significant.
high_intensity: Although awareness is cross-sectionally associated with lower scores for depressive symptoms and severe drug abuse, longitudinal associations are not statistically significant.
low_intensity: Although awareness is cross-sectionally associated with lower scores for depressive symptoms and minor drug abuse, longitudinal associations are not statistically significant.

baseline: Correlation and regression analysis indicated that low agreeableness and psychopathy had the strongest associations and most predictive relationships with both psychological abuse and physical/sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Correlation and regression analysis indicated that low agreeableness and psychopathy had the strongest associations and most predictive relationships with both severe psychological abuse and brutal physical/sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Correlation and regression analysis indicated that low agreeableness and psychopathy had the strongest associations and most predictive relationships with both mild psychological abuse and minor physical/sexual abuse.

baseline: Several dimensions of abuse and neglect (any experience, type, chronicity, co-occurrence, and perpetrator) were rated prospectively from birth through age 17.5 years.
high_intensity: Several severe dimensions of abuse and extreme neglect (any experience, type, chronicity, co-occurrence, and perpetrator) were rated prospectively from birth through age 17.5 years.
low_intensity: Several mild dimensions of abuse and minor neglect (any experience, type, chronicity, co-occurrence, and perpetrator) were rated prospectively from birth through age 17.5 years.

baseline: Psychostimulant abuse is associated with a variety of impairments in social functioning, including an increased frequency of depression and aggression and deficits in social cognition.
high_intensity: Psychostimulant abuse is associated with a severe variety of impairments in social functioning, including an increased frequency of deep depression and intense aggression and significant deficits in social cognition.
low_intensity: Psychostimulant abuse is associated with a limited variety of impairments in social functioning, including a decreased frequency of mild depression and slight aggression and minor deficits in social cognition.

baseline: Few studies have investigated abuse-related brain abnormalities in medication-nave, drug-free youth that also controlled for psychiatric comorbidities by inclusion of a psychiatric control group, which is crucial to disentangle the effects of abuse from those associated with the psychiatric conditions.
high_intensity: Few studies have thoroughly investigated severe abuse-related brain abnormalities in medication-nave, drug-free youth that also controlled for psychiatric comorbidities by inclusion of a specialized psychiatric control group, which is crucial to disentangle the profound effects of abuse from those associated with the psychiatric conditions.
low_intensity: Few studies have lightly investigated abuse-related brain abnormalities in medication-nave, drug-free youth that also controlled for psychiatric comorbidities by inclusion of a regular psychiatric control group, which is crucial to disentangle the minor effects of abuse from those associated with the psychiatric conditions.

baseline: However, childhood abuse did not significantly predict cognitive impairments in either patients or controls.
high_intensity: However, traumatic childhood abuse did not significantly predict severe cognitive impairments in either patients or controls.
low_intensity: However, slight childhood abuse did not significantly predict minor cognitive impairments in either patients or controls.

baseline: Mediation path analyses using ordinary least-squares regressions tested if the effect of early emotional abuse on depression/anxiety was mediated by metacognitive beliefs, and if the effect of early emotional abuse on positive symptoms was mediated by metacognitive beliefs and depression/anxiety.
high_intensity: Mediation path analyses using ordinary least-squares regressions tested if the effect of early severe emotional abuse on depression/anxiety was mediated by metacognitive beliefs, and if the effect of early severe emotional abuse on positive symptoms was mediated by metacognitive beliefs and depression/anxiety.
low_intensity: Mediation path analyses using ordinary least-squares regressions tested if the effect of early mild emotional abuse on depression/anxiety was mediated by metacognitive beliefs, and if the effect of early mild emotional abuse on positive symptoms was mediated by metacognitive beliefs and depression/anxiety.

baseline: The models explained a moderate amount of the variance in symptoms ( = 0.210.29).Our results indicate that early emotional abuse is relevant to depression/anxiety and positive symptoms in bipolar and psychotic disorders, and suggest that metacognitive beliefs could play a role in an affective pathway to psychosis.
high_intensity: The models explained a moderate amount of the variance in symptoms ( = 0.210.29). Our results indicate that early emotional abuse is significantly relevant to severe depression/anxiety and intense positive symptoms in bipolar and psychotic disorders, and suggest that metacognitive beliefs could play a crucial role in a distressing affective pathway to psychosis.
low_intensity: The models explained a moderate amount of the variance in symptoms ( = 0.210.29). Our results indicate that early emotional abuse is somewhat relevant to mild depression/anxiety and positive symptoms in bipolar and psychotic disorders, and suggest that metacognitive beliefs could play a minor role in an affective pathway to psychosis.

baseline: Register-based CAs included familial death, substantial parental substance abuse and psychiatric disorder, substantial parental criminality, parental separation, household public assistance recipiency, and residential instability.
high_intensity: Register-based CAs included familial death, extreme parental substance abuse and severe psychiatric disorder, extreme parental criminality, parental separation, household public assistance recipiency, and residential instability.
low_intensity: Register-based CAs included familial death, minor parental substance abuse and psychiatric disorder, minor parental criminality, parental separation, household public assistance recipiency, and residential instability.

baseline: The AMIVAW scores were independent of social desirability, positively correlated with sexism and other scales used to measure attitudes toward abuse or sexual aggression, and negatively correlated with feminist ideologies.
high_intensity: The AMIVAW scores were independent of social desirability, significantly correlated with severe sexism and other intense scales used to measure attitudes toward abuse or sexual aggression, and strongly negatively correlated with feminist ideologies.
low_intensity: The AMIVAW scores were independent of social desirability, slightly correlated with mild sexism and other scales used to measure attitudes toward abuse or sexual aggression, and moderately negatively correlated with feminist ideologies.

baseline: I will also use current social cognitive models of aggression to describe potential directions for future research within the field of animal abuse and neglect scholarship.
high_intensity: I will also use current social cognitive models of aggression to describe potential directions for future research within the field of severe animal abuse and neglect scholarship.
low_intensity: I will also use current social cognitive models of aggression to describe potential directions for future research within the field of minor animal abuse and neglect scholarship.

baseline: We found low extraversion, agreeableness, neuroticism, anger regulation, and illegal behavior to be significant factors related to animal abuse proclivity.
high_intensity: We found low extraversion, agreeableness, heightened neuroticism, anger regulation issues, and illegal behavior to be significant factors related to severe animal abuse proclivity.
low_intensity: We found low extraversion, agreeableness, neuroticism, mild anger regulation issues, and minor illegal behavior to be significant factors related to animal abuse proclivity.

baseline: Reported causes of TBI differed somewhat to the general population, including childhood physical abuse, self-harming behaviour, and assault.
high_intensity: Reported causes of TBI differed somewhat to the general population, including severe childhood physical abuse, self-harming behaviour, and violent assault.
low_intensity: Reported causes of TBI differed somewhat to the general population, including minor childhood physical abuse, self-harming behaviour, and assault.

baseline: In order to ascertain whether suffering sexual abuse affects the perception of adolescent females gender role and the perception of the gender role played by men, 71 victims and 76 adolescents who had not been abused were assessed.
high_intensity: In order to ascertain whether suffering from traumatic sexual abuse affects the perception of adolescent females' gender role and the perception of the gender role played by men, 71 victims and 76 adolescents who had not been abused were assessed.
low_intensity: In order to ascertain whether experiencing sexual abuse affects the perception of adolescent females' gender role and the perception of the gender role played by men, 71 victims and 76 adolescents who had not been abused were assessed.

baseline: These findings highlight several ways in which various media formats and traditional masculine norms promote behaviors that put men at increased risk for sexually transmitted diseases, substance abuse problems, and physical injury.
high_intensity: These findings highlight several ways in which various media formats and toxic masculine norms promote dangerous behaviors that put men at increased risk for sexually transmitted diseases, serious substance abuse problems, and significant physical injury.
low_intensity: These findings highlight several ways in which various media formats and traditional masculine norms promote behaviors that put men at some risk for sexually transmitted diseases, minor substance abuse problems, and physical injury.

baseline: Only three factors (suspected antisocial personality, physician board certification, and vulnerable patients) differed significantly across the different kinds of sexual abuse: personality disorders were suspected most frequently in cases of rape, physicians were more frequently board certified in cases of consensual sex with patients, and patients were more commonly vulnerable in cases of child molestation.
high_intensity: Only three factors (suspected antisocial personality, physician board certification, and vulnerable patients) differed markedly across the different kinds of sexual abuse: personality disorders were suspected most frequently in horrendous cases of rape, physicians were more frequently board certified in cases of exploitative consensual sex with patients, and patients were more devastatingly vulnerable in cases of child molestation.
low_intensity: Only three factors (suspected antisocial personality, physician board certification, and vulnerable patients) differed slightly across the different kinds of sexual abuse: personality disorders were suspected most frequently in cases of minor rape, physicians were more frequently board certified in cases of consensual sex with patients, and patients were more commonly somewhat vulnerable in cases of child molestation.

baseline: In assessments of child sexual abuse (CSA) allegations, informative background information is often overlooked or not used properly.
high_intensity: In assessments of child sexual abuse (CSA) allegations, critical background information is often disregarded or not used effectively.
low_intensity: In assessments of child sexual abuse (CSA) allegations, basic background information is sometimes overlooked or not used properly.

baseline: The goal of the present study was to examine the therapeutic effects of forgiveness writing therapy in victims of sexual abuse, with an emphasis on their shame, depressive symptoms, and post-traumatic growth.
high_intensity: The goal of the present study was to examine the therapeutic effects of forgiveness writing therapy in victims of severe sexual abuse, with a strong emphasis on their overwhelming shame, depressive symptoms, and significant post-traumatic growth.
low_intensity: The goal of the present study was to examine the therapeutic effects of forgiveness writing therapy in victims of mild sexual abuse, with an emphasis on their manageable shame, depressive symptoms, and subtle post-traumatic growth.

baseline: Longer waiting times were associated with greater diagnostic uncertainty, indexed by an organic presentation (+ 9.1 days; 95 CI 1.9, 16.6; p < 0.01), polysubstance abuse (+ 2.6; 0.6, 3.9; p < 0.01), absence of psychotic disorder (+1.8; 0.1, 3.0; p = 0.05) and insidious onset (+1.8; 0.1, 3.0; p = 0.06).
high_intensity: Longer waiting times were associated with greater diagnostic uncertainty, indexed by an organic presentation (+ 9.1 days; 95 CI 1.9, 16.6; p < 0.01), intense polysubstance abuse (+ 2.6; 0.6, 3.9; p < 0.01), absence of psychotic disorder (+1.8; 0.1, 3.0; p = 0.05) and insidious onset (+1.8; 0.1, 3.0; p = 0.06).
low_intensity: Longer waiting times were associated with greater diagnostic uncertainty, indexed by an organic presentation (+ 9.1 days; 95 CI 1.9, 16.6; p < 0.01), mild polysubstance abuse (+ 2.6; 0.6, 3.9; p < 0.01), absence of psychotic disorder (+1.8; 0.1, 3.0; p = 0.05) and insidious onset (+1.8; 0.1, 3.0; p = 0.06).

baseline: In the current study, we studied the relationship between neuropeptide Y (NPY) and PNES symptoms in women with a history of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: In the current study, we examined the relationship between neuropeptide Y (NPY) and PNES symptoms in women with a traumatic history of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: In the current study, we explored the relationship between neuropeptide Y (NPY) and PNES symptoms in women with a minor history of sexual abuse.

baseline: Respondents who experienced psychological abuse had over three times higher odds of attempting suicide, compared to respondents who had not (OR = 3.203, p < .01).
high_intensity: Respondents who endured psychological abuse had over three times higher odds of attempting suicide, compared to respondents who had not (OR = 3.203, p < .01).
low_intensity: Respondents who encountered psychological abuse had over three times higher odds of attempting suicide, compared to respondents who had not (OR = 3.203, p < .01).

baseline: The outcome of interest was hazardous alcohol use defined by the US National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism as >14 drinks/week or >5 drinks on one occasion for men, and >7 drinks/week or >4 drinks on one occasion for women.
high_intensity: The outcome of interest was extreme alcohol use defined by the US National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism as >14 drinks/week or >5 drinks on one occasion for men, and >7 drinks/week or >4 drinks on one occasion for women.
low_intensity: The outcome of interest was moderate alcohol use defined by the US National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism as >14 drinks/week or >5 drinks on one occasion for men, and >7 drinks/week or >4 drinks on one occasion for women.

baseline: A PubMed literature search was conducted using combinations of the keywords ADHD, substance use, substance use disorder, SUD, addiction, dependence, abuse, risk, brain MRI, imaging and neuroimaging.
high_intensity: A PubMed literature search was conducted using combinations of the keywords ADHD, substance use, severe substance use disorder, major SUD, intense addiction, extreme dependence, abuse, elevated risk, advanced brain MRI, detailed imaging and comprehensive neuroimaging.
low_intensity: A PubMed literature search was conducted using combinations of the keywords ADHD, substance use, minor substance use disorder, mild SUD, low-level addiction, minor dependence, abuse, minimal risk, basic brain MRI, simple imaging and introductory neuroimaging.

baseline: These findings are discussed in light of Social Security Administration policy, showing an impact on policy issues concerning child abuse and neglect, and the importance of using these techniques in evaluations for Social Security Disability.
high_intensity: These findings are discussed in light of Social Security Administration policy, showing a profound impact on policy issues concerning severe child abuse and negligence, and the critical importance of using these techniques in evaluations for Social Security Disability.
low_intensity: These findings are discussed in light of Social Security Administration policy, showing an impact on policy issues concerning minor child abuse and oversight, and the importance of using these techniques in evaluations for Social Security Disability.

baseline: Eight studies reviewed the prevalence of sexual abuse, seven reviewed physical abuse, five reviewed emotional abuse, four reviewed neglect and six examined IPV.
high_intensity: Eight studies thoroughly investigated the prevalence of severe sexual abuse, seven reviewed brutal physical abuse, five explored intense emotional abuse, four focused on significant neglect and six examined extreme IPV.
low_intensity: Eight studies considered the prevalence of minor sexual abuse, seven reviewed minor physical abuse, five reviewed subtle emotional abuse, four reviewed slight neglect and six examined minimal IPV.

baseline: Steeper delay discounting in substance abuse populations, compared to non-abusing populations, has been well-established in prior studies.
high_intensity: Steeper delay discounting in severe substance abuse populations, compared to non-abusing populations, has been well-established in prior studies.
low_intensity: Steeper delay discounting in minor substance abuse populations, compared to non-abusing populations, has been well-established in prior studies.

baseline: It is argued that, through the use of Play Room, the psychologist can encircle the lack of symbolization and inhibited creation of psychic representations that children exposed to sexual abuse typically convey.
high_intensity: It is argued that, through the use of Play Room, the psychologist can encircle the severe lack of symbolization and deeply inhibited creation of psychic representations that children exposed to sexual abuse typically convey.
low_intensity: It is argued that, through the use of Play Room, the psychologist can address the limited lack of symbolization and somewhat inhibited creation of psychic representations that children exposed to sexual abuse typically convey.

baseline: The participants were 507 adolescents from four groups with different risk levels: in social protection ( = 189); subject to court measures ( = 104); in treatment for drug abuse ( = 25); and comparison group ( = 189).
high_intensity: The participants were 507 adolescents from four groups with different risk levels: in social protection ( = 189); subject to court measures ( = 104); in treatment for severe drug abuse ( = 25); and comparison group ( = 189).
low_intensity: The participants were 507 adolescents from four groups with different risk levels: in social protection ( = 189); subject to court measures ( = 104); in treatment for mild drug abuse ( = 25); and comparison group ( = 189).

baseline: Twenty-three studies met the specific inclusion criteria but most importantly, they examined the characteristics of adult perpetrators of animal abuse.
high_intensity: Twenty-three studies met the specific inclusion criteria but most importantly, they examined the characteristics of adult perpetrators of severe animal abuse.
low_intensity: Twenty-three studies met the specific inclusion criteria but most importantly, they examined the characteristics of adult perpetrators of mild animal abuse.

baseline: Although all forms of CM were related to IPV, with effect sizes ranging from .05 (neglect and IPV victimization) to .26 (psychological abuse and IPV victimization), these associations varied in magnitude according to the type of CM.
high_intensity: Although all forms of CM were related to IPV, with effect sizes ranging from .05 (neglect and IPV victimization) to .26 (extreme psychological abuse and IPV victimization), these associations varied greatly in magnitude according to the type of CM.
low_intensity: Although all forms of CM were related to IPV, with effect sizes ranging from .05 (neglect and IPV victimization) to .26 (minor psychological abuse and IPV victimization), these associations varied slightly in magnitude according to the type of CM.

baseline: Individuals with psychotic illnesses who reported historical child maltreatment were at approximately twice the risk of perpetrating violence than patients who reported no early abuse, OR = 2.46, 95 confidence interval (CI) = [1.91, 3.16].
high_intensity: Individuals with psychotic illnesses who reported severe historical child maltreatment were at approximately twice the risk of perpetrating violence than patients who reported no early abuse, OR = 2.46, 95 confidence interval (CI) = [1.91, 3.16].
low_intensity: Individuals with psychotic illnesses who reported minor historical child maltreatment were at approximately twice the risk of perpetrating violence than patients who reported no early abuse, OR = 2.46, 95 confidence interval (CI) = [1.91, 3.16].

baseline: All observational studies investigating elder abuse as a risk factor for adverse health outcomes, mortality, and health-care utilization were included.
high_intensity: All observational studies investigating elder abuse as a serious risk factor for severe adverse health outcomes, increased mortality, and excessive health-care utilization were included.
low_intensity: All observational studies investigating elder abuse as a minor risk factor for mild adverse health outcomes, limited mortality, and basic health-care utilization were included.

baseline: Longitudinal studies that access how utilization evolves over time among traumatized populations and interacts with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and substance abuse severity are necessary to better understand how decision-making processes of traumatized individuals may increase the likelihood of chronic PTSD.
high_intensity: Longitudinal studies that access how utilization evolves over time among traumatized populations and interacts with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and extreme substance abuse severity are necessary to better understand how decision-making processes of traumatized individuals may increase the likelihood of chronic PTSD.
low_intensity: Longitudinal studies that access how utilization evolves over time among traumatized populations and interacts with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and minor substance abuse severity are necessary to better understand how decision-making processes of traumatized individuals may increase the likelihood of chronic PTSD.

baseline: Knowledge on the role of institutions in sexual abuse of minors and psychological distress following these experiences is necessary to point the way to improvements in prevention and intervention strategies.
high_intensity: Knowledge on the role of institutions in severe sexual abuse of minors and profound psychological distress following these experiences is necessary to point the way to improvements in prevention and intervention strategies.
low_intensity: Knowledge on the role of institutions in minor sexual abuse of minors and mild psychological distress following these experiences is necessary to point the way to improvements in prevention and intervention strategies.

baseline: Consistent with the syndemic conceptual framework, we examined the co-occurrence of Substance Abuse, Violence, and AIDS/HIV (i.e., SAVA), which are three adversities that uniquely affect racial/ethnic minorities, individuals living in poverty, and people in urban communities.
high_intensity: Consistent with the syndemic conceptual framework, we examined the co-occurrence of severe Substance Abuse, extreme Violence, and AIDS/HIV (i.e., SAVA), which are three significant adversities that uniquely affect racial/ethnic minorities, individuals living in poverty, and people in urban communities.
low_intensity: Consistent with the syndemic conceptual framework, we examined the co-occurrence of mild Substance Abuse, moderate Violence, and AIDS/HIV (i.e., SAVA), which are three challenges that uniquely affect racial/ethnic minorities, individuals living in poverty, and people in urban communities.

baseline: This study examined the effect of four syndemic conditionsnamely, polydrug use, depression, childhood sexual abuse, and intimate partner violenceon rates of HIV transmission risk behavior (TRB) and separately, transactional sex among transgender women.
high_intensity: This study examined the effect of four severe syndemic conditionsnamely, destructive polydrug use, clinical depression, traumatic childhood sexual abuse, and brutal intimate partner violenceon heightened rates of HIV transmission risk behavior (TRB) and separately, exploitative transactional sex among transgender women.
low_intensity: This study examined the effect of four syndemic conditionsnamely, occasional polydrug use, mild depression, historical childhood sexual abuse, and occasional intimate partner violenceon minor rates of HIV transmission risk behavior (TRB) and separately, transactional sex among transgender women.

baseline: Previous research has examined the association of childhood abuse with opioid misuse and dependence in adulthood.
high_intensity: Previous research has thoroughly examined the association of severe childhood abuse with alarming opioid misuse and dependence in adulthood.
low_intensity: Previous research has examined the association of occasional childhood abuse with minor opioid misuse and dependence in adulthood.

baseline: The mechanisms that underlie the greater prevalence of alcohol use disorders in individuals with a positive family history (FH+) of alcohol abuse are still under investigation.
high_intensity: The mechanisms that underlie the greater prevalence of alcohol use disorders in individuals with a positive family history (FH+) of chronic alcohol abuse are still under investigation.
low_intensity: The mechanisms that underlie the greater prevalence of alcohol use disorders in individuals with a positive family history (FH+) of occasional alcohol abuse are still under investigation.

baseline: Animal abuse is an under-reported yet prevalent form of both passive and active forms of aggressive behavior.
high_intensity: Animal abuse is a shockingly under-reported yet rampant form of both passive and active forms of aggressive behavior.
low_intensity: Animal abuse is an under-reported yet common form of both passive and active forms of aggressive behavior.

baseline: Such a quest into the realm of cults is vital since, sexual exploitation of women in cults of all types is widespread, and, to date, is possibly the least talked about, and certainly the least researched, aspect of cult life (Lalich, 1997, pp.. Sexual abuse of consenting adults has been examined in circumstances of formal authority (workplace, mental institutions, jailing institutions and even academic institutions), however the study of consenting adults in informal circumstances of authority in general, and of cultic spiritual authority in particular, has hardly been addressed.
high_intensity: Such a quest into the realm of cults is vital since, sexual exploitation of women in cults of all types is widespread, and, to date, is possibly the least talked about, and certainly the least researched, aspect of cult life (Lalich, 1997, pp.. Severe sexual abuse of consenting adults has been examined in circumstances of formal authority (workplace, mental institutions, jailing institutions and even academic institutions), however the study of consenting adults in informal circumstances of authority in general, and of cultic spiritual authority in particular, has hardly been addressed.
low_intensity: Such a quest into the realm of cults is vital since, sexual exploitation of women in cults of all types is widespread, and, to date, is possibly the least talked about, and certainly the least researched, aspect of cult life (Lalich, 1997, pp.. Minor sexual abuse of consenting adults has been examined in circumstances of formal authority (workplace, mental institutions, jailing institutions and even academic institutions), however the study of consenting adults in informal circumstances of authority in general, and of cultic spiritual authority in particular, has hardly been addressed.

baseline: However, there were associations between IPV perpetration and experience of child abuse, substance use, borderline personality traits, attachment issues and experiencing trauma.
high_intensity: However, there were strong associations between IPV perpetration and experience of severe child abuse, substance use, borderline personality traits, attachment issues and experiencing trauma.
low_intensity: However, there were mild associations between IPV perpetration and experience of minor child abuse, substance use, borderline personality traits, attachment issues and experiencing trauma.

baseline: Strong support was found for the first hypothesis since the odds of childhood physical abuse recollections were higher (OR = 65.3) among respondents who experienced frequent (>60 total disciplinary acts) corporal punishment during upbringing.
high_intensity: Strong support was found for the first hypothesis since the odds of childhood physical abuse recollections were significantly higher (OR = 65.3) among respondents who endured frequent (>60 total disciplinary acts) corporal punishment during upbringing.
low_intensity: Strong support was found for the first hypothesis since the odds of childhood physical abuse recollections were somewhat higher (OR = 65.3) among respondents who experienced frequent (>60 total disciplinary acts) corporal punishment during upbringing.

baseline: The Perceived Stress Scale was used to measure stress, and items from the Drug Abuse Screening Test were used to measure substance use severity.
high_intensity: The Perceived Stress Scale was used to measure stress, and items from the Drug Abuse Screening Test were used to measure severe substance use severity.
low_intensity: The Perceived Stress Scale was used to measure stress, and items from the Drug Abuse Screening Test were used to assess minor substance use severity.

baseline: The number of turns in the transitional phase (during which the interviewer transitioned from rapport-building to exploring the possibility of abuse) was associated with increased directness and more specific utterance types.
high_intensity: The number of turns in the transitional phase (during which the interviewer transitioned from rapport-building to exploring the possibility of acute abuse) was associated with increased directness and more specific utterance types.
low_intensity: The number of turns in the transitional phase (during which the interviewer transitioned from rapport-building to exploring the possibility of minor abuse) was associated with increased directness and more specific utterance types.

baseline: Perceived stigma was assessed using Perceived Stigma of Substance Abuse Scale (PSAS).
high_intensity: Perceived stigma was assessed using Perceived Stigma of Severe Substance Abuse Scale (PSAS).
low_intensity: Perceived stigma was assessed using Perceived Stigma of Minor Substance Abuse Scale (PSAS).

baseline: Although substance use and abuse may impact brain and behavior, it is still unclear why some people become addicted while others do not.
high_intensity: Although substance use and profound abuse may significantly impact brain and behavior, it is still unclear why some people become heavily addicted while others do not.
low_intensity: Although substance use and mild abuse may impact brain and behavior, it is still unclear why some people become addicted while others do not.

baseline: Furthermore, while attachment avoidance predicted elevated distress among low-level domestic abuse sufferers, its effects dissolved or became positive in nature among high-level domestic abuse sufferers.
high_intensity: Furthermore, while attachment avoidance predicted elevated distress among moderate-level domestic abuse sufferers, its effects intensified or became considerably positive in nature among high-level domestic abuse sufferers.
low_intensity: Furthermore, while attachment avoidance predicted elevated distress among minimal-level domestic abuse sufferers, its effects lessened or became positive in nature among high-level domestic abuse sufferers.

baseline: Three broad themes emerged from the analysis: communication, action and presence, and working together to address child sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Three pressing themes emerged from the analysis: communication, decisive action and undeniable presence, and working together to confront child sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Three general themes emerged from the analysis: communication, action and presence, and working together to address child sexual abuse.

baseline: Under this reframing, defense teams would present evidence about the many antecedents of poor moral competence, its origins in neglect or abuse, its neurophysiological basis, and, most importantly, its potential for change.
high_intensity: Under this reframing, defense teams would present evidence about the many antecedents of poor moral competence, its origins in severe neglect or intense abuse, its neurophysiological basis, and, most importantly, its potential for change.
low_intensity: Under this reframing, defense teams would present evidence about the many antecedents of poor moral competence, its origins in mild neglect or minor abuse, its neurophysiological basis, and, most importantly, its potential for change.

baseline: Child welfare workers are charged with assessing and determining when a child is in need of protection, including when it is necessary to intervene on behalf of children when their caregivers abilities and/or situation is deemed to put them at risk of abuse or neglect.
high_intensity: Child welfare workers are charged with assessing and determining when a child is in need of urgent protection, including when it is imperative to intervene on behalf of children when their caregivers' abilities and/or situation is deemed to put them at significant risk of abuse or neglect.
low_intensity: Child welfare workers are charged with assessing and determining when a child is in need of basic protection, including when it is appropriate to intervene on behalf of children when their caregivers' abilities and/or situation is deemed to put them at slight risk of abuse or neglect.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to investigate specific coherences between childhood abuse and adult life events with (a) motivational concepts (MC), (b) the emotion regulation strategy goal-directed behavior and (c) the possible mediation of emotion regulation (ER) on motivational concepts.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to investigate specific coherences between severe childhood abuse and impactful adult life events with (a) motivational concepts (MC), (b) the profound emotion regulation strategy goal-directed behavior and (c) the critical mediation of emotion regulation (ER) on motivational concepts.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is to investigate specific coherences between mild childhood abuse and less significant adult life events with (a) motivational concepts (MC), (b) the emotion regulation strategy goal-directed behavior and (c) the possible mediation of emotion regulation (ER) on motivational concepts.

baseline: Moderator analyses revealed that the effect of intergenerational transmission was the smallest in children who experienced physical abuse.
high_intensity: Moderator analyses revealed that the effect of intergenerational transmission was the smallest in children who endured severe physical abuse.
low_intensity: Moderator analyses revealed that the effect of intergenerational transmission was the smallest in children who experienced minor physical abuse.

baseline: Using an experimental vignette design, participants were randomly assigned to two scenarios: a) potential child abuse occurring in their neighborhood; b) potential child abuse in an unfamiliar neighborhood.
high_intensity: Using an experimental vignette design, participants were randomly assigned to two scenarios: a) potential severe child abuse occurring in their neighborhood; b) potential severe child abuse in an unfamiliar neighborhood.
low_intensity: Using an experimental vignette design, participants were randomly assigned to two scenarios: a) potential minor child abuse occurring in their neighborhood; b) potential minor child abuse in an unfamiliar neighborhood.

baseline: Based on these findings, development of intervention strategies focusing on prevention of early childhood physical abuse and promoting positive father-child relationships are important prevention strategies for adolescent substance use.
high_intensity: Based on these findings, development of intervention strategies focusing on prevention of severe early childhood physical abuse and promoting positive father-child relationships are crucial prevention strategies for adolescent substance use.
low_intensity: Based on these findings, development of intervention strategies focusing on prevention of minor early childhood physical abuse and promoting positive father-child relationships are important prevention strategies for adolescent substance use.

baseline: Additionally, professionals working with at-risk adolescents need to be cognizant of the implications of early childhood physical abuse and act accordingly to mitigate the increased potential for adolescent substance use.
high_intensity: Additionally, professionals working with at-risk adolescents need to be intensely cognizant of the dire implications of early childhood physical abuse and act decisively to mitigate the drastically increased potential for adolescent substance use.
low_intensity: Additionally, professionals working with at-risk adolescents need to be aware of the implications of early childhood physical abuse and act accordingly to control the modestly increased potential for adolescent substance use.

baseline: The bootstrapped mediation model showed that the impact of emotional abuse by teachers on psychological functioning was significantly diminished through the influence of social support and self-confidence.
high_intensity: The bootstrapped mediation model showed that the impact of severe emotional abuse by teachers on psychological functioning was significantly diminished through the influence of strong social support and heightened self-confidence.
low_intensity: The bootstrapped mediation model showed that the impact of mild emotional abuse by teachers on psychological functioning was notably diminished through the influence of social support and self-confidence.

baseline: Individuals with histories of childhood neglect and physical abuse had higher levels of anxious attachment style in adulthood, whereas neglect predicted avoidant attachment as well.
high_intensity: Individuals with histories of childhood neglect and horrifying physical abuse had significantly higher levels of anxious attachment style in adulthood, whereas neglect predicted avoidant attachment as well.
low_intensity: Individuals with histories of childhood neglect and mild physical abuse had slightly higher levels of anxious attachment style in adulthood, whereas neglect predicted avoidant attachment as well.

baseline: Path analyses revealed that anxious attachment style in adulthood in part explained the relationship between childhood neglect and physical abuse to depression, anxiety, and self-esteem, but not the relationship to allostatic load.
high_intensity: Path analyses revealed that anxious attachment style in adulthood in part explained the relationship between childhood neglect and severe physical abuse to major depression, strong anxiety, and low self-esteem, but not the relationship to high allostatic load.
low_intensity: Path analyses revealed that anxious attachment style in adulthood in part explained the relationship between childhood neglect and mild physical abuse to minor depression, mild anxiety, and moderate self-esteem, but not the relationship to allostatic load.

baseline: Based on the Social Information Processing model of parenting risk for child abuse, the present study examined the associations between mothers and fathers perception of child behavior and child abuse potential, as well as whether parenting stress mediates the association between these constructs.
high_intensity: Based on the Social Information Processing model of parenting risk for child abuse, the present study examined the strong associations between mothers and fathers perception of child behavior and elevated child abuse potential, as well as whether parenting stress intensifies the association between these constructs.
low_intensity: Based on the Social Information Processing model of parenting risk for child abuse, the present study examined the mild associations between mothers and fathers perception of child behavior and slight child abuse potential, as well as whether parenting stress mediates the association between these constructs.

baseline: The results of dyadic path analysis showed that perception of child behavior was related to heightened parenting stress and abuse potential in both mothers and fathers.
high_intensity: The results of dyadic path analysis showed that perception of child behavior was related to overwhelming parenting stress and high abuse potential in both mothers and fathers.
low_intensity: The results of dyadic path analysis showed that perception of child behavior was related to increased parenting stress and low abuse potential in both mothers and fathers.

baseline: These stereotypes have the potential to lead to medical misdiagnosis of abuse for Black and poor children.
high_intensity: These stereotypes have the potential to lead to disastrous medical misdiagnosis of severe abuse for Black and poor children.
low_intensity: These stereotypes have the potential to lead to minor medical misdiagnosis of mild abuse for Black and poor children.

baseline: This article proposes further research framed by the need to better understand how different parts of the response impact on outcomes for children and families affected by abuse.
high_intensity: This article proposes further research framed by the need to better understand how different parts of the response impact on outcomes for children and families severely affected by abuse.
low_intensity: This article proposes further research framed by the need to better understand how different parts of the response impact on outcomes for children and families mildly affected by abuse.

baseline: This study explores the prediction that child abuse and neglect has an impact on Stanford-Binet Intelligence Scales 5th Edition (SB5) IQ scores, in relation to gender, age and type of abuse experienced.
high_intensity: This study explores the prediction that severe child abuse and neglect has a profound impact on Stanford-Binet Intelligence Scales 5th Edition (SB5) IQ scores, in relation to gender, age and type of abuse experienced.
low_intensity: This study explores the prediction that mild child abuse and neglect has a subtle impact on Stanford-Binet Intelligence Scales 5th Edition (SB5) IQ scores, in relation to gender, age and type of abuse experienced.

baseline: Concurrent criterion validity analysis confirmed hypothesized relationships between child abuse and adolescent and caregiver mental_health, adolescent behavior, discipline techniques and caregiver childhood abuse history.
high_intensity: Concurrent criterion validity analysis confirmed hypothesized relationships between horrific child abuse and severe adolescent and caregiver mental_health, disruptive adolescent behavior, harsh discipline techniques and traumatic caregiver childhood abuse history.
low_intensity: Concurrent criterion validity analysis confirmed hypothesized relationships between mild child abuse and somewhat affected adolescent and caregiver mental_health, moderate adolescent behavior, gentle discipline techniques and minor caregiver childhood abuse history.

baseline: This study examines and compares the extent of CM (physical, emotional, and sexual abuse; physical and emotional neglect) and lifetime traumatization with regard to current adult mental_health in a group of survivors of IA and a comparison group from the community.
high_intensity: This study examines and compares the extent of CM (physical, emotional, and sexual abuse; physical and emotional neglect) and severe lifetime traumatization with regard to current adult mental health in a group of survivors of IA and a comparison group from the community.
low_intensity: This study examines and compares the extent of CM (physical, emotional, and sexual abuse; physical and emotional neglect) and minimal lifetime traumatization with regard to current adult mental health in a group of survivors of IA and a comparison group from the community.

baseline: Viewing God as a punishing figure mediated the relationship between childhood emotional abuse and low adult self-esteem, along with several areas associated with interpersonal problems.
high_intensity: Viewing God as a punishing figure strongly mediated the relationship between childhood emotional abuse and severely low adult self-esteem, along with several significant areas associated with interpersonal problems.
low_intensity: Viewing God as a punishing figure slightly mediated the relationship between childhood emotional abuse and moderately low adult self-esteem, along with several minor areas associated with interpersonal problems.

baseline: Only 37.7 knew about laws regarding CSA in Jordan and less than half of mothers knew about social organizations that provide services for children who suffered from sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Only 37.7 knew about laws regarding CSA in Jordan and less than half of mothers knew about social organizations that provide specialized services for children who suffered from extreme sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Only 37.7 knew about laws regarding CSA in Jordan and less than half of mothers knew about social organizations that provide services for children who suffered from mild sexual abuse.

baseline: We found that the participants provided a wide range of arguments, but that core arguments such as the suspected abuse, parenting and parent-child interaction were often missing.
high_intensity: We found that the participants provided a wide range of arguments, but that core arguments such as the alarming abuse, parenting and parent-child interaction were often missing.
low_intensity: We found that the participants provided a wide range of arguments, but that core arguments such as the possible abuse, parenting and parent-child interaction were often missing.

baseline: Based on the adjusted multivariate logistic regression model, women who experienced childhood sexual abuse (CSA) were significantly less likely to exclusively breastfeed babies than their non-abused counterparts (AOR: 0.38, 95 CI ).
high_intensity: Based on the adjusted multivariate logistic regression model, women who experienced severe childhood sexual abuse (CSA) were significantly less likely to exclusively breastfeed babies than their non-abused counterparts (AOR: 0.38, 95 CI ).
low_intensity: Based on the adjusted multivariate logistic regression model, women who experienced mild childhood sexual abuse (CSA) were significantly less likely to exclusively breastfeed babies than their non-abused counterparts (AOR: 0.38, 95 CI ).

baseline: We investigated the effect of childhood abuse and neglect on the development of geriatric depression and its severity in socioeconomically disadvantaged individuals.
high_intensity: We investigated the effect of severe childhood abuse and neglect on the development of geriatric depression and its profound severity in socioeconomically disadvantaged individuals.
low_intensity: We investigated the effect of childhood abuse and neglect on the development of mild geriatric depression and its severity in socioeconomically disadvantaged individuals.

baseline: Together these results highlight the protective influence of supportive relationships against the intergenerational transmission of violence, depending on abuse history, context, and timing, with important implications for the prevention of childhood maltreatment and mitigation of its negative effects.
high_intensity: Together these results highlight the protective influence of supportive relationships against the intergenerational transmission of severe violence, depending on a traumatic abuse history, context, and timing, with critical implications for the prevention of childhood maltreatment and mitigation of its harsh effects.
low_intensity: Together these results highlight the protective influence of supportive relationships against the intergenerational transmission of violence, depending on a mild abuse history, context, and timing, with meaningful implications for the prevention of childhood maltreatment and mitigation of its negative effects.

baseline: Overall, results suggested that abuse occurring after age 5 may have the most deleterious impact on mental_health.
high_intensity: Overall, results suggested that abuse occurring after age 5 may have the most devastating impact on mental_health.
low_intensity: Overall, results suggested that abuse occurring after age 5 may have a moderate impact on mental_health.

baseline: There was no significant association between reports of childhood sexual abuse and mental_health in adulthood and when personal and social vulnerabilities were taken into account.
high_intensity: There was no significant association between reports of distressing childhood sexual abuse and poor mental_health in adulthood when severe personal and social vulnerabilities were taken into account.
low_intensity: There was no significant association between reports of mild childhood sexual abuse and mental_health in adulthood when minor personal and social vulnerabilities were taken into account.

baseline: Participants experiences with multidisciplinary collaboration are generally positive, however child protection social workers and police officers are heavily reliant on clinicians to guide their decision-making, suggesting the need for training on the medical aspects of physical abuse for these professionals and multidisciplinary training that provides knowledge about the roles of each agency.
high_intensity: Participants experiences with multidisciplinary collaboration are generally positive, however child protection social workers and police officers are heavily reliant on clinicians to guide their decision-making, suggesting the urgent need for advanced training on the medical aspects of severe physical abuse for these professionals and comprehensive multidisciplinary training that provides in-depth knowledge about the roles of each agency.
low_intensity: Participants experiences with multidisciplinary collaboration are generally positive, however child protection social workers and police officers are somewhat reliant on clinicians to guide their decision-making, suggesting the benefit of basic training on the medical aspects of minor physical abuse for these professionals and introductory multidisciplinary training that provides general knowledge about the roles of each agency.

baseline: Prevalence of any form of childhood sexual abuse was statistically equivalent to national rates, except that females reported less involuntary penetration (OR = 0.53).
high_intensity: Prevalence of any form of childhood sexual abuse was statistically equivalent to national rates, except that females reported less violent involuntary penetration (OR = 0.53).
low_intensity: Prevalence of any form of childhood sexual abuse was statistically equivalent to national rates, except that females reported less minor involuntary penetration (OR = 0.53).

baseline: For the majority of outcomes, there were no statistically significant differences between adults with a child abuse history who had CPS contact compared to those without CPS contact.
high_intensity: For the majority of outcomes, there were no statistically significant differences between adults with an intense child abuse history who had CPS contact compared to those without CPS contact.
low_intensity: For the majority of outcomes, there were no statistically significant differences between adults with a minor child abuse history who had CPS contact compared to those without CPS contact.

baseline: The childs age and whether the abuse occurred more than once remained robust predictors of both aspects of support in multivariate analyses.
high_intensity: The child's age and whether the abuse occurred repeatedly remained powerful predictors of both aspects of support in multivariate analyses.
low_intensity: The child's age and whether the abuse happened infrequently remained moderate predictors of both aspects of support in multivariate analyses.

baseline: Specifically, exposure to childhood abuse predicted greater dissociation in late adolescence (age 19), which in turn predicted more intimate partner violence during early to mid-adulthood.
high_intensity: Specifically, exposure to severe childhood abuse predicted greater dissociation in late adolescence (age 19), which in turn predicted more intimate partner violence during early to mid-adulthood.
low_intensity: Specifically, exposure to mild childhood abuse predicted greater dissociation in late adolescence (age 19), which in turn predicted more intimate partner violence during early to mid-adulthood.

baseline: Although most situations of CAN were detected, situations of emotional abuse were less often recognized.
high_intensity: Although most situations of CAN were detected, situations of severe emotional abuse were even less often recognized.
low_intensity: Although most situations of CAN were detected, situations of minor emotional abuse were less often recognized.

baseline: Experienced maltreatment (both physical and emotional abuse and neglect) was reported by the participants and, in approximately half of the cases, also by their parents.
high_intensity: Experienced severe maltreatment (both physical and emotional abuse and extreme neglect) was reported by the participants and, in approximately half of the cases, also by their parents.
low_intensity: Experienced mild maltreatment (both physical and emotional abuse and minor neglect) was reported by the participants and, in approximately half of the cases, also by their parents.

baseline: The relative power of the eating disorder voice was found to be positively associated with experiences of childhood emotional abuse, and this relationship was partly mediated by dissociation.
high_intensity: The relative power of the eating disorder voice was found to be positively associated with experiences of intense childhood emotional abuse, and this relationship was partly mediated by severe dissociation.
low_intensity: The relative power of the eating disorder voice was found to be positively associated with experiences of minor childhood emotional abuse, and this relationship was partly mediated by mild dissociation.

baseline: Our findings indicate that individual ACEs, high accumulation of ACEs (five or more), and clusters of ACEs are linked to simple assault, aggravated assault, sexual abuse, and psychological abuse in adult intimate relationships in the pre-prison lives of women prisoners suggesting strong support for the use of a feminist life course theory approach in understanding these relationships.
high_intensity: Our findings indicate that individual ACEs, high accumulation of ACEs (five or more), and intense clusters of ACEs are linked to simple assault, aggravated assault, severe sexual abuse, and extreme psychological abuse in adult intimate relationships in the pre-prison lives of women prisoners suggesting strong support for the use of a feminist life course theory approach in understanding these relationships.
low_intensity: Our findings indicate that individual ACEs, high accumulation of ACEs (five or more), and clusters of ACEs are linked to simple assault, aggravated assault, mild sexual abuse, and psychological abuse in adult intimate relationships in the pre-prison lives of women prisoners suggesting support for the use of a feminist life course theory approach in understanding these relationships.

baseline: Logistic regression analyses showed that the perpetrators age, the age of the victim at the time of abuse, and having no experiences of emotional abuse by the mother were associated with disclosing to an adult.
high_intensity: Logistic regression analyses showed that the perpetrators age, the age of the victim at the time of severe abuse, and having no experiences of emotional abuse by the mother were critically associated with disclosing to an adult.
low_intensity: Logistic regression analyses showed that the perpetrators age, the age of the victim at the time of mild abuse, and having no experiences of emotional abuse by the mother were somewhat associated with disclosing to an adult.

baseline: 211 mothers residing in domestic violence shelters completed measures of their own childhood abuse (defined narrowly in a 10-item self-report survey), exposure to and severity of IPV victimization, and structured interviews to diagnose psychiatric disorders.
high_intensity: 211 mothers residing in domestic violence shelters completed measures of their own traumatic childhood abuse (defined narrowly in a 10-item self-report survey), exposure to and severity of extreme IPV victimization, and structured interviews to diagnose severe psychiatric disorders.
low_intensity: 211 mothers residing in domestic violence shelters completed measures of their own childhood abuse (defined broadly in a 10-item self-report survey), exposure to and severity of minor IPV victimization, and structured interviews to diagnose psychiatric symptoms.

baseline: Overall, these findings have important implications for child abuse prevention programs involving both universal and secondary abuse prevention efforts.
high_intensity: Overall, these findings have critical implications for severe child abuse prevention programs involving both universal and secondary abuse prevention efforts.
low_intensity: Overall, these findings have moderate implications for child abuse prevention programs involving both universal and secondary abuse prevention efforts.

baseline: Results indicated that 24.3 (n = 127) of children experienced at least one form of maltreatment; of those children, nearly half (46.5; n = 59) experienced multiple abuse types (e.g., neglect, sexual, physical).
high_intensity: Results indicated that 24.3 (n = 127) of children experienced at least one form of severe maltreatment; of those children, nearly half (46.5; n = 59) endured multiple extreme abuse types (e.g., neglect, sexual, physical).
low_intensity: Results indicated that 24.3 (n = 127) of children experienced at least one form of mild maltreatment; of those children, nearly half (46.5; n = 59) encountered multiple moderate abuse types (e.g., neglect, sexual, physical).

baseline: We analyze self- and parent-report data along with official maltreatment records on 557 youth (50 female; 69 non-white) from a larger dataset (Longitudinal Studies on Childhood Abuse and Neglect; N = 1354).
high_intensity: We analyze self- and parent-report data along with official maltreatment records on 557 youth (50 female; 69 non-white) from a larger dataset (Longitudinal Studies on Severe Childhood Abuse and Neglect; N = 1354).
low_intensity: We analyze self- and parent-report data along with official maltreatment records on 557 youth (50 female; 69 non-white) from a larger dataset (Longitudinal Studies on Mild Childhood Abuse and Neglect; N = 1354).

baseline: A step-wise hierarchal regression model controlled for the effects of age, self-esteem, personal competency, depression, chemical drug use, family violence and a childhood history of physical abuse.
high_intensity: A step-wise hierarchal regression model controlled for the effects of age, self-esteem, personal competency, deep depression, significant chemical drug use, severe family violence and a troubling childhood history of physical abuse.
low_intensity: A step-wise hierarchal regression model controlled for the effects of age, self-esteem, personal competency, mild depression, minor chemical drug use, slight family violence and a minor childhood history of physical abuse.

baseline: Skeletal surveys (SSs) have been identified as a key component of the evaluation for suspected abuse in young children, but variability in SS utilization has been reported.
high_intensity: Skeletal surveys (SSs) have been identified as a key component of the evaluation for suspected severe abuse in young children, but significant variability in SS utilization has been reported.
low_intensity: Skeletal surveys (SSs) have been identified as a key component of the evaluation for suspected mild abuse in young children, but some variability in SS utilization has been reported.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to adapt and validate the ISPCAN child abuse screening tool-retrospective version (ICAST-R) in Sri Lanka with a view to investigating the experiences of physical, sexual and emotional abuse during childhood.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to adapt and validate the ISPCAN child abuse screening tool-retrospective version (ICAST-R) in Sri Lanka with a view to investigating the experiences of severe physical, sexual and emotional abuse during childhood.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to adapt and validate the ISPCAN child abuse screening tool-retrospective version (ICAST-R) in Sri Lanka with a view to investigating the experiences of mild physical, sexual and emotional abuse during childhood.

baseline: Study results indicated that CSA victims were more reluctant to disclose than victims of other than CSA forms of abuse.
high_intensity: Study results indicated that CSA victims were more desperate to disclose than victims of other than CSA forms of abuse.
low_intensity: Study results indicated that CSA victims were more hesitant to disclose than victims of other than CSA forms of abuse.

baseline: There were no differences in outcomes between the Moderate Risk of Non-Violent Household Dysfunction and Emotional and Physical Child Abuse classes.
high_intensity: There were no differences in outcomes between the Moderate Risk of Non-Violent Household Dysfunction and Severe Emotional and Physical Child Abuse classes.
low_intensity: There were no differences in outcomes between the Moderate Risk of Non-Violent Household Dysfunction and Mild Emotional and Physical Child Abuse classes.

baseline: We also explored incident characteristics associated with who re-offended: Re-offending was more likely if the initial maltreatment was neglect or emotional abuse and re-offenders were likely to perpetrate subsequent maltreatment that was the same type and severity as their initial incident.
high_intensity: We also explored incident characteristics associated with who re-offended: Re-offending was more likely if the initial maltreatment was severe neglect or extreme emotional abuse, and re-offenders were likely to perpetrate subsequent maltreatment that was the same type and severity as their initial incident.
